All Reviews

  1. its the best shaver ever
  2. I have owned this shaver for approximately one month and have generally a positive reception. Previously I owned an older generation Braun shaver and liked it. It lasted for nearly 10 years, but ordered the Series 7 after it finally died.<br /><br />The cleaning station works great as I experienced before. I am still on my original cleaning solution Braun included from a month ago. I clean it after every use since I think using a clean shaver every day is one of the benefits of this shaver. Also the solution is pretty cheap, so it's only a few cents every time you clean it.<br /><br />Electric shavers will never provide as close of a shave as a razor, but it's not designed or marketed to. It provides a nice shave quickly and easily. Yes, it makes a noise when it is on, but it has a motor, so that is expected. I do find that it shaves better after it has been cleaned as the cleaning solution has a lubricant. Recently I have started to use it in the shower with some cream on my face. This model is not the &#34;wet & dry&#34; model, but it does say it is waterproof. I think as long as I don't submerge it I should be ok!<br /><br />Overall it's a great shaver. It is on the prices side, but I think you get a lot for your money, especially when it will last you for years, and you will more than make your money back compared to buying razors. I saw Braun just came out with a Series 9, but looks to be several hundred dollars.
  3. to large ,no blade cover, I found it to be harsh.
  4. I've been using this for about a year and a half now and it works very well. My only complaint is that it doesn't shave the neck as well as I'd like and I usually have to clean it up with a regular razor if I want to get everything. Also, it's important to know that you will need to continue to purchase the cleaning solution for this self cleaner to work.

  11. Great! My friend likes very much!
  12. After using a Braun 7526 for the last ten years, I figured it was time to upgrade my shaver.<br /><br />The Series 7-790cc seems to be a quantum leap forward in shaving comfort and closeness.<br /><br />However, all the new bells and whistles -- LCD screens, battery life indicators, &#34;hygiene&#34; indicators, etc -- come at a price. Even though this shaver costs $170 -- three times what I paid for my previous Braun --- it feels less substantial. I am hoping that this is due to more efficient, lighter battery tech. The upside to the lighter weight, of course, is that it is more suited to travel.<br /><br />The cleaning feature is a pricy convenience, but very handy. As recommended by some other users, I take the cleaning solution packet out and seal it up between cleaning cycles so that the fluid doesn't evaporate too quickly.<br /><br />The head assembly is much more complicated than that of my old Braun (integrating both the foil and cutter block into a single unit). It seems to pay off -- the 7-790cc shaves very smoothly and without irritation.<br /><br />I hope this razor will last as long as my trusty 7526 did, because I am really enjoying how it performs. It has cut my shaving time in half, while providing superior results.
  13. This shaver is awesome! So easy to use and clean. I couldn't be happier!
  14. This product is nothing special for the price. My husband always has to have the most expensive version of EVERYTHING thinking it will out-perform a cheaper model. This shaver system probably does the trick but it works the same as most others. It sits on the counter, on the charger and I have only seen him use it once since he bought it almost a year ago. He uses a cheaper model almost daily that is battery operated and doesn't require a charger so stores much easier in a drawer or vanity.
  15. This was my first electric razor and I am not happy I changed. It does not give the close shave I have been use to. After a couple of hours it feels as if I need to shave again AND I have a very light beard. I can't imagine what it would be like if I were average and had just normal growth.

  20. I had been trying for over a decade to get a electric shaver for my husband. He has a very thick, coarse beard and prone to in-grown hairs in his neck. He was adamantly against electric shavers, saying that in his past experience they don't shave close, they pull at his hairs and tears at his face. I came across this shaver with all the great reviews of genuine surprise at how much they love this shaver, so I took a chance. My hubby is a convert. He says it's painless, the shave is closer than a blade and he doesn't need to shave as often. The only thing he mentioned is that it does take longer than a blade to shave. I do get the solution for the auto-clean. We've had it for 6 months so far and it's been great!

  23. Received the new Braun 790cc shaving system and discovered the cleaning and charging base was dead on arrival. I contacted Braun customer service and the representative told me I had to contact their service center in Watertown, MA before sending it in for repair or replacement. I attempted to phone the repair center and waited a long time before anyone answered. That representative told me to send it back to them. I spent nearly $200.00 for a defective product, have wasted nearly an hour on the phone, and have to pay postage on returning it for repair. No wonder Walmart is so successful. They do all that work behind the scenes just to be certain the customer is getting what he paid for. Braun has been downgraded in my opinion to just another average International manufacturer who shifts the responsibility of poor product quality to the customer. With more and more companies adopting that &#34;I don't care attitude&#34;, online buying has become a higher risk than a convenience.

I have had a hard time finding the cleaner cartridges at my local stores. They seem to include a disinfectant as well as a lubricant.

The two items that did make themselves present is that during the cleaning cycle it does appear a little loud. I believe I might be able to remedy that by placing a vibration absorbing article/face cloth or the sort underneath to absorb the noise/vibration conducted onto the hard bathroom counter surface, thus making it less noisy.<br /><br />The 2nd item was when using the sideburn/beard flip trimmer, it exposes itself for use in a position that requires additional thought and just appears unnatural to what at least I've been use to in the past and therefore I have to change hand positions with care as to not give myself any artistic cuts. Over all great little shaver that does the job so far and looks good.

  37. I've just had my first shave with this wonderful little machine. Hands-down, the finest shave I've ever received from an electric shaver, comparable to a blade. Very ergonomic, and the extra features are nice. I hadn't shaved in over ten days; I &#34;rough-trimmed&#34; my very thick, dense beard with a set of clippers, leaving a very rough mess with which to test the new Braun. After pre-treating my curiously handsome face with William's Lectric Shave, I plunged the Braun into the brush. I was amazed to see and feel this unit leave a clean, tanned stripe on my face.   39. Before I had this, I had this: [[ASIN:B001VEK1C6 Braun Series 3-370cc Men's Shaving System]]. This is FAR superior to that model. I prefer to shave with a manual razor, but sometimes I don't have time for the \\"prep\\" to do it. This shaves almost as close as my manual razor (there is still the tiniest bit of hair left, about 6 microns long. Still closer than the previous razor I mentioned), and the sideburn/facial hair trimmer is built into the razor MUCH more solidly than the last one, with a \\"flip-up\\" design. I don't expect it to break off any time soon (like the last one).<br /><br />The cleaner is pretty much the same concept as the previous model, just a few extra lights to show progress of the cleaning. There is a \\"turbo clean\\" feature, but I don't use it. I believe it won't get the \\"deep\\" cleaning done. Besides, it doesn't matter to me since I start the cleaner before I head off to work!<br /><br />I think a lot of people think it's a bit on the pricey side, but I've found that you get what you pay for (at least when it comes to electric razors).<br />Get this, you won't be sorry!<br />Highly recommend!

  58. Very good shave first week. However this is a relatively complex razor, with swivel and floating heads and head position lock, with more to go wrong than earlier models I have had over 20 years. After 3 weeks the lock no longer worked.<br /><br />Depending on the position of the swivel head, the floating heads lock down on one end - one side if swiveled one way, the other side is swiveled the other way. Quality of shave deteriorated rapidly over the 3 weeks.<br /><br />Experience with all previous Braun razors, for my face, has been that the cutter block and foil have lasted and matched new block and foil for 2 years. It would appear the reduced quality of shave of the series 7 is due to the poor functioning of the swivel and floating heads
  59. After using a Braun 8985 (360 Complete) for several years, I upgraded to this Braun Series 7 when my son went to college. Since he does not need to shave every day, I gave him my old 8985 because it still works perfectly. The new Braun Series 7 is a fantastic shaver. I have a very thick beard and must shave every day. I tried a Norelco rotary shaver many years ago and found it ineffective on my thick beard. My first shaver 30 years ago was a Remmington foil shaver. It was pretty good and better than the Norelco rotary shaver. My second shaver was a silver Braun which was far better than any other shaver. My third shaver was the Braun Syncro 7526 now used by my youngest son. My fourth shaver was the Braun 8985 now used by my older son. My fifth shaver is this Braun Series 7 bought in 2012. After over 30 years of shaving, I can attest to the fact that these Braun shavers last a long time and are very effective. Here is the secret . . . You do not have to use the Braun cleaning system every day as recommended. Just use the shaver every day for a couple of weeks until the battery gets low. When it is time to recharge the shaver, open the lid on the cleaning solution, put it in the cleaning machine, slide the shaver into the machine, push the button and let it clean and charge the shaver. SAVE THE LID FOR THE CLEANING SOLUTION. After the shaver is cleaned and charged, remove the shaver and put it in your drawer. Remove the cleaning solution and put the saved lid back on the cleaning solution. Put the covered solution back in the cupboard. Put the cleaning machine on the shelf next to the cleaning solution. Use the shaver for a couple weeks and repeat. The solution will last a long time. Watch the price because it does fluctuate. I got a great deal when the price went down significantly and there was a rebate available in addition to the price cut. Some reviews indicate Panasonic shavers might give Braun a run for its money. Although Panasonic is the one shaver brand I have not tried, I can assure you the Braun 790 provides a very close, smooth shave every time. The cleaning machine and solution work very well. Don't forget the secret . . . Save the lid for the cleaning solution to prevent evaporation.the one shaver brand I have not tried, I can assure you the Braun 790 provides a very close, smooth shave every time. The cleaning machine and solution work very well. Don't forget the secret . . . Save the lid for the cleaning solution to prevent evaporation.

  64. I have a beard, so I find a foil shaver much more effective than a rotary (I have to shave around the places where I want my beard to be, or it starts halfway down my neck and grows up to my eyes like some kind of werewolf). I've had a Braun 7526 for many years, but when it stopped holding a charge it was time for a change. Overall, I've found the 790cc to be superior to the 7526, with a couple of caveats.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- The 790cc is much quieter.<br />- It is better at cutting long hair (for instance, if I go a couple of days between shaves).<br />- It appears to hold a charge longer than the 7526 did even when new, and the charge indicator is better.<br /><br />Cons:<br />- I don't like the alignment of the mustache trimmer, which comes out at a 90 degree angle to the body and is sometimes a little hard to position.<br />- While effective at cutting long hair, it's fairly painful.<br /><br />Other comments:<br />- The 7526 was completely straight (like a candy bar) whereas the 790cc is somewhat angled (I can't think of a better description than a Star Trek Next Generation phaser). I thought that would annoy me, but I find that it doesn't seem to make any difference.<br />- I do a light cleaning daily by opening the head and tapping out the residue. I use the cleaning process once per week. This seems to work fine and allows the cleaning solution to last quite a long time.<br /><br />Overall I'm very pleased so far, and if it lasts as long as the 7526 did I'll have no complaints.

  90. Finally decided to replace the old Braun I had (10+ years old, heck, was made in West Germany, so that shows how dated it was)... anyway, what can I say, I love the product and this did not disappoint. The shave was a vast improvement over the old one, quicker, cleaner, closer, with less strokes, but it still did not getting my neck 100%, which has always been a problem. It will get maybe 98% of the job done,but then I need to go to the Gillette Fusion ProGlide (my neck is a tough bugger to get smooth) to finish the job. I was glad to see that the shaver itself was made in Germany and was not some nasty 'Made in China' piece of junk, although some of the other components were made in China (go figure). It is actually made in 4 different places: (1) shaver in Germany, (2) Clean/Storage Unit in Hungary, (3) Cleaning Cartridge in Ireland and the rest in China (so I can at least expect the cord to fail any day now... damn, why not all of it in Germany and charge me $5-$10 more, are you really saving that much money???) Anyway, enough of my rant on junk from China... To sum it up, great shaver, still German, get one now!!!
  91. ive wanted this shaver for a long time. finally got it for christmas, and am very pleased with it.<br />ive only used an electric shaver a few times before, and wanted an alternative to a razor---------hate the mess!<br />its fast and comfortable. pretty quiet.   92. I am a long-time user of safety razors, primarily because I have a heavy beard and never got a very good shave with the electrics. Also the electrics tended to irritate my face, so I was willing to put up with the occasional, unavoidable cuts despite using the most advanced safety razor system. I heard good reports about the Braun; I had previously tried primarily rotary electrics. The results were as good as the safety razor and this time the irritation was simply not there. I do use the Gilette Fusion Sensitive Skin Wash as a type of shaving cream to \\"lubricate\\" the movement of the razor over my face, which is much nicer to use than the old Gillette Pre-Electric Shave. This is possible because this shaver is a \\"wet shaver\\", which allows me to run the head under hot water before beginning to shave--no cold steel against my face on those winter mornings. The fact that the Braun comes with the automatic cleaning system that ensures that the shaver is cleaned after each use also greatly reduces the maintenance effort, which was a pain with the other electric razors. Finally, the Gilette Fusion blades have become so expensive that it is actually less expensive to buy this electric shaver. I have not identified any negatives.
  93. I have been a Braun shaver user for many years and each time I upgrade, usually every 5-7 years, the shavers get better and better. This one is no exception cutting shaving time to half of my last one. I do miss having a protective cover on the screen, although the case itself protects the whole device.
  94. I've been shaving with Braun electric razors for three decades, and while each new generation gets better, the Series 7 is by far the best in terms of comfort, closeness, and battery life.
  95. Charged up and used the first time this morning - distinct improvement over the previous Series 7 model [[ASIN:B000Q6SU3C Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver]] and 9595 [[ASIN:B000IWFU3W Braun 9595 Series 7 Electric Shaver]] with several modifications recommended by users incorporated into the design:<br /><br />1) Redesigned head. No, you do NOT need the old blue strip in the middle - the new Series 7 head is better than the previous model. Slightly larger diameter holes with irregular shapes, redesigned center cutting strip with rounded guides (contrary to other reviews, cutting surface of the center strip is exactly the same in the new head as the old - 30mm long); it actually cuts better and more comfortably (and cooler for some reason) than the old head design. Sort of a moot point, because you can use either head design with either shaver series, but nice to see an improved head design come out with this new shaver.<br /><br />2) The plastic strip in the back, below the shaver head on the body of the shaver, is now smooth and without lettering. The reason this is important is because in the OLD design, a rather meaningless \\"CAUTION: Use only with Braun power unit blah, blah\\" is stamped into the case, through the silver paint covering the black plastic body. That's important because over a short period of time, with daily exposure to the alcohol cleaning fluid, the silver paint begins to peel off around the lettering because of the break in the surface, exposing the black plastic below. Just cosmetic, other than flakes of paint falling into the cleaning unit, but annoying on a high-priced shaver, and it's pretty well guaranteed because it happened to all three of my previous Braun units, generally after a couple of months' use. The new shaver has the lettering printed on the soft rubber backing, and presumably the unbroken surface of the top strip will not peel. Still appears to be painted black plastic (in this case with a graphite-colored paint), so the jury is still out on its durability.<br /><br />3) Quieter operation. I would estimate about 20-30% quieter than the older model. Virtually the same on the cleaning unit as the old one, but the actual \\"noisy\\" part of the cleaning cycle in the cleaner is less than 5 minutes (much shorter than Norelco's or Panasonic's auto cleaner units); the rest is convection drying and charging, which is completely silent (also unlike Norelco and Panasonic, which use a fan for drying).<br /><br />4) The comfort setting buttons (+ and -) on the body of the shaver actually do work, slowing down or speeding up cycles and vibration on ALL the cutter heads. The \\"sensitive\\" setting gives the most comfortable shave I have had from a dry shave on my neck and upper lip.<br /><br />5) The \\"Lock\\" button on the head appears to be metal. Really thin metal, but metal. The previous design was a plastic button with a tiny pin holding the head locked, which was almost guaranteed to break around the end of the warranty period. Again, durability remains to be seen, but if it has been reengineered with metal, that's a definite plus.<br /><br />Minuses: The soft rubber backing (on my new unit) has several gaps between it and the hard plastic body, and seems to be not fitted as well as my older unit. Doesn't appear to be loose, and may again be only cosmetic, but Braun QC is still somewhat lacking. Customer service with Braun is still a well-reported irritant - if you run into an issue with their shavers you must find a Braun dealer in the nearest STATE that will accept a return of your shaver, and they may not be very user-friendly if you didn't purchase from them - caveat emptor; you also cannot return this item to Amazon, unlike other shavers. The \\"On\\" button is suitable for a night-light. A really bright night light. Then again, this may be a plus, depending on whether you keep it on your nightstand and are afraid of the dark. Lots of painted plastic still, but the shaver doesn't feel \\"cheap;\\" just a question of long term wear with use - Panasonic and Norelco shavers seem to be able to use molded plastic that is colored throughout on their units, instead of paint over plastic (actually Braun does too in their lower-end Series 7s); it's a curiosity to me why their top-of-the-line shaver retains this archaic Mattel-like production process. Collectively, Braun loses a star for the above.<br /><br />All in all, a definite improvement with a more comfortable shave over the previous Series 7 and 9595 units if you shave dry or with a pre-electric. Still not as comfortable (to me) as a wet electric shave, but faster, quieter (for a foil), less messy with a closer shave, and I suspect the best of the dry shave lot at this time.t feel \\"cheap;\\" just a question of long term wear with use - Panasonic and Norelco shavers seem to be able to use molded plastic that is colored throughout on their units, instead of paint over plastic (actually Braun does too in their lower-end Series 7s); it's a curiosity to me why their top-of-the-line shaver retains this archaic Mattel-like production process. Collectively, Braun loses a star for the above.<br /><br />All in all, a definite improvement with a more comfortable shave over the previous Series 7 and 9595 units if you shave dry or with a pre-electric. Still not as comfortable (to me) as a wet electric shave, but faster, quieter (for a foil), less messy with a closer shave, and I suspect the best of the dry shave lot at this time.
  96. So far...<br /><br />I have owned a Braun 340s wet/dry shaver and it worked from about two months into Afghanistan (July 2011) until now that I want to &#34;upgrade.&#34; Don't get me wrong, my 340s still does really well with a little bit of Williams Lectric Shave. I'm not active duty anymore, but my girlfriend likes a clean face :) and I want something newer that doesn't have deployment inside it.<br /><br />Five hours after I purchased this shaver, Amazon dropped the price from $170 to $149. I was P$SSED! I went to return it and buy it again to save myself $20 but I can't because it ships with a highly flammable alcohol product. I guess if I want to test drive shavers (as all men can attest that if a rotary works on one guy doesn't mean it'll work on another....same goes for foil), I'll have to buy locally. And then I feel weird about returning shaving products. Oh well, my friends and 2,000+ other Amazon reviewers can't be wrong. I will update this review 30 days after I get the product.
  97. It works well but no shaver even comes close to a blade. It is good for keeping your face fairly clean until you can use your real razor.
  98. I've struggled to find a shaving system that doesn't irritate my face since my beard made the transition from peach fuzz to wire bristle at about age 21. I've tried them all; inexpensive electric shavers, special sensitive skin disposable razors, safety razors, straight razors, depilatories, and more. Nothing worked except for the Remington 1000 'Black Man's Shaver', which was promptly discontinued after I bought one. I was always hesitant to try the expensive electric shavers because I would be stuck with it if it didn't work and I'd be out a lot of money. Since Braun is offering a 60 day money back guarantee I decided to give this shaver a shot. IT'S GREAT! I can finally shave every day with barely any irritation. It's not as close of a shave I can get with a disposable or safety razor, but that might improve as my face adjusts. It's plenty close enough to look presentable, which is all I care about at this point. If you also struggle with sensitive skin and a heavy beard, give this shaver a try.
  99. This is my first electric shaver and I have been using it for the last 5 months. It has been a good experience so far and have put an end to the razor use! It took time to get used to the electric shaver as a first timer with the sound and particularly using an electronic device up your face. The manual tells you to shave against the facial hair growth. After you use it for 2-3 times, your facial hair will get used to this and shaving gets easier. The shaver gives a close shave, it has been very safe and the whole kit is easy to use be it shaving or cleaning. The battery charging, cleaning has not been an issue. It has a good grip and the blade motion works well too for using it against your jaw and neck. Also you can adjust the vibration level to your personal choice and put to use what is comfortable to you. Below chin/neck area for me, sometimes I have to try multiple times and up the vibration level for a close shave but I wouldn't read much into this if I were you.<br /><br />Overall, it has been a good experience and I would recommend it.
  100. It has been a while since I have bought a new electric razor. But I figured if I was, may as well go with the best. After A LOT of research, I found this model, and I am glad I did!!<br /><br />This razor is amazing. By far the closest shave you will get with electric. The cleaning system is awesome, it will feel new and fresh after every clean. Braun hit the jackpot with this one!<br /><br />Also I am coming from a rotary style razor, because I thought those would be the closet. Wrong!! If you are debating on this razor, no need, just buy it. You won't regret it.
  101. I much prefer to shave with a safety razor, but there are days when I just can't be bothered. For those occasions there is this Braun shaver. I use this top shave my head and face. It does a pretty good job, but certainly isn't a close shave. I really like the charging dynamic (just resting it in the holder) and I like that this has a cleaner on it (which I suppose makes it shave better, longer).<br /><br />The replacement cartridges for the cleaner aren't too cheap, but they do last me quite a while.<br /><br />Just remember not to start a cleaning cycle right before bed because it is loud enough to keep you awake.<br /><br />The charge lasts about 5 days for me, which is good since shaving both head and face takes a fair amount of time.
  102. This is my 3rd Braun Shaver... They last 5-7 years of every day use and then the battery usually get very weak. If you use the electrical cord they will continue to work as advertised. Braun gives me a close shave without tearing up my sensitive skin.
  103. We purchased Bruan series 7 790cc thru dealsofamerica on Amazon.com and we got a good price the razor came without a cleaning cartridge and IT DIDN'T WORK!! We plugged it in to AC- dead. So we charged it overnight - the next day still dead. We tried multiple outlets, no luck. It didn't look damaged or have any wrayed wires- it just didnt work. When we purchased it off Amazon it stated \\"This product cannot be returned\\" I thought no big deal Amazon is credible right? Which is why I was so shocked our razor didn't work. But long story short, we contacted dealsofamerica and they let us keep the broken razor (which we can salvage for spare parts) and gave us a full refund. Overall, I'm impressed with rapid responses and follow-thru that we got from dealsofamerica in making it right.

Then this beauty comes along, and does everything I need it to do. Have been using this 3 or so times a week for quite awhile, and don't have a single complaint. Heck, it even cleans itself to. Nice close shave (my bald head), quick/thorough cleaning (although a little loud when cleaning). Overall a great product.
  105. I am very happy with this shaver. It replaced a Braun shaver that I bought ten years before, and the new unit is an improvement in every respect. The Series 7 shaver gives a fast, close shave and does not irritate my skin. I have a fairly light beard, so this should be taken into consideration when reading my review. For someone like me, this shaver is ideal.
  106. I owned a Braun 7 series before and expected I would like the latest one as much if not more. For some reason when I shave after skipping a day or more, the new one is much more prone to grabbing and pulling out hairs. I have made the adjustment of shaving much more slowly, and still it pulls 5-10 hairs each time I shave. It doesn't matter how careful I am, this thing grabs and pulls out hairs. I HATE that.<br /><br />Every good thing about this shaver is eclipsed by the fact that it hurts me every time I shave, unless I shave every day. I have taken to using a separate clipper to make my hair shorter, if I have skipped a day or more. I don't think a top of the line shaver should require using a separate hair clipper before shaving.<br /><br />I don't think I saved the box, so I think I'm stuck with the damn thing. I am bummed to have spent a couple hundred bucks for a product that I dread using. Braun if you read this, can you help out a long time customer who used to be a happy customer?
  107. It works fine, is expensive, and does not shave as close with a first pass as did my old one.
  108. I have been using Braun shavers since the 80's, and have always been pleased. I had never spent more than $100 on a shaver before, and stepping up to the pricepoint of this one took some time, but I took the plunge. I have used it now for about 3 months, and I wanted to give it some time before I reviewed it to give it a fair shake. Bottom line: It's a decent shaver, but not worth $250.00 in my opinion. Sure it has the requisite gimmicks to demand it's high price: The self cleaning system, \\"Pulsonic\\" technology, 3 different power settings, cutesy charging/cleaning station, hi tech look and feel, etc. But compared to all the other Braun shavers I've used over the years, it works about the same. It did seem to shave better when new, but all of them did. After a few weeks of using it, my shaves took the same amount of time, and my face felt the same as all the others.<br /><br />Having said that, I do like the fact that the shaver smells \\"fresh and clean\\" the first shave after cleaning, and it does leave a small film of lubricant on my face, but I usually only clean it once a week, and the shave is the same whether I cleaned it or not. And regarding other reviewers comments about hair clippings falling out into the sink, what did you expect? It is an electric shaver after all, and the hair has to go someewhere. I must say that this shaver does a better job than most of holding on to the clipped hairs than all othe Braun shavers I've used. I just take off the head and blow the hairs out after each shave, and it's good to go. And as far as noise? This is by far the quietest Braun shaver I have used. It might not seem like it when pressed against my face because of the \\"Pulsonic Technology\\" vibrating the shaver though. With some others, I swear I could wake my upstairs neighbors with the noise, not with this one.<br /><br />I think they should have just put one power setting on it- the most powerful. I don't see any need for the others. Why would you not want the most powerful setting? My skin is fairly sensitive especially on my neck, and I don't have any problems with the max setting. The pop up trimmer is handy, and works a little better than past Braun shavers I've used, no complaints. Battery life is good so far. I tried not charging it for a week to see if it would make it, and it did. Of course it is relatively new, but since I always put it in the charging/cleaning station, this will be a non issue anyways later in it's life. As far as the cleaning solution goes, I just passed the 3 month mark, and the indicator just turned to yellow, so it has lasted a long time, but like I said, I only clean it once a week. You may have to compare shaves with and without cleaning to see if that will work for you. Like I said, the shave seems about the same for me.<br /><br />I will agree with most reviewers about the cord that plugs into the wall. It is just riduculously HUGE. Why they had to make it that way I have no idea. We're not going to use this thing to power a microwave for Pete's sake. And if you plug this thing in anywhere you don't want light at night- say, your bedroom- forget it. This thing is more than a nightlight, and it is loud when cleaning. I have mine docked in the laundry room down the hall from the bathroom. You could land planes at night with a couple of these things! Seriously though, it is bright, and I like darkness in my bedroom.<br /><br />Overall, it does a decent job as a shaver. I will go as far as saying it does a bit better job at a thicker beard than most. You won't be disappointed with it's performance. But for me personally, the Pulsonic Technology doing anything to help shaving is debatable, and I could do without the cleaning system and the power settings, if it didn't have them I would still be satisfied. Knock about a hundred bucks off the price, and I would be even more satisfied!erful setting? My skin is fairly sensitive especially on my neck, and I don't have any problems with the max setting. The pop up trimmer is handy, and works a little better than past Braun shavers I've used, no complaints. Battery life is good so far. I tried not charging it for a week to see if it would make it, and it did. Of course it is relatively new, but since I always put it in the charging/cleaning station, this will be a non issue anyways later in it's life. As far as the cleaning solution goes, I just passed the 3 month mark, and the indicator just turned to yellow, so it has lasted a long time, but like I said, I only clean it once a week. You may have to compare shaves with and without cleaning to see if that will work for you. Like I said, the shave seems about the same for me.<br /><br />I will agree with most reviewers about the cord that plugs into the wall. It is just riduculously HUGE. Why they had to make it that way I have no idea. We're not going to use this thing to power a microwave for Pete's sake. And if you plug this thing in anywhere you don't want light at night- say, your bedroom- forget it. This thing is more than a nightlight, and it is loud when cleaning. I have mine docked in the laundry room down the hall from the bathroom. You could land planes at night with a couple of these things! Seriously though, it is bright, and I like darkness in my bedroom.<br /><br />Overall, it does a decent job as a shaver. I will go as far as saying it does a bit better job at a thicker beard than most. You won't be disappointed with it's performance. But for me personally, the Pulsonic Technology doing anything to help shaving is debatable, and I could do without the cleaning system and the power settings, if it didn't have them I would still be satisfied. Knock about a hundred bucks off the price, and I would be even more satisfied!
  109. If I had to nit-pic about something, it's that the trimmer is rounded. That may be more personal preference, but the shaver is by far the best I've used. My old one broke after 8 years (I got too much hair stuck in the trimmer, which is one reason I like the placement and design of the new one, and jammed up the switch that I then forced and broke) and I had to resort back to a razor, my new shaver puts everything else to shame. I love it

  111. I used this razor for a year and a half. I told myself it was cheaper than buying all those cartridges for my razor. In the long run, it probably was. But I just never got a really close shave with this. Look, the battery life is fantastic. It is easy to clean (I also used the cleaning feature of the stand) but the auto clean feature didn't always get all the beard residue out of the shave head. The cleaner cartridges are pretty pricey as well. I finally gave up the idea of a good shave with even the best electric razor out there and I've gone to DE shaving. It is, like the Braun, a bit of an investment in gear up front but the quality of shave can't be beat (I use a Muhle R41 with Feather blades and a Parker silver tip badger brush and Mitchell's wool fat soap.). I know this is a review of the Braun and if you like an electric shave, you'll like the Braun Series 7. I just couldn't get the closeness I needed without a real blade.

  114. Bought this on recommendation from a cosmetic dermatologist. I had switched to a rotary electric shaver after repeated facial cuts in generally the same location with a blade shaver. Although less frequent I still cut myself with the rotary electric about once a month. Was considering laser treatment of surface veins; during consult the CD recommended this shaver, said he has one (and did not sell them from his office), and although it is expensive he thought it could help.<br />He was absolutely correct. Had this for multiple months, no cuts, clean shaves, clean machine. I am very happy with it at this point.
  115. I found the three top of the line electric shavers - Braun Series 7, Panasonic es-la63, and Phillips Norelco 3D - to be so similar as to recommend any of them as excellent shavers, but each has its strengths and weaknesses. Too many reviewers are only comparing the closeness of the shave, but that's only one factor of several that may be most important. Here's my breakdown:<br /><br />Closeness - Let's start with the most popular category. If all you care about is how close you can shave, then I rate the wet-shaved Panasonic and Norelco even, BUT ONLY when coupled with a shaving oil/gel combo such as [[ASIN:B005ACNPLO Remington Alphagel Sensitive Shave Gel 5 oz. (Pack of 2)]] (there's a cooling menthol version as well). Another way to accomplish the same thing is by using [[ASIN:B0023XF60Q SHAVE SECRET SHAVING OIL- THE BEST SHAVE EVER! 18.75ML]] topped with [[ASIN:B0032ANCUU Edge Shave Gel, Senstive Skin, 7-Ounces Cans (Pack of 6)]].These provide the closest shave possible, but, of course, it's messy, takes a lot of extra time, and can be a general pain. There's no advantage in closeness to using non-oil shaving cream by itself. Going dry-shave, I may give the tiniest of edges to Panasonic over Braun and Norelco, but all three are awfully close - to each other and in quality of shave.<br /><br />Speed - If you're in a hurry and want to get in and get out with a dry-shave as quickly as possible, the Norelco wins. The Panasonic is next followed by the Braun.<br /><br />Comfort - I don't have sensitive skin, but the Braun wins out (unless going wet-shave with the oil/gel as described above). The Braun has three speeds so you can go slower for sensitive areas and intensive on less-sensitive places. I just leave it set on intensive all the time and have no problem. The Panasonic is next followed by the Norelco third. The wet-shaving Panasonic and Norelco are the most comfortable of all if you want to put up with the oil/gel prep and clean-up time.<br /><br />Cleaning - Any auto cleaning system is easier than manual cleaning. Just pop in the shaver and press a button. That said, the Braun is the only system with alcohol in its cleaner to sanitize as well as a detergent to clean and oil to lubricate. Norelco's apparently has detergent and lubrication. From what I've been able to tell, the Panasonic solution is only a detergent. Manually, the Norelco is easiest to clean and you can duplicate the auto clean by pouring some of its [[ASIN:B002DHVAZW Philips Norelco HQ200 Jet Clean Solution]] in a dish or mug and whirring the shaver in it for 30 seconds after shaving. The Panasonic and Braun can be rinsed off under a faucet. The Panasonic's special cleaning speed makes it slightly easier to manually clean than the Braun.<br /><br />Maneuverability - If you have a moustache, goatee, beard, long sideburns, or whatever this is a very important category. The Braun is king here with the Norelco second and the larger-head Panasonic last.<br /><br />Noise - You can hardly hear the Norelco at all. The Braun is a little buzzy and the Panasonic loudest although not irritatingly so. Still, a sleeping spouse nearby will appreciate you using the Norelco most.<br /><br />Travel - The Norelco is last in this category because you'll need to bring the charging stand with you. The Norelco soft case does not hold the stand so that's a bit of a drawback. The Braun's harder case gives it top honors over the Panasonic's soft one, but the Panasonic has an on-off lock that the Braun lacks. Perhaps the Braun doesn't need it because the case is harder, and also because the Braun is the only shaver that can run while plugged in with a depleted battery. The other two require a 5-minute charge to give you a few minutes shave. A fully-charged shaver gives you about 50 minutes in each.<br /><br />OVERALL - They're all excellent, but overall I'd choose the Braun with the auto cleaner. Without the auto cleaner, it's very close between them all and I'd simply find thebest one in your most important categories.<br /><br />Update November 2015: After four years, I still have all three electrics, and all are doing fine. That said, the Braun gets 95 percent of my use. I prefer dry shaving and it's the best dry-shaver. The Norelco is the worst dry shaver and most irritating on my face. However, the Norelco has, by far, the best trimmer. Because of its rotary heads, it also hits my face at different angles, so I occasionally follow up the Braun with a quick run over with the Norelco. I use the Panasonic strictly as a travel razor. It offers no advantage over the Braun or Norelco, except that it cleans easier if you don't have the cleaning station. (I only have the cleaning station for the Braun).best one in your most important categories.<br /><br />Update November 2015: After four years, I still have all three electrics, and all are doing fine. That said, the Braun gets 95 percent of my use. I prefer dry shaving and it's the best dry-shaver. The Norelco is the worst dry shaver and most irritating on my face. However, the Norelco has, by far, the best trimmer. Because of its rotary heads, it also hits my face at different angles, so I occasionally follow up the Braun with a quick run over with the Norelco. I use the Panasonic strictly as a travel razor. It offers no advantage over the Braun or Norelco, except that it cleans easier if you don't have the cleaning station. (I only have the cleaning station for the Braun).
  116. I recently purchased the subject razor from Amazon and have been very happy with it. I upgraded from a Braun 8000 series razor and have found that the upgrade was very worthwhile. My shaves are closer and the razor handles very well.
  117. I been using electric shaver for over ten years. Mostly I was using Norelco's high-end models. Although Norelco was provided me comfort shaves but its battery tends to be highly unreliable. That was reason of switching to this shaver. I am using it for over a year now and I am very satisfy with its performance around all contours of my face. I do use it with Gillette or Neutrogena Face Wash.<br /><br />*** UPDATE 3/2012 ***<br />After an year of use, shaver is still providing awesome shaves.
  118. Well hello! I'm feel compelled to take time out of my day to write a review for this amazing little shaver. A little background about me before I begin is that I have REALLY sensitive skin. I have never been able to shave with a razor on back to back occasions as I would suffer from severe razor burn/irritation as well as pain/cuts on my face. The best way for my skin to handle a razor blade would be to wait about 4-5 days after an initial shave. The worst part of this is that I would have to plan my shaves in advance to accommodate events like weddings or outings. I always envied guys that can shave everyday lol.<br /><br />Now, I don't know about anyone else but I hate shaving. It's such a damn process for me as I would shave with the grain first then against to get the closest shave possible but due to my sensitive skin I would have to shave really slow. Shaving for me has always been a 20 minute ordeal, may not sound like much but since I've been doing this most of my adult life it's gotten to the point where at times I won't go out on a Saturday night because I'd rather not shave. Yea, that bad.......<br /><br />After having tried my fathers Norelco many years ago I swore I would never use an electric shaver. That thing tore my face up! I mean talk about yanking hairs, I don't know, maybe that shaver doubled as a lawnmower or something. What changed my perception of electric shavers was when a couple months back while I was getting my hair cut the barber used a Whal electric shaver on my face. There was no pain, burn feeling, cuts or major irritation so I decided I'll start looking into quality shavers. I say quality because that Whal left so may hairs and the overall quality of the shave was not so good, I had to use a razor at home to finish the job.<br /><br />I've always liked the Braun brand and after reading/watching reviews on this model and well as other makes I decided to go with 790cc-4 because it's what I preferred. The other brands do offer great shaves by all accounts but I'm of the opinion that one should get what they want if it's within your means or else you'll live with regret. I was going to either give this shaver a one star or 5 star rating because I think shavers should do what they are marketed to do. What's the point of an electric shaver if you have to use a razor blade afterwards to clean up what's left behind?<br /><br />Initial out of the box impressions- The build quality of this razor is really nice! The finish is also really nice though only time will tell how well the finish will hold up. The shaver feels real nice in my big hands; it's not too heavy but not flimsy feeling either. Also, feels solid not like it's made out of cheap plastic. The clean and renew station is NO WHERE near as huge as it looks online. For some reason I was under the impression that the clean and renew station was ginormous, It's actually nice and compact. I absolutely love the fact that I can use the charger cord on the shaver itself and not be confined to using the base at all times or even having to travel with it. Bravo there Braun. The instruction manual is basic but covers everything well, I remember reading where someone said the manual was lacking. I completely disagree as I think its fine. And yes, I did actually read the manual lol.....I always read instruction manuals. The travel case is also a nice addition, looks high end and insures no incidental contact with the power button.<br /><br />Shaving impressions- let me say that a reviewer on this Amazon reviews page says \\"shaves as good as a razor\\". He's dead on! This shaver shaves exactly like a razor blade and that was the most jaw dropping thing for me. There is zero pain, cuts or major irritation after I shave. I say no major irritation because there is some for me from the shaving process but don't assume I'm pressing real hard to achieve my shave, it's an issue of skin sensitivity for me. Please be sure to follow the recommended shaving procedure in the manual, I didn't at first but then remembered what is written in the manual and boy what a difference. I am able to shave on back to back occasions or everyday if I want.......I feel like a normal man lol! On to the trimmer and I must say it works great. At first I thought it would be rather obtrusive given it's location but trust me it's fine where it is but could be improved, see \\"suggestions\\" on the bottom.<br /><br />Conclusions- I'm going to wrap this up in a \\"pros\\" and \\"cons\\" format but not before adding that the clean and renew station is absolutely great. I thought I was going to abandon it after my initial solution ran out but not anymore. It literally gets 99% of the hair out of the head while leaving the head oiled and with a nice lemon smell, please note that the lemon smell is not overwhelmingly powerful which is a good thing in my book.<br /><br />Pros:<br />-Shaves just like a blade, face is left ultra smooth. I did notice that my hair grows back a little faster though.<br />-Clean and renew station works to perfection and the solution is not too expensive. After shaving, just put the shaver in the base, hit the clean button and run out the door. That's modern tech for ya!<br />-Ability to charge the unit without needing the base, perfect for traveling.<br />-No need for shaving cream thus making shaving quicker and less fussy.<br />-Ion battery! No need to baby it like Ni-cad batteries.<br />-Works fantastic on sensitive skin.<br /><br />Cons:<br />-Pricy<br />-Didn't get one sooner<br />-Letting your hair grow for 4 plus days will require more work to achieve a nice shave. I guess this would depend on how fast your facial hair grows and how thick it is. Of course, since this shaver is such a pleasure to use I don't see why one can't shave everyday.<br /><br />Suggestions to Braun:<br />-Add the ability to discharge the battery. I like to cycle the battery at least once a month for better longevity.<br />-Move the trimmer to the bottom area? Make it pop out of the bottom that way it mimics a conventional trimmer.<br />-Better LCD display or even an OLED display. Nothing wrong with the current one but it can have a higher end display.n the manual, I didn't at first but then remembered what is written in the manual and boy what a difference. I am able to shave on back to back occasions or everyday if I want.......I feel like a normal man lol! On to the trimmer and I must say it works great. At first I thought it would be rather obtrusive given it's location but trust me it's fine where it is but could be improved, see \\"suggestions\\" on the bottom.<br /><br />Conclusions- I'm going to wrap this up in a \\"pros\\" and \\"cons\\" format but not before adding that the clean and renew station is absolutely great. I thought I was going to abandon it after my initial solution ran out but not anymore. It literally gets 99% of the hair out of the head while leaving the head oiled and with a nice lemon smell, please note that the lemon smell is not overwhelmingly powerful which is a good thing in my book.<br /><br />Pros:<br />-Shaves just like a blade, face is left ultra smooth. I did notice that my hair grows back a little faster though.<br />-Clean and renew station works to perfection and the solution is not too expensive. After shaving, just put the shaver in the base, hit the clean button and run out the door. That's modern tech for ya!<br />-Ability to charge the unit without needing the base, perfect for traveling.<br />-No need for shaving cream thus making shaving quicker and less fussy.<br />-Ion battery! No need to baby it like Ni-cad batteries.<br />-Works fantastic on sensitive skin.<br /><br />Cons:<br />-Pricy<br />-Didn't get one sooner<br />-Letting your hair grow for 4 plus days will require more work to achieve a nice shave. I guess this would depend on how fast your facial hair grows and how thick it is. Of course, since this shaver is such a pleasure to use I don't see why one can't shave everyday.<br /><br />Suggestions to Braun:<br />-Add the ability to discharge the battery. I like to cycle the battery at least once a month for better longevity.<br />-Move the trimmer to the bottom area? Make it pop out of the bottom that way it mimics a conventional trimmer.<br />-Better LCD display or even an OLED display. Nothing wrong with the current one but it can have a higher end display.
  119. I switched from the rotary Norelco shavers to Braun after comparing them and realizing that I got a better shave from the Braun style shavers. After the adjustment period all was great. However, after about 14 months of use the Series 7 Pulsonic shaver started making an extremely LOUD clacking noise. I used the cleaning system regularly and it was clean. What I'm saying here is I really took care of it. I tried replacing the blade unit, and no change. I should emphasize, it wasn't just a loud sound -- it was clacking so much it vibrating against my face and wouldn't get a close shave. Like holding a little AK-47 against your face and expecting goodness. This was a big investment, and between the shaver, the cleaning system, and the new blade certainly in the hundreds. I would expect such a shaver to last much longer. My Norelcos only needed replacing when the batteries wore out. I like the style of shaving with the Braun better, so I'm not sure what I'll do but I'm probably done with the Braun brand and their poor quality control.
  120. This thing is super expensive and one might think after all the expense that they wouldn't have to shell out more money but leave it to Proctor & Gamble- Braun's Owner- to find ways to milk you for money!<br /><br />First you have to buy the cleaning trays which last only a month and will run you about $60 per year. Then you need a new shaving block after a year and a half which is another $50. And after shelling out all this money you will have a shaver that takes twice as long as a manual and will never shave as close or as well.
  121. This is a very good razor. Very smooth on the face. Gives a close shave. Very satisfied with this razor
  122. Great product, have had three different types of braun shavers over the last 10 years and by far this is the best; three different shaving modes for smooth comfort and a really close shave;, my sensitive skin cannot use standard razors, and after trying several competitor brands before stumbling upon the braun products.
  123. I bought this shaver about a month ago. I read all the reviews on it and it appeared the automatic cleaner had some issues with it. I will have to admit the cleaner has not been a problem with me so far. I only clean the shaver about twice a week.<br /><br />The shave is the closest I have received with an electric shaver. I had a Norelco, but it does not compare to Braun. The shave is so close that I might be able to go two days without shaving.<br /><br />I would recommend this shaver to anybody who wants a closer shave. It is more expensive than most of the others, but it is worth it.
  124. I have been a blade shaver 99% of my adult years. Through the years I have purchased different electric razors with no real satisfaction. I am truly happpy with my new Braun 790. It has taken a couple of weeks to get used to the electric -vs- the blade. I am happy with the results.
  125. I really like the shave I get from this razor. I'd recommend this one to anyone needing a new razor.
  126. It turned out to be a sad day when my Series 5 shaver broke... I had had good luck with Braun on two previous models, so I decided to upgrade to the latest-and-greatest (and expensive) Series 7. Bad move.<br /><br />Despite all the talk of an improved design and buzz words like \\"Pulsonic\\", it shaves about as well as the Series 5.<br /><br />The real problem for me is its use of the Clean and Renew cartridges... the old Series 5 would behave like this:<br />* day 1 after my shave: \\"economy cleaning\\" required.<br />* if I didn't press the clean button, then day 2, \\"normal cleaning\\" would be required. Generally, to save on cleaning fluid, I'd clean it every other day.<br />* Then, about once every two weeks, it would recommend \\"intensive cleaning\\". Fine. Seems reasonable.<br /><br />The Series 7, on the other hand, worked like this for me:<br />* day 1, \\"economy cleaning\\" required. Fine, just like before.<br />* day 2, \\"INTENSIVE cleaning\\" required already!<br /><br />I called customer support (and the representative did NOT tell me that, since it was within 60 days, I could have gotten a replacement shaver), and instead they had me send it to a service center... Like is typical these days, I was required to pay the postage, and it was recommended I insure the delivery. Fine... my shaver just got $10 more expensive. A couple weeks later, the technician called me, suggesting I won't be too happy.. I wasn't.<br /><br />They replaced the computer board in the thing, and now it does this:<br />* day 1, \\"NORMAL cleaning\\" required (up from the previous \\"economy\\", so I don't even have a chance to use less fluid.<br />* day 2, \\"Intensive cleaning\\" required again.<br /><br />Another call to customer service, and all they could suggest is I try a different service center. However, since they replaced the entire electronics in the thing, I don't expect that to do much good, plus I'm not interested in spending more for postage to be without a shaver for weeks. I was (foolishly) hoping they'd admit to the design error, and send me an upgrade, but no luck.<br /><br />At this point, my personal suspicion is that this isn't just a mistake with my shaver, and the replacement electronics that went into it at the service center... I think it was DESIGNED to use LOTS of cleaning fluid.. why not? Guaranteed regular income for Braun! It's a shame. If you have the older models of this shaver, I recommend keeping them!oolishly) hoping they'd admit to the design error, and send me an upgrade, but no luck.<br /><br />At this point, my personal suspicion is that this isn't just a mistake with my shaver, and the replacement electronics that went into it at the service center... I think it was DESIGNED to use LOTS of cleaning fluid.. why not? Guaranteed regular income for Braun! It's a shame. If you have the older models of this shaver, I recommend keeping them!
  127. The Braun 790cc is by far the best electric razor I've ever used. My old panasonic finally died, and it was time for something new. I shopped around, read reviews, looked for the best deal, etc. I was scared of the price tag for this one, and I still think it's a bit steep; but I talked my self into giving it a try. All the reviews are true. The shave is always close, the battery lasts a long time if I go on trips, and I don't worry if I run out of cleaning fluid because I can always run it under a faucet too.<br /><br />I think buying the cleaning fluid is still cheaper than buying blades for a regular razor, but I don't know how good it is for the environment-- it's a cartridge of alcohol that can be closed up and put in the trash...<br /><br />If you have a little extra cash, this is definiely the best razor on the market--for the past year anyway.
  128. I ordered from Amazon a Series 7 Braun ...........they sent me a Series 5 Braun - not what I paid for - not what I ordered...............unbelievable.
  129. I have an unfortunate combination of sensitive skin, a coarse fast-growing beard and very much prone to ingrown hairs. Moved away from blade shaving on the recommendation from my dermatologist where she said for my condition an electric shaver might help.<br /><br />My quest started a year ago trying various shavers. I initially was drawn to the rotary types but they irritated my skin so much and produced mediocre shaves that I switched to foil shavers and really saw an immediate positive change.<br /><br />Tried each of the following for a minimum of 8 weeks before deciding (Braun 790cc-4, Braun Series 5 570, Panasonic Arc IV ES8249S and the Remington F5 5790) and the one that worked best for me was the Braun Series 7.<br /><br />The Braun 790 just felt superb in the hand, build quality was top notch - no flex or give at all, the weight is perfect and the handle feels very secure. The display on the base of the shaver is unobtrusive, no bright LEDs or anything that is attention seeking, just providing the right amount of information about battery and how clean the head is. The foils float a fair bit beyond the head assembly so nothing makes contact with your face but the foils, and the foils just glide really easily across a dry face, unlike other shavers.<br /><br />The trimmer is very effective and I found the curvature of the trimmer helps to get the occasional missed hear, even tiny stubble that the shaver missed on my neck. The three intensity settings are there however I never really found a substantial difference in performance between the three settings so I typically use the most intense.<br /><br />The internal battery is a Li-Ion type so there's never a need to fully discharge or any maintenance of the sort, there's also no battery memory issues of course. The battery charges in under an hour and gives 50 minutes of use. The power cable can be plugged directly into the shaver for plugged-in shaving, for those times when the battery is completely flat. This was important to me as most other shavers I've tried didn't allow for plugged-in shaving (possibly due to them being wet/dry shavers?), which meant once the battery was done, so was the shaver.<br /><br />I love the Clean and Renew system. It's an essential item for this shaver, especially since the Series 7 cutting block and foils are a single unit that cannot be taken apart for a thorough cleaning. You can however release the shaving head unit off the shaver to clean underneath the cutting block but with the Clean and Renew system none of that is necessary. It cleans the shaver thoroughly, lubricates it and dries it in about 30 minutes. The process is a little loud but not uncomfortably so. To top it off, the shaver smells great every time. There's also a fast clean button on the base for a 25-second cleaning for when you're really rushed but you'll need to wipe the fluid off the unit after as it doesn't dry the shaver. I can't see myself ever using the fast clean but it's there.<br /><br />Best of all is the shave performance. This is where in my opinion the 790cc really blew away the other shavers I tried. Not only did it give the closest shave of all of them, it was also by far the most comfortable shave. There was never any irritation and the head remained cool throughout the shave. The pulsoic action, while very gimmicky sounding, seems effective in getting the trouble hairs to get cut, those hairs that are near impossible to shave due to them being flat laying.<br /><br />A note about wet/dry shaving; the Braun is strictly a dry shaver so it cannot be used with shaving creams or gels and cannot be used in the shower. The head can be rinsed under running tap water, that's as far as its wet-use properties go. And in my opinion it's a good thing. While most shaver makers are rushing to make the best wet/dry shaver, Braun seems intent on focusing to make the best dry-use-only shaver and in this regard I think they've succeeded. Personally, one of the perks ofusing an electric shaver was that I no longer needed my shaving creams, lotions and brushes and the whole shaving process as a result became much quicker (cutting my shaving time in at least half) and a lot less messy. But for those looking for a wet shaver then obviously this shaver isn't for them.<br /><br />There's really not much to add here. This is a superb shaver that I think will work for many people. Shavers are very personal, what works for one person will not necessarily work for another. But having this shaver out-perform all the others on my less-than-ideal skin/beard combination really impressed me and I think it's at least worth a try for those considering the jump to electric shaving.using an electric shaver was that I no longer needed my shaving creams, lotions and brushes and the whole shaving process as a result became much quicker (cutting my shaving time in at least half) and a lot less messy. But for those looking for a wet shaver then obviously this shaver isn't for them.<br /><br />There's really not much to add here. This is a superb shaver that I think will work for many people. Shavers are very personal, what works for one person will not necessarily work for another. But having this shaver out-perform all the others on my less-than-ideal skin/beard combination really impressed me and I think it's at least worth a try for those considering the jump to electric shaving.
  130. Quit getting Razor burn. This is the best razor. Hands down.
  131. I've been shaving with one of the Braun self-cleaning predecessors of this shaver for years.<br /><br />I replaced the shaving head on that old model recently but it just didn't work well, it would cut me around the jawline (a problem written about by others in the blogs).<br /><br />I decided to buy this current model even though I was annoyed that the reason for doing so was that the new shaver head on the old model didn't seem to be up to standard.<br /><br />Having said that, this model is SO MUCH better even than the prior model.<br /><br />It shaves quickly effectively and painlessly.<br /><br />Well worth the upgrade!

I am surprised that the cartridges are cheaper than the less expensive models -- so I guess the prices work out in the end.
  135. This is the 3rd generation off Braun electric razors I have used. I recently switched from the 8000 \\"activator\\" series and wondered if it was worth the money to upgrade to this razor-let me just say that it was worth every penny as this razor is far and away the best electric razor I have owned.<br /><br />I get a smooth, comfortable shave every time I use it. No nicks, cuts, or anything of the sort. It has 3 modes to cut your face (I use normal during the week and strong on the weekend) and both modes work great. The clean and charge works great as it always has.<br /><br />If you are thinking about upgrading from an older Braun razor or are looking for a new electric razor this one is outstanding.

  137. I've been using Braun shavers for years and had trusted the brand until I purchased this shaver. I usually shave while I drive on my way to work, and this shaver apparently doesn't do well with sitting in the car when its cold outside. Basically it stops after running for one or two seconds and will not start again until plugged in, but once you plug it in it would run fine. It seems something with the new technology actually causes the shaver to behave like this.<br /><br />I thought it was perhaps a defect, but the same thing is happening with a second unit. When contacting Braun, I explained the problem and didn't receive a great response in terms of acknowledging a known issue or any guarantee that a repair would solve the issue. Consequently, the shaver will be returned. Warning to anyone who keeps this shaver in their car and lives in a cooler climate - that it won't run after a cold night. New certainly isn't better - in fact its a step backwards.

  144. I've used electric shavers in the past, but not steadily. In fact, I was using an older version Braun as a means to get a quick \\"clean up\\" when I didn't have time for my blade shave ceremony which might include a British badger brush, etc. My experience was that to get a \\"real\\" shave you just had to do it with the blade.<br /><br />A recent physical condition required me to sign up for blood thinners for at least 6 months and I was finding that a nick became a serious problem so I decided to see if any advances had been made with the electric shaver industry. After checking around I decided on the Braun 790 as a good possibility and bought it here on Amazon (on a day where I was offered a bonus certificate with purchase so actually paid less than the usual).<br /><br />What an eye opener to me. There are so many wonderful improvements of the model I had used from the early 2000's to about 3 years ago that I find myself actually looking forward to using it. Bottom line, the shave, even in the neck area, is superb. Even several hours after shaving my skin feels razor smooth. Amazing.<br /><br />Secondly, it's a beautifully designed, highly ergonomic device. It feels fantastic in the hand and is very precise in it's movements . . .very easy to control. I particularly like that there are 3 settings for closeness, but in fact just use the closest one. I also like the head lock button which is super easy to touch and enables the head to be precisely navigated to any small, particular area such as directly between the upper lip and the nose and the chin. It's in a perfect place to activate and deactivate in less than a second but not by accident. Great.<br /><br />i'll say again that I also love the way the shaver feels in my hand. It is a perfect fit, extremely accurate to place when moving, and just \\"feels\\" right. I used the word \\"sensuous\\" in my title and I think that bast describes what I'm trying to communicate here.<br /><br />Last, I would say that when I first used it (I had been doing just blade shaves for the past few years) the results weren't so wonderful, I was experimenting and I had to work the shave for a while to get results. But after the second or third time it seemed that a amiracle had occurred. I guess my face got accustomed to it because with no apparent effort and much less time, I found a smooth, blade quality shave. And it only gets better. On my face, moving the Braun vertically back and forth seems to be do a better job than circular motions. But I guess that might have to do with the direction of your beard growth.<br /><br />The cleaner is well designed as well and does a lovely job. The battery seems to last forever and the LCD on the bottom of the 790 gives two bar readings: power and hygiene. I usually wait until the hygiene bars are down to one before doing a cleaning. The battery bars hardly move at all before that will happen.<br /><br />So this is not a very technical review. But for people who are just interested in a machine that is a pleasure to use and does the best job I have received from such devices, and even as good as my blade shave, by far, this has got be right at the top of the list. It's hard to imagine otherwise.it (I had been doing just blade shaves for the past few years) the results weren't so wonderful, I was experimenting and I had to work the shave for a while to get results. But after the second or third time it seemed that a amiracle had occurred. I guess my face got accustomed to it because with no apparent effort and much less time, I found a smooth, blade quality shave. And it only gets better. On my face, moving the Braun vertically back and forth seems to be do a better job than circular motions. But I guess that might have to do with the direction of your beard growth.<br /><br />The cleaner is well designed as well and does a lovely job. The battery seems to last forever and the LCD on the bottom of the 790 gives two bar readings: power and hygiene. I usually wait until the hygiene bars are down to one before doing a cleaning. The battery bars hardly move at all before that will happen.<br /><br />So this is not a very technical review. But for people who are just interested in a machine that is a pleasure to use and does the best job I have received from such devices, and even as good as my blade shave, by far, this has got be right at the top of the list. It's hard to imagine otherwise.

  146. A series 5 Braun was my first electric razor (8985 I believe...) that I used for several years. As it was my first I didn't have any experience to compare it to. It did the job and I liked the cleaning system that provided a fresh smelling, and clean razor for each shave. After going through several replacement foils and blades I decided it was time to buy a new razor and went with the Panny.<br /><br />Panasonic ES-LA93-K<br />I must say the first time I used it I was completely floored by how much better/easier it was than the my old Braun. My shaving time was dramatically reduced and I was getting a closer shave as well. For me, my neck is the hardest place to get a very close shave. The Panasonic shaved my neck much closer and with less passes than the Braun before it. I was a Panasonic convert... until a month later. The cleaning system, which I was not impressed with from the start, completely stopped working. Some googling revealed this was a very common issue on this model. Since this was a wet/dry model, I thought I could get by just removing the foil and rinsing both the foil and blades under the sink. However this was not the case. A year and a half later I was fed up with shaving with a stinky razor every morning. Hoping Braun had engineered a closer shaver I purchased the 790cc to replace the very good, but very stinky Panasonic ES-LA93-K. Final verdict: excellent shaver, terrible cleaning system.<br /><br />Braun 790cc<br />Sorry, not in the same league as the ES-LA93-K in terms of closeness. From the very first shave I could tell a dramatic difference. It takes a lot longer with a lot more pressure and skin pulling to even come close the the shave I got with the Panasonic. Thinking about the series 5 Braun and this one, I can't really tell any difference as far as improvements to the shaving experience. Final verdict: good shaver, excellent cleaning system.<br /><br />I imagine I'll stick with the 790cc for quite some time as it is a good (just not great) shaver and I truly appreciate the cleaning system. If you are not lazy like me and don't mind manually cleaning your razor, I'd recommend the Panasonic over Braun in a heartbeat.good (just not great) shaver and I truly appreciate the cleaning system. If you are not lazy like me and don't mind manually cleaning your razor, I'd recommend the Panasonic over Braun in a heartbeat.

  163. In the words of Peter Griffin (Family Guy). This is &#34;fricken sweet&#34;.   178. I had high expectations for this given the reviews. However, I feel like the shaver is just \\"meh\\" at best. My point of reference is a 15 year old Grundig Roltronic 8835. The Grundig has better built quality, shaves closer with less irritation, is much less noisy and easier to clean. The Braun cleaning base (Made in China?) is OK, but expensive since regular cleaning will add $60+ to annual cost. The worst part is that you are basically forced to use it since it is virtually impossible to fully clean the blades with a brush given the enclosed head. Shaving takes a looong time with the 7-series, I spent upwards of 8 minutes each morning, nearly twice as long as with my old shaver. The \\"Pulsonic\\" feature appear to be more of a gimmick than actually improving the shave. The micro vibrations also seemed to irritate my skin more, as well giving me a headache. Lastly, I am disappointed in the display. The Braun's battery indicator is no more advanced than my Grundig from the 90s (!) I know the higher end Panasonics show the time elapsed of each shave, etc, but the Braun has just a basic bar display of battery usage.<br /><br />On the positive side, the Braun does provide a decent shave (if you spend enough time) and the unit feels comfortable in the hand. The travel case and charger are good quality. But for a shaver in this price class, I expected much, much more.

  184. EDIT::::<br />Still love this. 6 years!!! I have a light beard but get great shaves. Have replaced the foils/cutters twice in 6 years for the heck of it.<br /><br />Original 2010 review:<br />I've had a top of the line Braun 8000 series (8595) for about 6+ years. It just started to fail recently - I didn't feel like trying another replacement foil/blade and after over 2,000 shaves - I guess it's hard to complain. If this new one lasts the same duration, then it will be well worth the money for just over $0.12 per day plus consumables (cleaning solution & replacement foils).<br /><br />I opened this new shaver this morning (790-CC4), charged it, and started using it. I like the variable setting (3-steps) for mild to intense. I like the feel of it and although the display is less sophisticated than my old one, this one might be more practical in usage. It has a Li-Ion battery and so is a bit lighter, and seems well-constructed.<br /><br />The real test is the shave - and this is the best result I've ever had from shaving with an electric. On rare occasions I'll use a blade for a special occasion and a blade is usually much closer than most electrics - but I've been okay with a slight sacrifice using an electric in the past. My face right now feels so shockingly smooth, I'd swear I shaved with a blade this morning... So the proof is in the pudding - and I'd wholeheartedly recommend this shaver if you're partial to electrics.
  185. The previous version, 790CC was $180-$190 at Amazon until it was sold out and this new one (790CC-4) is currently $269.99. That is a $80 - $90 premium (or 42% - 50% more expensive)...<br />Trivial fact, the MSRP of the regular 790CC was also $269.99.<br /><br />The only differences I can see are:<br />1) Different color scheme (black/silver)<br />2) Variable settings (called personalization modes)<br />3) New foil (OptiFoil)?<br /><br />I cannot even tell if it is a new foil since the replacement head cassette part for the 790CC-4 (also known as type: 5692) is the 70S. The regular 790CC (type 5671) also uses the 70S...<br />By the way the part number for the 70S is 65671768.<br />My sources are the use/instruction manual for the 790CC-4 states 70S and the Braun Canada service website for the 790CC-4 also states 70S.<br />Just a fyi, you cannot find the 790CC-4 on the Braun US website since they have not updated it yet...<br /><br />So right now it seems like there are only two differences between the 790CC-4 and 790CC, but here is a curve ball:<br />The Braun global website (or any Braun website with the 790CC-4) shows there is a difference between the OptiFoil and Smart Foil:<br />[...]<br /><br />However (yes there is more), the Amazon Germany website shows the Braun 70S as having the OptiFoil technology... The thing is the Amazon Germany Braun 70S product page was created on January 1, 2007. I guess they can update the product page anytime they want.<br /><br />Could it be that the Braun 70S will eventually get an update with the OptiFoil or is OptiFoil the same thing as the Smart Foil?<br />Regardless I am putting my money on a negligible difference between OptiFoil and Smart Foil.<br /><br />Unless there is something else I am missing, $80-$90 is quite a bit more for what you get (only two or *maybe* three differences!). One of them being a simple change in colors...<br />They did not even improve the trimmer!

  191. I have had a Braun since I was a teenager and have since had about 4 generations of Braun shavers. About a year ago I bought one of the newer but less expensive model Braun shavers (a series 3) for my son but was not very impressed as it did not look very much different to the last generations of Braun's, but as they say \\"you get what you pay for\\". By chance my Braun 8000 Activator series broke and immediately bought my self the top of the line 7-790cc. My gosh, this is an incredible machine! If you could imagine that the best shave would be by blade, and take out the rash that you'll get afterward, this is the best way I can explain it. I have been shaving about a month with the 7 series and the head and the blade system is just an engineering marvel on its own, unlike the previous systems that had minor revisions from one generation to another. I am a mechanical engineer and I can tell you that you will appreciate the materials used in this shaver. The motor is strong and quieter than the previous system. I have medium to coarse hairs and have to shave every morning. I leave a mustache and this machine is something I can trust without even looking at the mirror and I don't have top run my finger up and down my face to see if I missed any hairs. It shaves quicker and much better than my previous unit, even if you consider that I change foils on a regular basis. You will appreciate the quality of the cut of this new shaver.
