  201. I have had this shaver for a little over a month and am very satisfied with its results. You do need to use it for several weeks before you see those good results though. I think that the fact it cleans itself daily has a lot to do with the positive results.<br /><br />I don't find the three levels of shave very useful. I don't really notice a difference.<br /><br />I do like having the LED read-out on the bottom to keep me posted on battery level and how dirty the razor has become. Although I haven't done it yet, I think this will come in very handy when I travel without the base.<br /><br />If I had to complain, it would be about the base. It's made of simple plastic and doesn't feel nearly as sturdy as the razor. The cleaning process is VERY LOUD. However, the loud part only lasts about 5 minutes. For such a sturdy and well made razor, you would think the base would be more substantial. It works though.<br /><br />Keeping in mind that it's difficult to get a shave as close as you can with a regular razor blade, I have no regrets with this purchase. If you want electric, this is the best I've used.<br /><br />UPDATE (5/2/2012) - It's still running strong. I replaced the blade cartridge a few weeks ago. No major complaints. I use it three times/week and use the OEM cleaning fluid.

  203. For the last 50 years or so (oops, I just dated myself) I've used the latest and greatest blade razors because no electronic shaver I tried could handle my heavy beard. I get incredibly smooth shaves with my current razor, but shaving with it is literally a pain. If I shave leaning over a sink by the time I'm finished I need a strong pain-killer for my very bad back. Even standing in the shower using a shower mirror hurts, and I don't always want to shower when I need to shave. The result of all this is that I had started going two or even three days between shaves and was looking pretty scruffy. So I decided to try an electric shaver again.<br /><br />After some research it seemed that the Braun Series 7 was probably the best choice for me so, after choking a bit on the price, I placed my Amazon order. And am I pleased that I did! The combination of Braun quality, which has always been superb, and advances in their design and technology since the last time I tried an electronic shaver (probably 10+ years ago) has produced an amazing shaver. The first shave out of the box (after charging) was totally comfortable and extremely smooth and close. Not quite equal to my blade razor, but darn close. At the end of the day, no 5 o'clock shadow.<br /><br />Braun, like all electric shaver manufacturers, says that you need to use your new shaver for a month or two before your skin becomes accustomed to it. I've used my 7 Series for about 10 days now and I've gotten consistently excellent shaves and absolutely no skin irritation. I'm very pleased already but if the shaves get better over the next few weeks, all I'll be able to say is \\"wow!\\". And since Braun recommends that you shave with a dry face, I can shave any time without the whole blade production of wetting your face, applying shaving cream, shaving, in my case repeating all this against the grain, rinsing, and finally applying skin moistener. Which means no painful back from leaning over a sink or no need to take a shower. And the whole process of shaving with the Braun takes less than half the time of a razor shave. The result of all this is that I am a very happy camper, shaving every day and getting great shaves.<br /><br />I should briefly mention Braun's charging and cleaning system - it is fabulous. While you can charge with a cord and clean the shaver under running water (very useful when traveling), I highly recommend using Braun's charger/cleaner every day. It does a fantastic job, results in better shaves, and should prolong the useful life of the shaver before you have to change the blade cartridge.to take a shower. And the whole process of shaving with the Braun takes less than half the time of a razor shave. The result of all this is that I am a very happy camper, shaving every day and getting great shaves.<br /><br />I should briefly mention Braun's charging and cleaning system - it is fabulous. While you can charge with a cord and clean the shaver under running water (very useful when traveling), I highly recommend using Braun's charger/cleaner every day. It does a fantastic job, results in better shaves, and should prolong the useful life of the shaver before you have to change the blade cartridge.

  209. After having not seen my face for 20 years (and my daughter never having seen me unshaven), and having the grey in my beard the only grey, I decided to \\"go bare\\" a couple of months ago. When I last shaved in my 40s, I had the typical problem with ingrown hair, and was a little worried that problem would still be true.<br /><br />Now after shaving for a couple of months, i can say that the shaver is well worthy of its common excellent regard. It's convenient, easy to use, gets the small curves, is almost as exacting and maneuverable as a regular blade razor. I find the trimmer useful for grabbing those few hair that lie flat against the skin and trimming them closely.<br /><br />Some discoveries I've made about minimizing ingrown hairs are: 1) by not pressing, but letting the razor travel very lightly over my face, with multiple strokes, and 2) using neosporin (white) cream as my \\"aftershave,\\" I get almost no ingrown hair, and when I do, they don't flare into acne-like eruptions. Use the water-based neosporin cream not the oily regular stuff.

Of lesser importance but still annoying is the extreme noise and vibration created by this razor.   226. I have light growth that luckily allows me to go days without needing to shave. Actually my weeks worth of 'beard' may be equivalent to others daily 12 o'clock shadow!!<br /><br />But maybe because of this I found electric shavers never gave me a good clean shave, lots of missed spots and still leaving my face feeling rough. I've only owned two shavers in my 43 years, the last was a high end panasonic wet n dry model.<br /><br />Of course nothing beats a hand shave, but as I'm such an infrequent shaver find it a hassle and 'save' for special occasions! But boy what a smooth baby's bum result when I do!!<br /><br />Which leads me to my first impressions of the Braun 790. IMPRESSIVE! My first shave with it was the most smoothest electric shave ever, if not quite matching the baby bum smoothness of a hand shave. But so very very close.<br /><br />Love the maneuverability of the head which moulds to your face as you shave, and the ability to select mild, normal or intense shave. If I were to shave regulary - being every 2 or 3 days I would be happy to use the mild setting. If I leave it a bit longer the more intense settings can be used. I think this is a key feature that for me justifies choosing the 790 (NB: refer to edit below) over the cheaper but similarly featured 760 model. Otherwise the enhanced display and 'fast clean' functions of the 790 are nice but not showstoppers for me over the cheaper 760. Check the features as the 760 could be a better opmodel for your needs - def will give the same great shave result.<br /><br />But to be honest I bought this with a rebate offer and was such a great deal I didn't need to really worry about the price difference vs functions between the two models.<br /><br />I also like the self cleaning/ storage unit - it does not take up as much space on the vanity as other reviews intimated. I've only cleaned it once so far and whilst not sure I'd clean it daily (ha, as I said I don't even shave that often!!) but was impressed with the result and the lemony scent is quite pleasant. I used to clean my old razor with cleaning spray/brush which was a gross messy affair, so am all for the all in one self cleaning solution of the Braun.<br /><br />So overall I am wowed by this product and believe it is every penny well spent!<br /><br />EDIT 09/07 - It appears I misread the comparison specs as ALL new Series 7 models actually have the variable shave option. So I could've saved a few $$ myself as the only other differences I see are bells and whistles with the battery/hygiene display and the fast clean function on the cleaner. The specs/comparisons are in the Amazon listing, so check them out!ith the result and the lemony scent is quite pleasant.   227. Nice shaver with one tiny issue....just not that impressed with the level of noise when self cleaning. It does however provide a nice shave.
  228. I never thought I would pay $200 for an electric shaver! I used Remingtons most of my life (I am 70 years young). When my latest Remington died, I replaced it with a top-of-the-line Remington. It performed worse than the previous one, so I returned it. I then ordered the Panasonic ES8243A Arc IV Nano. While the Panasonic gave a pretty good shave, I found it quite uncomfortable to hold. In desperation, I ordered the Braun Series 7-7900cc. This shaver way out-performed anything I had previously had. Maybe you really do get what you pay for.<br /><br />This shaver leaves no hairs behind - even when shaving a 3-day old growth. Also, no \\"pulling\\" of hairs ever! The trimmer is the best of any shaver I have owned. For the first several months, I did not use the Braun \\"cleaning\\" system. I simply tapped the removable shaver head, blew out whisker \\"dirt\\" from the body and followed the wet cleaning procedure (running hot water over the head).<br /><br />After reading about the cleaning cartridge issues (good for only 1 month), I decided to try tapping & blowing followed by using the cartridge cleaning - then followed by resealing the cartridge until its next use (easy to do). I only shave every other day. This procedure looks like it will allow the cartridge to last a VERY long time. Even so, I cannot conclude that the cartridge cleaning leads to a better shave.<br /><br />In any case, I am extremely happy with this shaver. For me, it is the Lexus of electric shavers.

His face is so smooth now and he doesn't need to use the special creams anymore. He's been using it for about a year now and it still works really well. Great for black men or anyone with very thick, curly hair.

  233. This is one of the best electric shavers on the market. Shaves very close with no irritation. The cleaning/lubricating system seems like a sleazy money grab - and it is - but over time it's worthwhile as shaving performance always feels like new and you never have a disgusting, gunked up shaver.<br /><br />However, over the years Braun has been skimping on quality.<br /><br />What used to be an all metal shaver is now mostly plastic with metallic paint - pretty crappy for a top of the line product retailing for nearly $300.<br /><br />***8/25/11 Updating my review to note that battery life is actually amazing, contrary to what I originally posted, and much improved from previous models. While the \\"hygiene\\" indicator suggests a cleaning cycle after just a couple of shaves, the charge indicator barely registers a drop after a week of daily shaves. Among other things, this completely eliminates the need to bring along the charging cord when traveling, unless you're going to be away for over a month or plan to shave your dog with it. This is such a huge improvement that it warrants a bump from 3 to 4 stars.<br /><br />The power/charging cord has a ridiculously large and awkward plug that looks ugly, takes up too much space and sticks out four inches from the wall. Braun should at least redesign the plug with a swivel so it can be folded flat against the wall. The charging/cleaning station takes a long time to charge a dead battery and sounds like a chainsaw while cleaning (the plastic housing actually seems to amplify the normal sound of the shaver.)<br /><br />*** 8/25/11 Also wanted to note that this model features a quick clean mode (hidden button) that will get you up and running in just a few minutes. The down side is that this does not provide sufficient time for drying, giving you a face full of alcohol while shaving - so probably best to make do with the dirty shaver until you have time for a full cleaning cycle.<br /><br />For you environmentalists out there, this little shaver comes in a ludicrously large box, almost big enough to pack a basketball in.<br /><br />Finally, based on the previous model I owned, the pop-out trimmer is both useless and destined to fail. After finding that the hinge on mine had broken (meaning it sticks out and jabs you in the face) I discovered that many other owners have also had this part fail, and Braun's response is simply to buy a new shaver. Stay classy, Braun. I see no change in the design or materials used in the new model to suggest the current trimmer is more durable or replaceable than the old one. My recommendation is to avoid use of the trimmer entirely as this will greatly extend the usable life of your $300 shaver.his little shaver comes in a ludicrously large box, almost big enough to pack a basketball in.<br /><br />Finally, based on the previous model I owned, the pop-out trimmer is both useless and destined to fail. After finding that the hinge on mine had broken (meaning it sticks out and jabs you in the face) I discovered that many other owners have also had this part fail, and Braun's response is simply to buy a new shaver. Stay classy, Braun. I see no change in the design or materials used in the new model to suggest the current trimmer is more durable or replaceable than the old one. My recommendation is to avoid use of the trimmer entirely as this will greatly extend the usable life of your $300 shaver.

  235. I know this may be a bad pun but this Braun operates like it's on PED's.<br /><br />I have been using Gillette Fusion razors for years and have been happy with them. My one constant complaint was the razor burn and bumps I would get with my sensitive skin. I would take weekends off of shaving if I could and don't get me started on what my neck would look like if I had to wear a tie that day and had my collar pressed against my skin.<br /><br />I have only owned one electric shaver in the past and it was a Norelco wet and dry rotary shaver that I received as a gift. I wasn't a fan, it took forever to shave and it wasn't close at all. I still had bumps and I swore I would never use an electric shaver again.<br /><br />Fast forward to this recent purchase. I had an Amazon gift card for Fathers Day and my Birthday. After reading reviews I decided to give it a shot even though it seemed pricey. Wow was I impressed. I love the shaver and so does my wife =) I shave every day now and I look forward to it. I don't get bumps anymore and that's with using the highest setting. It is a close shave and does so with ease. As members have mentioned, it does take some time for your skin to get accustomed to using a shaver. You will notice your shaves being closer and closer as you get used to it.<br /><br />If there is a down side it would be the hygiene setting. It doesn't matter how well you clean the unit it shows it as a level 2 and needs fluid cleaning. I get that they are trying to sell their cleaner so be advised. So far I haven't had to replace the fluid and I have had this for over a month. It does smell good after the system cleans the unit.<br /><br />I also wish that the stand was straight black instead of the color with flecks. I keep thinking the unit is dusty but it is just the fleck in the color, minor issue.<br /><br />I am true believer in this shaver and don't see my self going to back to the razor. Buy this unit with confidence and even though it's pricey, you get what you pay for.it's pricey, you get what you pay for.
  236. There are only three reasons to buy an electric razor: save on blades, save time from buying blades or to avoid getting cut while shaving. Other than that blades, or manual shaving are superior--no one would argue that you can get as close as shave with an electric. The only thing they might say is \\"it is close to a blade.\\"<br /><br />With that said, I ordered the Braun 790. The thing has a whole lot of items to it and things you must buy to keep it going. Unlike the Braun of old when it actually was a German company which specialized in practicality and didn't try to milk customers into buying unnecessary things, Proctor & Gamble (the maker of Tide and Crest) bought them out and changed the game.<br /><br />Now you need to have this nasty alcohol solution cleaner--which must be repurchased every thirty days--in order to use your shaver. In the past Braun was designed to be cleaned with water and a brush. Furthermore, you need to replace the cutting block every year and a half for about forty bucks. So any money you might have saved by not having to buy blades is eaten up by Proctor & Gamble's desire to milk as much money as it can from you!<br /><br />Within a year and a half you will have spent nearly $400 to buy and maintain this razor--which will never shave as close as a blade and takes twice as long to shave as a blade. And unlike Panasonic which allows for shaving under water, Braun must be used dry which reduces lubrication and the closeness of the shave. All in all a raw deal, and therefore I am returning my Braun and realize the only thing this razor will help you get rid of is a lot of your money!<br /><br />UPDATE: I returned my Braun to Proctor & Gamble, you know the makers of Ivory, Crest, Tide, etc.; unlike the 8 weeks they promise to refund your money for this product, they took 13 weeks and will only give you a Citibank Prepaid Card instead of giving you actual money back. Like most things from Citibank, the card has all sorts of rules and limitations. I would avoid anything Proctor & Gamble and their worthless 60-day guarantee!limitations. I would avoid anything Proctor & Gamble and their worthless 60-day guarantee!

  240. I was excited to upgrade my older version Braun shaver to the latest and greatest, but despite all the (superfluous) bells and whistles, this razor did a worse job than my 10+ year razor. No matter how hard I pressed the razor, or increased the \\"intensity\\" button, there was still stubble left.<br /><br />The hygiene detector is smart in theory, but it always knocked one bar off no matter how long the razor was going (e.g. if my clean razor was used once, and then twice more quickly to get a couple of missed spots, I was dinged 3 hygiene bars). Read the product description for an explanation on that.<br /><br />Oh, and when I finally decided to send it back (after the advised 3 week trial period), all Braun offers is a phone message with an address. No person or opportunity to give feedback, just an address. It seemed as though they really didn't care that some users weren't satisfied.<br /><br />All in all, stick with an earlier version if you're set on Braun. This one wasn't quite ready for prime time.

My first is like 10 years old and still works very well and I never had a problem with it - just thought it was time to upgrade. I would compare this razor to a new generation Corvette.   258. After being extremely pleased with my Braun 5550 for fourteen years, and after considering the glowing reviews on the web, I purchased a Series 7. My 5550 reached the point it would no longer work with the cord, and since I'd already replaced the battery once, decided it was time to upgrade. I didn't really want all the features of a wet/dry shaver with self-cleaning, but purchasing a shaver with these extra add-ons seems to be the only way to get a quality model.<br /><br />I'm returning the Series 7. What takes the 5550 two or three strokes to shave smooth, takes the Series 7 a dozen or more. I don't have a heavy, or fast-growing beard, either. I think the bulk of the problem is the foil design, which has regularly-spaced, smaller holes than the replacement foil for the 5550...which has a pattern that looks like tiny wagon wheels. These are more adept at passing through hairs from different directions, and which lay differently against the face. Are you listening, Braun?<br /><br />The other complaint I have of the Series 7 is that it is very LOUD! Granted, I have sensitive hearing, but when shaving near my sideburns (over and over and over...) the noise is excruciating.<br /><br />This story has a happy ending, though. I found a repair service that will rebuild my 5550. While expensive, I'll be able to enjoy a quick and clean shave for a least a few more years.

  268. For years I touted the Norelco arcitec rotary shaver, because it did an excellent job: smooth shave, and in all the difficult nooks and crannies. Recently however, something changed: I suppose my beard got tougher. Suddenly, even after a brand new shaving head, I couldn't get a close shave no matter what. Not sure what happened, but my Norelco no longer worked for me. So I decided to research shavers, both rotary and foil.<br /><br />After a good three weeks of online research reading reviews both from the United States and Britain, the consensus was the Braun 790cc-4, \\"the king of shavers,\\" as one British reviewer put it. Very expensive, over $200, ranging from $210 to $250, depending on who's selling. BUT -- it has the most amazing features. For details see [...] . especially the self-cleaning feature. The shaver head is automatically washed out with a special solution, the stubble falls to the bottom of a small well in the shaver receptacle, the shaver head is cleaned, dried, lubricated and ends up having a refreshing lemon fragrance. Once the automatic cleaning/charging process is done, it's set to go again and looks and smells like brand new -- and, the shaver's battery is fully charged. That's just one amazing feature -- if you're in the market for an incredible shaver, do read the feature details on the website above. Watch the videos, which explain the inner workings.<br /><br />As for me -- I get blade-close shaves with the least amount of pressure, and the head doesn't even heat up. I'm not sure how long the honeymoon will last, but at this point I'm in it for the long haul!<br /><br />UPDATE, 3/2/14: After having used this baby for the last three years now, I can say this: it's perfect for me; I will never go back to anything else.
  269. I have been a Braun shaver user for the past 50 years, starting with the Braun Sixtant model in 1960 when I was still living in Europe. It was an outstanding shaver and I always got a smooth very close shave with it just like with the razor blade. I brought it with me when I moved to the US in 1970 and I was using it for the next 10 years or so. At that time only the foil replacement was recommended by Braun in every 2-3 years, the cutter was claimed to be self sharpening and I never replaced mine. The foils came in flat packs and you just bend them and pop them into the brushed stainless steel foil holder. I brought quite a few of them with me when I came to the US and I never had any problem with it for the next ten years or so.<br />Later on I purchased many of the new models which had a few more extra bells and whistles, some convenience features, twin cutting blocks and became cordless and rechargeable which was probably the most significant change for me. But they really could not improve on the performance of the Sixtant since it was so good to begin with, but I was happy with all the other forthcoming models I purchased.<br />I still have the 7570 model in very good working condition and still holds the charge very well after 11 years, the first one came with the cleaning system (very bad design) which broke after 2-3 months of use, but I felt that the cleaning system on this shaver does not really needed anyway. As long as the cutting block was separate from the foil it was fast, efficient and easy to clean it with the brush. Later I purchased the 8595 model which had a lot better designed jet cleaning system, it was a bit noisier than the 7570 but the performance was the same.<br />Before I got the 790cc I tried the Philips Norelco 1280X w/jet clean system which is a very nice and quiet shaver, does an excellent job and close shave but I could not get used to the ergonomics and the Braun definitely gives me a touch closer shave, my face felt a lot smoother after shaving even with the Braun 7570.<br />Finally I decided to get the 790cc the latest and greatest Braun which certainly has a lot of nice features, bells and whistles, easy to use and convenient to clean it with the cleaning system every other day, when the shaver feels and smells fresh, like new. My 7570 is still in very good working condition and compared to the 790cc it gives me the same close shave as my new 790cc, no noticeable difference to me. However I enjoy the new design, all the new features, the better ergonomics and the convenience of the clean and renew station.<br />So I am back to the same brand I have been using for the past 50 years and I am delighted with the performance of this new 790cc shaver and I can honestly say there is no other shaver on the market which gives you this close shave without any skin irritation, highly recommend it to anybody.<br /><br />Update after almost 3 years:<br />I still have this Braun 790CC which works well but always has been pretty noisy and although I commented before that it gives me a touch closer shave than the Philips 1280XX it is really a toss up since I just repurchased a new Philips 1280XX/42 and alternately using both of them. They equal in closeness of shave and the Philips appears to be made from better material. On the Braun 790CC some of the nice metal looking parts are silver paint covered plastic and this paint coating is now bubbling up at the back under the cutting head after a couple of years of use and Jet cleaning which is very disappointing. The only thing with the Philips that it gives me a touch more skin irritation sometimes if I am not careful enough around the lower neck area, but very close and extremely quiet shave. No doubt that these 2 shavers are the best on the market today and I will be using both of them alternately for a while and make a final judgement if I will keep both of them or just the one I prefer to use.<br /><br />Another update after using both the above shaversalternately for 3 weeks:<br />After 2 weeks of use there was no more skin irritation with the Philips and I had to come to a conclusion that the Philips 1280XX gives me faster, a lot quieter, smoother and even a bit closer shave than the Braun 790CC. Final word, the Philips 1280XX is the keeper for me.alternately for 3 weeks:<br />After 2 weeks of use there was no more skin irritation with the Philips and I had to come to a conclusion that the Philips 1280XX gives me faster, a lot quieter, smoother and even a bit closer shave than the Braun 790CC. Final word, the Philips 1280XX is the keeper for me.

  275. I like everything about this shaver except the fact that I couldn't get a close shave. I was vert upset. I spent over 200.00 on this.<br />We got rid of the razor and cleaner refills,still never opened.<br />This a review about tge product we never used the product, just be well informed of Amazon.

  286. After all of the positive reviews I wanted to really like this product. However when it arrived and tried it out I was greatly disappointed. It simply made noise and didn't cut anything. I took out my $30 shaver and went over the same spots just to make sure I wasn't imagining things and sure enough it just wasn't cutting anything.<br /><br />I must say Amazon was excellent in refunding my money quickly so that I was able to purchase another shaver that works great.<br /><br />For all of you who are pleased with this good for you, but for me it was a very bad experience.
  287. I have been a fan of Braun for many years. I have owned a couple of 3 series and loved them. I decided to move up to this series 7 shaver. Wow! The difference was day and night. Don't get me wrong, I am very happy with what I have used in the past. I used this shaver for the first time this morning. After a single pass over my jaw line, it looked like hair never grew there! I also use these shavers on my head because... I shave my head. That will test any shaver for a close shave. What can I say, this shaver was hands down better. Usually it takes a little time to do my head, but this shaver must have cut down on the time by 75%! I did use the most aggressive shave setting for my face and head. Obviously it took more time (passes) on my head then face, but I never got this close or smooth of a look or feel before! Please note: I've been shaving for many years with electric shaver's so my skin is used to them. I would highly recommend this shaver.
  288. After using razor blades for 30+ years,I decided to try an electric shaver for the first time because I was unhappy about the expense of the blades. After much reseach I decided on the Braun series 7 razor. Although more expensive than most I figured it would pay for itself in the long run. I have a fairly heavy beard as the blade would last about a week and was looking for quality and performance in an electric razor. I found both in this Braun razor. I'm very happy with this purchase.

As soon as it came in, I plugged it in to charge and while it charged I took the time to read the manual. When it was finally charged, I had my first shave with the 790cc. Wow!! I did not expect the shave to be that close! It feels like I shaved with a razor.   305. I have been using Braun electric razors for almost 20 years. This is probably my 5th or 6th model over that period of time. This model (Series 7-790cc-4) is definitely an improvement. I think the biggest improvement is the increased RPMs which reduces the total shave time. However, you must turn up the 3 stage intensity to the maximum setting. I don't really use the first 2 intensity settings as I don't think the RPMs are high enough.<br /><br />I also really like the shape and weight of this model. It is much more ergonomic. The carrying case is also improved over the older styles which were just cheap plastic. My only issue is that I still have to use my other hand to push against my skin in front of the razor to raise my facial hair. I keep hoping that one day I won't have to do that. My total shave time (after going over my face numerous times) is about 10 minutes which has been cut down from 15-20 minutes on the previous model.
  306. I got this razor gift for my dad. So, it's the best electric razor and you get what you want and a lot of extras as well.

  325. FIRST IMPRESSION REVIEW:<br /><br />I know people will be asking specifically asking which Panasonic model I'm coming from. Here it is: [[ASIN:B000VKZMHK Panasonic ES8109S Men's 3-Blade (Arc 3) Wet/Dry Nanotech Rechargeable Electric Shaver with Vortex Cleaning System, Silver]]<br /><br />Where to start...People are usually most interested with how close the shave is. I thought that the Panasonic shaved close, but it really doesn't compare with the Braun considering the passes necessary to complete your shave for the Panasonic versus the Braun. Now some people will say I paid another hundred dollars on top of what I paid for the Panasonic, but it's more like $45 (Cyber Monday deal for the win). Even if paying another hundred dollars I'll say this once: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAID FOR. Emphasis necessary.<br /><br />First impressions:<br />-Shaver is well put together and excellent grip (Rubberized)<br />-Buzzer for the mustache and side burns actually works (Panasonic you felt forced and uncomfortable making sure it worked)<br />-The cleaning station is as simple and functional as it gets (Considerable difference between this one and Panasonic's)<br />-3 different power settings for shaver is a huge plus for me (Sensitive areas benefit from lower power setting)<br />-Travel case looks awesome and sturdy enough to protect (Panasonic only provided pouch and plastic cover to protect foil)<br /><br />Cons:<br />-For those who want a wet shaver, this shaver is not for you<br />-Haven't come across any others<br /><br />TL;DR: Better than Panasonic. Worth the money if you want a dry shaver. Will update if anything changes.

  328. I have been using electric shaver for 20 yrs. I had several different makers and different models like Panasonic,Remington,Wahl and ofcourse Braun. This one I like because it is quitter and shaves real good. I recommend anyone who wants to buy electric shaver to go for Braun Series 7.

  330. Hands down the best shave from an electric razor I have ever had. And the cleaning system is great. If you're looking for a shaver in this range, look no further, this is the one. I like the fact that I can take it on short trips without the base as well...held a charge for over 4 weeks once without being plugged in (mind you I don't shave every day, but still), and I can clean it with just water when I'm away from the base. Great stuff.
  331. Great shaver. I use it on my head, and it shaves faster and cleaner than any other electric I've used.
  332. The other reviews on here rave about this product, but I fell as if these are users who have little experience with older foils. This shaver has some important pros but some important cons as well. I've been using it since January.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- excellent battery life<br />- can be rinsed under the tap<br />- little to no tugging of hairs<br />- motor seems sufficiently powerful<br />-the different power settings are a nice touch. Occasionally I like using a lower power setting on my neck<br />-does a decent job (not great, not as good as previous generations of this product) of catching grain in different direction.<br /><br />Cons:<br />- does not capture cut hair very well. Your stubble will get all over your shirt.<br />- Construction feels a little flimsy, at least for a premium product<br />- The base is a flimsy looking and feeling product, I don't like having it on my counter as a result.<br />- the pop up trimmer is in a strange location. You cannot see where you are trimming when using it. It also doesn't work very well, I still use my whal trimmer instead of this.<br />- clean up is a little bit of a hassle. The foil release button doesnt work very well.<br /><br />Overall, I agree with some of the reviewers who compared this to the older, more powerful, braun foils.
  333. I have never owned better shaver. This product is great. I am using it for more than 2 years and the battery life did not change at all. I still recharge it after three weeks of use, considering the fact that my beard is very hard to shave. The other thing that I like most is that this shaver doesn't irritate my skin even on the hard mode like Philips's product do. Next, I spend around 5 minutes to shave my face and clean the shaver, with Philips I spend 10 minutes to shave only. Only thing that I do not like at this point is that it is very hard for me to shave the part of my face that is next to the ears ... probably I have to practice more ;)
  334. UPDATED REVIEW<br /><br />35 years ago my Father told me \\"If Your going to use an electric razor - buy a Braun\\" and so began a relationship with Braun products that up until recently has lasted close to forty years. I was always eager to try the new models, Braun razors were just one of those products that only got better and more innovative as time marched on. When Braun introduced the first cleaning/charging system for the 8585 model, I bought one immediately and loved it. When the Pulsonic came out I bought the 790cc and as you can see from my review below I adored it.<br /><br />What set Braun apart from every single other electric razor on the planet was it's foil and cutting block - which really did last their promised 18 months. For those that remember the multi patented Optifoil was unlike anything else on the market. Instead of uniform, same shaped holes. The foil had a wide variety of different shapes. Circles, half moons, crescents, stars and so on. It seemed random in placement but there was a method to the madness and you really ended up with a blade close shave.The foil and cutter (linear blades designed by Gillette) when it comes to performance the cutting block and foil is the very heart of any electric razor.<br /><br />Being both a head and face shaver, I prefer a wet shave with a DE (double edge) safety razor or straight blade. But the process is time consuming. I've tried other electrics over the years and they all have been sub par on most every level compared to the Braun.<br /><br />Enter Proctor & Gamble.<br /><br />When P&G bought out Braun they made some significant changes. The small appliances division was closed down. Manufacturing of the electric razors was terminated in Germany and resumed in China with the exception of the 760 & 790cc which are still, at least for the time being made in Germany.<br /><br />P&G scrapped the original foil and replaced it with the generic series 7 one. Now with uniform octagon punch holes and many without the center \\" Active Lift\\" strip now this once excellent razor shaves as well as any $40 piece of junk.<br /><br />Most resellers of replacement heads both on and off Amazon feature a photo of the original foil and cutter but ship the \\"new and improved\\" P&G version which is neither .You'll also find no shortage of disgruntled consumers who detest this stripped down and terribly compromised version.<br /><br />The Braun you knew, the Braun I knew doesn't exists now in name only.<br /><br />I have little doubt Max Braun who founded Braun on a promise of uncompromised product integrity and performance in the 1920's would be appalled at the products now attached to his name. P&G one of last hold outs regarding animal testing, has a long history of buying and destroying wonderful products and companies - they couldn't have done a better job if they had set out and tried.<br /><br />As for me, I'm breaking in a new Norelco Sensotouch 3D it's a very decent razor but it's not a Braun. But then again nothing is, not anymore - not even Braun itself.<br /><br />ORIGINAL REVIEW<br /><br />The Braun series 7- 790 Pulsonic is the only shaver left in the Braun line that's still made in Germany - and the craftsmanship shows. Solid build quality, beautifully balanced and smart looking.The head of the razor pivots twice as much as any other razor in the history of the company.<br /><br />Braun has long been applauded for their patented micro thin foil. A random array of different sized and shaped holes. On this model you get two floating heads - each one flexes and moves independently of the other. This helps the razor glide across any bumps or curves providing a gorgeous sense of conformity.<br /><br />The blades (made by Gillette) are fastened into a cutting block and cut from side to side beneath the foil. Much like a tiny pair razor sharp scissors snapping at turbo speed. In between the two heads is another patented Braun exclusive - the power comb.It's an odd looking zig zaggizmo that runs back forth at very fast speeds. It lifts up stubborn, hard to reach hairs as well as any that may be trying desperately to hide from their impending doom.<br /><br />If you have a moustache, beard or goatee you'll really like the pop up trimmer. It's sharp, lightening fast and at an angle that actually lets you see what you're doing.<br /><br />Pulsonic Technology<br /><br />10,000 pulsations per minute. May seem like a gimmick - it did to me. But after two months of use I can assure you it's not.<br />There's a method to the madness in that the vibrations cause the hairs to stand up for easier, closer cutting.The odd thing is there's really no \\"sensation\\" on your face or if your like me are a head shaver as well. Put this puppy on the back of your hand and those pulsations shoot along the bones right to your fingertips - the feeling is like a painless electric shock. (don't ask how I discovered this)<br /><br />The Clean & Renew system<br /><br />Braun claims the Pulsonic cleaning system is the most advanced and intelligent in the world. Based on my experience with it, I have to agree. There are two digital meters of \\"bars\\" at the base of the shaver. The left is \\"Hygiene\\" and the right \\"Power level\\"<br /><br />The level of cleaning i.e.: economy, regular and intense is determined by how many bars have disappeared from the gage. Trust me I've tried to outsmart it. You can bypass the clean & Renew system by washing the shaver (head only) under running warm water, place it back in the charging stand and get a different reading. But why bother?<br /><br />Using the Clean & Renew system is like waking up to a brand new razor each and every day. I clean my razor after every use, that's at least once a day and sometimes two. My first cartridge lasted five weeks before the indicator light to change it came on.The replacement heads should last 18 months, for head shavers like myself it's half that. Replacement heads (foil and blades) retail for about $45 - but has them for about half that.<br /><br />I paid $269.00 for mine and am quite amazed to see the razor on sale on Amazon for less than $190.<br /><br />The shave.<br /><br />Absolutely the smoothest , fastest and most stubble free shave I've ever experienced with an electric. I can spend an hour using my arsenal of pre shaves and creams, my Merkur 12C HD and 23C both loaded with new Feather blades (sharpest razor blades made) and still not get as close and stubble free of a shave as I get with the Braun.<br /><br />What you Get.<br /><br />* The Razor<br /><br />* The charging station with the Clean & Renew system<br /><br />* Power cord (for razor and station)<br /><br />* One cleaning cartridge<br /><br />* Nifty carrying case<br /><br />* Cleaning brush<br /><br />* Users manual<br /><br />Mine also included a travel razor, the Braun Pocket-Go P-70. It's a nice little travel razor that actually does a great job. It runs on two AA batteries which are included and the razor can be cleaned under running water. This may have been a limited time offer. But a nice touch.gizmo that runs back forth at very fast speeds. It lifts up stubborn, hard to reach hairs as well as any that may be trying desperately to hide from their impending doom.<br /><br />If you have a moustache, beard or goatee you'll really like the pop up trimmer. It's sharp, lightening fast and at an angle that actually lets you see what you're doing.<br /><br />Pulsonic Technology<br /><br />10,000 pulsations per minute. May seem like a gimmick - it did to me. But after two months of use I can assure you it's not.<br />There's a method to the madness in that the vibrations cause the hairs to stand up for easier, closer cutting.The odd thing is there's really no \\"sensation\\" on your face or if your like me are a head shaver as well. Put this puppy on the back of your hand and those pulsations shoot along the bones right to your fingertips - the feeling is like a painless electric shock. (don't ask how I discovered this)<br /><br />The Clean & Renew system<br /><br />Braun claims the Pulsonic cleaning system is the most advanced and intelligent in the world. Based on my experience with it, I have to agree. There are two digital meters of \\"bars\\" at the base of the shaver. The left is \\"Hygiene\\" and the right \\"Power level\\"<br /><br />The level of cleaning i.e.: economy, regular and intense is determined by how many bars have disappeared from the gage. Trust me I've tried to outsmart it. You can bypass the clean & Renew system by washing the shaver (head only) under running warm water, place it back in the charging stand and get a different reading. But why bother?<br /><br />Using the Clean & Renew system is like waking up to a brand new razor each and every day. I clean my razor after every use, that's at least once a day and sometimes two. My first cartridge lasted five weeks before the indicator light to change it came on.The replacement heads should last 18 months, for head shavers like myself it's half that. Replacement heads (foil and blades) retail for about $45 -but has them for about half that.<br /><br />I paid $269.00 for mine and am quite amazed to see the razor on sale on Amazon for less than $190.<br /><br />The shave.<br /><br />Absolutely the smoothest , fastest and most stubble free shave I've ever experienced with an electric. I can spend an hour using my arsenal of pre shaves and creams, my Merkur 12C HD and 23C both loaded with new Feather blades (sharpest razor blades made) and still not get as close and stubble free of a shave as I get with the Braun.<br /><br />What you Get.<br /><br />* The Razor<br /><br />* The charging station with the Clean & Renew system<br /><br />* Power cord (for razor and station)<br /><br />* One cleaning cartridge<br /><br />* Nifty carrying case<br /><br />* Cleaning brush<br /><br />* Users manual<br /><br />Mine also included a travel razor, the Braun Pocket-Go P-70. It's a nice little travel razor that actually does a great job. It runs on two AA batteries which are included and the razor can be cleaned under running water. This may have been a limited time offer. But a nice touch.
  335. Best electric shaver I've ever had. Over all the best in Braun shavers
  336. I don't usually get a very good shave from electric razors but this one works much more nicely on me than any other electric that I've ever used. It's pretty close to a blade, but unlike a blade this razor doesn't give me skin problems like a blade does (due to my \\"sensitive\\" skin).<br /><br />My only complaint is that I have to buy cleaning cartridges. I wish I could just refill it with isopropyl alcohol from the drug store, though something like that would probably be kind of difficult for Braun to accomplish. The cartridge thing doesn't bother me too much because they aren't that expensive; I'm just worried that one day they'll stop making them.
  337. My wife Janet wanted to buy me the Braun series 7 pulsonic shaver. I've had a number of electric shavers including a recent Braun and always returned to a blade.<br />I insisted it have a return policy.<br />To my surprize this one gave me a shave as close to a blade as possible without knicks, so have decided to keep it.
  338. the cleaning tank does not travel well...but once a week cleaning is ok. other than that.. the product is great.
  339. I previously owned a Braun 9595 shaver, but it was due for a new head, and the battery was starting to fail, so I decided to try the new model. From my standpoint, the big selling point of this shaver is the automatic cleaning using an alcohol based disinfectant, which reduces the risk of infection. The 9595 gave a pretty good shave--not as good as a blade, but about as good as I've gotten from electric razor. It did have one annoying characteristic--it was horribly noisy. With this model, Braun has managed to moderate the noise level without any loss in shave quality. Aside from that, it's pretty near identical. The cleaning/charging base also seems to be the same, except for cosmetic differences. It takes the same cleaning cartridges, and I was able to use the new base to clean my old 9595. It came with a soft travel case that I don't like as well as the old hard case--but since the new one fits in the old case, that's no problem for me.
  340. Don't be fooled by all the \\"advanced technology\\" propaganda.<br />I just bougth this shaver a week ago because my Philips Norelco needed it's heads replaced..<br />so I thought i would buy a much more expensive shaver whose head costs less to replace anyways.<br />I thought it would pay off in the end.<br />But this shaver shaves worse than my Philips Norelco! I have come to appreciate my Norelco<br />shaver since it shaves even better with it's old heads than this shaver as new...even though<br />this one is more than five times the price...literally.<br />Wow...just wow.<br /><br />Also with this shaver you HAVE to shave over the sink. There is no space inside it to store the<br />hair. This shaver would be fair if it was $20, not $200.

  355. After charging the shaver I tried my first shave. Fantastic results. Head mechanism pivited correctly and locked properly. Inserted the shaver in the cleaning recepticle and all went ok. Next morning while using the shaver I tried locking the head but to no avail. Pivited the head in both directions and tried moving the slide switch to lock the head and neither position of the head would lock. After reading a couple of other reviews I am not the only one with the problem. I probably will not send the shaver off for repair and use it just as is. My older Braun a 7526 Syncro never once gave me a problem. A follow-up on this review. After one year of use the razor is shedding its finish. The paint is flaking off more than likely do to daily use of the Braun recommended cleaner solution. I emailed Braun and their only suggestion was to send the unit in for repair. I am not a happy Braun customer.<br /><br />Update 1/4/2015<br /><br />The paint on the razor has flaked off on the inside of the cutter head housing. It is so bad that it clogs the small port of the cleaning chamber. I am very disappointed in the quality of this shaver. My older model Braun a 7526 is of much better quality and I will probably go back to using it and throwing the 790cc in the garbage where it belongs

  363. I've always shaved with blades, like the Mach 3, but wanted to try an electric. For camping and travel, a cordless electric seemed like a great idea.<br /><br />The physical quality of the shaver is high, and the charging stand is nice. It of course looks great with the cool blue glow and the classic Braun tilt when placed in the cradle.<br /><br />However, it doesn't work. Pressing lightly on my face does nothing, pressing harder does a little, but not enough to leave the house without looking ridiculous. I have tried it a few more times recently, just to give it another chance, and have the same results. The last time, I was able to partially shave an area of my face, but there were two hairs it just would never remove. They weren't weird mutant hairs, just normal hairs that I could have easily just plucked out, and of course remove easily with a traditional blade. If I have to get out a blade to finish up, it's not worth it.<br /><br />I don't know if mine is defective, or if my hair is weird, but it's useless. I should have returned it, but I kept telling myself I just hadn't figured it out. It's now too late.<br /><br />I've since switched to an old fashioned safety razor, which is the best shave I've been able to do myself.<br /><br />I still would rather have a working electric, if only for camping. Oh well.
  364. Not worth the money. This shaver is loud as a jet plane, and the vibration is bone jarring. And the shave is no better than my $50 Norelco.   365. As a longtime user of Braun shavers (20 years), each model was a significant and welcome improvement over the last. Until now.<br /><br />Previous models shaved so well that my wife thought I used a blade. For the 3 months I tried this model, I used my 4-year old 6000 series to clean up everything this expensive shaver missed. People commented on my 'one day' stubble the same day I shaved with this razor. For shaving quality, this model was a visible step down from earlier Brauns.<br /><br />Although quieter than other models, there's no audible confirmation of clipped beard hairs as they're cut, so it's harder to brush over an area and hear whether you got additional hairs you'd missed before.<br /><br />There are improvements such as the trimmer that folds nicely away into a stylish and rubber-accented grip. It also has a clean silver look with a nice blue LED accent. Although the base is too busy-looking for my tastes, it's shaped well and looks sturdy for being made of plastic. You honestly couldn't buy a better-looking shaver.<br /><br />But for a close shave, this is a huge step back for Braun. Although their new shave head does a great job of retaining clippings and catching those pesky hairs that lay flat against your skin, the overall shave is far inferior to previous models. Worse, the entire line of Braun shavers including the 3 and 5 series all use a variation of this inferior shave head as well. As a result, I've turned to discontinued Braun shavers (6000 and 8000 series) and grudgingly turned in my longtime Braun fan-boy status for a move to Panasonic.<br /><br />PROS:<br />For those with soft beards, this may work well<br />Gets hairs pressed flat against your skin very well<br />Attractive and accurate charging level display<br />Retains shavings better than earlier models (fewer flecks fall out)<br />Quieter shaver (not as noisy) than others<br /><br />CONS:<br />Pop out trimmer isn't as wide as previous models<br />Trimmer has odd angle (hard to see where you're trimming)<br />Shaver looks ergonomic, but is hard to hold firmly in hand<br />Shave head becomes unbearably hot after 10 minutes of use<br />Unnecessary cleaning solution<br />Travel case holds shaver only, not charging cord<br />Charging cord is bulky (huge head on outlet side)<br />With cleaning base, takes up a lot of space on countertop<br /><br />Braun provides a 90-day guarantee if you don't like the shaver. So, if you're on the fence, give it a try. NOV 2010 UPDATE - This has now been reduced to a 60-day guarantee by Braun.<br /><br />If you don't like it and choose to return it, get ready to walk the gauntlet and wait a long time for your refund. The Braun web site makes it nearly impossible to find the return location (keep the form that comes with your shaver for these details - which may be outdated and refer to the 90-day risk free period which is now only 60 days). Braun requires 8-12 weeks to even notify you (by mail) that they received your shaver and then even longer to cut a refund check. Their refund center has a looping phone tree that suggests you can check the status of your return but endlessly loops to a recording of the location to mail your shaver instead. Obviously keep your receipt. Also send your return with a Delivery Confirmation to preserve your costly investment.rd to see where you're trimming)<br />Shaver looks ergonomic, but is hard to hold firmly in hand<br />Shave head becomes unbearably hot after 10 minutes of use<br />Unnecessary cleaning solution<br />Travel case holds shaver only, not charging cord<br />Charging cord is bulky (huge head on outlet side)<br />With cleaning base, takes up a lot of space on countertop<br /><br />Braun provides a 90-day guarantee if you don't like the shaver. So, if you're on the fence, give it a try. NOV 2010 UPDATE - This has now been reduced to a 60-day guarantee by Braun.<br /><br />If you don't like it and choose to return it, get ready to walk the gauntlet and wait a long time for your refund. The Braun web site makes it nearly impossible to find the return location (keep the form that comes with your shaver for these details - which may be outdated and refer to the 90-day risk free period which is now only 60 days). Braun requires 8-12 weeks to even notify you (by mail) that they received your shaver and then even longer to cut a refund check. Their refund center has a looping phone tree that suggests you can check the status of your return but endlessly loops to a recording of the location to mail your shaver instead.   379. I know you probably think I work for Braun, but let me assure you - I don't.<br /><br />I just received the Series 7 a couple days ago and I can say with certainty that this is the very best electric razor I've ever owned. I upgraded from the Braun Series 5, so I was already a Braun user. I had it for about five years, and only decided to upgrade because the original blade for the Series 5 was no longer available and the reviews of the replacement were not so hot. Although that bugged me somewhat, I decided to take a chance on the Series 7. It was totally worth it.<br /><br />First off, this is the closest shave I've ever had with an electric razor. There's no doubt: this razor shaves as close as a manual blade. The shave is perfect. Even getting the hairs on my neck are no problem.<br /><br />Second, there is no razor burn. That was actually a slight problem for me on the Series 5, but it is gone with the Series 7.<br /><br />Finally, the motor is very quiet and the actual shave is very smooth. There's no tugging of hairs or any other discomfort that some electric razors have. Everything is just so smooth, even when I shaved on two days worth of stubble. Still great.<br /><br />If you're thinking of upgrading, this is actually a case where it's worthwhile. If you're thinking of trying an electric for the first time, this is the one to go with. Yes it's pricey, but worth it. When you add it up over time, it pays for itself. I just hope Braun keeps the replacement blade for this model available for a LONG time! I seriously don't know how they could improve upon the Series 7. It's basically the perfect electric razor.

  391. I purchased the 790 Holiday Edition from Amazon as a Lightning Deal for a steal of a price. I'd looked into this shaver before, but felt that at near $300 it was listed for at the time, it was a bit too rich for my blood. When I saw the great sale price, I jumped on it and am glad I did.<br /><br />This is my first electric shaver. I am a black man, which means that I, like many others have problems with ingrown hairs. Since I was in high school, I've used balding clippers to shave. Yes, this is painful and really irritates the face, but I like a clean look, so I've delt with the issue.<br /><br />I'm over 30 now, and over the years have become educated on many what I call \\"male beautification products\\", but not the bar soap like crap sold in Wal-Mart that enhance the shaving experience. Even after using clensers, shave oil, and cooling gels from Jack Black and others, I was still scared of a razor or typical electric shaver.<br /><br />My perspective changed when hearing about the Braun Series 7. I felt that if the shaver was reviewed that well, it must be good enough to try, so I did and am more than happy.<br /><br />I only shave every other day and take weekends off. With my old clippers, stubble was always there just a little and the second day showed that I truly needed to shave. With the Series 7, my face is smooth and my razor bump problem is minimal. Good products from Kiehls, The Art of Shaving, and Jack Black help with that problem. My second day now looks like my old day one with the clippers. The Series 7 takes care of the shaving quite well.<br /><br />A note about getting a close shave with the Series 7. I don't know other guys experiences, but with my face, hair grows in many different directions, so to get a smooth shave I start off with the strong setting, then go back over my face with the other lighter settings, and hit the tough spots repeatedly. Yes, this takes a little longer, but it helps you not miss any spots, but I'm only talking maybe 5 to 7 minutes to finish shaving.<br /><br />Overall, I love the Series 7; it works, and you can get a close smooth shave that is painless. Because I only shave every other day, my refills last a little longer. Only one Clean and Renew refill comes with your shaver. Ordering the refills from Amazon is much cheaper than buying them in a store, and you can get them automatically ordered on a schedule that you set up.<br /><br />If you like electric, or wish to switch, the Series 7 can't be beaten.king maybe 5 to 7 minutes to finish shaving.<br /><br />Overall, I love the Series 7; it works, and you can get a close smooth shave that is painless. Because I only shave every other day, my refills last a little longer. Only one Clean and Renew refill comes with your shaver.   398. I have a tendency to \\"over buy\\" and get disappointed by the results but that's not the case here. The tl;dr version is that you can buy an expensive electric razor and get something that performs very well for the price. Just don't expect it to be an all-in-one solution.<br /><br />I've been using the 790cc for a few days now and think it's the best electric razor I've owned. Granted, my previous razors came off retail shelves at big box stores. So, my shaving evolution has been:<br /><br />- 3 blade Mach 3 razor. It wasn't bad, but still irritated me. And, I'm lazy, so I wouldn't do it every day.<br />- Remington Foil (no idea, got from a big box store) gave me a vastly inferior shave compared to the razor.<br />- Got frustrated, grew a full beard.<br />- Shaved the beard, used a Norelco similar to the QT4070 and a 5 blade razor to maintain. I really liked the 5 blade razor but bas still lazy which lead to infrequent shaving.<br />- Norelco busted, and I picked up a Wahl Groomsman Plus with many attachments hoping for a decent all in one product. Of course, the trimmer was good enough but the shave was less than satisfying.<br />- Now using the 790cc for shaving and the Wahl for trimming.<br /><br />As for the 790cc, it really does well on my stubborn neck hairs without leaving a sandpaper look. I flipped out the trimmer but it's a bit of joke. If you have trimming to do, pick up a simple trimmer to keep near by the 790cc.
  399. I owned the previous iteration of this shaver system, I think it was the top of the line 360 Complete #8995, for about 10 years until the base station died and I decided to upgrade the full set, rather than just replacing the base station.<br /><br />This one does have some interesting new features including a more ergonomic grip, better battery charge and cleaning indicators, and a variable 3-speed design while maintaining compatibility with the same cleaning cartridges I already stocked.<br /><br />Unfortunately, however, this model seems to be very finnicky about being perfectly perpendicular to your face at all times, whereas the previous one was quite a bit more forgiving. This one, brand new with a pristine cutting foil, likes to grab and painfully tear at hairs near the edges of the foil in a way the previous model would never do. Very painfully, in fact. It's taking some getting used to. Other than that, it's a fine shaver.
  400. I have been using this shaver for about a month now and I can feel safe to say this shaver is the best shaver I have ever owned. I have been spying on this shaver for about two years but was reluctant to pull the trigger on a $200 shaver purchase. Now I kick myself in the butt for not doing it sooner. I am in the US military and therefore have to shave every day. Shaving everyday can be very tough on the face using a razor or even subpar shaver (which I have been doing for years.) The pivoting head helps the contour to every part of my face. It's fairly quiet and even cuts the hair that lays flat on my face. The clean and renew base is cool but I'd even purchase the shaver if that wasn't offered. Slap on some Lectric Shave just before using the shaver and your face will be baby butt smooth.

(Sorry, english is not my native language, so I do not know all the correct words for what I want to say.) With it I can shave quickly, daily and have a great result. When using the Mach 3 I could only shave every other day due to skin irritation.<br /><br />Having experienced using an old school straight razor I feel that the Braun does not give me the same close shave, but then, neither did the Mach 3. For everyday use, it is more than enough and I don't have the hassle of creams and cleaning up after. (The Braun cleans itself.)<br /><br />There is only one downside in my opinion, but it will not stop me from using the 790cc: The shaver head gets warm after a while. This is not really a problem, but as far as I can tell, if it stayed cold like other Braun models, it would be much better.<br /><br />This is an awesome product and I recommend it to everyone.

  414. Upgraded from an old braun freeglider 5710 that died after 5 years of continuous daily use! I shave pretty much everyday. My skin feels smooth but when I look closer I can see stubbles in some of the most tricky areas like the neck and jaw areas. To get a really good shave you have to pull your skin up real good and run the shaver back and forth at least 3 or 4 times. Since I shave daily around the same time I can easily tell the difference between my old freeglider and the new 790.<br />To summarize:<br />Pros:<br />- Good cleaning system. Shaver feels nice and new after every clean. Never tried running it under water. Will probably do during my travels sooner!<br />- Gives a smooth shave.   416. Braun made a wise decision to compete in their lower-end lineup using Chinese labor yet still keep their high-end models made in Germany to ensure high quality. I have used Braun for decades after trying out Remington and Norelco models. The Braun provides a better, faster shave, especially when my beard is a few days long. The pop-up trimmer actually functions well and is easy to see. There is a built-in lock that holds the flexible head at about 35° to make it easier to get up close and personal in hard-to-reach areas like the sideburns and nose. It is easily activated and deactivated with one finger, even while shaving.<br /><br />I have been shaving now for 43 years, 36 of those with a Braun. The first two were made in Germany and lasted nearly 20 years each. I expect this one to last just as long. Blades are relatively expensive they are designed to last for 18 to 24 months. If compared to how many straight razor blades you would need for 18 to 24 months these blades are dirt cheap.<br /><br />All in all, there is no better way to get a close smooth shave for such a low overall cost.

  423. I have had a few Braun shavers before, so purchasing the latest offering from Braun really was a no brainer. Their reputation is upheld by this product. Everything works as it should: effortlessly, comfortably, logically, and smoothly.<br /><br />Grasping the shaver in your hands one immediately recognizes the quality of the build and comfortable ergonomic design; the handle fits in different positions in one's hand depending on the part of the face or angle required at that given point of shaving. There is curved groove on the facing side of the shaver where the thumb sits quite comfortably (I know, I keep saying \\"comfortable\\" and \\"comfortably\\", but they are the most accurate words to use). Right where the thumb rests is also where one would access the trimmer; just a quick and effortless slide upwards and you are ready to trim your sideburns and then just as easily close it and continue shaving, all without having to lift the thumb from where it rests.<br /><br />Shaving is very easy, and it does so with aplomb. The shaver runs smoothly over one's face. Once can choose to either take one's time and shave carefully and get all those pesky hairs, or if short on time, no problem, just switch to one of the three optional electronic shaver settings and shave more quickly without hurting the skin. It may not be as close, but it still shaves very close and will last most of a typical work day. I could go on, but don't wish to bore you with too many details.<br /><br />The Clean and Renew system (as with my previous Braun shaver) works perfectly; it quickly, easily, and effortlessly cleans the shaver's head, leaving it smelling wonderfully lemony, and charges the shaver completely to boot! So the next time a want to shave, I look forward to the lemony smell and a clean head running along my skin. I had a Panasonic shaver with its own version of a cleaning system, but it PALED IN COMPARISON to the Braun's. The cleaning solution cartridges for the Braun shavers aren't too expensive and only need to be replaced maybe every other month (depending on how often you use it - myself, I clean the shaver only twice a week at the most even though Braun suggests doing so every day, but this really is not necessary)<br /><br />In the end, this is an EXCELLENT SHAVER that works very well without anything that would prevent one from having a comfortable (Oops! There's that word again), close shave.<br /><br />By the way, when I purchased this right here from Amazon, they had the best price ANYWHERE! Thanks Amazon :)ren't too expensive and only need to be replaced maybe every other month (depending on how often you use it - myself, I clean the shaver only twice a week at the most even though Braun suggests doing so every day, but this really is not necessary)<br /><br />In the end, this is an EXCELLENT SHAVER that works very well without anything that would prevent one from having a comfortable (Oops! There's that word again), close shave.<br /><br />By the way, when I purchased this right here from Amazon, they had the best price ANYWHERE! Thanks Amazon :)

  427. When replacing my mid-priced Panasonic 807x shaver after it broke, I wanted to try a different brand and got many recommendations for Braun as sturdy and amazing shaves. The difference between top of the line and the one immediately behind it was only $10, so I went with this one.<br /><br />I've had it for a few days, Its great, but possibly not worth $200.<br /><br />Pros:<br />1. I like the battery readout. Its no longer roulette, with the Panasonic it would often just die in the middle of a shave.<br />2. The cleanliness reminder is a gimmick but useful even if it just counts the shaves.<br />3. The washing fluid is actually alcohol based. Panasonic had detergent soaked cartridges and I couldn't tell when to replace them.<br />4. Shave seems close enough, though I feel any one of them nowadays gets you a close shave. It gets the hair on my neck, though not with particularly amazing ease.<br />5. Trimmer is fast, strong and effective<br />6. Speed buttons is possibly a gimmick. How often would you vary the speed of your shave?<br />7. I like the quick clean on the base. Comes out smelling lemony fresh in 30s!<br /><br />Cons:<br />1. The base is massive. I think a better space-efficient design is called for which still keeps the same amount of liquid.<br />2. Once you've plugged in the cartridge, you'd better not move the base around or the liquid spills. That's bad design - can't they invest in some gaskets?<br />3. For this price, shaver should be wet/dry.<br />4. The lock button only locks in one position. That's not evident, and mine didn't work, so I had to exchange the unit. Something must have broken inside it, which is a surprise because the metal switch implies sturdiness.<br /><br />For $200, I expect perfection. This is great but with a few flaws.

I also like the ability to choose the three different intensity settings, for the me the medium works just great. I've seen quite a few bad reviews for this shaver, and I'm not knocking those who don't like this shaver, but for me it shaves vry close, with no neck rash at all. Sooo, with the Braun 60 day return policy in place, I'd say if you are on the fence, give this shaver a go, you can always get a refund, but for me, I'll be keeping my second Series 7 and most likely be buying another Braun product when it's time to replace this one.

  433. very close shave, almost as close as a razor. Let's be honest NOTHING shaves as close as a razor, or lasts as long then with a razor. Some people have very sensitive skin especially around the neck area of the face, for a lot of men this is a problem area as usually the beard is most tough in this area. Too much pressure trying to shave the stubborn hairs on the neck part can very easily irritate the skin and cause razor burn or rash. Lubrication is a big help in shaving, wash your face first with warm water and soap, then lightly dry it. Now the pores will be opened up more and this will make it easier to shave especially with an electric razor. Also try a pre-electric lotion this can help too.

The pulsonic works in my opinion to help transition the foil during a pass to help catch hairs that don't want to be cut, reducing the amount of passes. The hygiene/battery indicator at the bottom appears to do as its intended (let me know when to charge/clean). Very ergonomic handle (Non Slip when wet) when held from any position.   475. I have been using a Braun 6550 for over 10 years. It is similar to this shaver but of course much older. I've replaced the head twice and the rechargeable batteries once. I like the shaver, but the motor is starting to lose steam and a replacement would cost more than I want to spend on an old shaver. I'm giving this history because I think that some of the men who are looking to buy this new shaver need to know what I am comparing it to. Preferences vary and I know some men who have always used rotary shavers and are not happy with anything else although they have tried. Rotary shavers hardly work at all on my beard. On me they pull, hurt, and irritate.<br /><br />My personal preference has been the oscillating type like the Braun so I come to this new shaver with a beard already conditioned to shaving with a Braun. I always thought the 6550 gave a decent shave although I had to work on it a bit and there were always some hairs on my neck that it could never cut. My beard is as wiry and thick as you will find. The hairs on my neck grow in a swirl pattern which are difficult to get and often after spending minutes trying to stretch my skin and making repeated passes to attack those few strays I end up with a close shave but my skin is irritated. Even then I still have to resort to making a pass over my neck with a razer to catch the strays that can't be picked up with the electric. So that's the background.<br /><br />This new shaver is like a miracle to me. It is not as noisy as the old Braun but sounds like it is humming at twice the frequency. When I touch it lightly to my face I can hear all the hairs being cut. Two passes with this shaver and the hairs are gone. I can keep on going for even closer shaving and without pressing on the shaver at all in about 3 minutes there is simply nothing to left for this shaver to cut. The cutter in the center of the head works wonderfully to raise and cut the hairs that lie against the skin. There is no irritation and the shave is as close as I can get with a razer but without any flecks of blood that I always get from shaving closely with a razer. This shaver cuts my beard superbly.<br /><br />Other little things to mention. Since this shaver includes the cleaning solution you can't get it shipped any faster than UPS ground (ORM-D). So if you have Prime and you want it tomorrow it isn't going to happen. It took a week to get to me.<br /><br />The cleaning base works fine. Yes, the solution is a consumable item and not very cheap but it really is nice to have a clean shaver. So what's that worth to you? If it's worth nothing to you, then buy the Braun a few models down that have no cleaning station. When I think of all the time I have spent fastidiously disassembling shavers to clean and lubricate them I think this new cleaning technology saves my time (which is money, don't you know?)<br /><br />The shaver feels great in the hand. The rubber coating on the palm side helps with the grip.<br /><br />My previous Braun had the floating combs and the tilting head that this new one has. However, the action on the old shaver was stiff. I would have to press way too hard to make the head follow the contours of my face and the cutters never moved up and down at all in actual use so far as I could tell. In fact, I used to just lock the head rather than try to put up with this poorly implemented feature. This new shaver improves on Braun's innovations and these features actually work now. It takes only the merest shaving pressure to enjoy the benefit of the tilting head and floating combs.<br /><br />The hair trimmer works fine for sideburns.<br /><br />Look closely at the instruction booklet and you will find the 60-day return instructions. It involves calling Braun and then shipping it to them with your receipt or printed invoice or what-have-you to prove you bought the shaver somewhere. It's nice to know you can return it it if you hate it. It is truly \\"to each his own\\" when it comes to shavers. As I've said I can't promise this shaver will work for you but it sure performs great for me.s. As I've said I can't promise this shaver will work for you but it sure performs great for me.
  476. This shaver is expensive, but it is worth the money. I have had a Braun shaver for years, and my old one finally wore out. The 790cc relatively quiet and very comfortable. It easily handles three or more days growth of beard, which no shaver I've ever owned could do. I also like the fact that they cutters are now supposed to last 18 months, while those for my earlier Braun shavers only lasted a few months. The trimmer is also better designed on this model, allowing for better visibility and control.<br /><br />I let the shaver clean and recharge in the base every day, but I like the fact that this one can also be cleaned manually under a running faucet if needed. This shaver appears to be very well designed and well made. Based on my previous experiences with Braun, I would expect it to work well for several years.

  483. I tend to obsess a bit over purchases and did a fair amount of researching about this shaver before deciding to buy it. Several other reviews similarly say to buy this, you'll love it and I want to add another comment to support this idea. I've had the shaver about a month and think it's great. There is a label on the shaver reminding us that our beards take a couple of weeks to get used to going from blades to electric, and I have found that to be the case, so give it a little while. That doesn't mean you won't get a close shave at first, just takes a little longer. Now, the shave is fast, comfortable and easy. I love the cleaner too and for those minor concerns about the trimmer being awkward, it's no big deal. I'm not sure how good a job it does, but I use a separate trimmer for mustache grooming anyway. I've traveled with the shaver, held the charge great and didn't have to clean it for several days and it cleaned up great when I got home. Best parts are no more water, shaving cream and EXPENSIVE blades that are supposed to last up to 4 weeks, but start leaving 'shaving zooters' after 1-2 weeks! If you can afford $200 for a razor, buy this one, you'll be delighted and wonder why you didn't get it sooner. Lastly, buying from Amazon is great and they have a great deal on the replacement cleaning cartidges.

You just have to help it a little bit with your wrist and hold it close to your face, it takes on from there.<br />If you have the money to buy one I see no reason why you should not.

  489. I like the shaver &#34;system&#34; ... pop it in the holder, press a button and it runs through a cleaning cycle in 30 minutes or so. I'm wondering if maybe those folks don't store their shaver in the holder every day, thus leaving it open which leads to faster than expected alcohol solution evaporation.<br /><br />So why did I only rate with three stars? Because it doesn't come even close to shaving as close as a safety razor. Requires two shaves per day if I go someplace in the evening which requires a clean shaven appearance. That dreaded &#34;five o'clock shadow&#34; is more like a stubble when my morning shave is with the Braun Series 7. It does as good of a job as any other premium electric shaver but certainly no better.
