  498. I've been shaving for half a century now (gasp!) and have used any number of electric (last, Panasonic,) and blade (last, Gillette) shavers; I have a medium, fast-growing beard, and my last e-shaver did not seem to \\"like\\" some thicker solo hairs on my face (we \\"olds\\" get those).<br /><br />This shaver is very easy to use - large handle, so my large hand can grasp it firmly and give it plenty of control; articulated head, so it follows facial shapes and contours flawlessly; allows selection of heavier or lighter cut; has two graphs built into the handle bottom, one for remaining battery power and the other for degree of \\"hygiene\\" (built up debris) in the head.<br /><br />This shaver makes less noise than my previous e-shavers, including my battery-powered travel Braun, and is so thorough it is much faster yet longer-lasting, At the end of the day, I actually have no more \\"six o'clock shadow\\" than, and on occasions less than, when I use a blade shaver. As well, the shave is non-irritating and smooth - the ultimate test is my wife's hand over my cheek, and my beard passes that test flawlessly. Other benefits - no cuts, and I am presenting occasional basal cell carcinomatous areas on my face (skin cancer) so I have to be careful and not chop - the blades used to catch the occasional skin irregularity, and after surgery definitely had troubles with any scar area or skin variation; this shaver doesn't bother or irritate and mows down whiskers without regard to where they are or whether they are the occasional thickened, wire-imitating resister - even the shirker hairs that try to lie down out of the way of the shaver do not escape.<br /><br />The shaver comes with a travel case (unfortunately, the case does not accommodate the charging cord), a cleaning and charging base (the cleaning fluid is apparently no more than 40% \\"rubbing\\" alcohol, perhaps with a small amount of lubricant? meaning Braun is taking the H-P printer path - pay high prices for refills, so search for sales), a two year warranty (extended a year with my credit card), cleaning brush (one can opt to clean with brush and water and some detergents, but they caution you not to brush the foil screen itself) and has what appears to be a durable, robust build.<br /><br />I only wish Amazon had honored my Prime membership and had not taken nearly two weeks to deliver (and still had easier ways of contacting Amazon for customer service flaws)- but that's about Amazon, not this truly five star product - the best electric shaver I have owned and had the pleasure of using. (If you have a very different beard than mine, your mileage may vary). I'll update in a few months.les), a two year warranty (extended a year with my credit card), cleaning brush (one can opt to clean with brush and water and some detergents, but they caution you not to brush the foil screen itself) and has what appears to be a durable, robust build.<br /><br />I only wish Amazon had honored my Prime membership and had not taken nearly two weeks to deliver (and still had easier ways of contacting Amazon for customer service flaws)- but that's about Amazon, not this truly five star product - the best electric shaver I have owned and had the pleasure of using.   499. I have used this shaver for 10 months. On the plus side it has a very long lasting battery,quiet running and I like the cleaning system. I use this about every fourth shave and clean with water on a daily basis. On the minus side it doesnt shave very close and you have to go over your face several times to get a good shave. My old Remington actually gives a faster ,closer shave for about a $130.00 less money. I believe that it will be a long lasting shaver and I havent had to replace the foils yet which I had to do with the Remington every three months.   500. First off, my one \\"irritation\\" with this shaver. I does not come with a plastic protective cap for the foil. There is a nice, hard sided carrying case that comes with the shaver. There also is not a power \\"lock out\\" switch to prevent the shaver from accidentally being turned on while packed in your luggage. Hopefully the hard sided carrying case will prevent accidental powering on of the shaver while traveling.<br /><br />The good part is that this model shaves better than any of the four previous Braun models I owned. It is not quite as good as shaving with a blade, but it's darn close (pun intended). The comfort level is very good, even when shaving against the grain of my beard. When I do that with a blade, I always draw blood. Hair pickup is excellent. With my previous Braun shaver, it could never quite get all the hairs on my neck. The 790cc has no problem.<br /><br />In summary, an expensive shaver, but so far worth the money. Now, if it will only hold up for 5 years like my previous Braun, and if the Li ion battery will last longer than the NiMH batteries I always had to send off and get replaced every three years at the shaver service center with all my previous Braun shavers.
  501. I have had the Series 7-790cc for about 6 months and have never regretted the purchace. I get 98% the closeness of a razor shave without the nicks. However, I have had to learn a method to overcome the depilatory effect if I don't shave for two days or more. Using an acute angle the first pass shaves close enough so I can then use the company recommended 90 degree angle to finish the shave for a very close shave without it pulling my beard. I highly recommend the shaver for a consistent close shave withoutthe nicks. The clean and renew system works like a charm for me even though it is a bit loud.

  517. Before I start off, it might be useful to understand the difference between electric shaving and shaving using the conventional razor for those who have not experienced the both.<br /><br />Using the razor, we usually apply some kind of a lubricant like gel or foam. Using the electric razor, I have found the lubricant to be optional. Using the razor we essentially wipe the blade over the shaving area, while using the electric razor I feel, it is more like a scrub. The scrubbing does not necessarily mean that the skin would get irritated more but for some people and brands of electric shavers, it does. If there is any skin irritation/burn 1% Hydrocortisone ointment provides relief in a matter of minutes.<br /><br />Applying lubricant may also not always get you better results in all shaving zones when using an electric shaver. However, sometimes it does. If you apply a lubricant and shave with an electric shaver, the cleaning process may take you a little extra bit of effort.<br /><br />A quick note on the shaving foam vs. the Gels - For me the conventional foam yields better results than the newer gels. The cheapest Gillette shaving lather yielded better results than the much more expensive Neutrogena gels. Therefore, you may want to experiment especially before you settle for an expensive product.<br /><br />At this point, it might be useful to mention that I switched to the 790cc shaving system after having used Philips/Norelco-Razor for 18 long years. My facial hair is not one of the toughest but is oriented randomly enough to make my shave hard to do a perfect job especially using an electric shaver.<br /><br />I classify my shave into four zones based on the hair types/difficulties I encounter:<br /><br />Zone 1 - on the cheeks: Shaving is easy in this zone and I have been able to get close shaves by several means wet and dry/electric and razor shavers.<br /><br />However, Norelco were nasty on this seemingly straightforward job. The shaves were usually not perfect and if I tried to shave multiple times, the razor burn would be nasty. The discomfort went to the extent that I had to actively research and discovered the Hydrocortisone and it became a norm.<br /><br />With Braun, this area is a piece of cake as it should be and there is no need to apply steroids any more. Also notable is the fact that the number of scrubs it takes is considerably less than a Norelco - almost the same number of strokes is required as the conventional razor. Using a shaving foam/gel further reduces the number of strokes and the subsequent skin irritation.<br /><br />Zone 2 - the chin & below the cheeks: Hairs in this zone seem tougher but the reality is that the hairs grow closer to the skin to be harder to pick. For me the random orientation begins here. Here Braun is clearly superior to a Norelco and comes very close to the conventional razor in terms of the number of strokes and related skin irritation.<br /><br />The pressure of application of an electric razor in this zone is considerably higher. However, with 790cc the increased pressure would not result in a razor burn. Any attempt to mimic the results of 790cc with a Norelco may result in severe skin burn and irritation. I would therefore switch to a razor with Norelco in this zone.<br /><br />Zone 3 - the moustache: My moustache is is sensitive and the lining with the upper lip if irritated would take considerable time to calm down. There also seem to be some random oriented hairs and then of course are the ones that are otherwise perfectly visible but hide along the nose when it comes to shaving! Along the nose, Norelco shaves the best as its circular cutters can find hairs better. However, 790cc did not lag too far behind if I allowed a few extra strokes, which is easy to do, as the burn factor is absent.<br /><br />790cc is also benign on my upper lip lining, Norelco and conventional razors were outright nasty! On the flat areas my experiences were a mixture of Zone 1 and 2 with 790cc faring the best.<br /><br />Zone 4 - the neck: Even though 790cc does a much better job than the Norelco, I feel that the conventional razor is the champion of the shave on the neck. 790cc however does produce acceptable results with some foam applied. If you have to the time to shave pinched skin, you will get the same results as the razor. You may not want to try Norelco in this area since the resultant burn may last for days and the shaving might need a razor to complete.<br /><br />Now a word on the cleaning system. If you want the liquid inside it to last, always rinse the 790cc under hot water and shake it to remove water before you put the 790cc in the cleaner. I did find traces of shaved hair under the foil after a full clean cycle. I do clean the foil with a brush and detergent once every 2 weeks. If you tried to clean the cavity in the cleaning system every other week, you would find good amount of smudge there as well. I consider this normal. However, what I do not like about this system is paying for the cleaning cartridge every month. I therefore perfected an 85% rubbing alcohol, 10% glycerin and 5% lemon oil (all purchased from a drug store) concoction for my cartridge that seems to work well and save me the monthly charge. Do not use other forms of denatured alcohol as some of the preparations may contain potentially dangerous additives. Some people have reported that mouthwash also works well but I doubt that since the mouthwash are water based.<br /><br />Well so much for the review. Hope you enjoy the 790cc!0cc faring the best.<br /><br />Zone 4 - the neck: Even though 790cc does a much better job than the Norelco, I feel that the conventional razor is the champion of the shave on the neck. 790cc however does produce acceptable results with some foam applied. If you have to the time to shave pinched skin, you will get the same results as the razor. You may not want to try Norelco in this area since the resultant burn may last for days and the shaving might need a razor to complete.<br /><br />Now a word on the cleaning system. If you want the liquid inside it to last, always rinse the 790cc under hot water and shake it to remove water before you put the 790cc in the cleaner. I did find traces of shaved hair under the foil after a full clean cycle. I do clean the foil with a brush and detergent once every 2 weeks. If you tried to clean the cavity in the cleaning system every other week, you would find good amount of smudge there as well. I consider this normal. However, what I do not like about this system is paying for the cleaning cartridge every month. I therefore perfected an 85% rubbing alcohol, 10% glycerin and 5% lemon oil (all purchased from a drug store) concoction for my cartridge that seems to work well and save me the monthly charge. Do not use other forms of denatured alcohol as some of the preparations may contain potentially dangerous additives. Some people have reported that mouthwash also works well but I doubt that since the mouthwash are water based.<br /><br />Well so much for the review. Hope you enjoy the 790cc!
  518. Works great! Almost as close as a blade, quick shave, less than 5 minutes and done. 100% better than my old foil shaver.
  519. [[ASIN:B003YJAZZ4 Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver]]I have been using Norelco razors since high school.I am now 65. Every 2or3 years for all of my adult life I have purchased the latest top of the line Norelco on the market. Way back many years I did buy a couple of other brands to check them out, but they always seemed like they were yanking the hairs out one by one , so I always stuck to Norelco. The last couple of Norelcos that I have had didn't seem to be better than the last. After doing lots of online research, and reading Conumer Reports I decided to try the 790-cc Braun. I was very skeptacle, but what the hey, you've got to try something different once in a while. I have been astounded at the difference. When people wrote that they got a shave as close as a blade, I fgured they were just rationalizing their purchaces. Well, they weren't. The shave is remarkable. It is quick,confortable and amazingly close. There are some negatives. The cleaning-charging system seems a little funky and the travel case is very flimsy compared with the Norelco. Other than those couple of minor details I really believe this is going to one of my best puchases ever. One other thing. This is the first product evaluation I have ever done, so i hope this isn't too long and has been helpful.
  520. I've been shaving for many years now and 99% of the time I've used an electric shaver because blades just don't seem to work well for me. I can tell you that in using this fine electric shaver I've received the best shave out of any other electric razor I've used. I've been using the razor for about two weeks now and here are some of my thoughts on it.<br /><br />Pros:<br /><br />- First and foremost you get a very close shave. Isn't that what we all want?<br /><br />- Charging station that also acts as a cleaning mechanism (more on this cleaning device below).<br /><br />- Shaver is very quiet.<br /><br />- Battery Life: Can go many shaves between charges even after a thoroughly shaving each time.<br /><br />- The razor head is built very well. I've never had any issues (though some have stated it can pull hair). I've never used an electric razor that had a foil on each end and a foil/trimmer type mechanism in between two foils. This works well for cutting the hair on the neck area or stubborn hairs that the regular foil systems can leave behind.<br /><br />- The cleaning system: I've seen some people complain on the added costs for this cleaning system. Yes, it's true you must replace the cleaning cartridges. The manual states that each cartridge should last for approximately 30 days with daily use. I haven't used the system long enough to see if I can get a full 30 days or 30 cleaning out of it on a single cartridge. I've found that what works for me is a cleaning after every 2nd shave. So that said I would think I could get at least 60 days between cleaning cartridge replacement. I'll have to wait and see if that will work. There is a neat display on the bottom of the shaver that displays battery charge remaining and hygiene. I've noticed that if I shave twice between cleanings the hygiene bar still shows at least two bars remaining. When cleaned it's nice to shave with a fresh feeling shaver.<br /><br />- Shaving speed. The \\"pulsconic\\" technology really shines here and the pivoting head is a real plus.<br /><br />- The build quality of this razor is also phenomenal. It doesn't feel cheap like some of those other lower quality shavers do.<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />- Razor trimmer is a bit awkward compared to other razors I've used. First of all the trimmer is very narrow compared to others I've used and seen.<br /><br />- Charging station is a bit noisy when the clean cycle first starts out. Why is this? One reason is the fact that the shaver turns on and off during the cycle and the sound of the shaver reverberates through the plastic cleaning enclosure. This very small annoyance only lasts for probably the first 1/3 of the cleaning cycle and I can easily live with it.<br /><br />In conclusion it's rare that I give a product an endorsement much less a 5 star rating. This product definitely deserves both. I'm glad I took the plunge and purchased this fine Braun product. I highly recommend it for all men that want a close shave, in fact, in my opinion this is a must have if you want a good quality shave using and electric shaver. I'm confident that I'll be able to use this shaver for many years to come.gy really shines here and the pivoting head is a real plus.<br /><br />- The build quality of this razor is also phenomenal. It doesn't feel cheap like some of those other lower quality shavers do.<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />- Razor trimmer is a bit awkward compared to other razors I've used. First of all the trimmer is very narrow compared to others I've used and seen.<br /><br />- Charging station is a bit noisy when the clean cycle first starts out. Why is this? One reason is the fact that the shaver turns on and off during the cycle and the sound of the shaver reverberates through the plastic cleaning enclosure. This very small annoyance only lasts for probably the first 1/3 of the cleaning cycle and I can easily live with it.<br /><br />In conclusion it's rare that I give a product an endorsement much less a 5 star rating. This product definitely deserves both. I'm glad I took the plunge and purchased this fine Braun product. I highly recommend it for all men that want a close shave, in fact, in my opinion this is a must have if you want a good quality shave using and electric shaver. I'm confident that I'll be able to use this shaver for many years to come.
  521. Very good shaver! Easy to use. Love it so much!
  522. This is the greatest shaver ever. It shaves much closer and smoother than the previous 7680 model I had. It also irritates my face much less. I would recommend it highly. I love all the luxury features that come with it. It is the Cadillac of shavers.
  523. [[ASIN:B003YJAZZ4 Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver]]<br />Having purchased a Braun 340 in 12/10 as a gift for my son (who decided he wanted a cash gift instead) I decided to keep it myself. Having been a Gillette blade guy for the past 5 decades, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the shave - near as good as a Gillette blade!<br />So I decided to step up to the Braun 790. Having used it just one week I tell all that it AS close as a Gillette blade and without the nicks. No burning or irration either. Follow the instructions by shaving before washing your face and use a splash of electric pre-shave lotion and get ready for one of the best most comfortable shaves of your life.<br />The quality and construction of the unit has also impressed me. It is manufactured in Germany - not China. My only qualm is the cleaning system that came with it (you have no choice as it is a package deal.) Since the razor is so easy to clean with either supplied brush or under running water, the cleaning system is superfluous. The cleaning system appears to me as a way for Braun to increase their revenue by forcing you to buy replacement cartridge cleaning solution for this razor and others in their product line.<br /><br />8/5/2013 A follow-up on my previous review. Guess what? My \\"Clean & Renew\\" station went south on me. It plugged up and would not drain. I attempted to clean/unplug it several different ways with no positive results. A replacement station costs more than $50 and I'm out of warranty. So buyer beware.
  524. About 5 years ago I upgraded from a Braun 5 series to a Braun 7 series. The pulsonic microvibrations seemed like overkill at the time but I got used to them after about a week. Two weeks ago I needed to replace my 7 series and went back to a 5 series (565) because of price. Boy did I miss the microvibrations then! The 565 acted like its battery was dying when it is put under the load of my one-day-old whiskers. I had to move the shaver so slowly across my face or it felt like it was pulling the hair rather than shaving. I ended up with a very close shave which made me happy but at almost 3X the length of time as my 7 series. I was able to return it and purchased this series 7 and have been very happy with it. This is what I expect from a quality Braun shaver and it did not disappoint.

  527. I received my Braun Series 7-790cc shaver system on February 11 and began using it the next day. Everything was packed nicely into the box and it was easy to unpack and set up. The first thing I noticed was that the power plug is huge! Instead of using a plug that routes the plug straight down the wall or to the side, this sticks straight out - several inches! This is the only thing I would change about the unit because in our bathroom, that gets in the way and even if it didn't, it would just look bad. I was able to correct this by using a Power Strip Liberator with a flat plug on the end, routing that down and hiding the massive Braun plug behind a box of Kleenex in the corner of the countertop.<br /><br />I switched from a Norelco rotary shaver system. That unit was very old and needed to be replaced. I opted to switch to the Braun for several reasons: maintenance, battery life, quality of shave, and skin irritation. Norelco may have addressed some of these issues in their newer models, but after experiencing drawbacks in all of these areas on three different Norelco shavers, I was ready for a change.<br /><br />It took about a week and a half to adjust to the new shaving system (foil vs. rotary). However, once I was used to it, the Braun seems to provide a more close shave with far less skin irritation. With my old rotary, I always had to use a facial lotion after shaving because my skin was irritated from the many passes necessary to get a good shave. Although some areas require just as many passes with the Braun, my skin is no longer red and itchy after shaving. The only area of my face that the Braun does not outperform the rotary on is right under my jaw line on the sides of my face. Everywhere else, including my chin, appears to be getting a closer shave.<br /><br />The unit does have three sensitivity settings that are easily changed by buttons next to the power button. I tried these for a few days and then gave up - using it only on the strongest setting. It might be helpful if this shaver is irritating your skin, but it isn't for me so I just keep it on high.<br />Many people have commented or complained about the Clean & Renew Solution. As I wrote above, I started using my system on February 11 and that first cartridge lasted until April 16. I run through the cleaning procedure after every other shave. According to the manual, the solution will evaporate naturally after about two months. My first cartridge lasted that long with using it every other shave, so I see no reason to hold off on running the cleaning cycle beyond two shaves. I would add that as the manual states, when the cleaning solution level indicator goes to red, you have no solution left and it will not even attempt to clean the razor - so plan ahead when it turns yellow and order more then. I would also add that this system really does give a feeling of a renewed shaver and does an excellent job of cleaning the hair out of the unit.<br /><br />After shaving with Norelco rotaries for about 16 years, I made the switch to the Braun foil system and haven't looked back.ongest setting. It might be helpful if this shaver is irritating your skin, but it isn't for me so I just keep it on high.<br />Many people have commented or complained about the Clean & Renew Solution. As I wrote above, I started using my system on February 11 and that first cartridge lasted until April 16. I run through the cleaning procedure after every other shave. According to the manual, the solution will evaporate naturally after about two months. My first cartridge lasted that long with using it every other shave, so I see no reason to hold off on running the cleaning cycle beyond two shaves. I would add that as the manual states, when the cleaning solution level indicator goes to red, you have no solution left and it will not even attempt to clean the razor - so plan ahead when it turns yellow and order more then. I would also add that this system really does give a feeling of a renewed shaver and does an excellent job of cleaning the hair out of the unit.<br /><br />After shaving with Norelco rotaries for about 16 years, I made the switch to the Braun foil system and haven't looked back.

  532. The value gets to be questionable at this price, but certainly a good shaver. Since I have to use it everyday I put the extra into this hoping to make life easier. It gives a good shave if you pay attention, press harder to get closer. Still not like a razor but doesn't irritate my skin like one either. Definitely quieter than a $70 Braun I have lived with the past few years. If I haven't shaved for 2-3 days this does make more of a mess, but cleans up fine over the sink. Normal use I pop the head off after each shave and tap it out then I never have problems with pieces falling out during shaving. The alcohol wash is kind of a nice easy way to clean it. Just take the container out and put the cap back on when not in use and it lasts for a long time. Overall this was expense but with everyday use it was still worth it.
  533. This is my third Braun Shaver. I almost did not purchase the shaver as some of the reviews made me concerned. I then read the reviews for the competitors and decided to come back and take a chance. I am glad I did.<br /><br />I have always found Braun shavers to work great when new. In the past the problems started when it came time to replace the cutters and foil and the replacements never seemed to work like the original. My last razor was a Braun 8985 and I tried the replacement parts recommended by Braun and the alternative ones recommended by reviewers at Amazon. Neither worked well. I hope the replacement parts for this razor work - I will find out in 12 to 18 months - but for now I like the razor a lot.<br /><br />It does a great job on the hairs on my neck - something my old Braun 8985 with the replacement parts was unable to do.<br /><br />The razor has a more awkward shape than my old Braun 8985 in that it is larger and does not feel natural to hold - However as it does a great job I can put up with this. The razor has a lot of new displays and features I don't really need but are nice.<br /><br />There is a change in how the cleaning unit works. In the old unit you put the shaver in and it automatically started. With the new unit when you put the shaver in the unit recommends a cleaning type but does not automatically start - you have to press the button. I suppose this is for people who don't want to automatically clean every time to save the cleaning fluid. The only issue here is that the instructions say the fluid evaporates over time and ends up needing to be replaced if you use it or not.

  568. This review is from a long time Braun shaver user with a tough beard and sensitive skin (a bad combination). A little long, but hopefully worth the read...<br /><br />I stared using an electric razor right at the time Braun released the Syncro. The Syncro shaved fast, smooth, and quick, with little irritation, though it was a bit rough, especially on my upper lip. I shaved with this razor happily for many years.<br /><br />Always looking to improve, I would try each new top of the line Braun razor that came out after the Syncro, including the Activator, 360, and Pulsonic, all of which were terrible and I would go back to the Syncro. As near as I could tell these razors were lacking because of the crazy blue center cutter with very sharp edges - the shave was not close at all and would cause my cheek's to break out in red bumps which would not go away even after more than a month of shaving.<br /><br />Then a few years ago Braun came out with the 390cc, a good looking razor that for the first time shaved as close as the Syncro, but more comfortably - they did away with the crazy blue center strip and improved in other ways I'm sure. Strangely this model was the 3rd down the Braun shaver line, but shaved significantly better than the top of the line Pulsonic. I secretly wished that Braun would take the great shaver head on the 390cc and apply it to the Pulsonic, I would be happy to pay more for the extra bells and whistles.<br /><br />Sure enough, the 790cc-4 (the \\"-4\\" is most important!) has a similar head to the 390cc, only the 790 is a better all around razor. It's more powerful than the 390cc so you get a faster, smoother shave, yet is very close and every bit as comfortable. It also works very well in difficult areas such as under the ears and on the neck (I suffer from difficulty shaving my neck which is all but cured with this razor). I can safely say this is the worlds best electric razor!<br /><br />The cleaning base is very easy to use and more than worth the cost of the cleaning cartridges which free you from having to clean the razor yourself, you can lock the shaver head for hard to reach areas of your face (though I never have found a real need to lock it), there are sensitivity settings (this really works, not a gimmick, though I just leave it in the normal middle position), you can wash the head with soft soap while traveling (haven't had the opportunity to try this yet but a welcome feature that was also on the 390cc), the pop out trimmer is more than acceptable, and the overall design it terrific.<br /><br />Its like driving a Porsche across your face, shaving is fun again. I'm so impressed I've also bought one for my father.<br /><br />Absolutely worth the money, buy it and be happy. Thank you Braun!n worth the cost of the cleaning cartridges which free you from having to clean the razor yourself, you can lock the shaver head for hard to reach areas of your face (though I never have found a real need to lock it), there are sensitivity settings (this really works, not a gimmick, though I just leave it in the normal middle position), you can wash the head with soft soap while traveling (haven't had the opportunity to try this yet but a welcome feature that was also on the 390cc), the pop out trimmer is more than acceptable, and the overall design it terrific.<br /><br />Its like driving a Porsche across your face, shaving is fun again. I'm so impressed I've also bought one for my father.<br /><br />Absolutely worth the money, buy it and be happy. Thank you Braun!

  587. I bought this as a replacement for a 10 year old Braun shaver I was quite happy with. I had to replace the old one as the battery would charge it for only 1 or 2 uses. I did some research and found out it was the best rated shaver on Consumer Reports.<br /><br />This shaver has out-performed others I have owned, including the older Braun and a number of Norelco's. I get a closer shave without any razor burn. The cleaner unit works like a charm. The cleaning liquid lasted longer than the estimated 30 days, so I was pleased by this.
  588. I have been using nothing but Phillips rotary shavers since I started shaving 25+ years ago. I generally buy their top model with all the features, but was not impressed with the last one I purchased a few years ago. It didn't shave well, left me with razor burn (my young daughter kept on wanting to know why I was hurt)and never handled more than a couple of days growth. Sometimes after finishing shaving, I felt like I hadn't done anything.<br /><br />As the last razor's batteries were starting to die - it wouldn't hold a charge, and my cordless now had to be run plugged in. It was time to look for a new razor. Unhappy with Phillips, I decided to give the Braun 790CC a try.<br /><br />Best move I have made in regards to shaving. It is so much better than my rotary. On the packaging it states that it can take a couple of weeks if you move from a rotary to this type of razor, but I never had any problems. I no longer get any shaving rash, and this shaves as close - or closer than a blade, but without the nicks. Not sure why, but my \\"5 O'Clock Shadow\\" the next day is more even. The hairs stick straight out and are smaller, so even after a day, the results are far more impressive than my old razor.<br /><br />The Braun does like straight skin for the best results, and the shaver needs to be straight on, so you have to stretch your skin or hold your arm up higher than with a rotary to get it straight on, but the results are perfect.<br /><br />I have never seen noted anywhere that this vibrates a lot when shaving. Using a rotary all my life, this was a big difference when I first started using it. But don't notice it now, so just a transition issue. The trimmer also works a lot better than the old razor, being wider and appears to be faster, so cuts side burns neater.<br /><br />I wish I had saved some money and purchased a 760cc as the fast clean mode is never used, you can't fast clean and then use the razor, the fast clean washes it, but doesn't apply a dryer, so you would get the same result by using a brush, if you wanted to use it straight away. When traveling you can't take the cleaning base with you anyway, as the cleaning liquid would spill, so you have to get use to using a brush if you are going to be away from home for 5 or more days anyway.<br /><br />One (undocumented) advantage, is when left in the cleaning base and the power on, the razor's little blue light is left active. So it acts like a night light for the bathroom.<br /><br />I am in Australia and this Braun works well here. I just need a small adapter for the 2-pin plug, but there are no voltage issues. The box comes with one cleaning solution, which can't be shipped by air, so getting it on Amazon (half the price compared to retail Australia) and to Australia is a big difficult, but is possible.<br /><br />I am very impressed with this razor, and in 5 years time when the batteries don't hold their charge - I will definitely be buying another Braun.would get the same result by using a brush, if you wanted to use it straight away. When traveling you can't take the cleaning base with you anyway, as the cleaning liquid would spill, so you have to get use to using a brush if you are going to be away from home for 5 or more days anyway.<br /><br />One (undocumented) advantage, is when left in the cleaning base and the power on, the razor's little blue light is left active. So it acts like a night light for the bathroom.<br /><br />I am in Australia and this Braun works well here. I just need a small adapter for the 2-pin plug, but there are no voltage issues. The box comes with one cleaning solution, which can't be shipped by air, so getting it on Amazon (half the price compared to retail Australia) and to Australia is a big difficult, but is possible.<br /><br />I am very impressed with this razor, and in 5 years time when the batteries don't hold their charge - I will definitely be buying another Braun.
  589. I purchased the Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver 760cc Braun razor for my father who is in a nursing home. After getting the razor and talking to the nursing staff, they said it may not be the best to have such an expensive razor in an unsecure area.<br /><br />So -- when I tried to return this nearly $200 razor UNOPENED to Amazon they wouldn't take it back because the package contains flammable liquids!!! Yes it does, the system's cleaning solution probably has some alcohol.<br /><br />They sent it to my home -- its a consumer product, but they wouldn't take an unopened, factory sealed product back or even give me full credit for it.<br /><br />AMAZUN didn't state \\"NO RETURNS\\" in the email confirmation they sent to me after ordering the product.<br /><br />Will never purchase from Amazon again. I'm no longer amazed at Amazon - just unamazed and very shocked at their deceptive and heavy-handed return policy.<br /><br />Amazon had no problem taking my money and then mailing this \\"hazardous material\\" to my home.
  590. I've used a large number of shavers over the years... most recently Norelco, Remington, Panasonic, and the Braun 360 complete 8595.... the Series 7 790 is hands down the best of them...<br /><br />In general the Norelco and Remington I would describe as ordinary. They get the job done with more time, louder, and tend to be rougher on my skin in general.<br /><br />The Panasonic has a good feel to it and a definite step up from the ordinary brands, but is a little unusual, heavy, and a little cumbersome with the huge head.<br /><br />When I got the Braun 360 complete, on first use I was very surprised about how it clearly was so far above the rest, zipping through a shave in a smooth way and having a fit and finish that was very high end. The Clean and Renew is no joke and gives a crisp fresh feel every time and is really not very expensive when taken in context.<br /><br />I dropped my 360 and broke the on off slider, so time for a new shaver... Braun was so much better in the past, how could I not buy it?<br /><br />I don't believe in spending the extra bucks on luggage, watches, and various other stuff.... but in shavers it pays off... Same thing when getting higher model Brauns... why skimp $30 and give features when you have already committed to getting a great product?<br /><br />So I got the 7 - 790... I put in the cartridge, charged it and tried it out.. and I have to say, the 790 is clearly a full generation better than the 360, which I didn't think was possible. It shaves in an almost surgical instrument kind of way.<br /><br />Myths:<br />-Clean and renew is expensive: In use the $4 clean and renew cartridges last about 6-8 weeks in 5 day a week use. I've seen crackpot ideas like refilling them with seabreeze (dumb as you aren't putting the right cleaner lubricant on your expensive shaver and it barely saves any money).<br />- An expensive shaver doesn't stack up to a quality razor. BS, this thing definitely gives a better shave than I ever got with a blade with a lot less mess or time and no cuts ever.<br />- An expensive shaver doesn't make sense with quality disposables being so cheap. BS also, to get in the ballpark quality wise, you would have to be buying $3 each disposables.... it only takes 4 months of blades to pay for a new shaver and a year of clean and renew packs.<br /><br />Hints:<br />- shave a very dry face, before washing in the morning. your skin expands a lot when moisturized, drawing your beard in and making in inaccessible to the shaver and showing a shadow much quicker as your skin dries out later, forget shaving in or after the shower<br />- wake up first and shave at least 30 minutes later, not only will you be better at it, faces tend to be somewhat puffy from laying down and result in a poor shave<br />- after shaving before putting the shaver in the base, pop the foil off and tap it a couple of times in the trash to get most (probably 90%) of the beard out.. it keeps the clean and renew fluid much cleaner and makes it last much longer as the base does a 'thorough' clean much less often.<br /><br />Reasons I'm glad I broke my 360 complete (if I had known these, I would have just bought the 790 anyway)<br />- the fit and finish of the 790 is very very high.... like museum watch high.. ultra cool looking and constructed product<br />- the shave quality is much better than the 360 complete... almost surgical in feel, hard to believe I know because I thought the 360 was about perfect<br />- the 790, while having the same size head, has a much thinner and easier to hold body, the older Brauns tend to be a little beefy<br />- it has push button on off.... the older ones had a combo switch / trimmer slider which always was a little awkward to use<br />- the 790's trimmer juts way out from the shaver allowing a much better view for trimming sideburns etc. a HUGE advantage.<br />- the 790 has a quick clean feature, so you can start a cleaning cycle without it taking the shaver out of commission for hours.<br />- the hair lifting bar is very very good now at avoiding in grown hairs... if you have this problem, this shaver is the only one I've ever found that is effective at reducing them.<br /><br />one of the few products in the universe that doesn't disappoint in some way.... buy it.ission for hours.<br />- the hair lifting bar is very very good now at avoiding in grown hairs... if you have this problem, this shaver is the only one I've ever found that is effective at reducing them.<br /><br />one of the few products in the universe that doesn't disappoint in some way.... buy it.
  591. I used to use an el-cheapo walmart $20 electric shaver that got the job done, but just barely. After a while, I got fed up with the electric, and switched back to a straight/safety razor. Enjoyed the closeness of the straight razor shave, but the hassle of heating the lather and prep work was quite tedious. I did quite a lot of research, and ended up with this razor. I have to say that it's an absolutely great shaver. It took a good 1-2 weeks before my skin/hair got used to the new shaver... but this is about normal from what I read. The shave is pretty damn close to the closeness of the straight razor, which is damn impressive! I still have the occasional stubborn hair that doesn't get trimmed by shaver, but they are not noticeable by any means.<br /><br />I had to go with the 4 stars due to the fact that the cleaning solution does not last very long if you shave on a daily basis. Yes, they are cheap, but it really stinks how fast it runs out. My main suggestion would be to alternate using the brush to manually clean and use the auto clean sparingly.<br /><br />Other than that, no regrets. Worth every penny!

It was too big, too loud, and the cleaning station looked bulky and ugly. I was truly was amazed with its first shave! Granted that I have been using electric shavers for a while and I didn't need those 15 days to 'get my skin used to' this shaver, but still, my shave was super smooth, including in those hard-to-reach areas under the neck. My pros and cons are:<br />Pros:<br />1- Shaves closer than the Pana (mind you, the Pana shaves quite close too, but not as good)<br />2- Not very noisy<br />3- Good solid feel in the hand, compact<br />4- Clean and Renew makes it 'new' every morning<br />5- Fast shave, mine takes only 3 to 4 minutes.<br />Cons:<br />1- No wet shave option<br />2- Need to buy monthly refills of cleaning packs.<br />Moving from an earlier Braun to the Pana was a great forward shift, as the shave was close to a blade shave. But the Pana is too big in my hands, and it was difficult to shave in those hard-to-reach places like below the nose. Shaving with this Braun 790cc is a breeze, and I can't make out the difference between a blade and electric shave anymore. I would prefer not to have a monthly expenditure stream for the Clean and Renew cartridges, but bought in bulk, they aren't that expensive really.<br />I highly recommend this shaver!

I brought this razor fairly cheaper than amazon's price, and that is the one of the reasons I finally brought it but had I known how great of a shave it would give me I would've brought a long time ago.   666. To start off I have had 3 braun shavers up to this one since i started shaving. also two rotary styles that people gave me that i hated. Foil electric is just the way to go. The last braun i owned was the cheapest of the brauns i have owned, it was a series 3 wet/dry. Every shave took a minimum of 8 minutes and the battery life was never great and i always had some hairs left behind. plus no cleaning station. I LOVE the cleaning station.<br /><br />With the 790 im lucky if i can stretch a full shave to 3 minutes. I have WAY less irritation because of this even on the most intense of its 3 settings. The very first shave my skin felt incredibly better then my braun 3 with a new foil cassette. Even much nicer series 5 i used to love before it got smashed on accident (and replaced by the series 3 which i hated from day 1). The cleaning cycle on this new 790 is fast and the readout of battery life/hygiene is great.<br /><br />Ive read reviews where people have some small personal cons or dislikes but there is nothing to dislike unless you want to get picky and look for something. The shave is close, fast, WAY less irritation than many other foils and it has a solid construction and feels study and sleek in your hand. My last braun shaver was big and bulky in comparison which wasnt good at all, maybe felt sturdier but not better. also the side shaver is \\"different\\" in its angle but if your facing the mirror to clean sideburns its actually nicer because you dont have to flip the shaver around to use the trimmer. I think that is a plus because being morning groggy and shaving i have dropped a shaver while turning it around to flip out the trimmer and when the foil hits something its ruined instantly.<br /><br />Im not sure how you could be disappointed with this shaver. Maybe if you expect a razor style shave you will be disappointed but if thats what your looking for no electric will ever meet your expectations. I was hoping that this 790 would be equal or slightly better then my cherished braun 5 that i missed and this 790 is leaps and bounds better so i couldnt be happier.lightly better then my cherished braun 5 that i missed and this 790 is leaps and bounds better so i couldnt be happier.

  673. I bought the Braun series 7 shaver because I wanted the best shave possible in zero time. A smooth close shave &#34;NOW&#34;! As I shave I listen to quality humming in my ear.   674. Long term Braun user, loved the 5790 for the last 9 years, so I bought the 7-series 790cc. The moment I turned it on, I knew I had been had. I've used it for the last 7 weeks to give it a chance. And I am loathing.. No.. hating it more and more every day. Pinches, pulls, rips hair from my face, and takes entirely too long to shave - just a few of the problems. Every day I find a patch which just isn't smooth, even after spending entirely too much time on that problem area that it refuses to shave. I am now relying on my $20 AA Braun travel razor in the shower to clean up. If I skip a day or two of shaving - forget about it, this shaver takes an eternity to take it down. Also, the shaver just won't get close enough to remove the hairs right under my nose, nor will it pick up the straggling hairs on the front of the lower neck. What gives? After reading the reviews I opted for the 790cc even though I have very thin/sparse facial hair, the motor still seems to struggle. Is it the pulsonic system that's restricting a full sweep of the bar from side to side and pinching the death out of me?<br /><br />The beard trimmer is such a poor design. The angle on the trimmer makes it entirely too awkward to use. It continuously slams shut whenever I use it. It extends perpendicular to the unit and does not have a locking mechanism on it. I use the beard trimmer to take some length off my sideburns from time to time, but the angle of the trimmer pop-up causes the shaver head to gauge into my haircut. While the shaver head does have a locking mechanism on it, it is utterly useless and doesn't rotate the shaver out of the way anyhows, and I scalp into my haircut regardless. And to make this worse, the razor also will not allow a detailed edge. So, I'm left with sloppy sideburns as I just can't get a clean detail no matter what angle I try. The beard trimmer can not be angled to clean up the hairline on the back of my neck either.<br /><br />The shield/razor and bar on this unit are in a self contained all-in-one casing. The screen can not be miss-seated. And it is not damaged. Its simply a bad design. The hair aligner on this unit is spaced too far away from the screen which may be causing the blasted pinching. Either that or its this pulsonic system not allowing a full sweep of the bar across the screen. Regardless, this razor is simply junk. Cheap Chinese garbage at that. You'll know it as soon as you get it in your hand.<br /><br />15 content years with my last Braun shavers, but not this one. Seriously unhappy with Braun for this $200-$300 purchase. And with all this blasted pinching, I fear using my own razor every day. I read the reviews before I made this purchase, and thought maybe these other people are not used to an electric shaver, and with hesitation I bought it anyhows. Now regretting this purchase just like the others here. I would be unhappy if this razor cost $30 much less $200. I am surprised Braun put their name on this box.<br /><br />Braun, we had a great relationship over the years, but recently you have changed. Regardless, I am no longer interested in you.<br /><br />PROS:<br />- The cleaning solution smells real good.<br /><br />CONS:<br />- Everything else.<br /><br />This thing is such a waste of recycled plastic, that I am thinking most of the supporters of this razor must be Braun employees guarding their bad investment.<br /><br />I will be making a purchase of another razor from a different manufacturer today. I won't ever go back to Braun shavers after this.<br /><br />UPDATE: 8-7-2013:<br />I had just found out that Braun offered a 60-day money back guarantee. I had purchased this unit exactly 2 months ago today 6-7-2013. It took 1 week to ship, so I have been using it for exactly 7 weeks and 1 day. I requested a money back refund from Braun, which Braun has denied even though we are on right on the 60th day. After I informed them of this amazon review, they offered to send a replacement head to help with the pinching and lousy shaving. Braun expects 3 weeks for delivery of the new head. I have no reason to believe the existing head is faulty, nor that the replacement head will fix just some of the problems with this razor.<br /><br />What is important is that Braun is not abiding by their 60-day money back guarantee. Yet, if the head replacement helps, which I do not expect that it will, I will return to amazon and edit this review about the pinching and lousy shaving of this razor. If there is no update to this review within 4 weeks, this razor has been disposed of in the trashcan and Braun has not done anything for me. Steer clear.<br /><br />Update:<br />After Braun received link to this review, Braun emailed me a week later and approved the return of the razor. Braun offered to refund the money so I took them up on the offer and returned the unit.d a replacement head to help with the pinching and lousy shaving. Braun expects 3 weeks for delivery of the new head. I have no reason to believe the existing head is faulty, nor that the replacement head will fix just some of the problems with this razor.<br /><br />What is important is that Braun is not abiding by their 60-day money back guarantee. Yet, if the head replacement helps, which I do not expect that it will, I will return to amazon and edit this review about the pinching and lousy shaving of this razor. If there is no update to this review within 4 weeks, this razor has been disposed of in the trashcan and Braun has not done anything for me. Steer clear.<br /><br />Update:<br />After Braun received link to this review, Braun emailed me a week later and approved the return of the razor. Braun offered to refund the money so I took them up on the offer and returned the unit.

  702. This is a great electric razor. It provides the closest shave I can get with an electric razor. The only drawback for me is that it is not as fast of a shave as the Norelco Sensotouch 3D 1280x and it also doesn't shave as well with anything longer than day old stubble. I do like the cleaning station that comes with the shaver because it does a great job of cleaning the razor but I am not a fan of having to have replace the cleaning cartridge every month or so because of the added expense. My solution to this is simply to remove the cartridge after each cleaning and recap the cartridge so the solution does not evaporate.<br /><br />In summary, if you want an electric razor that provides an extremely close shave (closest to blade in my opinion) and don't mind that it might take a few more minutes of shaving time to get there then purchase this razor. If you want a razor that is quite faster in terms of shaving time and does a great job on longer stubble but is not quite as close of a shave (admittedly the difference is negligible between the two) then purchase Norelco Sensotouch 3D.
  703. It had been 10 years since I'd used an electric when I decided to give this Braun model a try - while I love the closeness of a blade shave, I was sick and tired of neck irritation. Does the Braun Series 7 shave as close as a blade? No. Is it better than any Norelco or Remington I'd tried in the past? Yes - by a factor of 10! Provided you're willing to shave daily, this razor will provide a near-blade closeness while being amazingly gentle on the skin.<br /><br />One thing I will say: if you're planning to switch to this razor after using a blade for an extended period of time, use the Braun for a month or so before making up your mind on whether you like it. Certain facial hairs (particularly those on the neck) need to be \\"retrained\\" before you'll get optimum closeness. Be patient - I can almost guarantee you'll be happy with this razor if you give it time.<br /><br />All told, I'm quite happy with this purchase. Having done the math, I don't think I'm paying any more to use the Braun 7 than I was to use my Gillette Fusion blades - if you've purchased razor cartridges at the supermarket recently, you know how expensive those darned things are! Even paying for the Braun cleaning solution (which does a great job maintaining this razor, by the way), I don't think I'm paying that much more than I was while using a traditional blade. I wholeheartedly recommend this solidly built German electric!
  704. This is the third Braun shaver I have owned. I am 70 years old and I love the shaver. I bought one of my friends the same shaver for Christmas and he loved it. There are no cuts on my face when I shave with Braun. No small pieces of toilet paper to absorb blood.

  708. Hi All,<br />I'm a customer changing from a razor shaving to electric shaving and hence this review can be a little negative.<br />When you shave with a razor you are used to 1 glide of a razor and clean shave, but that is not the case with electric shavers, you need to use it like can eraser, I mean like how we need to keep on rubbing till it is erased same way you need to keep on rubbing till it is clean shaved.<br />With a razor you are used to gliding it mostly in 1 direction, but with the new electric shaver you need to go up and down just like how you rub.<br />First few shaves with the electric shaver can be a little frustrating as you are not use to the rubbing method of shaving. The other important thing is that when you shave with a razor you are sure that all the hair will be removed if not very smooth but still to the level that they are not visible. But with the electric shaver you need to shave and then check if the hair have been removed. So getting used to checking your shave is something that you get used to after a few shaves and then you get use to it. The other tip would be to keep your shave rough when shaving with an electric shaver, it is not like a razor where it is recommended to wet and soften your shave before shaving. So more the rough hair, more smoother the shave.<br /><br />The above has nothing to do with Braun Series 7- 790cc shaver, it is mainly to do with changing from razor shaving to electric shaving<br /><br />Braun Series 7- 790cc this is a good shaver and the shave is quite clean, when you compare it with a razor shave it is still not bad at all.<br />it is a bit noisy to start with, saving on the neck line can be difficult specially when you are in a hurry. Shaving with a razor is much quicker compared to Braun Series 7- 790cc, it atke approx 4-5 mins for me to shave with my Braun Series 7- 790cc. It is a dry shaver and hence cannot be used while bathing.<br /><br />Overall I personally find it quite okay after 2 months, maybe cause I have paid so much for it. If I would have not bought it, I would have reverted back to razor shaving.e cause I have paid so much for it. If I would have not bought it, I would have reverted back to razor shaving.

  713. After using a rotary razor for the last ten years I switched to a foil.   714. I replaced my Braun 8595 that I had been using for the last 6 years with the Series 7 790cc-4. While the old razor was still working, I just wanted to try a newer product that I hoped worked a little better. I have very sensitive skin, hard stubble and quite frankly hate shaving, I was hugely impressed with the 7-790cc-4 from the first shave. I have been using razor for two months and the shaving performance has been very impressive. Stubble removal is very effective on one, two or three day's growth, and unlike the 8595 the razor doesn't heat up a lot. My skin has been definitely felt less irritated after each shave. Shaving time per shave feels shorter that the 8595, but unlike the 8595 the 790 doesn't provide a timer (I estimate my shave takes about 3.5 minutes). The LCD cleaning and charge indicator is definitely a step down from the 8595's, and is a basic block design but works well enough. The cleaning system is as effective (but quieter) than the 8595, the cleaning cartridges are exactly the same. The razor's build quality is excellent, it feels very solid in the hand and the rubberized grip on the rear of the razor is very secure.<br /><br />Another great improvement is the carry case, which is now a zip closing fabric type case that appears to be far sturdier and should last longer than the older plastic cases that always seemed to crack on the hinge.<br /><br />All in all, Braun has certainly improved on its previous models and created a great electric razor that provides an excellent close shave. The razor is not cheap, but I believe it is worth every penny.
  715. I owned a Braun shaver for over 15 years and while it was still running fine, I felt the battery life was beginning to diminish a little. So I debated on whether to invest in another expensive shaver again or go for a cheaper one that I could buy at Walmart. After much internal debate, (mostly about the money) I decided to stick with the Braun Series 7-790cc. I want to tell you,that was the best decision I think I have ever made! This shaver is just phenomenal and will give you the closest shave of your life and do it so smoothly. It has three different face settings that allows you to adjust it to the sensitivity of your face and get as close a shave as you want. It literally will give you a closer shave than a blade razor will and in half the time and no cuts! Lastly when you are done you put it in it's charging cradle and it automatically cleans itself. Absolutely the best shaver I have ever owned and if it lasts as long as my last Braun it will be with me for a long time!
  716. The Braun 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System Silver is not cheap, but if you are someone that shaves everyday this might be a good investment for you.<br />A tradesman would not buy a regular tool to use on a job every day, the potential of risking loss time and future business does not support the rationale.<br />Thus, to spend a few extra dollars on a razor with good ratings could result in a happy customer. This model does have extra bells & whistles but I like the self-cleaning and self-sharpening stuff. The razors fits into my hand well with a slip resistant grip, it is one of the quietest razors I ever used. The foil head is pro-rated to last for eighteen months and the charging system will tell you when to clean the unit and when to replace the foil. All this and I take it into the shower to shave every day, time is money. I hope this info helps you.
  717. This is absolutely the best, most comfortable shaver on the,market. Price was 60% of competitors'.
  718. This shaver represents a BIG shift for me! I've used Norelco rotary shavers for about 50 years now but they really cheapened the rotary heads, so I tried an oscillating shaver. Does that seem like a &#34;small&#34; thing? No! To a stubborn guy, this is an earth-shifting change!<br /><br />And I'm glad I did. So far ( about a month now ), the Braun is terrific. Smooth close shave, no pinched skin or pulled hairs, and the cleaning/charging station isa real treat.<br /><br />Time will tell, but I'm a happy camper right now!

  720. love it!<br />no shaving cream, no razors, no hot water, virtually no maintenance!

  723. Did my homework and almost bought a lower-end Braun shaver, even though the 790cc was what I really wanted and thought I could not afford.<br /><br />Then I saw the 790cc for an incredible price on Amazon and I grabbed it. Item was exactly as advertised. Seller shipped it immediately, but UPS lost/misplaced the package and it sat in a one of their store-front depots for a week, unnoticed and unprocessed. (Note: This is NOT the seller's fault!) When I contact the seller about this, he/she was surprised and went to UPS and together they found the package and it was finally shipped. I received the package in a few days. (Thanks to the seller for their extra effort! The seller even discounted the shipping charge because of UPS' delay. Nice touch!)<br /><br />The 790cc shaver is amazing - with not extra effort on my part, it is like 1000s of hungry little blades against your skin, cutting every hair/stubble it touches, leaving your skin very smooth with not residual beard. The ergonomic shape is easy to hold and is less likely to slip out of your hands (like some of Braun's older shavers. Also, due to the 790cc's efficiency, it only takes me 1/2 as much time to shave -- an additional benefit I didn't expect, since no one had mentioned this in the reviews I read.<br /><br />I have used Braun electric shavers for 35 years and have never had such an experience. Braun's products keep getting better and better.....and the 790cc is a winner. Thanks Braun.

  731. This is without a doubt the best electric shaver I've ever owned. If you're worried about it shaving down as close as a razor blade, don't be. The Braun Series 7 - 790cc provides an extremely close shave without the risk of any irritations or cuts. The same can not be said for your average manual razor!<br /><br />Don't let the cost of this shaving system fool or scare you away from making the purchase either. Think of this as an investment with an upfront cost that will depreciate well over time. You only have to replace the foil every 18 months or so and you can purchase refills of the cleaning solution (did I mention that this shaving system comes with awesome self cleaning functionality?) via Amazon in bulk.<br /><br />BOTTOM LINE: If you're ready to step up into the big leagues and leave your razor blades behind, purchase a Braun Series 7 shaver. If you'd like to save some money, go with a previous model or year.. but I'd recommend the 790cc because the hygienic cleaning station is a fantastic asset.
  732. The razor works very well on my old sensitive skin and the cleaning system assures me of a clean razor every day.
  733. this product is prefect, I never see a item is better than it. I will recommand it to my friends as soon as possible.By the way,the shopping experience with amazon.com is excellent.
  734. I have never had a good electric razor. I am in the army and currently deployed. So I wanted to try an electric razor to avoid the bathroom rush to shave every morning. First use, I was amazed at how close of a shave it was. It actually excited me :). It was as close as I can get taking my time going against the grain with a leading brand straight blade razor. I have sensative skin and it caused no irritation or discomfort at all. I love this razor and will never go back to a blade. The cleaning system is quick and very convenient. I push the button and it does its thing. Was very excited and it surpassed every expectation I had. The lcd screen is also very nifty I leave it on the charger so no use in the battery but the hygene lets me know when to let it clean. Deffinately would recommend this product to anyone.
  735. This shaver is almost as good as a razor, which is very impressive. I am very happy with my product
  736. I switched from a rotary shaver and was nervous about this shaver because of its price. The price was a bit more than I was looking to spend. However, I heard such good feedback about this device I decided to give it a try. (Amazon has a great return policy, which was my backup.)<br /><br />Most importantly, it does a terrific job of shaving my face. Most people have a grain to their beard, but my facial hair doesn't seem to work that way. So I've always had a problem with electric shavers.<br /><br />I don't know why, but this shaver catches all of my facial hair and cuts it cleanly. I'd say my one little nit is that I can't tell when it has cut hair. With my other razors, I could feel it clip a hair, but not this one. So I can't listen for when I'm done shaving; I have to feel my face to know.<br /><br />I like how solid the device feels. It moves easily on my face. It catches those funny hairs under my nose and the hairs on the sides of my neck. It just does a terrific job all around.<br /><br />I was a bit concerned about the supplies cost (the cleaner), but I like having a clean, lubricated shaver every day. And the consumables cost is about $4.00 a month; that's not bad at all for the benefit.<br /><br />All in all, I'm happy with it and I'd buy it again.
  737. I'm a bit of a tech geek, so one of the reasons I bought this shaver was because of the neat lcd display and the cool blue lights on the shaver and the base. It did not disappoint, it looks great and feels solid in my hand when I'm using it. It's well built too, it has stood up well over the past year through countless business trips in the sturdy travel case it comes with. One nice feature is that you can recharge it with the power cord alone and not the base if you're traveling.<br /><br />The cleaning system does an excellent job, and the life of the cleaning cartridges can be prolonged if you remove them after cleaning and replace the plastic cap on them so the solution doesn't evaporate (I've only had to change mine twice over the past 8 months).<br /><br />The shaver does an excellent job alone, but if you want a really close shave, use Lectic Shave to pre-treat your beard. You can buy a bottle at Target for a few bucks.

It is the first electric razor I've owned that didn't require me to touch up my neck with a traditional razor.<br /><br />The battery life is also very robust; it got me through a two-week National Guard training exercise on a single charge.
