The only exception is at the bottom of my neck, which can require a few extra passes of the razor to get all of the hairs, but overall, i love this razor, and have been completely converted!
  744. I've always been impressed with Braun shavers and the new Braun Series 7-790cc is better than previous shavers I've owned. Very close and smooth shave every time and it's quite, too. It's a well built solid product and I'd highly recommend this shaver to anyone looking for a great electric razor. Price is a little high, but well worth the money.
  745. Obviously use for shaving. Fast shaves & fairly close shaves although not as close as a razor. I like it.
  746. I have owned a Bruan Pulsonic Shaving System for over two years. It works great for me. Just remember that shaving head must be kept flat with the skin for it to cut. Since the cleaning fluid is mostly alcohol,and alcohol evaporates in open container,if the cartridge is left in the cleaner I notice that it barely lasts a month. To save on cleaning fluid, I remove the cleaning cartridge about 5 minutes after the cleaning cycle is complete (to let the cleaning fluid drain back into the cartridge from the wet shaver head) and tightly close it. I only reinsert it into the cleaner when I am done with shaving and ready to have it cleaned. This way the cleaning fluid usually lasts for about month and a half. I hope this helps.
  747. I've accumulated quite a few electric razors over the years, with the three most recent being the new models from Norelco, Braun and Panasonic. So, thought I'd do a comparison to perhaps help those who are debating between these high-end models.<br /><br />But first let's get a basic question out of the way: do you have to spend this much to get a good shave from an electric shaver? Absolutely not. Lower-end models such as the Braun Series 5, the 7000 and 8000 Norelco series and the Panasonic ArcIV are great shavers. What you get for the extra money is a slight improvement in the shave, a bit better design, and a few somewhat useful bells and whistles.<br /><br />Build quality - all are very nicely put together. The Braun feels the most substantial; the 3D feels the most &#34;plasticy.&#34;<br /><br />Sound - the 3D runs very quietly; the Braun and Panasonic are far more &#34;buzzy&#34; but not too loud.<br /><br />Overall feel - for me, the Braun feels the most comfortable to hold. Easy to grip even if your hands are wet. The Panasonic is a close second. The 3D feels the most awkward. Not horrible, but not all that comfortable either.<br /><br />Dry shave: closeness - this is a tough call, with the Braun and the Panasonic both providing very close shaves. The 3D does a pretty good job, but my face does not feel as smooth as with the others.<br /><br />Dry shave: speed - the 3D is the clear winner here. Just mows through my beard, with a total shave time of less than 3 min. The Panasonic takes about 4 min for a good shave; the Braun clocks in at about 5 min.<br /><br />Dry shave: neck - this is the most difficult area for most shavers, and all of these models left a few errant hairs here and there. The 3D did the best but it comes at the expense of some irritation (see the next note). The Braun and Panasonic are about equal.<br /><br />Dry shave: comfort - Braun is the winner for me, followed by the Panasonic. Zero redness even in the more sensitive spots (jaw line and neck). The 3D left me with some red spots on my neck. Nothing severe, but it is clearly a notch below the others on the comfort meter.<br /><br />Wet shave - this is limited to just the Panasonic and the 3D. I'm not a big fan of wet shaving, but both of these do a very good job. The Panny works best with a very thin layer of gel-type cream; the 3D works best with a heavier lather (I got good results with Edge). Both provided close shaves, with the Panny a bit more gentle than the 3D. But, the 3D did a better job on the neck and jaw line.<br /><br />**Update: Just tried the new Remington Alphagel shaving cream and that works very well with both the Panny and the Norelco. The scent is a bit heavy (menthol) but the no-foam consistency is a perfect match for a wet electric shave. Much better than any other shave cream I've tried. I reviewed the Alphagel if you want more info.<br /><br />Maneuverability - this is where the Braun really shines for me. I have a mustache, and edging it with the Braun is a piece of cake. The 3D takes some practice, but it can do a decent job. Worst by far was the Panasonic - the huge head makes it very hard to create a clean edge around the `stash.<br /><br />Auto cleaning - I love the cleaning station from Braun. Works well, cleans well, and the razor comes out lemony-fresh. The Panasonic cleaning station is OK, but is louder, takes longer, and the water-based cleaning solution is not as effective. I can't comment on the 3D station since the model I bought didn't come with it.<br /><br />Manual cleaning - both the Panasonic and 3D are very easy to clean manually. They actually don't need the auto cleaning station (although it is handy for storage for the Panny). The cutters are removable from the 3D (unlike the Arcitec models) for extra cleaning every so often. The Braun can be cleaned with water, but it's hard to get it very clean since the cutter block is a single unit.<br /><br />Lots more that I could say about these razors, but this review is already way too long. If I had to pick just one, I'd go with the Braun. While not perfect, it excels in several areas and feels the best. It also offers three settings (gentle, normal and intensive) that vary the speed of the cutters, a feature the other two lack. I find that very helpful. Plus, replacement heads are easily available and often discounted (as are the cleaning cartridges). But, the 3D and the Panasonic are also very good shavers and will get the job done. If you are willing to spend the money, any one of these would be a good choice.<br /><br />Note: I have the Braun 790cc-4 since I was able to get it at a fantastic price (on another site - sorry Amazon!) on Black Friday. But, under normal pricing situations, the 760 is cheaper and a better value. They work the same, with the differences limited to color of the razor, type of read-out on the handle, and the fact that the 760 lacks the &#34;quick clean&#34; feature in the cleaning station. None of these are really significant, so if you go with the Braun, pick the one that is cheaper.<br /><br />But, you have to learn how to use an electric razor properly to get a good shave. Some quick tips:<br /><br />1) Don't press hard - use an easy touch. If the heads are getting warm or hot, you're pressing too hard.<br />2) Shave against the grain when using a foil; shave in circular motions when using a rotary.<br />3) Stretch your skin taut when shaving your neck<br />4) Wait at least an hour after getting up before shaving (everyone's face gets a bit puffy when sleeping).<br /><br />Happy shaving!<br /><br />&#62;&#62;Update June 2012: Thought I'd post an update after 1.5 years of use. No complaints at all - works as good as the day I bought it. I'm also pleased to report that I have not yet had to replace the foil. Although I have several shavers, this remains my favorite, and I have yet to find another shaver that provides the same blend of solid build quality, ease of use, and outstanding shaving performance. It's still a 5-star razor in my book.<br /><br />&#62;&#62;Update August 2013: Still working like a champ! Zero problems with functionality; fit and finish still looks very nice. I did end up replacing the head a couple of months ago, and it was surprising how much of a difference that made. I didn't really notice the foil and blades wearing since it occurs so slowly, but really noticed the improvement with the new head. I'm not going to wait so long to replace the head next time.<br /><br />&#62;&#62;Update July 2014: Humming along without a problem. I did find that the head can be cleaned very well if I use an ultrasonic cleaner. Not nearly as quick and easy as using the cleaning station, but if you find yourself without any cleaning cartridges (as I did), an ultrasonic cleaner gets the head very clean. That method of cleaning does not add lubrication as the Braun cleaning fluid does, so I give it a quick spray with Norelco shaver spray after an ultrasonic cleaning.<br /><br />&#62;Update May 2016: Zero problems to report. Getting some wear on the silver parts and the handle has taken a ding or three due to getting knocked about while traveling, but the shaver continues to put in a good day's work without complaint. However, I recently had the opportunity to use the Panasonic ES-LT7N-S. I have to give the edge to that as my current favorite. It is new, so the price is still way up there, but Panny fixed a lot of the issues/complaints I had with their other high-end models. If your wallet doesn't complain about the price of the Panny ES, it's well worth considering along with the Braun 7 series.s review is already way too long. If I had to pick just one, I'd go with the Braun. While not perfect, it excels in several areas and feels the best. It also offers three settings (gentle, normal and intensive) that vary the speed of the cutters, a feature the other two lack. I find that very helpful. Plus, replacement heads are easily available and often discounted (as are the cleaning cartridges). But, the 3D and the Panasonic are also very good shavers and will get the job done. If you are willing to spend the money, any one of these would be a good choice.<br /><br />Note: I have the Braun 790cc-4 since I was able to get it at a fantastic price (on another site - sorry Amazon!) on Black Friday. But, under normal pricing situations, the 760 is cheaper and a better value. They work the same, with the differences limited to color of the razor, type of read-out on the handle, and the fact that the 760 lacks the &#34;quick clean&#34; feature in the cleaning station. None of these are really significant, so if you go with the Braun, pick the one that is cheaper.<br /><br />But, you have to learn how to use an electric razor properly to get a good shave. Some quick tips:<br /><br />1) Don't press hard - use an easy touch. If the heads are getting warm or hot, you're pressing too hard.<br />2) Shave against the grain when using a foil; shave in circular motions when using a rotary.<br />3) Stretch your skin taut when shaving your neck<br />4) Wait at least an hour after getting up before shaving (everyone's face gets a bit puffy when sleeping).<br /><br />Happy shaving!<br /><br />&#62;&#62;Update June 2012: Thought I'd post an update after 1.5 years of use. No complaints at all - works as good as the day I bought it. I'm also pleased to report that I have not yet had to replace the foil. Although I have several shavers, this remains my favorite, and I have yet to find another shaver that provides the same blend of solid build quality, ease of use, and outstanding shaving performance. It's still a 5-star razor in my book.<br /><br />&#62;&#62;Update August 2013: Still working like a champ! Zero problems with functionality; fit and finish still looks very nice. I did end up replacing the head a couple of months ago, and it was surprising how much of a difference that made. I didn't really notice the foil and blades wearing since it occurs so slowly, but really noticed the improvement with the new head. I'm not going to wait so long to replace the head next time.<br /><br />&#62;&#62;Update July 2014: Humming along without a problem. I did find that the head can be cleaned very well if I use an ultrasonic cleaner. Not nearly as quick and easy as using the cleaning station, but if you find yourself without any cleaning cartridges (as I did), an ultrasonic cleaner gets the head very clean. That method of cleaning does not add lubrication as the Braun cleaning fluid does, so I give it a quick spray with Norelco shaver spray after an ultrasonic cleaning.<br /><br />&#62;Update May 2016: Zero problems to report. Getting some wear on the silver parts and the handle has taken a ding or three due to getting knocked about while traveling, but the shaver continues to put in a good day's work without complaint. However, I recently had the opportunity to use the Panasonic ES-LT7N-S. I have to give the edge to that as my current favorite. It is new, so the price is still way up there, but Panny fixed a lot of the issues/complaints I had with their other high-end models. If your wallet doesn't complain about the price of the Panny ES, it's well worth considering along with the Braun 7 series.
  748. ok let me give you guys some background, I have a fast growing beard and sensitive skin, even with the best razors and shaving gels my skin is red after shaving. I have actually hated shaving because of this and will let me beard grow because of it. In the past I have tried Norelco products and hated them all. My skin would feel terrible after the shave and the circular Norelco product would pull my hair/burn my skin. I know all manufactures of electronic shavers state that you need to let your skin break in the product and ask that you try the product for 30 days but even after 30 days, Norelco products gave me the same problems.<br /><br />In essence shaving was something I did not look forward to and did as little as possible (once every week/ two weeks) and only did so because my beard would not look good when it got long. Enter Braun - I felt I should give this a try because I was tired of my look with a beard. I was skeptical at first and shaved without any creams the first time and actually had a good experience as smooth a shave as with any razor I have used (and actually with a razor I had to scrape to get as close a shave - not so with this razor you get a close shave with ease) and quicker than ever too. I have tried shaving daily and most is 4 days after a holiday weekend) and achieve the same results. My wife actually loves the smoothness (she no longer complains that my beard scrapes her) and I notice my bosses at work appreciate my new look. I also love the clean shave system. Once a week (full program) seems to be good enough (sometime I use the program 2xs a week) and the shaver feels/smells great after the process. The shaver is also easy to clean under running water and does not take much counter space. Its pricey but worth it probably costs about the same as shaving with the Gillette Fusion razors (utilizing one a week which costs around 3 bucks each) for a year and a half (the say you need to replace the shaving mechanism every 18 months) when you consider the clean system replacement costs. If you have sensitive skin and want to shave daily, get this razor.ou consider the clean system replacement costs. If you have sensitive skin and want to shave daily, get this razor.
  749. I rarely hand out 5 star reviews but I can't find anything wrong with this 7 series...I bought it to replace a very old Braun (at the time their top of the line like the 7 series is now) which I think I had for over 12 years and still worked but the cord was a bit frayed and it was time for some modern technology...the 7 series is unbelievable...I have a very thick fast growing beard that requires daily shaving and this thing does the trick with virtually no irritation and virtually no extra passes except for around my neck area...I am not a shaverphile so I don't know about all the nifty technology built into this product but I do know the thing is awesome and because it is a Braun will last forever!
  750. I've been a Norelco product person for years, the Braun is far superior! I have had great results with the 7 series. Shaves have been a close as I remember with a blade years ago.   751. I'm at the Naval Academy and typically electric shavers are avoided because chiefs and the like will chew you out during uniform inspections for poor shaves.   752. great,comfortable.I love it.I really love it. cheap,it is really a good product.The most comfortable thing I have used.I love it 高端大气上档次。

It is a little noisy when it self cleans but that's to be expected when the shaver turns on. All in all, this is a great buy.
  754. I've used Braun shavers for years and it was time to replace my 5 series and Amazon had a great deal on the 7 series so I purchased one.   760. Very good. High reviews. BUT, the 5 blade Panasonic ES-LV81-K is a much better shaver. Having had both the Braun and the Panasonic, the cleaning systems on both the Braun and Panasonic are essentially the same, however, the use of water base in the Panasonic, permitting the used cartridge contents to be simply emptied into the sink and is septic safe vs. the alcohol base used in the Braun cleaning station, which makes it more environmentally difficult when disposing of cartridge contents. Overall, not a bad shaver system, by any means, but, the Panasonic system is better than the Braun.
  761. So far I am disappointed in the shaves I have received. I don't know if I should use it dry or wet. I was told by someone they get better the more you use it.

The only complaint I could have about it is that the trimmer is harsh on the skin, but that might just my particular case. There isn't much to say except that it's truly a great product.
  763. This shaver replaced a Braun that I've used for the last twenty years (that had been maintained with replacement blades, batteries and foils). However it was getting tired, so I got a new Series 7.<br /><br />At first I wasn't sure about the disposable washing solution, but after seven months of use, I do feel it's worth the expense (when bought a Amazon's price for refills) to keep the shaver clean and lubricated. I use the solution every three days or so, and not daily, and find I can stretch the solution to two months of use.<br /><br />The quality of the shave with the Series 7 is the best I have ever had, and when combined with the Lab Series preshave lubricant, the shave is as close as to what I think a razor shave might be.<br /><br />The \\"lock\\" button to lock out the pivoting head when using the trimmer, suddenly broke off, after seven months of use. I called Braun customer service, who gave me a list of authorized local service centers, where I will bring it in for warranty repair. Hopefully this shaver can last at least half as long as my previous Braun shaver.
  764. It is notable that I have been shaving for some (almost) fifty years and have tried electric shavers from time to time, always either giving them away after one attempt or relegating them to a drawer and losing track of their final resting places. They we're (mostly) unused, unliked and lost to history.<br /><br />I decided to try once more given the outrageous cost of blades and the inconvenience of needing to soak my beard and apply shaving gel or lather of some sort.<br /><br />Good decision. This Braun 790 model shaves close, gently and cleans automatically. A giant leap forward from my previous experiences with several other brands AND I bought the high end models of them too.<br /><br />I highly recommend this shaver because it performs as claimed and that is a rare thing currently.
  765. I so wanted to like this given the very high ratings. Now that I have been using it for four months, I don't understand the level of ratings given how this consistently misses areas.<br /><br />I spend more time shaving with this than with a good disposable quad blade, as I must cross over the same areas multiple times at multiple angles, pulling the skin with my other hand vs one or two swipes with a blade.<br /><br />And I am not particularly fussy, nor do I have a heavy/thick beard, but when I find that two or three days later I HAVE TO use a blade because it cut no hair whatsoever in areas, this is a problem. Most problematic areas are around the neck, but even along the jaw up to top of ear is a problem - and that is largely \\"flat\\" surface. And forget getting a clean edge to your goatee...even using it sideways, the goatee has a shadow.<br /><br />I bought this to save time shaving, but I don't get a complete shave to the point that on the second day I am not \\"work place presentable\\", that is a deal breaker.
  766. This shaver will give u a very close shave. Almost as close as shaving with a razor. Noted i said almost.
  767. There isn't anything new I can really say that hasn't been said before. I've owned my Braun Series 7- 790cc electric shaver for over three years, and I've had nothing but good luck with it. Even after over three years using the original head, the shave is still as close as ever; the cleaning system also works extremely well. If you're looking for an excellent electric shaver, this is the one. Highly recommended.
  768. This machine is very well designed, and works very well, previous to Braun Series 7-790cc, I owned the philips 1290x, which I though, was the best shaver one could own, now I know better, Braun Series 7-790cc, leaves the philips 1290x in its dust. Braun is a beautifully designed shaver which works very well, the shave is smooth, fast, and easy, all the nooks and crannies of your face are cover and some more, the shaver head needs to be replaced every 18 months, can be cleaned fast and with some simple actions, I defiantly like the cleaning system...It is hard to find fault with this machine, may be if they could somehow get rid of the plastic cartridge in the cleaning system, where we one would not need to throw the plastic away...My score of the Braun Series 7-790cc, Pulsonic Shaver System is 10/10....

  770. I finally decided to give an electric shaver a try, and after reading the Amazon reviews I selected the Braun Series 7 790cc. I have used it for a month now.<br /><br />Bottom line: It gives me a decent shave. Certainly it is no where near as close as my Gillette Fusion Power razor, but now that I have gotten used to it I find that:<br /><br />I shave faster than I did with my razor<br />I don't need shaving cream and expensive replacement razor blades<br />I get no irritation on my neck using the Braun where as I did with the razor<br /><br />I would have rated the unit as 5 stars, but it does not get all of my neck whiskers as easily as it does the rest of my face. I find myself having to make many more passes on my neck then I'd like. Yes, I stretch my skin and use the directional techniques that are recommended but it still comes up short.<br /><br />Although it doesn't necessarily equate to a better shave, the device feels good in my hand and it gives the impression that it is a high quality product. As a comparison, my son bought a Norelco rotary sensotouch 3D at about the same time. The costs are similar and it also gets good reviews. To me it feels cheap and it's not something I'd feel comfortable bringing on a trip with me.<br /><br />As a quickie test we decided to swap our electric shavers for one shave a week ago and afterwards both of us preferred what we had bought (I the Braun, he the Norelco). I thought the Norelco felt cheaply made and I didn't like that the cleaning solution gets poured into an open reservoir vs the Braun cartridge system. We both agreed the Norelco was slightly quieter, and that the Braun made shaving a little bit faster. He thought the Norelco shaved him closer, I thought the Braun shaved me closer. We both agreed neither beat the Gillette Fusion razor for closeness, but between the two of us and our blade use the two electric shavers will pay for themselves in about a year's time.<br /><br />These conclusions are certainly not the result of a scientific lab experimentation of shavers in a controlled manner, but they do represent our real-world personal conclusions.he result of a scientific lab experimentation of shavers in a controlled manner, but they do represent our real-world personal conclusions.

  780. Excellent shave on face, even with a few days of growth. This is easily the best electric razor I've ever used (I have had several over the years). As a person that very easily gets facial irritation, having a good razor really can improve your quality of life. I feel that this product has done that. I used to dread shaving before work everyday, because I knew that several hours later I would have red irritation that would be painful to the touch. I tried may different traditional razors as well as countless shave gels and creams. The Series 7 has eliminated about 90% of the discomfort I was dealing with, all while cutting my habitual shaving time in half. The one downfall to the product, in my case, is it's ability to provide an acceptable shave on the right and left bottom side of my neck. This is probably due to the fact that the hair seems to grow in a circle in this location on my face. But in order to finish the job each morning I have had to resort to the traditional razor, but it is minor and only takes a few small circular strokes to finish the job. In any case I am still very pleased with the product and would recommend it too friends and family.

Takes way longer to shave than the 5000 series and leaves neck hairs. I have very thick hair and get stubbly very quickly.<br />Now I'm not going to lie to you, I still think blade shaving is closer, but this is just fine as a day to day shaver and I'm impressed by how far the quality of these things has come along since I last tried.<br />The cleaning system seems to work well and leaves the shaver with a nice lemony scent, though I'm grumpy that the cleaning solution is not that cheap (as far as I can tell, it's just alcohol and some scent). However, it's nice to know the shaver is clean every time I want to use it.<br />So, the shaver itself is an easy five stars for me. I'm knocking off a star because I feel that the cleaning cartridges are overpriced for what they are (especially when the shaver is not cheap in the first place). This was overall though a great purchase, and I have no regrets.<br /><br />Updated review. Head lock button broke after 2 months. Currently getting the run-around trying to get this repaired. Seems from the Internet that this is a common problem and shouldn't be happening with a shaver that's this expensive. Removing a star from my original score.

  831. This shaver has a heavy solid feel in your hand and looks and feels well-constructed. I still wish it did better in the shaving dept. I swear, I don't even have a thick shadow, but I still find myself grinding away with every shaver I try on the patch under my chin and on my neck.<br /><br />The cleaning system is nice but it can be a money sucker unless you know my trick! Here's what to do.<br /><br />1.) Only clean it once a week with the solution.<br />2.) Keep the solution cartridge capped during the week when not in use so it doesn't evaporate away.<br />3.) Once it's time to clean, uncap, and clean. Then recap.<br /><br />This will allow your cleaning solution to last much longer thereby saving a lot of money. SNAP!

  850. I've been using this razor now for six months on an almost daily basis and overall I am very pleased with it. The one complaint I have is that, as other reviewers have pointed out, it can be a bit tricky and frustrating to get all the neck hairs depending on how they lie on your neck. I've found that going nice and slow, using plenty of light, and going at the tricky spots from multiple angles pretty much resolves the issues.<br /><br />The only other recommendation I have is regarding the &#34;Clean & Renew&#34; Cartridges. At first, I'd just shave and put the razor in and let it completely clean it (as the manual suggests). While it did a nice job of cleaning it, after I while I noticed the nice, lemony fresh started getting a bit gross. It basically recycles the cleaning fluid so over time it accumulates the hair and skin cells and just starts getting smelly. In addition, this uses up the fluid rather quickly and the cartridges are not cheap.<br /><br />My solution (no pun intended) is to simply pop the razor head off after each shave, give it and the razor a quick rinse, shake them out and then place it in the charger and let it do the clean. This makes sure it gets sanitized and lubricated but doesn't accumulate near as much of the hair and skin cells, therefore reducing the smelly factor to nothing. All the way through the life of the cartridge, it still smells nice and fresh. As an added bonus, it makes the cartridges last a lot longer. I can easily go 1.5-2 months without having to change cartridges and again, they still smell nice and fresh at the end.<br /><br />Overall, I would totally recommend this razor and I am very happy with my purchase.
  851. Folks, don't let anyone fool you. There is no electric razor that will shave as close as the state of the art Gillette razors. It's just not possible. But that doesn't mean that there aren't very good electric razors. I believe this is the best of the bunch.<br /><br />This is actually the 3rd Braun 7-790cc that I've owned. I've got a really bad habit of leaving them on hotel bathroom countertops. I'm really trying to work on this. I had my first Braun razor for about 4 years, changed the head twice and was totally satisfied. Over the years I've owned Remington, & Norelco brands but none have equaled this Braun model. I think the key is the speed at which this one vibrates. Very easy to use with minimal irritation.<br /><br />When I need really close shave I keep a Gillette handy. But for typical daily use this Braun is more than sufficient.

I travel a lot and and don't always have the base available to me, so I remove the screen top and tap out the debris after every shave. This is the first Braun I've had where the &#34;screen top piece&#34; feels flimsy and cheap when removing and inserting. Most times I'm either afraid I'm going to break it or I've put it on incorrectly - I haven't broken it, but I have needed to readjust it when I &#34;thought&#34; it was on correctly, and it just doesn't &#34;snap in&#34; with a firm, secure, satisfying sound or feeling. Again, great shave, the battery life (so far) seems exceptional, just that one little complaint.

  888. I have always gotten close shaves using regular disposable razors. Every year I have spent money throwing away many disposal shavers after 2 to 3 shaves. So,I figure that instead of throwing away money on disposables, I would bite the bullet and get an Electric shaver. In the hopes that the electric shaver would pay for itself over a period of time. Years ago, I did own a small electrical razor and I was never quite satisfied with the results. So, when looking into purchasing a new electric shaver, i did extensive research and asked friends and family and the occasional store customer what they owned and what kind of brand electric razor they would recommend to get the closes shave possible.<br /><br />After combing through many online reviews including on Amazon for the best shaving brands . My extensive search led me to the Braun Series 7 - 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System. I have been using it now for several months and I must confess that it did a better job than the old electric shaver but it wasn't by much. I still don't get that close shave that I desire. To be candid, I don't think there is a machine that exists out there that can give you a close smooth shave.<br /><br />In respect to the design, the machine and the storage unit are very elegant in style and it does a great job in cleaning itself automatically. Although, it can get pricey changing the blades and buying the refill cleaning cartridges. But if you are looking to get a good shave that is better than most. Then I recommend this machine for you. It is easy to use and and very easy to maintain clean. it is better than most of the electric shaver out there in the market.

  892.   895. The first self cleaning Braun I purchased had a charge arm that would lock it into the cleaning base, the plastic latching piece in that broke so I started using a rubber band to charge it. When I saw this unit with no arm I thought all the trouble were behind, I was wrong. Three months after purchase the locking head lever stopped locking it, so I continued using it in swivel mode. Now the locking button disappeared, I finally located it in the bottom of the cleaning base. Both the old and the new were taken out with a thin plastic piece that broke off. I left the razor in locked head mode. The closest I can figure the vibrating in the cleaner base caused it to break. The trimmer on it is all but useless since it opens in the middle of the shaver at a ninety degree angle to the razor, very awkward to use the trimmer. I lived with that but I could not live being burned twice by cheap craftsmanship and had to say something. Moving on to another razor company next time.
  896. I purchased this shaver to replace a Panasonic self-cleaning shaver that had stopped working after almost 8 years of constant use. The reason why I decided to switch to Braun, was because the cleaning system on my Panasonic had to be replaced 4 times due to leakage. After the 4th replacement started leaking, I gave up and cleaned it myself for the remaining years that it was in service.<br /><br />The Braun 790-CC is a nicely designed shaver and its ergonomic handle makes it a pleasure to hold while in use. I had fully expected to rate this shaver 5 stars, but after just 7 weeks of use, I'm giving it 2.5 stars instead.<br /><br />When working properly, I would have to say that this shaver does a good job, not a great one. After reading all of the 5 star reviews, which influenced me to purchase this shaver, I find myself dismayed, as the shaver doesn't deserve such high ratings. As mentioned above, the ergonomic handle makes it feel good while shaving. The problem is, the shaver doesn't provide a close shave unless you spend at least 10 minutes using it each time. I've tried all of the various settings, as well as running it across my face lightly, moderately and pressing down fairly hard. The optimum way to use the shaver is to run it across your face lightly, and at different angles. At times it helps to stretch out your skin and then run the shaver against it. Despite doing all of the above, in no way does this shaver come anywhere near as close as a blade does to providing the user with the optimum shave. Since I've heard so many rave reviews about how close the shave is supposed to be, I'm really disappointed in the job that it does on my face. I was preparing to go out to a formal event, and wanted to look good. After using the shaver for 15 minutes, covering every possible angle and pressure on my face, the closest I could come to a blade wasn't close at all. Running my hand across my face after using the shaver, it was evident that a blade wins by a long shot. In fairness to Braun, I would like to state that no shaver that I've used to date provides a shave that's as close to a blade. This seems strange to me, as some 40 years ago, the owner of Remington shavers claimed that their shavers \\"Performed as close as a blade, or your money back.\\" I guess you can say anything in advertising, whether it's true or not.<br /><br />Braun, AKA P & G advertises that this shaver is, and I quote \\"Shaver Built To Perform ~ Perfectly smooth skin with shavers tested to last 7 years.\\" Well perhaps they got the 7 correct, but in my case the years should have said weeks. Yes, after just 7 weeks of use, the cleaning base failed. In addition, the locking mechanism on the shaver itself no longer works. The locking mechanism is meant to be used to keep the foil/cutter in a stationary position, thus enabling you to better access the area above your lips, and the lower neck area. I really didn't find that this helped at all, so I only used it once or twice. Even so, for it to stop working after 7 weeks is unacceptable.<br /><br />A reputable company would make sure that the customer is pleased with their purchase. (Braun ~ P & G) is not such a company. I called them up to explain that the cleaning base had broken. I also explained that the locking mechanism on the shaver itself had failed. I asked them to send me a replacement cleaning base, and that I could live with the broken lock on the shaver itself. To my dismay, they refused to honor my request. I was told to send the base to their repair department at my own expense. I explained to them, that the shaver comes with a 60 day money back guarantee, and tried to get across the point that if they would simply send me a replacement base, it would cost them less than having to give me a full refund on my entire purchase. They still refused. Not wanting to send the shaver back, I contacted Amazon, and unbelievably, Amazon sent me an entire new shaver and base at no cost. They told me to throw outthe defective unit, as it was a non returnable item. Amazon deserves kudos for their exceptional customer service. Unfortunately, this does not change my opinion on the mediocre performance of this shaver.<br /><br />Braun has been making this shaver since 2009 or 2010. You would think that after that period of time, they would have gotten all of the kinks out of the system. The bottom line is that this is an overrated shaver. It is prone to premature failure, doesn't come anywhere near as close as a blade, and Braun/P & G has atrocious customer service. I truly hope that a company will come out with a shaver that is really as close as a blade, and also come out with a self-cleaning system that is designed to last.<br /><br />The bottom line is that I use an electric shaver in order to save time. If it's going to take me 10 - 15 minutes to get a shave that's not as close as a blade, I might as well use a blade. It would seem to me that in this day and age, where virtually anything is possible, a company should be able to come out with an electric shaver that not only equals the performance of a blade, but does so in less time. They should also be able to produce a product (shaver & cleaning base) that's designed to last. In my opinion, if we can land men on the moon, and send spacecraft to distant planets, we should certainly be able to design the perfect electric shaver. I'm rating the Braun 790-CC at 2.5 stars. Had mine performed as advertised, I would have rated it 4 stars, the highest I would give to any electric shaver that I've used to date.<br /><br /> Verdict: Shaver, when working as advertised ~ B-/C+ ~ I would not rate any electric shaver higher than this.<br /> Shaver ~ In condition that mine was in after 7 weeks ~ D<br /> Braun customer service ~ F<br /> Amazon Customer service ~ A+the defective unit, as it was a non returnable item. Amazon deserves kudos for their exceptional customer service. Unfortunately, this does not change my opinion on the mediocre performance of this shaver.<br /><br />Braun has been making this shaver since 2009 or 2010. You would think that after that period of time, they would have gotten all of the kinks out of the system. The bottom line is that this is an overrated shaver. It is prone to premature failure, doesn't come anywhere near as close as a blade, and Braun/P & G has atrocious customer service. I truly hope that a company will come out with a shaver that is really as close as a blade, and also come out with a self-cleaning system that is designed to last.<br /><br />The bottom line is that I use an electric shaver in order to save time. If it's going to take me 10 - 15 minutes to get a shave that's not as close as a blade, I might as well use a blade. It would seem to me that in this day and age, where virtually anything is possible, a company should be able to come out with an electric shaver that not only equals the performance of a blade, but does so in less time. They should also be able to produce a product (shaver & cleaning base) that's designed to last. In my opinion, if we can land men on the moon, and send spacecraft to distant planets, we should certainly be able to design the perfect electric shaver. I'm rating the Braun 790-CC at 2.5 stars. Had mine performed as advertised, I would have rated it 4 stars, the highest I would give to any electric shaver that I've used to date.<br /><br /> Verdict: Shaver, when working as advertised ~ B-/C+ ~ I would not rate any electric shaver higher than this.<br /> Shaver ~ In condition that mine was in after 7 weeks ~ D<br /> Braun customer service ~ F<br /> Amazon Customer service ~ A+

With any blade type razor I always had irritation in the area due to needing multiple passes to get that smoothness. With this one, there is no issue at all.   962. As some backstory: I have a ridiculously difficult face to shave. Prone to razor bumps and with hair that has no real grain and kind of grows in swirls. No lotions, creams, razors would give me a close shave without givning me an uncomfortable and unsightly burn on my neck.<br /><br />I was told not to use electric razors, but that was a long time ago and figured that they must be better and more reliable now than they were 10 years ago. After going through a rotary electric razor with some improvement I decided to splurge on the Braun Series 7.<br /><br />WORTH. EVERY. PENNY.<br /><br />After about 1 week of my skin getting used to the foil shaver I saw dramatic decrease in the amount of razor burns/bumps and this still left me with an INCREDIBLY close shave. Comparable to a multi-bladed analog razor. And with the charging station the blade is always clean. The razor itself is really nice and has 3 settings for blade speeds to use to help decrease irritation for your skin and also has a lock for the pivoting foil head that helps especially under the nose and just under the jaw.<br /><br />Since I have to shave every day for my work, this item has been an incredible investment and now that I have been using it for about 1 year I don't know how I got by without it. If you have similar problems as I do with sensitive skin/uncommon grain to your beard/razor burn I would HIGHLY recommend this razor

  967. I have been using a Braun System 7 razor for over 3 years now. I have a Van Dyke (Goatee) but shave the rest of my face including my entire head.   968. I was very skeptical about purchasing, as I've loved my older 7000 series Syncro model bought about ten years ago. I even considered buying some parts to bring the Syncro up to newer standards. However, this was money well spent, and as long as it lasts long term, this is a great step forward. In reading the reviews, some have reported it as very noisy. Compared to my Syncro, this is a little quieter. It's a different frequency, a little higher, but not as loud, so when I shave early in the morning I am not bothering anyone else. Someone did comment that you don't have as much audible feedback as it chops through stubble, and that is true, and does take some getting used to, as that used to be my indicator to move on to another area on my face. The cleaning system is a little different than I'm used to because it has the quick clean and more thorough options, but otherwise, it's great. The station on the counter does not take up more space than my Syncro one, in fact I think it's a little narrower in diameter.<br /><br />Others noted problems with the lock mechanism breaking on the head. I haven't had this problem, and I've locked it several times just to see and ensure it's working, but I actually don't use that feature typically when shaving, I find that allowing the head to float serves me well, even in tough areas like neck and upper lip.<br /><br />My shave is faster, closer, and all around better. The price here was on Amazon was very competitive with others I found, though they don't let you return it to them like normal products, if you needed to. I am guessing this is because of the alcohol cartridge which technically requires special shipping.<br /><br />Great step forward. In my late thirties, this is now my third Braun razor product since late high school, and each has lasted me about ten years before moving on. Hopefully I'll get the same longevity from this one!<br /><br />One side note - I read some reviews that said that you must ensure you get the 790cc-4, with the \\"4\\" on the end being critical. I found no way to really ensure this on Amazon, but I ordered based on my past positive experiences with Amazon and that is exactly what I received - the 790cc-4.you get the 790cc-4, with the \\"4\\" on the end being critical. I found no way to really ensure this on Amazon, but I ordered based on my past positive experiences with Amazon and that is exactly what I received - the 790cc-4.

  999. My 3 year old 7 760cc finally gave out on me the flip trimmer finally stopped working but the battery is still going strong. I have also read that the 3d recommends that you unplug the clean/charge base when done shaving so as not to ruin the battery NOT COOL. The braun manages the battery and will not let it overcharge. The only drawback I have found with brain shavers is that the neck is a difficult area to get an even shave unless you spend extra time. My old 760 cc I would have to use the trimmer every single shave to get one or two stubborn hairs. This new braun seems to be an improvement as I have not had to use the trimmer in the couple shaves I have done. The very first braun I tried 6 years ago before they switched to the triangular foil I returned because it simply would not cut neck hairs. There is a progression with the bruan shavers. The one thing I like about the norelco shavers is I think they have a superior head design hitting each hair at several different angles with every pass, however their build quality is questionable. I would say that the shaving closeness is comparable with all rotary or foil razors. If you want a close close shave use a blade however you are also scratching and irritating your skin, not good for people with sensitive skin.

I am still trying to get used to the Braun Series 7 as my rotary still seems easier and faster.<br />Although my research seemed complete, the need to purchase a liquid solution to clean the razor and the seeming loud noise it makes when running causes me to do more research prior to future purchasing.<br />I loved a Braun prior to my Rotary so perhaps that love will resurface after using this powerful razor... hopefully sooner than later.
  1028. If this thing lasts more than 5-6 years like it says in the warranty it will be more than enough for me. I made a small calculation. If I use regular shaving stuff like foam, aftershave, razors, and other small things the amount of cash that I'll spend on all of them for 6 years will be the same as the amount of cash I spend on this Device.<br /><br /> Sellers are not stupid! They sell good products at the maximum price the customer can provide!
  1029. I think the Braun Series 7-790cc Pulsonic Shaver System is great. I have a medium heavy beard and I consider the shave close enough for me. It's not as close as the old safety razor I used for years, BUT it sure is easier, less messy and results in no bloody cuts.
  1030. I've been using this product for about a month, I used a philishave 3 rotary shaver before this change. The Braun shaver gives a slightly closer shave than the old shaver, can be used cordless (I used it for 6 days without need to recharge it on a recent vacation) or with the cord in, and has the cleaning system which also keeps the blades lubricated. The shave is close, it's particularly good on the face, but it loses a star as it takes a bit more work to get the neck smooth, and because I think it may be costly to maintain (I got 5 years of life out of the philishave blades, but the manual says to expect about a year out of these baldes and the cleaning / lubricating liquid needs to be replaced approximately monthly). It has 3 levels of intensity, I messed around with the different levels but found the normal mode (middle intensity) worked well. The trimmer is very precise and the the shaving head has a lock out if you don't want it to pivot. Overall a very good product, I'm just waiting to see how much ongoing costs will be.<br /><br />Update - I have now been using this for about 6 months, and the cleaning solution lasts 1.5 to 2.5 months (lasts longer n the cooler months, probably due to less heat evaporation).
  1031. I bought the Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver to replace a 5 year old Braun razor. I really didn't expect much of a change in performance. Wow, was I wrong. The new razor gives an amazing shave in a third of the time of the old system. I'm not very sure about the sideburn trimmer yet, but the quality of the shaving blade makes this the ultimate shaver.[[ASIN:B003YJAZZ4 Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver]]
  1032. It is not easy to spend this kind of money on a shaver in this poor economy but if you can afford it do it. I have tried norelco, panasonic and other various types of shavers that have always left me wanting a bit more from them. This one will not let you down. The shave is quite smooth just like a razor without the blood splatters all over the place. The automatic cleaner is great too keeps the shaver in tip top shape for every shave and there is no excuse for not cleaning it since you don't have to. I recommend this shaver to anyone that feels the wrath of the razors like I do. Money well spent
  1033. Nothing but the best. The Item preforms as expected, thats why I purchased another one. I have had three over the years.
  1034. I got this based on very good experiences with Braun shavers before - my previous 7000-series lasted more than a decade until the battery just gave up. If you're in the same situation - get your old one fixed and don't downgrade to the new one.<br /><br />The shaver is kind of ok. It is a clear step down from the previous model in shaving result, ergonomics (why the tiny buttons when they had a very nice mechanism before) and an awkward flimsy feeling long hair trimmer.<br /><br />The cleaning station is a disaster. If the shaver feels cheap now, that's nothing compared to the plastic station. It sort of worked for a few months (sometimes failing to complete the cycle), but now at maybe ten months in it fails completely even with a new cartridge, only going between orange and red for low/empty cartridge.<br /><br />Feels like the whole things was designed just to get you to buy refills. Frustrating, because the previous ones felt like such solid engineering.
  1035. This is the best shaver I ever had. In the past I had to use a razor in order to get a 24 hrs clean shave. now I can do it faster with the electric shaver.<br />The shaver comes with a large cleaning system which I'm not sure that it does much except increase Braun sales of cleaning fluid cartridges. You probably can get the cleaning done with the plain brush (included) and water.<br />Overall a great machine.
  1036. After 5 cleans the cleaning station no longer works. Same thing happenend on a prior Braun razor. Braun requires you to ship everything back including the razor for Warranty Repair/Replacement. This process takes 3-4 weeks to complete and the shipping is on my dime for their poor quality product. Crazy, just replace the $20 plastic part! Not very forward thinking customer service.<br />The razor works fine but not worth the nearly $200 price tag. Last Braun product I ever buy.
  1037. As advertised, great shaver

  1044. I am bald. I live in Sacramento. There is a severe drought. That being said I wanted to find a way to shave face and head without water. I have shaved face and head in the shower for years but realized that I was using 10s of gallons of water with each shave! I first tried the &#34;The Bald Eagle Smart Shaver thinking it would best suit my needs. It is a rotary shaver like a Norelco. Not only did it give a poor result, just like every Norelco I've every tried, it broke after only two shaves. I returned it. After looking up alternatives, I discovered this Braun (pronounced brown). This is a special shaver apparently designed for Amazon customers, as I was not able to find it at Walmart, Target or any of the usual retailers. As usual, it came quickly and charged quickly. Voila! With a little bit of Lectric Shave my face and head were done rapidly and without any chafing, burn or discomfort. The shave is 95% as good as with blade in the shower!! It is simply the best shave for your time and money. Not only is shaving quick and satisfying, the Pulsonic cleans itself! After 50 years of searching for a simple, clean shave, here it is.
  1045. It's the best shaver I had used. U can use everyday that it doesn't hurt your face. Use it ok.
  1046. So far....working great!
  1047. I have been using the Braun series 7 for about a week. I had been a lifelong Norelco guy. Last Norelco was a wet/dry mid priced version that did not shave me very well; lots of skin irritation and missed hairs. Tried a shaving gel. That helped a bit but still did not do the job. I do not even need a pre electric product with the Braun. The shave is much closer than the Norelco with absolutely no irritation. It was a true pleasure to apply after shave lotion without the burning from skin irritation. One big negative of this system is the high cost of the cleaning solution. This is another case of sell the razor at a fair price and to get people to spend mucho more than the razor costs on liquid refills over the lifetime of the razor. I beat the system; excuse the pun. I purchased an ultrasound cleaner (about $25) on Amazon plus a small plastic bottle of Braun razor oil. That is a million times cheaper than refills. I retired from the health care field (DVM) a year ago and used to use my office ultrasound cleaner to do my shaver heads, jewelry etc...Just add a drop or two of soap detergent to the ultrasound container. Overall, I am extremely impressed with the Braun.
  1048. Over the years I've had many electric shavers--a variety of brands--and have found the Braun shavers to have the best feeling of quality: solid and durable. This particular shaver has given me the closest shave yet, and I like the idea of the cutter/foil cartridge; the replacement cost is an improvement over the cost of previous replacements for the cutter and foil. One area I'd like to see them improve concerns the noise level of the shaver and of the cleaning system (though, to be fair, the cleaner is loud for a relatively short time). The cost of cleaner refills is also high, but I see that another company has come out with a more reasonably priced refill. Aside from the two somewhat minor quibbles, I do recommend this shaver.
  1049. I SATISFIED WITH THIS PRODUCT, BRAUN ARRIVED A MY LIFE AND I WON'T LEVE. I USE THE BRAUN SERIES 7 ALL DAYS.

  1058. What can I say that hasn't been said. I love this razor. It does everything I need and more. Highly recommend.
  1059. The Braun 790cc is a very good shaver. It is easy to hold and to maneuver. It has 3 shaving modes and I use the one for sensitive skin. It works well. The trimmer comes out at a right angle to the shaver, and for me, it is awkward to use and takes off points. Much has been written about the cleaner. I don't particularly like it, but I do use it twice a week. It is easy to cap and uncap the cleaning solution tank. When not in use, I store the cleaner and solution under the counter. Most days I rinse the shaver under hot water. I use one cleaning tank for 3 months. Before buying the Braun, I had a Norelco for many years. I decided to switch, and I am glad that I did. On the bathroom counter, I put the Braun in my old Norelco stand. Braun does not provide anything but the cleaning tank which is large, and there is no plastic cap to cover the shaving head. Too bad.
  1060. Bought this a few years ago on a whim because i hate shaving with a razor and this looked good. Its the only electric razor ive used though so no helpful comparisons here.<br /><br />It's quiet and has a little bit of weight to it which makes it feel stable in your hand. It also doesnt shake around much. The grip is nice also.<br /><br />There's a meter at one end of the razor which indicates hygiene. When that meter gets low you are supposed to use your razor station to start the cleaning process which uses some type of special cleaning liquid. This tends to evaporate very quickly. To save on that cleaning liquid cost I just don't use it all. To somewhat clean I usually just pop the razor end, turn on the razor, and then hold the two parts together. this kind of vibrates all of the cut trimmings out of the razor.<br /><br />If you don't shave for three days straight the razor may seem kind of plucky. To help reduce the pulling sensation, I use the razor with the grain of the hairs on my chin and then I go sideways actually and then I go against the grain to finish it up. Ive noticed a lot less pain this way.<br /><br />Dont drop it too many times though. I dropped it one too many times and it started to shake violently while turned on. It also became very loud and poppy like a push lawnmore sounds. It still cut hairs though. Repair cost me about 65$.<br /><br />Good enough razor that i bought a second.
  1061. This razor is a really nice unit. I love the intense shaving setting on it as this setting shaves under my neck and does not seem to irritate it like other razors have. The one razor that did irritate under my neck was the Norelco Sensotouch. Shaving under my neck would cause it to become red and sore but not with this shaver and the intense shave setting. I find too that I can use a lighter touch when shaving and this razor will do a very decent job. You will never get a very close shave with any electric razor. For a close close shave, a manual razor will accomplish this every time. I do like the option of being able to put the razor in the cleaning station for a complete cleaning/renewal of the razor. I have not tried all the features of it. It may be a little expensive but it is worth it in my opinion. Of course, all razors work differently on different people so this model may or may not be the one for you.
  1062. ...self-cleaning, sharp for a close shave. Couldn't be better unless, of course, it were cordless. Would be nice, but still an excellent gentleman's razor.
  1063. I HATED cleaning my old razor. This takes the part I hated the most about shaving away. It works really well and keeping it clean helps give a good shave.
  1064. It's very nice!<br />My friend likes it very much.<br />It can works very well and his jaw feels really good.
  1065. After over 10 years of service, I finally decided to retire my trusty Braun 7526 in favor a a new Braun. I initially picked up a 3 series in a local store on sale, but returned it unopened when I saw I could get a 7 Series on Amazon for about $30-40 more...and the reviews indicated to me the extra money was worth it...I will, after all, use this thing at least 5 days a week for hopefully many years to come. Here's my take:<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Close shave, no irritation on my sensitive skin, I like it.<br />- Charge lasts a long time.<br />- Not messy...shaver seems to trap most all the \\"stubble dust\\"...which is a huge improvement over my 7526...that thing left dust all over me and the sink every morning.<br /><br />Cons (which I consider all to be minor in nature):<br />- I'm not a fan of this model's pop-out trimmer. It's long and awkward to use, and IMO doesn't trim as well as the 7526 shorter slide-up trimmer did.<br />- While it's a pretty quiet shave, it makes a much louder racket when being cleaned in the base. Kind of annoying in the early morning when others are sleeping, you can hear this thing being cleaned all over the house.<br />- Seems to need a lot of cleaning--I am very curious how it estimates hygiene/cleanliness...seems to only reset while cleaned on the base. While travelling, I occasionally clean the head myself with hot water and the brush...but that never raises the clean-meter on the shaver. Not really a con, just gee-whiz for me.<br /><br />Bottom-line: it gives a nice shave, I like it. all the other stuff is gravy.
  1066. Downsides: takes up a lot of counterspace with a big hunk of plastic. EXPENSIVE-- you'll need to pay for the liquid on a regular basis for the life of the shaver.<br />Upside: Provides the illusion of cleanliness, mainly via the smell of rubbing alcohol.<br />SERIOUSLY: do you think product development in this case was driven by the engineers, or the bean counters? This is a textbook case of a brilliant way of milking the customer for YEARS after the initial purchase. Don't be a sucker.... your shaver does not need to be sterilized like a surgical instrument before each use.
  1067. It's possible that this is one of the best electronic razors, and maybe they will never work for me, but I purchased this so I could do a quick shave every morning and make things easier than shaving with a razor blade.   1072. I have been using my Braun for about a month, and to date it has been the best razor I have owned. The razor itself is solid, well built and easy to hold. One can both see and feel its quality. I have a light beard, and for me the shave is as good as that attained with a blade and far more comfortable, especially in the area of the neck, which is always tender. I have owned two other Braun electric shavers; this one is by far the quietest and most comfortable to use. The cleaning station is also well constructed and leaves the shaver clean and smelling fresh for the next shave. So far, the only criticism I have is that the travel case does not have room for the charging cord, which has to be packed separately during travel. Other than that minor discrepency, I would highly recommend this shaver.
  1073. This is now the second Braun shaver that I have owned. I was very happy with my last one until it finally croaked. That being said, I would still take this unit over a Norelco any day!

  1076. My boyfriend seems to love it. Close shave without the razor everyday. Love the self cleaning feature. Would buy it again.
  1077. I started shaving like most guys I guess when I enlisted in the Army at 18 back in '65. Back then we used the double edge safety razor we were issued and received the standard amount of nicks and cuts during the learning curve. Fast forward several years to civilian life and my new Mother in law (May God forever bless and keep this wonderful woman) presents me at Christmastime with the latest and greatest \\"New\\" gizmo ever created for a man, a Norelco Rotary Shaver, designed and engineered to eliminate nicks and cuts forever. Sounds great on Madison Avenue but in all practical applications, it doesn't work on Main Street. Every time I yelled \\"Ouch\\" in my bathroom it seemed that I received a \\"New\\" set of replacement blades or a completely new Norelco Model as a Birthday or Christmas gift. no B.S! I've got a box in my garage with about 15 different models of that Rotary Razor and they all stink in my opinion but what else was I supposed to use? Fast forward to a couple of months ago when I'm reading the reviews of this \\"New\\" Braun Pulsonic. I'm now in my late 60's and I'm not impressed with Corporate Adjectives but I will listen to what more than just a few real guys are saying about this Braun Series 7 razor. So I decide to take a leap of faith. Heck, at my age and after all the nicks and cuts I've suffered over the years, I've earned a treat. If you're truly tired of the beating you've been taking every time you put your current razor to your face, then give this baby a try. And one little piece of \\"For What It's Worth\\". I splurged for the complete system but you really don't have to. After shaving you place your razor upside down in this holder that keeps your razor charged and clean at the same time which is kind of neat. There is a cleaning cartridge hidden in the base that gives your razor the once over after your razor is placed in the holder. It whirs, clicks, blinks & buzzes and goes all R2D2 on you but it's just a toy in my opinion. I got suckered in and smiled to myself while I played with it for the first time. In truth though I'm a more practical guy. After shaving I just pop off the little shaving cartridge and give it a few little blasts from a can of compressed air over the top of the razor & the shaving head, replace and go. By the way this little baby also comes with an ultimately cool hard sided travel case that I use to store it in when we go out of town for a few days as well as the wall charger. Otherwise, I leave mine in \\"The System\\". One other note that you married guys will bust a gut over. My wife thought that this entire gizmo sitting on the top of my vanity was so cool that she knitted a Silver & Black (I'm a Raiders Fan) Cozy for it. It's actually pretty slick and keeps it from getting splashed and hit by all sorts of flying whatnot from bathroom activity. (Maybe I should start taking orders)....To close...I purchased this razor August of '13 and have used it almost daily ever since. It's the finest razor I've ever owned by a mile. It slides easily over my face and neck removing my whiskers quickly and cleanly without nicks, pinches or cuts especially on my neck. It's sort of a men's dream come true.led to myself while I played with it for the first time. In truth though I'm a more practical guy. After shaving I just pop off the little shaving cartridge and give it a few little blasts from a can of compressed air over the top of the razor & the shaving head, replace and go. By the way this little baby also comes with an ultimately cool hard sided travel case that I use to store it in when we go out of town for a few days as well as the wall charger. Otherwise, I leave mine in \\"The System\\". One other note that you married guys will bust a gut over. My wife thought that this entire gizmo sitting on the top of my vanity was so cool that she knitted a Silver & Black (I'm a Raiders Fan) Cozy for it. It's actually pretty slick and keeps it from getting splashed and hit by all sorts of flying whatnot from bathroom activity. (Maybe I should start taking orders)....To close...I purchased this razor August of '13 and have used it almost daily ever since. It's the finest razor I've ever owned by a mile. It slides easily over my face and neck removing my whiskers quickly and cleanly without nicks, pinches or cuts especially on my neck. It's sort of a men's dream come true.
  1078. Lot smoother & faster shave than my old Series 3. Not cheap, but I feel it is worth the extra cost.
  1079. My father had purchased one of these several months back. I am more of a traditional razor person and have never used an electric. My line of work requires I am clean shaven daily. I decided that I would give this a shot as a backup plan. Upon arrival I had my first electric shave. I use this during the week for a quick shave before work. The fact that I can place it in the charger, push a button and have a clean and ready to go razor is a huge benefit. No mess.   1080. A very good shaver with no pulling. Comfortable feel. The cleaning system is also a big positive for this shaver.
  1081. This shaver has a strong motor, smooth foils, and a good charging base. Though nothing is as close as blades, I have found this gives the closest shave from a foil shaver I have ever had. The cleaning system takes a while to complete it's cycle but, unless you are OCD and want to clean it in mid shave, that is not a big deal. The indicator that tells me how close it is to needing a clean cycle is very accurate and useful. I've had this shaver for well over 1 month and have not yet needed to change out the cleaning fluids.   1086. I cannot say much since there is over a thousand 5 stars reviews.<br /><br />But I will compare, and review this product from another shaver perspective.   1099. I bought this as the first replacement for my old Braun Activator. I'd gotten used to the LCD and the cleaning charging stand, so I had to have those features again. The 790cc's advancements over the Activator included a new faster motor, a different foil system, and the ability to select different skin &#34;sensitivities&#34;, which correspond to how hard the shaver would attempt to shave your face.<br /><br />The shaves are very close, and definitely no irritation on the sensitive level. The unit is sure easy to clean. The LCD on the other hand, doesn't tell you as much information as the old Activator's; number of shaves and how long are not displayed. Just battery level and hygiene of the head (which is more a count of times-used-since-last-cleaning). Not a real problem, but just mentioning it FWIW. Certainly didn't meet my expectations.<br /><br />The only real design problem with the 790cc is the trimmer. It is well-concealed, popping out over the power button. But it has an awkward angle of use, and is also a bit flimsy due to the mechanism. If you have a lot of edges that need defining (say a mustache, beard or sideburns), this is not the all-in-one tool you're looking for. As that was my situation, off I went to look for another solution.<br /><br />None of the other ones have plain shaved as well as the 790cc.
  1100. Good product. Nice hi tech design and feel. It does the job but it does not feel sturdy like the Braun Series 5 shavers from 10 years ago. The charging station feels flimsy as well. You need to jiggle the shaver slightly to get a good contact. I never had to do that with the 8995 shaver I had before. The beard trimmer is also extended outwards too much and does not provide good control during precise trims. This is supposedly a better product and while it does a fine job, I have a feeling it won't last as long as my last Braun did. Wish they cut down on the fancy design and put more in actual build.

I do change the foils and blades every year or so. I just saw one of the Cooltec models in the store today on sale and bought it, so I guess I'll be retiring these two shavers and use them for backups or traveling. I highly recommend Braun shavers, they are not perfect in every aspect for everybody, but you'll get your money's worth in longevity in my experience.

  1146. I've had this razor for a few months- it could be that I've always bought razors for under $100-- but this was definitely worth the (discounted) price I paid for it ($150). While I wish it was completely waterproof- this is only a minor setback. The only other complaint I have is about the pop out razor. Its kind of in an awkward spot and I prefer the location of it on the back side like my older Braun razor.<br /><br />The cleaning system leaves you with a million dollar shave after each cleanse. I don't clean it as often as it suggests (pretty much after every time I use it) as the cost of the cleaning fluid is pretty steep- but I do clean it about once a week and its been working out well.<br />Overall a great product. Not disappointed with it at all.<br /><br />UPDATE: It has now been almost two years since I've been using this product and it is still going strong. I now see the price has actually risen quite a bit, but honestly this shaver is worth it at almost any price. Every time I use this razor I'm amazed by the closeness of the shave and the lack of razor burn that I would occasionally get with other models.<br /><br />After these two years I have finally changed the razor head, like it suggests (every 1.5 years) and the shave is as good as ever. As for the cleaning pods, I still don't use them as often as it suggests but every time I do it's like I'm using the razor for the first time. I cannot recommend this razor enough due to the relatively low price and the quality and feel of the shave. You get closeness of a manual razor with the comfort of an electric one (without fear of razor burns, cuts, etc.) I often forget, but the razor even has a speed or &#34;roughness&#34; setting so that when shaving in sensitive areas you can turn down the razor so that it won't do any damage-- I've found that in doing this you have to go over the area quite a few more times, but in exchange for the safety of sensitive areas it is worth it.<br /><br />As I mention on review page for the cleaning fluid there are a few tips that help the solution last longer (5-6 months, versus 2-3) and will help you have that million dollar shave every time: &#34;Each [Cleaning Pod] lasts about five months, sometimes longer, although I don't use them as much as Braun suggests I should. For me one long/deep clean a week, and the quick clean when I feel it's needed keeps the razor working fine. Like other reviews have suggested I have found that placing the cap back on when your not using the cleaner does help it last longer, but I feel the MOST IMPORTANT step to making it last is to rinse all the hair out of razor and let it dry a bit before you use the cleaning dock. Using the cleaning system with a razor full of hair only dilutes the cleaning solution and makes it not clean as well.&#34;review page for the cleaning fluid there are a few tips that help the solution last longer (5-6 months, versus 2-3) and will help you have that million dollar shave every time: &#34;Each [Cleaning Pod] lasts about five months, sometimes longer, although I don't use them as much as Braun suggests I should. Using the cleaning system with a razor full of hair only dilutes the cleaning solution and makes it not clean as well.&#34;
