  1182. I replaced an older Braun 7505 shaver (with sideburn trimmer) with an OUTRAGEOUSLY EXPENSIVE Braun Series 7 (790 cc) Pulsonic shaver and cleaning system that has a liquid-crystal display and LEDs. The Pulsonic definitely moves much faster, but … Unfortunately, after a little over a year and a half the tiny plastic and nylon parts in the sideburn trimmer catastrophically failed leaving a couple of flapping plastic sliders. After about two years, the center cutting head for longer whiskers failed catastrophically in a shower of tiny parts. So now I have a Pulsonic that only shaves very short whiskers and does not trim sideburns. I still have the old 7505 which is perfectly fine, but slower, that I use for trimming sideburns and shaving after more than 2-3 days. I then finish with the Pulsonic. The old 7505 is a nice straight-forward design but is slower. It would have been great to have the Pulsonic motor built within the simpler and solid design of the 7505. One wonders what possesses the Braun designers and engineers to come up with those ridiculously over-engineered and complex shavers that are so failure prone. I had a suspicion that the sideburn trimmer on the Pulsonic was going to fail when I first saw how it works because it was obviously laughably and stupidly complex. Hey Braun designers & engineers … WAKE UP and design for longevity!
  1183. Friends get satisfied. Razor shave is clean, sounds great, but in the acceptable range, picked everything is satisfied, if need be, I will choose it to family and friends.
  1184. This is my 3rd Braun electric. It's also the best yet. I'm more of a minimalist so it took some research and a little leap of faith to splurge for the higher end model. I was also a bit skeptical of the &#34;cleaning station&#34; - just more consumables to maintain. But this is indeed a great system.<br /><br />The Shave<br />This razor gives a nice close shave. Very comfortable overall (one exception later). It seems to vibrate at much higher speed than previous models I've had - this is evident in the audible pitch and in the way it feels. It's smooth and reasonably aggressive in its trimming action so that overall your shave is pretty fast. I find that it does a good job not leaving &#34;stragglers&#34;. One noticeable issue is that if I have grown a mid-length stubble (for me thats 3-4 days), this model seems to catch the odd hair with a painful pull more frequently than others I've used. So if you have a couple day old beard going (not too long, not too short) you need to slow down a little. Not sure if thats the foil design or what, but it's a noticeable thing for me.<br /><br />Trimmer works well, is a bit smaller (width-wise) than other's I've had, and it flips out (not slides up) so that it's perpendicular to the shaver body. That has it's advantages in that it stays well clear of the shaving head and you can be a little more precise.<br /><br />Operation<br />Simple, one button on/off operation. Battery and &#34;cleaning&#34; indicators are on the bottom. Big plus is the battery life. This thing will run for a week on a single charge. I leave it out of the charging cradle during the week and only charge it when it gets low (just to prevent battery burnout - not sure if it's that kind of battery). The cord that powers the base can also be used directly with the shaver for travel which is a good design. Comes with a nice travel case, but the case is so form fitting to the shaver, you can't fit the power cord in the case with the razor - that was a bad design decision.<br /><br />Self-Cleaning<br /><br />OK here's the special thing about this model - the cleaning station.<br /><br />The removable head is a more complex part than the simple 2 piece foil and blade of prior models. This is one piece. It removes easily and seems to readily release most clippings that it collects with a few taps on the side of the sink. The shaver seems to go immediately from &#34;Clean&#34; to &#34;Dirty&#34; in pretty much one or two shaves. So basically it wants to be cleaned multiple times a week. I usually run the cleaning cycle once every two weeks to conserve the cleaning solution.<br /><br />The cleaning cycle is really nice. There is a self-contained alcohol/sanitizing solution that slides into the base. The cleaning cycle washes the cutting head with this solution, runs the razor, and dries it. Your shaver indeed comes out feeling and smelling like new. It's a noticeably smoother shave after it's done. Your mileage will obviously vary depending on how often you run the cleaning cycle. The cycle itself seems to take 30 minutes or so - so don't plan on cleaning this right before you need to shave - you put it in the dock, press a button, and walk away for a while. It cycles the razor several times with a drying cycle in between. I've never really waited for the whole process so I'm not sure exactly how long it will go.<br /><br />Summary<br />Great shaver<br />Feels good and works well<br />Holds a Charge<br />Cleaning station is a nice feature (from a skeptic) but will increase your expense in maintaining/operatingt was a bad design decision.<br /><br />Self-Cleaning<br /><br />OK here's the special thing about this model - the cleaning station.<br /><br />The removable head is a more complex part than the simple 2 piece foil and blade of prior models. This is one piece. It removes easily and seems to readily release most clippings that it collects with a few taps on the side of the sink. The shaver seems to go immediately from &#34;Clean&#34; to &#34;Dirty&#34; in pretty much one or two shaves. So basically it wants to be cleaned multiple times a week. I usually run the cleaning cycle once every two weeks to conserve the cleaning solution.<br /><br />The cleaning cycle is really nice. There is a self-contained alcohol/sanitizing solution that slides into the base. The cleaning cycle washes the cutting head with this solution, runs the razor, and dries it. Your shaver indeed comes out feeling and smelling like new. It's a noticeably smoother shave after it's done. Your mileage will obviously vary depending on how often you run the cleaning cycle. The cycle itself seems to take 30 minutes or so - so don't plan on cleaning this right before you need to shave - you put it in the dock, press a button, and walk away for a while. It cycles the razor several times with a drying cycle in between. I've never really waited for the whole process so I'm not sure exactly how long it will go.<br /><br />Summary<br />Great shaver<br />Feels good and works well<br />Holds a Charge<br />Cleaning station is a nice feature (from a skeptic) but will increase your expense in maintaining/operating

  1194. This is the BMW 7 series of shaver for an executive shave. Yes, it has a cleaning mode, an LCD charge and hygiene meter. It is a little on the overkill, like top of the line model that you marvel at the LCD and then pick it up because it feels like some high tech taser. So what, how does it shave? Even though it might need a few passes, it is a very close shave. There are so many features that I don't even know where to start, but just press the power button and shave away. The trimmer is a bit flimsy unlike my old 7505. Actually, my 7505 still works, but the wierd charger broke (looking on Ebay). Yes, it is better than my 7505, but only the shaving part. The head vibrates very fast and the cutting block moves quickly so I don't even hear or feel it cutting. My 7505 - I can feel and hear it cutting. These things are getting too complex. When I took off the foil and cutting block, I don't see where the stubble went. I don't think I can clean the cutting block without disassembling the block. Maybe that is why they have the cleaning system. Actually, the holder helps prevent wear on the plug by charging the shaver, too.<br /><br />Update: Compared to my now working 7505 (found an old plug on the Bay)- I feel that my light scruff does not need the 790 shaver, but will keep it as a backup to my aging 7505. The cutting block on the 790 seems to be attached to the foil, so please take care of the foil. My 10+ year old 7505 that I bought on Amazon as a refurb still works great. It's slower motion actually feels better for my light growth than the high strung 790. Plus, I cannot undervalue the importance of the 7505's better trimmer. I can trim side burns and even get away with a haircut longer by using it to trim my hair. The 790 cannot do this as well or maybe I'm not used to it. My 7505 after 10 years has still only needed about 3 foil + cutters over the years and only because the foil got punctured by some jealous girlfriend. Braun makes the best shavers bar none. When my 7505 finally dies, the 790 will suffice.shavers bar none. When my 7505 finally dies, the 790 will suffice.

To my surprise, there is a trimmer you can use by sliding up the grooves above the power button to keep your sideburns at a certain length or to line up a beard, mustache, or goatee. I've enjoyed using this product very much and would highly recommend it. Less irritation, no shaving gel and the battery life is phenomenal.   1243. I'm a v-e-r-y long time electric shaver user (30+ years) with fairly heavy beard growth.<br /><br />Pros on the Braun Series 7 - 790cc: Initially, an excellent shave. (Though, strangely, future screen & cutter block replacements never resulted in as close a shave as the original blade, but still a pretty good shave. You'll find many similar reviews on the cutter block replacements). If I wrote this review in the first several months after purchase, it would be a 5 star review.<br /><br />Cons: They don't make 'em like they used to. This one lasted less than 2 years before the silver started flaking off the &#34;shoulder&#34; area of the razor and, I suspect, into the cleaning module. Now, when a new cleaning cartridge is inserted, the sides of the cutter block are coated with a thick, black, not-very-clean oily substance that must be wiped off by hand before every shave. The oil slick is reduced somewhat after about 2-3 weeks. If offered to buy an extended warranty by Square Trade or similar, strongly consider it. My last two Braun top-of-the-line models had fairly short lives.<br /><br />Previous model Braun's lasted a bit longer for me than this one before they too broke down, usually the problem being with the cleaning system malfunctioning.

  1267. First shaver I used was the Gillette Mach 3, and then it was Schick Quatro, then I got a Braun PocketGo as a gift and couldn't go back to a razor.<br /><br />At one point I decided that I couldn't continue using a travel shaver forever and I was time for an upgrade so I researched which shaver to get. First decision was Braun or Panasonic. Because I was already using Braun and I trusted their manufacturing workmanship and I've known other people who use Braun I chose Braun.<br /><br />The 7 series is rather pricey - at almost $200 it was breaking my budget so I waited to save up for a couple years to make sure that this wasn't an on the whim purchase. Finally the price dropped to ~$150 with a coupon and gave me $40 Amazon credit so I made the the purchase!<br /><br />With all the excitement after receiving the package I felt they did a great job making it a luxury item with their packaging details. The box was created to make sure that no one could repackage it to return. The product is in a plastic clear box and inside is a black cardboard box with details of the razor. Inside is styrofoam protecting the razor and its dock as well as a travel case and a small brush. The travel case and dock as in a plastic bag and the razor is in shrink wrap plastic. The cleaning solution is on the bottom of the box.<br /><br />Using a proper razor for the first time I was blown away by the difference it felt from using a travel shaver to a luxury shaver. There is absolutely no pain in shaving now. Closest shave I've ever had and the pivoting from this razor makes every angle easy. The trimmer is also a plus for sideburns.<br /><br />Cleaning this beast is a snap because you can easily remove the foil and wash it with water or use the dry brush. You can also throw it in the dock and push the clean button and it auto cleans the razor with an alcohol solution. The clean is loud but who's going to stand in the bathroom all day? Also.. wouldn't you go to work while it's cleaning?<br /><br />The dock is easy to set up. Just plug in the adapter and it is on. Push the lever on the side and put in the cleaning solution when it lifts up and push the dock back down and it's ready to clean.<br /><br />The bottom LCD is pretty great with a meter to show the battery and hygiene. I don't know how it measures hygiene but it feeds this info back to the dock and lets you know if it needs cleaning.<br /><br />One thing to note is that this is the top of the line Braun shaver. There are bells and whistles that aren't necessary and shouldn't be considered as such. For the price you will get extras but if you don't want to spend that much and still have an amazing shave I would recommend just going with Braun Series 3 or 5.<br /><br />For example<br />LCD screen vs LED? No difference, it tells you the same info -- luxury feature<br />Plusating head? No need, if it was needed Series 3 and Series 5 would have it, doesn't make much of a difference - luxury feature<br />Drying after cleansing? Unless you really want to shave within 10 minutes after you clean your razor in the dock then do you really need drying?<br />3 personalized modes? I have never needed to use the other two modes, I tried them and no they don't make the experience any better. It claims that the other modes are for more sensitive areas like the neck. My skin is pretty sensitive and I don't feel the difference.<br />The dock itself? It gives an easy clean and its nice to look at and have but you can clean the razor yourself -- I would use rubbing alcohol and Q-tips before I got this and it is just as clean..<br /><br />All in all I love it because I've been waiting to buy this thing forever and I do love luxury./><br />The dock is easy to set up. Just plug in the adapter and it is on. Push the lever on the side and put in the cleaning solution when it lifts up and push the dock back down and it's ready to clean.<br /><br />The bottom LCD is pretty great with a meter to show the battery and hygiene. I don't know how it measures hygiene but it feeds this info back to the dock and lets you know if it needs cleaning.<br /><br />One thing to note is that this is the top of the line Braun shaver. There are bells and whistles that aren't necessary and shouldn't be considered as such. For the price you will get extras but if you don't want to spend that much and still have an amazing shave I would recommend just going with Braun Series 3 or 5.<br /><br />For example<br />LCD screen vs LED? No difference, it tells you the same info -- luxury feature<br />Plusating head? No need, if it was needed Series 3 and Series 5 would have it, doesn't make much of a difference - luxury feature<br />Drying after cleansing? Unless you really want to shave within 10 minutes after you clean your razor in the dock then do you really need drying?<br />3 personalized modes? I have never needed to use the other two modes, I tried them and no they don't make the experience any better. It claims that the other modes are for more sensitive areas like the neck. My skin is pretty sensitive and I don't feel the difference.<br />The dock itself? It gives an easy clean and its nice to look at and have but you can clean the razor yourself -- I would use rubbing alcohol and Q-tips before I got this and it is just as clean..<br /><br />All in all I love it because I've been waiting to buy this thing forever and I do love luxury.
  1268. My husband has the older version of this and was in much need of an upgrade. We can always trust Braun for an awesome product.
  1269. One of the best shavers I have used. Would definitely highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quality shaver.
  1270. For starters, I'm in the military so I'm pretty picky about my razors as I need a nice shave everyday. As my face is very sensitive and my facial hair is coarse, I usually try and stay away from traditional shaving with blades, as it causes too much irritation. I received this razor as an early Christmas present from my wife because she was tired of hearing me complain about my current electric not getting the job done as it use to. I haven't owned a recent Braun product, sticking mainly with Philips Norelco, as they got the job done for me well enough. I just used the Braun 790cc this morning for the first time after letting it charge over night and this is what I think:<br /><br />What I love:<br />The 3 power settings: Intensive, Normal, and Extra Sensitive. As stated above, irritation has been a problem for me after dry shaving, and this razor has seemed to have solved that problem. I turned the power setting down to Normal for my face and jaw line, then swapped over to Extra Sensitive for my neck line. Not only did this razor give me the best shave I've ever gotten from an electric (comparable to a blade), but I also had zero discomfort, irritation, or redness after the fact.<br /><br />The LCD display: Nice, clear, easy to read information on the battery charge and dirtiness of your razor. I think the placement of this display is perfect, right at the bottom of the razor so when it's sitting in the charging station/cleaner, you have an easy view.<br /><br />Long Hair Trimmer: Not sure how many people actually use these features on electrics, but I use it everyday to trim up my sideburns and around the ears. The trimmer on this razor works better than my previous razor by far, only requiring a quick aim and cut. Love it.<br /><br />The Cleaning station: I've only every had one razor before this one with a cleaning station, the Norelco Sensotouch 2D. While that one did what it was suppose to do, the Braun station has a few extras which I like. First being the information LEDS on the base which show you approximately how many more cleans you got left from your current solution, and the type of clean your razor requires. It's broken down into \\"programs\\", which the unit will automatically select for you. Another feature is the Quick Clean, which allows you to press the button and have a nice quick rinse. This also omits the drying cycle. The cleaning solution also makes the razor smell like lemons, which is awesome.<br /><br />The shape and feel: This razor is very ergonomic, very comfortable to hold and use. The one thing I just hated about my Sensotouch 2d was the shape. It was so awkward and bulky, made shaving a chore trying to keep a good grip on it. The Braun 790cc is just outstanding in this department. Haven't tried it wet as of yet, but I don't see why having slippery hands would make this razor less easy to hold.<br /><br />Overall: An easy decision of 5 stars on this product. I'm very happy my wife picked this up for me, because I probably would have gone out and eventually gotten another Philips, never knowing about this razor (not to say the 3d wouldn't perform). The overall comfort level, smoothness of the shave, ease to hold and use, and power settings make this razor my favorite to date.<br /><br />What I don't love: I'm sitting here racking my brain to find some sort of flaw in this product, and thus far, I can't. I know nothing is perfect, but for my needs and personal tastes, this razor exceeds in every category. If I were to get real out there, I'd complain about the noise level. This razor likes to buzz, nowhere near as quiet as my 2d. That comes with the territory though, and not a big deal for me.<br /><br />Keep in mind, I'm writing this review after the first shave I've done with it, but I don't foresee my opinion changing.eing the information LEDS on the base which show you approximately how many more cleans you got left from your current solution, and the type of clean your razor requires. It's broken down into \\"programs\\", which the unit will automatically select for you. Another feature is the Quick Clean, which allows you to press the button and have a nice quick rinse. This also omits the drying cycle. The cleaning solution also makes the razor smell like lemons, which is awesome.<br /><br />The shape and feel: This razor is very ergonomic, very comfortable to hold and use. The one thing I just hated about my Sensotouch 2d was the shape. It was so awkward and bulky, made shaving a chore trying to keep a good grip on it. The Braun 790cc is just outstanding in this department. Haven't tried it wet as of yet, but I don't see why having slippery hands would make this razor less easy to hold.<br /><br />Overall: An easy decision of 5 stars on this product. I'm very happy my wife picked this up for me, because I probably would have gone out and eventually gotten another Philips, never knowing about this razor (not to say the 3d wouldn't perform). The overall comfort level, smoothness of the shave, ease to hold and use, and power settings make this razor my favorite to date.<br /><br />What I don't love: I'm sitting here racking my brain to find some sort of flaw in this product, and thus far, I can't. I know nothing is perfect, but for my needs and personal tastes, this razor exceeds in every category. If I were to get real out there, I'd complain about the noise level. This razor likes to buzz, nowhere near as quiet as my 2d. That comes with the territory though, and not a big deal for me.<br /><br />Keep in mind, I'm writing this review after the first shave I've done with it, but I don't foresee my opinion changing.
  1271. i love it!!!Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver.!!ding ni ge fei ,xie gan duo zi,kao a !wo ri ...
  1272. Let me first declare an interest: I have been using electric shavers since the early sixties: mainly Braun (probably around eight to ten), Remington (about three) and Philips (don't start me....) My earliest Braun was a Sixtant - which I still have somewhere.<br /><br />Of all the models I have consistently found Brauns to be the best designed, have the best build quality and to give the easiest and best shave. Remingtons also provide a smooth shave but are big and clumsy to handle, and difficult to get under the nose for those last few annoying bits.<br /><br />Out of the box the 790 cc looks well made, solid and is easy in the hand. The clean and renew unit feels a little flimsy, but with careful handling will probably last the course. The flip-out sideburn trimmer is frankly hopeless: once tried and then best forgotten. But then I have a Waal trimmer for that function, anyway.<br /><br />I used the shaver for several weeks before committing my review to \\"print\\": every shaver seems to require the owner to use it for some time before performing to its best, even when one has shaved electrically for years. However, I have to say I find this one a little disappointing: for all its easy handling and - one has to say price - for me it isn't quite up to the standard of shave of many previous models. Or, indeed, my last $25 Remington.<br /><br />Yes, it does get under the nose. It does feel comfortable in the hand. Its motor sounds powerful, and doesn't tire after a few shaves. It just doesn't give me the really smooth finish that I was expecting from a unit which retails here in Australia for a RRP of AU$599 (which is why I got mine from Amazon...)<br /><br />Exactly what the three levels of shave button/indicator do - beyond changing the motor note and the pretty LED colour - escapes me; I see no discernible difference in the end result.<br /><br />My feeling is that too much design attention has gone into the clean and renew facility at the expense of the shave itself. The cartridge system works like magic: lights show how much fluid remains, how grubby the foil is and recommend a cleaning plan. All well and good, but it would be nice if the end result was a better shave, which isn't the case. It's not a bad shave - don't get me wrong on that - it's just that it's no better than earlier models and slightly worse than some.<br /><br />Rather like the manufacturers of printers, who nowadays give them away and make a fortune on the ink refills, Braun charge heavily for the cleaning cartridges and for the all-in-one foil/cutter heads. The cartridges can easily be refilled (Google is your friend) but the head design means that you are paying a small fortune for its regular replacement.<br /><br />So: will I keep this shaver? Yes, I will, but if and when it comes to replacement time I will carefully review what is then on the market.. The cartridge system works like magic: lights show how much fluid remains, how grubby the foil is and recommend a cleaning plan. All well and good, but it would be nice if the end result was a better shave, which isn't the case. It's not a bad shave - don't get me wrong on that - it's just that it's no better than earlier models and slightly worse than some.<br /><br />Rather like the manufacturers of printers, who nowadays give them away and make a fortune on the ink refills, Braun charge heavily for the cleaning cartridges and for the all-in-one foil/cutter heads. The cartridges can easily be refilled (Google is your friend) but the head design means that you are paying a small fortune for its regular replacement.<br /><br />So: will I keep this shaver? Yes, I will, but if and when it comes to replacement time I will carefully review what is then on the market.
  1273. I used to be a big fan of wet shaving, and then I joined the army and found myself having to shave every morning. Suddenly I started to get skin irritation, ingrown bumps, and my face started to get really bad. I decided to try an electric razor because I heard it would help a lot with the problems I was having plus I would save money on razor heads. Needless to say, my first experience was not a going great at all – the shaver grabbed and pulled the hair rather than giving me a clean and easy shaving experience. It never left my face feeling smooth and for some reason it always left hairs uncut. I went from shaver to shaver and just couldn’t find the right one for the job, until he recently I stumbled across the Braun Series 7 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System. I now am kicking myself that I hadn’t found it sooner – my reaction – BOY what an incredible finish it gives.<br /><br />The Braun Series 7 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System uses Pulsonic Technology to churn out a crazy amount of vibrations (I think it’s nearly 10,000 per minute!) to ensure more hair is caught in the working parts. On top of this, Braun’s trademarked ActiveLift system cleverly raises hair that’s flat against the skin for cutting – I think this is where my previous shavers were going wrong. This ActiveLift system works most effectively in those tedious areas such as the neck.<br /><br />There’s more – the Braun Series 7 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System has a further trademarked system, namely the OptiFoil, which essentially gives you that perfect finish. It works in conjunction with the Pulsonic Technology and the ActiveLift system to capture even more hair than normal and cutting hair so close to the skin. My first shave using this trio of magnificent features left me in awe – I couldn’t stop rubbing my hand over my face, to the point where I was late for work!

After the first shave with the Braun and his skin cleared up completely of the redness and scaling. He thinks the reason is because the razor actual removes the whiskers at incredible high speed.   1283. My old Braun, which I reallly enjoyed, finally gave out after many years of service (the trimmer broke). This shaver is even better. The head runs faster, and if I take the time, it gives a very, very close shave. The only downside, and minor at that, is the trimmer. On my old razor, it popped straight up above the shaving head where it was easy to see what I was trimming. On this shaver, the trimmer pops out to the front (on a hinge instead of sliding up) where it can be more difficult to see what I'm trimming, such as when trimming a mustache, because the razor body can hide the trimmer from view.

I debated whether to go for it or not but ultimately went for it and that was the right call. Not only you get to enjoy a clean shaver in your hand everyday but also the self-cleaning helps to extend the life of the shaver in long run. Like somebody else had said, just throw the dross out manually by lightly tapping before putting in the stand to clean it. That way the cleaning solution lasts longer. Go for this model, you won't regret it. I waited too long to change and the suffering with Norelco was not worth it.

  1362. Seems to be working well. Haven't heard any complaints from husband.
  1363. I have been shaving with Braun shavers for the past 20 years, and I've personally watched the incremental improvements with each successive generation of technology. The battery in my 9 year old series 5 recently decided to stop working. Internet research revealed that the battery is super-glued to the circuit board, making replacement impossible -- which really pisses me off. Nevertheless, I reluctantly bought another shaver, as there was absolutely nothing wrong with my old one. The cleaning feature works as before (and uses the same cartridges) with 2 differences: the cleaning process now ends with a heated drying cycle, and allows for a quick clean, bypassing the heated drying (the majority of the cleaning cycle). The shaver, however, is quite different from the previous designs. The body of the unit is a sculpted/circular shape, unlike the rectangular bodies before -- similar to the rotary shavers. It feels very comfortable in the hand, and is easy to grip due to the textured material on the sides of the body. It has a very substantial feel, and a good weight and balance to it. The pop-up trimmer doesn't extend up vertically, but rotates up from the front of the body. The foil and cutter block are now integrated into 1 unit called a cartridge, and can't be manually taken apart if you want to clean them by hand. How does it shave? It shaves twice as close as my old series 5 did when the foil and cutter were brand new. I would dare to say that it shaves almost as close as a blade. -- and this is the first electric shaver that I would say that about. The shaver reeks of quality -- both in design and construction. The noise and vibration are similar to my old series 5, which is fine with me. I was never bothered by either, although some other folks here feel different. If you need a new shaver, I would give this one a close look. I was lucky and got an instant $40 rebate, which made this a no-brainer. I will mention that I was also looking at wet/dry shavers by Braun and Panasonic. The reason that I didn't go with those (everyone unanimously agrees that the shave is better and closer when done wet with gel than dry) is due to the fact that those models can't be run off a cord if the battery dies, for safety reasons. When you're on the road, or if the battery goes, you'll be without a working shaver.<br /><br />** Update 7/22/2014 **<br />This shaver continues to impress after 1 month. Every shave has the same closeness. This machine really does shave as close as a blade -- no joke. The cleaning function works even better than before. I don't bother with a preliminary manual cleaning before running a cleaning cycle, as I always did with my old series 5. It kills me to spend so much money on a new shaver, but this thing really does shave like a champ.<br /><br />** update 11/08/2014 **<br />The best shave I ever had. Every time I use this machine I find myself murmuring \\"this is an amazing shave\\". Shaving time is now cut in half due to not needing to reshave previous areas as much. Blades and cutter seem to be holding a good edge with use. The cleaning fucntionality works really well. Nice.un and Panasonic. The reason that I didn't go with those (everyone unanimously agrees that the shave is better and closer when done wet with gel than dry) is due to the fact that those models can't be run off a cord if the battery dies, for safety reasons. When you're on the road, or if the battery goes, you'll be without a working shaver.<br /><br />** Update 7/22/2014 **<br />This shaver continues to impress after 1 month. Every shave has the same closeness. This machine really does shave as close as a blade -- no joke. The cleaning function works even better than before. I don't bother with a preliminary manual cleaning before running a cleaning cycle, as I always did with my old series 5. It kills me to spend so much money on a new shaver, but this thing really does shave like a champ.<br /><br />** update 11/08/2014 **<br />The best shave I ever had. Every time I use this machine I find myself murmuring \\"this is an amazing shave\\". Shaving time is now cut in half due to not needing to reshave previous areas as much. Blades and cutter seem to be holding a good edge with use. The cleaning fucntionality works really well. Nice.

  1378. I have had my Braun 790-CC now for about 6 months. It is the best shaver I have ever owned. I love the close shave that it gives, although no electric shaver can match a razor. That being said, It is probably the closest shave you will ever get from an electric shaver. It has a good feel to it. Smart shape. Well designed. It took me a little bit to get use to the flip-up side burn cutter but it works very well. My favorite thing about the shaver is the automatic self-cleaning. Shave, slide it into the cleaner, push the button, forget it. Done. Cleaned and ready for the next shave. Sometimes I run it under the fauset to wash out the head before putting it back into the self-cleaner... especially if I had a two or three-day beard. No matter, it shave the same and cleans the same. Love it. I'm on my second cleaning fluid refill. This after 6 months. I don't consider that too bad. I have a light beard and shave ever day except once in a great while. You may use more fluid if you have a heavy beard and it takes you a little longer to shave. I recommend also buying a 4 pack cleaning fluid refill kit. Not a bad price and will last... my guess is about a year. I was a little concerned about the cost of the refills but now that I have the shaver and have used it for a while, the convenience of the self-cleaning unit has completely out-weighed my concerns about the refill cost. But thats me. I figure... you do this every day for the rest of your life. Make it a pleasant experience... and it is. I'm so glad now that I shelled out the money for the best. I thank Braun and Irish engineering for making a great product.

It always comes out smelling fresh and it seems to remain sharp. Braun says to change the cutting blades every 18 months or so. In the 8 months I've been using it, I have noticed no loss of sharpness. The cleaning cartridges can also be bought on Amazon.com at a pretty steep discount--making daily cleaning affordable and simple. I'd recommend buying a 4-box at the same time you get the razor. I only wish I had tried this electric earlier. I don't ever see going back to blades.

  1437. After nearly 50 years of shaving I purchased a Braun Series 7. I have used cheaper electric shavers ($50 to $70 range) for many years and never really had any complaints.<br /><br />My latest $70 shaver stared falling apart recently after 5 years of loyal service, so as I was looking/reviewing the current models of electric shavers, the Braun Series 7 was consistently rated near the top. As a side note, I have tried rotary type electric shavers in the past and found they didn't work for me so I decided to stick with a foil type shaver (every person is different in that respect).<br /><br />I have been using the Braun for a couple of months now. Overall, I like the Braun shaving experience just fine. Does it shave as close as its cheaper competitors? For me, the answer is no. But It does a great job on a two to three day growth of beard, doesn't irritate my face during and after shaving and I have gotten used to/learned to like the cleaning and charging system. In fact without the cleaning system I believe the Braun Series 7 shaver would become pedestrian, at best, in a short time because of the rather complex shaving head assembly, which is impossible to clean thoroughly with only a brush etc.<br /><br />It's a lot of money to pay for an electric shaver and I'm not sure it is money well spent just yet. How long it lasts/holds up to daily use, how often I have to replace shaving head assemblies and replace cleaning kits will ultimately determine if it was a good purchase or not.
  1438. My old Braun Razor lasted about 15 years, and I hated to see it go, but this Series 7 is even better. I highly recommend it, for both quality and longevityl

  1454. I have an interesting story to tell.<br /><br />I have had a Remington, a Norelco, a Panasonic, and 2 Brauns -- this series 7 and a series 3. You can see my review of the earlier shavers here: http://www.amazon.com/review/R2LX6UQLJZ5JCP/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B0021AG0Z6<br /><br />After all that I saw the Braun series 3 390cc on sale cheap, so I got it. See my review here: http://www.amazon.com/review/RE663YC47H4M9/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B001VEK1E4<br /><br />Since I liked my series 3 so much, I decided to splurge and get the series 7 790cc.<br /><br />The thing is, after using the 790cc for 2 months, I'm going back to the 390cc. I think it gives me a better shave.<br /><br />The 790cc DOES have a pivoting head, and does have the vibration, but the fact is that the 390cc still gives me a better -- i.e., closer, more complete, less time -- shave.<br /><br />I'm surprised, but that's the way it is.<br /><br />So my advice is, save some money and buy the quieter 390cc.

  1456. second Series 7, other reviews are spot on. the cartridges can get expensive if you don't use it everyday. Because they are alcohol based they evaporate in about a month even with out use and you can only use about 70% of the cleaning solution before the shaver registers the cartridge as empty. if you leave it for more than a week its work opening it and putting the top on the cleaning cartridge to stop the evaporation.
  1457. This is a major improvement over having to shave with a razor every day. Some said it was the smoothest, quickest shave ever and some said that the holes in the foil are too big and that head doesn't really pull in the hair as is advertised. Well, the foil holes are too big and the current foil design does not allow for a very close shave, at least not on my face. i have an older 7000 series shaver and it shaves better than this very expensive one. Anyway, what do you do with a $200+ shaver even if it doesn't do the best job? You use it. I do hope that Braun reads these and changes their design, or at least sell the thing with 2 different foils so that depending on beard type and face a person could customize their shave. Nobody wants to make a $200 mistake and have to live with it.

  1516. Update:<br /><br />Decided to update my review of this product because of a few technical issues that have come up. First, after only 2 months of use, the button on the razor that you use to lock the pivoting head (in order to shave in small, tight areas; especially under the nose) just fell off. Really...it just fell off. Apparently the button just broke off; and what's worse is that I almost never used it.<br /><br />Another issue is the charging station. After just 2 months, the charging station refuses to charge the razor to full capacity. A design problem with the station and the contacts on the razor.<br />I noticed online that a number of other customers are having a similar issue with the charging/cleaning station dying after a brief period of use.<br /><br />Don't get me wrong. This is still the best electric shave that money can buy, no question. The quality of shave itself is unmatched for an electric. It is just a shame that certain technical aspects have made me take a star away from my review. I hope Braun will consider these issues with their next generation of razors.<br /><br />Original Review:<br /><br />This product is INSANELY good. I have been a Norelco rotary shaver for as long as I can remember. I had tried foil shavers (mostly the old Remington products) off and on over the years, but had a real issue with neck irritation. As much as I was OK with Norelco, I still felt that there HAD to be something on the market that would give Norelco a challenge. I found it. This Braun is the best electric shaver in the world. There is no comparison. The first time I used it, I knew that this razor was different. I have never been a blade shaver very much over the years, but this product actually DOES shave as close as a blade. As far as the neck irritation goes, with this product...NONE. There is some time for the skin to adjust to a new shaving method, but it doesn't take very long. I can't speak for the \\"cleaning station\\" that comes with this. I use it after every shave, but I can't say whether it cleans the razor or not. Still, \\"cleaning station\\" or not, this is the best electric razor on the planet...period.after every shave, but I can't say whether it cleans the razor or not. Still, \\"cleaning station\\" or not, this is the best electric razor on the planet...period.
  1517. I love the Braun electric shaver with one exception- It does not work great at my neck line. It doesn't irritate. It leaves some unwanted hair. I usually have to shave my neck once a week. This is the reason I take off one star.
  1518. I've had a couple Braun shavers before over the years, and this one like those is excellent. It's all good - shave closeness, variable comfort setting, charger and self cleaning stand, ergonomics - the weight, shape, materials - how it feels in you hand. Now for a word of caution for folks thinking of switching over for the first time. This has been my experience, and certainly may be different with others, if not most (I may be weird)! Anyway, as I said it's my experience that one never gets as close a shave with ANY electric as one would get traditionally with a quality razor and sharp blade. Even after a few months of using the electric when your face is supposed to have become used to it, there's a noticeable difference. I've had other electrics, notably Norelco rotaries, and the Braun by far gives the closest shave, but still traditional shaving is much closer, The convenience and time saving with the electric are big pluses too. YMMV
  1519. This one is best shaver I have used. Love it!!!
  1520. Great shaver with a very close shave, the only draw backs are that it's a bit louder than I thought it'd be, I've owned Braun shavers for years and this one is louder than most. The cleaning station is also surprisingly loud but seems to do a great job so its worth it. Those two things are all that kept it from getting 5 stars.
  1521. Love this shaver. I also have a high-end Norelco rotary and this one is better. The cleaning system is better than I expected. I recommend your remove the solution cartridge and snap the cover back on between cleanings so the solution will not evaporate. I clean mine once a week in the machine, but I rinse the cutter in water (and let dry, of course) 2-3 times a week to help my solution last longer. Put a drop of light machine oil (like WD40) on your finger and smear it on the foil once a week if you rinse it in water as often as I do.
  1522. I really love this electric shave I have tried several electric shavers over the years buy they didn't leave my face smooth gave me a five o clock shadow this braun really works great and leaves your face really smooth

  1524. This shaver is awesome! It has three power modes, I set mine to &#34;Furious&#34; and use it dry. The resulting shave is as smooth as the best Gillette blades but with no irritation at all. My old $80 Philips Norelco Aquatec was slower, didn't do as good of a job and always left my face stinging. The Braun 790cc has literally improved the quality of my life... I look better, feel better and my wife gives my smoother face more attention too. :-)<br /><br />If there's any drawback it's that cleaning it out manually isn't as easy as it could be so it tends to build up some stubble dust during use which can get messy when it sprinkles out. I tap it out in the sink as best I can while I'm shaving and the automatic cleaning station does an excellent job when I'm done.<br /><br /> I ordered mine with the standard packaging, Amazon seemed to indicate it was made in Korea but rest assured the shaver is still made in Germany. The build quality is quite good, it feels solid in the hand and mine's even survived a fall of a couple feet without injury.

  1535. Have had this buzzer for two years. I'll start by stating that I have a thick beard.<br /><br />First the Good:<br />When I use this razor on a daily basis its a 5 star razor no question, quick, easy, close shaves. Cleans nicely under water (just the head, not fully water proof) and with the base unit.<br /><br />I won't call it the bad- but limitations:<br />If I go for a few days or week without shaving, while still capable of shaving nicely, it takes quite a while to shave completely clean. Probably 2-3x the amount of time if shaving with a traditional razor blade. I also feel as if the shave doesn't get as close when long.<br /><br />If you have thin facial hair this buzzer is a must have. Although expensive at first you will not have need to purchase another set of blades or cream and save in the long run. Also the time saved is great. With a thin beard, or daily buzzing this razor is extremely quick and close.<br /><br />To remedy my thick beard issue I have a set of blades and cream in my bathroom. When I buzz on a day to day or even day to third day basis I give this buzzer 5 stars. On weeks when I'm lazy and don't bother shaving I'll use the razors. Which for me isn't often. I've had the same 4 blades in my bathroom for 2 years.<br /><br />Don't have unrealistic expectations, no buzzer is going to get as close as a blade so if you're looking for the CLOSEST possible shave stick with razors, but if you want quick, clean and very close shave I recommend this buzzer.

  1547. This does everything that I expected of it. The razor has three settings (L - M - H) which helps for heavy vs light growth areas. The motor is strong enough for me, though I don't have a super-heavy beard, and it does take 6 quick passes over the same area (though that is normal). I think the new cleaning unit is an improvement over the older ones I had.<br /><br />What is missing? The older Braun had the so-called system 1-2-3, where you could use the long-hair clipper in conjunction with the blades. That is now gone. The long hair clipper comes out at 90 degrees to the unit. Works fine, but can't use it with the regular shaving blades. I also do lament the fact that over the years Braun has gone from making its razors out of real metal (yes, I still have one that is now 24 years old and still works - a direct plug-in model). These new ones are slivery-plastic. I'm almost positive it isn't going to last 24 years. This one is even more plasticy than the one I got 6 years ago. A worrying trend, but still a find product.

  1559. I've owned the shaver a few days shy of a month. I will start by saying it is easily the best consistent shave I've ever had. I've owned Norelco triple head shavers my whole life and I don't plan to ever use one again after trying this Braun shaver. When I received the shaver the first thing I noticed was the inner packaging looked like it had gotten wet and then dried over time. When I opened some of the plastic in the box I was a little disturbed to find what looked like muddy droplets of water in the package that held the cleaning solution. The shaver battery was discharged and after charging said the shaver needed the heaviest cleaning available (all the bars on the readout where on). I still am not sure how a supposed brand new shaver needed cleaning? The readout for the cleaning and battery status is extremely hard to read and you have to put it under certain positions under light to be able to see the readout. I am not sure if this gauge is suppose to light up or not. I can't find any documentation that says if it should or shouldn't light up. However after charging I had a wonderful shave. It does take awhile for your skin/beard to get used to the shave, but well worth putting up with mild discomfort. What gets my goat just a little is that all the documentation says that this fluid that cleans your shaver also lubricates. This seems to be a marketing ploy in my opinion. There are two fluids in the cleaning solution which is simply alcohol and scent. Where is the lubrication in that? So I would highly suggest anyone using this shaver to see what lubricant is available that might do the job and manually apply it. I do love the self cleaning option, it does leave the shaver in pristine condition. This shaver unlike my old Norelco shaver basically leaves your beard clippings as fine powder. The cleaning system pumps the liquid through the system and pulls all the trimmings out of the razor. I usually clean it after each shave as I shave my beard and head. The Braun is a bit pricey but well worth it in my opinion. I would have given it five stars if they actually had lubrication &#34;such as oil&#34; in the cleaning solution.beard and head. The Braun is a bit pricey but well worth it in my opinion. I would have given it five stars if they actually had lubrication &#34;such as oil&#34; in the cleaning solution.

In the past I've had the tendency to get facial bumps (which I absolutely hate) from other razors/shavers but after only about a couple of weeks of use of the Braun series 7 in order to get my skin used to it, there are no more razor bumps!! My only complaint about the shaver is that it does take me a few passes in order to get all of the hairs, and the shaver is a bit louder than I had anticipated from reading mentions of the sound in previous reviews before I purchased it.   1597. I'm troubled with ingrown hairs and very sensitive skin. Shaving for me is always a risk. When I didn't have to shave too often I used a razor but soon I went electric. This thing has been the best shave I've ever had and only recently has it started to miss a few hairs which was due to the blades becoming dull after 20 months of shaving. I absolutely love this thing for the battery live, the great shave, the indicator lights on it when it needs cleaning and recharging, the ability to plug in the razor and shave via electrical outlet if the battery is dead, and the cleaning station it sits/charges in.   1604. Let me begin by saying I have never written a review or endorsement of any product on the web or elsewhere. In addition, this review is not based on my personal experience, but that of my 86 year old father.<br /><br />My father had been a blade shaver for many years, but several years ago developed macular degeneration and had a very difficult time with the traditional razor and shaving cream. At that point he adopted an electric razor, and was pretty adamant that the Norelco shavers were the best. However, it seemed like the Norelco shavers only gave a good close shave for a very short time, and they were hard for him to clean and keep in good working order. Also, his beard is fairly stiff, and most days he would have a five o'clock shadow by noon!<br /><br />Anyway, exactly one year ago I gave my father this Braun razor as a Christmas gift, and I thought I would wait to see how it faired over several months before passing judgement. The fact is he loves it! I thought it might take him some time to get used to it, but within a week or two he was praising the shave he was getting with it. He says it only takes him about two or three minutes to shave in the morning, whereas his old Norelco was a five minute ordeal at least. The shave seems very close, and his five o'clock shadow now shows up at the right time! He loves the pop-up trimmer, and figured out how to use the head locking switch so that he can shave comfortably under his nose as well. Finally, the self-cleaning function is just what the doctor ordered here. He cleans it every other day, and a refill lasts about six weeks at that cleaning rate.<br /><br />So, for Christmas this year I'm giving him the replacement head and some cleaning refills. While I think the refills are a little bit over-priced, it seems like a minor thing given the overall ownership experience.<br /><br />OK, it's a second hand endorsement, but coming from my Dad it's pretty high praise.
  1605. I am a long time Braun user (20+ years) and was excited to see a new model when my previous razor suffered a tragic death in the swimming pool. Unfortunately, this model is a step back from any previous Braun which I have used. Considering the high price and overall positive reviews, I had expected a shave at least as close as prior Brauns. Unfortunately this model does not provide a close shave. Even after 10 to 15 minutes of shave-time I still have pesky hairs that this model cannot seem to reach. While it is quiet and I like the cleaning system, the shave quality is poor when compared to prior Braun models. You certaily could get as good or better shave with less expensive razors. I have been using this razor continuously for 3 months and have seen no improvement in shave quality during that time.
  1606. I bought the 790cc in March 2010. From the beginning (I have a rather heavy beard that grows in different directions), getting anything resembling a close shave in less than 15 minutes was impossible. Still, I decided to stick with the mediocre shaves, the earth-shattering noise both of the shave and the cleaning process, because I was fed up with blood all over my shirt collars resulting from the inevitable daily cuts that accompanied my super-duper Gillette blades. By September, the foils (supposed to last 18 months) had so badly degraded that after 10 minutes, I still had a full beard. So I purchased a new foil and cutter cassette. Slightly better results for about a week. Then, the five o'clock shadow became worse...and worse, and finally, the morning shave entailed an excruciating ripping of the hair from my beard. By late November, I was finally determined that this was not going to work, and I went back to the drawing board. For whatever reason, the Panasonic was not on my radar screen in March. This time, I expanded the search and the ES-LA93-K wet/dry came up. I read a half-dozen reviews, several from former Braun 7-series owners, and went ahead and bought the Panasonic. It arrived December 3rd. I have had two shaves, one dry with Williams Lectric Shave, and one in the shower with pre-shave oil and shave gel. Both shaves exceeded in closeness, comfort and neatness anything I have ever experienced, ever, anytime--in a record setting 4 minutes dry and 5 minutes wet. It is more comfortable to hold, quieter, utterly pain free, and is everything I expected and much, much more. The cleaning system is easy to use, and much quieter. I had used Braun shavers in the past, with similar results. The 7-series received rave reviews, and I decided to give it a shot. I am done with German engineering for good, after getting rid of a disaster of a BMW for an Infiniti and now the Braun 7-series in favor of the Panasonic. While the Braun may work for you if your beard is lighter and has a predictable and consistent growth pattern, I would recommend the Panasonic simply because it works better under the most difficult conditions, and would likely give you lucky light bearded folks a two-minute shave, dry or wet. I had grown to dread shaving--the past two days have been terrific. It is six hours now since I shaved, and no hint of shadow. With the Braun, it would be there in less than three hours. By night, if I was going out, I needed to shave again. Those of you who are still trying for a perfect or even acceptable shave with the Braun: do yourselves a favor and try the Panasonic.our beard is lighter and has a predictable and consistent growth pattern, I would recommend the Panasonic simply because it works better under the most difficult conditions, and would likely give you lucky light bearded folks a two-minute shave, dry or wet. I had grown to dread shaving--the past two days have been terrific. It is six hours now since I shaved, and no hint of shadow. With the Braun, it would be there in less than three hours. By night, if I was going out, I needed to shave again. Those of you who are still trying for a perfect or even acceptable shave with the Braun: do yourselves a favor and try the Panasonic.
  1607. I was already a Norelco user and was not happy with electric shaver compared to the Gillete Razors. The Razor gives awesome shave and with no much time. I needed a good shaver which would give me closest shave without much hassle.<br /><br />I tried the following 4:-<br /><br />1. Braun 550 cc-4<br />2. Braun 760 cc-1<br />3. Brain 760 cc-4<br />4. BRaun 790 cc-4<br /><br />There is a diffrence between cc-1 and cc-4 which was very difficult to judge or search online. Though from shaving point of view not much of a difference but Optifoil is better than Smartfoil. CC-1 is older model with Smartfoils and no Optifoil.<br /><br />All the products were awesome, 760 cc-4 and 790 cc-4 are exactly same except the LCD indicator and the Hygiene LCD indicator which I think was necessary for the difference I got. The washing system in 790 has quick wash option.<br /><br />The cc-1 are still more expensive. I dont know the reason. Perhaps the bigger pack size is the reason and it come with a plastic case instead of pouch. Pouch is much more better.<br /><br />The washing system in 790 is awesome . Infact you dont require a major wash if you wash it under quickwash daily.<br /><br />The overall Braun 790 cc is the best shaver in terms of treat to skin and closest shave. In one week you will be a fan of this product. I have seen Panasonics Arc 4 reviews and was sold for it. But when I tried 5 Series I realised Braun has class. I will agree that panasonic will also be good, but I doubt panasonic's clening system. Is it just there to give competetion to Braun or really a great, simple system, I doubt. Again for $180 getting a german machine is an edge. I would suggest guys, just go out and get a 5/7 series from nearest store and Try it for 1 or 2 weeks and see the difference yourself....
  1608. I can't speak highly enough about Braun shavers - had my first one for 8 years (was still working, but the batteries weren't holding much of a charge), then upgraded to a 6550 which I have been using for the past 13 years (and still works just fine - I'll probably put it in my office for those days I forget to shave before heading out to work!) - thought it'd be nice to have a change to a new shaver, and this is even better than the last one! I love the automatic cleaning feature - I was a little nervous that the solution would be perfumed (as I am sensitive to that sort of thing) but you don't even smell it after the razor is clean! Shaving performance is great (don't know if the vibrations help, but it's like getting a face massage - pretty funny) - overall, an excellent purchase!

I am 69 years old and the morning shave with this razor is a real joy.<br /><br />Cudo's to Braun - it is a winner!

  1614. The Braun 7 gives a close, fast, and comfortable shave. Having switched to the 7 after using the 5 for a couple of years, I expected an improvement. It requires many fewer strokes across my face, shaves incredibly close, and is so sharp that I experience no burn or other discomfort. I have tender skin and even an eclectic can burn my neck. But not this one. It shaves so close that I can shave at night, saving time in the morning. By the next morning (36 hours later), I start to feel stubble. The shaver is that good.<br /><br />I've used electrics nearly all of my life and this one is in a class of its own. It gets all the hairs, including those lying flat and in difficult spots. Though a little noiser than the 5, the 7 is pretty quiet. I'm recommending it to my buddies who shave with razors.<br /><br />I don't use many of the bells and whistles. The cleaning unit is straightforward, and it tells you when you need to replace the fluid cartridge.<br /><br />I highly recommend this product. Don't worry about the price. It's well worth it.

  1636. Gave it about a 2 week trial period. I can grow a pretty thick beard, and typically shave about 4 times per week. I switched from a Philips Norelco SensoTouch 3D. I loved that shaver. Best electric I ever had, until I couldn't get replacement heads for it anymore. The new replacements they have aren't the same. Anyway, it was my first attempt using a Braun shaver, and a non-rotary electric. Made sure I read up on how to get the best shave possible from this new shaver. Followed the tips, but never got a close shave. Here's what I found:<br /><br />-Insufficient around the jaw line. One of the tips suggests to stretch your skin in different directions to better apply the shaver in that area. The tip helps some, but still not a very close shave. I never had to contort my face in so many different way to shave when I used the 3D...<br /><br />-Difficult to get all of the hairs of the upper lip, just under the nose.<br /><br />-Hard to tell while shaving exactly where the cut will stop. For example, shaving near the edge of your side burns - there's a little guess work to know how far up you are. Sure, you can bust out the precision pop up, but that's not a close shave at all. Maybe with more time, you'd be able to get a better sense of where the stopping point is.<br /><br />-Went over the same spot multiple times.<br /><br />-Worse on longer hairs. Shaving the next day wasn't so bad, but waiting 2 or 3 days, and then shaving again, caused the shaver to have more difficulty cutting the hairs. On a positive note, I'll say that I did not noticed any bad snags or pulling.<br /><br />-Last warning is that if you're ordering from Amazon, and need to return this shaver, you may not be able to. It's considered hazardous for some reason, and they will not accept it back.

  1642. Let me start by saying I couldn't be happier with my new shaver. I switched over from being a Gillette guy for years, mainly because of the torture my neck went through using a razor. My face often felt irritated and I would always get ingrown hairs in my neck. Throw in some nicks and cuts every once in a while and you get the complete picture. I used to shave in the shower after washing my face with many different pre-shave lotions and scrubs. I also tried a ton of aftershave lotions. Nothing worked 100% at alleviating the ingrown hairs and irritation. I read a magazine article that talked about how razors scrape off a couple layers of skin which makes your skin form scar tissue which can leave you more suceptible to ingrown hairs. It was something like that. So I did a bunch of research and found the Braun series shavers were highly rated. I went with the 7 because it had the hygiene cleaning feature. I've had it for 3 months and I love it. The shave is all around better than with a razor. It's as close as the razor without the irritation and ingrown hairs on the neck. I used to only shave in one direction (down) with one swipe which sometimes left some hairs. With the electric razor I go in any direction I want and go over the area a couple times if needed. They say not to do this but it doesn't irritate my skin so I see no harm in taking a couple passes. I just changed the cleaning reservoir and it was definitly cleaning off shave residue so I'm glad I got that feature. I've taken the shaver with my on a few trips the longest was 5 days. The battery had 4 or 5 bars out of 6 left on the charge so plenty of juice and the hygiene bars hit 1 on the last day which means it wants to be cleaned. I've also done the oh no I'm running late I'm going to shave in the car. I never was able to do that with my razor. Like I first said, I couldn't be happier with the shaver. Well worth the money.
  1643. overall I gove this a 4/5. pretty good shaver, comfortable on neck and does a good job on the face overall. I think the price could be lower though.
  1644. Ok, for anyone skeptical about this razor, I can't think of a better story than mine. Three years ago, I bought a Braun razor - I believe it was a series 8000 or something like that. It used the Clean & Renew system like this one. That was the best razor. Then this past July when traveling, I lost my razor. I suffer from an acute case of seborrheic dermatitis which makes me break out for nearly ANY or NO reason including if the air goes from hot to cold too fast. My case got really harsh in my mid-30's and I could no longer use a blade razor. I had tried Norelco and all the others to no avail and then I came across that foil razor. It was amazing. So, to have lost it, I was in deep trouble to say the least. I researched and researched and even looked around for the same model on other sites because there just couldn't be a better razor than that one. I found a couple but they were used and I can't stomach the idea of using a razor that someone else has used.<br /><br />So I went back to Braun's site and really dug into this razor. It's their top-of-the-line Braun and my head said get it but I've been fooled before. I was using a blade razor once a week until finally I had reached a point that my face was swollen 5 days each week and I looked like I had been in a fight. It had gotten embarrassing. I stopped shaving altogether for a little while. My beard is slow-growing but VERY coarse. Finally, I broke down and ordered this razor near the end of September - last Friday as a matter of fact. Today, when I got home from work, there was the razor. I was hopeful but trying to keep my expectations low. I took it out of the packaging and plugged it in and set it up for charging - setup took about 2 minutes - plug, plug, slide in cartridge, insert razor. I waited 3 hours for it to charge really not wanting to shave with it because I knew it wouldn't measure up to my other razor and my face would swell and I have a big day at work tomorrow with a lot of face time. But all the more reason to shave, right???<br /><br />So just now at 10:00, I took the razor out of the charger. First, it felt different - BETTER. It really is easier to grip than the last one and the 360 head of the last one didn't pivot quite as much as this one. This one has a push-button power button rather than the slide like the last one. I was really dreading this. Then, I pressed the button and put it to my face. Don't apply pressure to this razor! Just let it glide over your skin. If you have a coarse beard like I did or if your beard is a little long, make two or three passes but don't press it to your face with any pressure. If your beard is long, do the typical trim to get it prepared for a shave. Then, just glide it. MAN, I LOVED the feel of this razor. In about 10 seconds, I felt at home again with my razor of three years but this one WAS better. IT JUST WORKS. Within 5 minutes, I was clean-shaven and my face was far from broken out - my skin was smooth and actually relieved now that the hair was gone. ABSOLUTELY NO IRRITATION. With the long beard, I expected there to be some pulling as my other razor had done that in its last few months. Not the first hair pulled. Oh, and those few little hairs that lie flat on the throat that you never seem to be able to get, I glided the razor over them just to see the results. Smooth and hairless after two swipes.<br /><br />Better yet, I finished my shave and sat down to read the instructions. I know if any lady is reading this, she's saying \\"Typical man\\" at this point. With my old razor, the instructions called for replacing the shaving block every 6 months - those things were about $50. As I read this one, the instructions call for the block to be replaced every 18 months. So I'll have three times the use between block purchases now.<br /><br />If you're not familiar with the Clean and Renew system, just imagine going a week eating every day and dropping the dishes in a sink and coming home to find them all clean and put away and ready for your next meal. That's what Clean and Renew does for you. Just drop your razor in, give it a second to tell you what level of cleaning your razor requires and press the button. When you come back tomorrow, the razor will be ready for you to simply pull from the \\"holster\\" and start gliding. I'm so completely impressed with this razor that I WISH I could be a spokesman for Braun on it. I am too ashamed to show my face when I was broken out from the dermatitis but it wasn't attractive at all. This razor allows me to live a more normal life - something a lot of guys don't have to think about when they are choosing a razor. I can't tell you how my stress level has decreased in just a few hours after opening and using the new razor.<br /><br />Guys, if you think you have a tough beard, just try the razor. Ladies, if you have a picky husband who wants those that distribute the lotion, take it from someone who has tried that razor - the lotion dispenser gets clogged and dirty and the razor takes a lot of time to maintain. THIS is a real guy's razor. No maintenance except a little money for the Clean and Renew cartridges - my last razor used one every 4 - 6 weeks and I expect this one will do the same. The razor is always fresh and ready as long as you just press the button. THIS razor will make you WANT to shave - maybe even TWICE a day. Can I give it a higher recommendation? Can I say anything else to make you buy this razor? Well, my last Braun that I loved so much cost all of $300+ if memory serves. This one costs $206.99 at amazon.com. There is NO reason not to use this razor for your beard or not to spend a little extra money on your man to show him you care and make his grooming time a little less stressful. No cuts, no pulling, no hair and no cleaning. It just doesn't get any better than this. BUY THIS RAZOR!d coming home to find them all clean and put away and ready for your next meal. That's what Clean and Renew does for you. Just drop your razor in, give it a second to tell you what level of cleaning your razor requires and press the button. When you come back tomorrow, the razor will be ready for you to simply pull from the \\"holster\\" and start gliding. I'm so completely impressed with this razor that I WISH I could be a spokesman for Braun on it. I am too ashamed to show my face when I was broken out from the dermatitis but it wasn't attractive at all. This razor allows me to live a more normal life - something a lot of guys don't have to think about when they are choosing a razor. I can't tell you how my stress level has decreased in just a few hours after opening and using the new razor.<br /><br />Guys, if you think you have a tough beard, just try the razor. Ladies, if you have a picky husband who wants those that distribute the lotion, take it from someone who has tried that razor - the lotion dispenser gets clogged and dirty and the razor takes a lot of time to maintain. THIS is a real guy's razor. No maintenance except a little money for the Clean and Renew cartridges - my last razor used one every 4 - 6 weeks and I expect this one will do the same. The razor is always fresh and ready as long as you just press the button. THIS razor will make you WANT to shave - maybe even TWICE a day. Can I give it a higher recommendation? No cuts, no pulling, no hair and no cleaning. It just doesn't get any better than this. BUY THIS RAZOR!

  1652. OK.... So this is like my first review ever normally I just read them. But, I just got done shaving with this Hog 9 minutes ago and all I can say is WOW!!! This thing mows through hair like a pig! No Joke, and it does this so smooth and effortless like a Cadillac gliding across my face with no irritation what so ever and shave oh so close, face like a baby bottom. In all fairness I stopped using electric shavers a few years back after the irritation from several Phillips Norelco rotary models and one Remington foil shaver got to be too much. Models ranging from the $180 Phillips Artic 1050x(which was a useless piece of junk that left neck and chin whiskers) down to the $45 Phillips 7310xl so I have used a wide range in quality shavers. I cannot believe the closeness and quality of shave I got from the Braun 790cc the first time using it coming from a Gillette Fusion blade razor. What happened to the break in period of like 1-3 weeks? All I can say is this is what an electric shaver should be.... I will expect and except nothing less from shaver from now on. WAY TO GO BRAUN!<br /><br /> Sure this is a bit more than some would like to spend but, in this case you truly do get what you pay for. It feels like one sturdy rugid piece of hardware compared to the cheap feeling shavers of the past. I gave this piece a good working. To get a feel for the razor I pushed down hard when shaving as well as let the blade do the work itself and it didn't heat up or irritate my skin one bit, very efficient. I seriously love this rig so much I feel like River dancing and I don't even know how...lol! I opted for the 790cc-4 over the 760cc-4 just in case I needed the quick clean feature one day and at a $10 difference I figured what the hell. Although besides color, the 5 min. quick clean and a different battery meter they are identical. If your thinking about getting this or are in the market for a new electric razor DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND GET THIS RIG! I did a lot of research about the product and currently, Amazon has the best price on this. I will do and update in about 3-4 weeks after the so called break in period and hopefully have more on this. I actually can't wait to shave again.<br /><br /> -G. Martuccithe product and currently, Amazon has the best price on this. I will do and update in about 3-4 weeks after the so called break in period and hopefully have more on this. I actually can't wait to shave again.<br /><br /> -G. Martucci

It misses hairs consistently in a few areas on my neck, it takes 10-15 passes to get them all, yet it hasn't caused any irritation. The pop out trimmer works great, though it is hard to see what you are trying to trim. The cleaning system is more of a bragging point, I would save some money and buy a shaver without.

  1660. Paid almost $300 for it in Canada. Within 1 year the shaver would cut out in the middle of the shave. Turn it back on, cut out, over and over. Braun provided a replacement even though I didn't have a sales receipt. Within one year the replacement shaver would cut out in the middle of the shave (sound familiar?). More annoyance, obviously a defect in some component, probably the switch. This time they wanted me to ship it across the border to Wisconsin and upon receipt a second replacement would be sent out. That was in September 2011, it's now January 2012 and Braun claims it was never received. Like an idiot I went cheap and didn't get a guaranteed delivery method. My shipper is investigating but I'm probably stiffed. Do packages actually get lost these days or did the receiving facility mishandle it?<br />Who knows. I now purchased a Phillips at half the price and it seems to cut just as good.<br />Braun's customer service was good but I can't purchase Braun products again.

It's my opinion that this Braun shaves much closer than the first generation Series 7. Although my previous series 7 unit worked well, this one is better. You don't notice how much things degrade over time, so even if you think your 10 year old shaver is fine, the new one works MUCH better. I recommend it. I don't really care a lot about the LCD display on the shaver itself, but the added displays on the cleaning station are very nice - they'll tell you how much longer your cleaning solution should last, and how dirty it thinks the shaver is. There's also a &#34;fast clean&#34; button if you don't want to wait for it to go through it's whole drying cycle.
