  1771. I bought this razor after I had been at a Military school for about a month. My face was getting destroyed from shaving every day, so I decided to invest in this Braun. Now about a month after using this product, I am happy to report that this razor causes no irritation on my face and it shaves close enough to pass inspection. The razor feels very solid and well made, and the cleaning station is a nice touch, but the blue light on it can sometimes be annoying since it is right by my head when I try to sleep (I live in a room the size of a broom closet.. lol), but other than that, I don't regret buying this razor at all. If you have the money, this is definitely a great buy!
  1772. Great shaver but don't expect to use this as a Trimmer.... You will be disappointed to see how useless the trimmer is.... Over great piece of engineering especially the hygiene function is good to have.
  1773. Yep! I find this hard to believe myself, as a life long wet blade shaver!<br /><br />Originally my reason for switiching to electric was due to my work, I have to look presentable, that means clean shaven all the time. But sometimes I am time pressed so I have to shave in a hurry. Hot water towel, shaving soap ritual takes too long, and sometimes just not feasible, because hot water simply is not available.<br /><br />Also, in summer time, when it's already hot and muggy outside, I really don't feel like getting hot water treatment to my face and head. (Yes, I am a head shaver as well.)<br /><br />Also, when shaving in a hurry, I ended up getting nicks and razor burns as well. Not very presentable.<br /><br />But due to inertia, I proscnated for years before finally plunging on electric. Wow! What a difference. I never could believe electric razor, and dry one at that could give shave as good as (not almost as good, but as good) wet blade shave without the nicks and the burns a lot faster and with no muss!<br /><br />One trick of getting a dry electric shave as good as wet blade shave is shave against grain, and learn the 'topology' of your face and head and adjust the angle of 'attack' accordingly. Btw. it's the same method as wet blade shave.<br /><br />But there is no 'learning' cuts and burns as in wet blade shave, just feel your face and head with your fingers if there is some stubble after the 'attack', you'll feel it.<br /><br />Now one reason why I think some 'feel' that wet blade shave is a touch better than quality dry electric shave is that in wet blade shave, one doesn't just cut the hair only, one also scrapes the grime, dirt trapped between the pores, by opening the pores of the skin through hot water towel treatment.<br /><br />Big deal, if one wants that 'wet blade shave' feel, just scrape one's face and head with face scrub soaked in hot water! after dry electric shave. You get the same that 'wet blade shave' feel without the cuts and burns, and a lot less muss.<br /><br />Finally for some who complain about Braun's cleaning solution costing too much, I'd say, go soak your head, it's only a few dollars a month, plus you would be saving money in time wasted on cleaning and drying, shaving cream, pre-shave oil, and what have you.<br /><br />Besides one doesn't buy Mercedez S600 and complain about poor gas mileage and premium gas one has to buy!s, and a lot less muss.<br /><br />Finally for some who complain about Braun's cleaning solution costing too much, I'd say, go soak your head, it's only a few dollars a month, plus you would be saving money in time wasted on cleaning and drying, shaving cream, pre-shave oil, and what have you.<br /><br />Besides one doesn't buy Mercedez S600 and complain about poor gas mileage and premium gas one has to buy!

  1779. This is my first electric shaver, after shaving with regular Gillette manual razors for ~7 years. This machine has cut down my shave time considerably and the shave is *nearly* as close. I have problems with completely eliminating the hairs near my Adam's apple, sometimes I can get them closely shaven, other times they remain no matter how much i stretch the skin around that area. I don't like the trimmer built-in to the shaver, it frankly sucks, awkward placement and sucky cutting.<br /><br />As for the system/dock I really like the cleaning system. I have had this shaver for ~7 weeks and I am still on the original cleaning fluid cartridge, the dock shows it is at half-life, so I fully expect to squeeze 3 months cleaning life from each cartridge. I don't go to extremes like other reviewers to squeeze 6 months out of the cartridges; I simply only clean the shaver when the display on it is showing the machine is dirty (1 bar left). My only complaint is the noise the dock makes when cleaning the shaver, but I guess it's necessary.<br /><br />Overall, I'm satisfied with the purchase, definitely recommend it.

  1785. This is my first ever Amazon review. I felt compelled to write it because I am so thrilled with this razor.<br /><br />For the past six years, I have been using an electric razor daily to shave my face and head. I've had a succession of three Panasonic razors, the last one being the ES-LA93. I had opted for the Panasonic since they had the most powerful motors, and honestly they did give me a good shave, but the blades are very expensive, and for my usage needed to be replaced every 4-6 months.<br /><br />I had been dithering about trying the Braun for several years. I read countless reviews comparing the ES-LA93 to the 790cc. Most gave the Braun a slight edge, which led me to take the plunge. I am most please that I did.<br /><br />For me, the Braun provides a noticeably closer and somewhat more comfortable shave. The foils are much more responsive. I assume the closer shave is the result of the \\"Opti-foil\\", which seems to be thinner. The motor is not as powerful as the panasonic, however it does not \\"bog down\\" at all, and the razor runs much cooler against my skin resulting in a more comfortable irritation free shave. Also, the cleaning station does a much better job than the Panasonic. Finally, when the blades do need to be replaced, the cost is appx. $18-20 less than the Panasonic.<br /><br />For me, the 790cc is a home run. I actually look forward to shaving again!

Might be a little iffy in the military but for regular business it does just fine.<br /><br />It performs the best with day old hair and anything longer than 2 days will need a cleanup run with a razor (just with water).
  1788. I noticed a lot of the reviews on here are from people who have had a multiple very expensive electric razors, so i'd like to give the point of view of someone coming from a gillete mach 3 and a norelco rotary electric razor. I've used this product for 3 shaves so far and i have to say it really seems amazing. That's considering that it mentions that you won't get the best shaves until your face has adjusted if you're coming from a rotary or regular razor. The norelco i had was about $100. It did an okay job but the shave lasted only for maybe half a day and i was never really able to get a close shave, so i would alternate between the regular razor and the norelco to keep a clean shaven look. This series 7 really makes it look like shaved with a regular razor. The only difference is that the razor will last me until the next day and the Braun i'll start seeing hair late at night. It's much, much faster than the norelco. With the norelco it would take me forever to get a decent shave. Long enough to make me consider just shaving with the regular razor every time i used it. The braun is nice looking, fast, gives me close shave, and is pretty loud. The hair trimmer really is at an odd angle, but works great, not like the one on my norelco. I'll have to come back to comment on the cleaning system, but as far as the Series 7, it does an amazing job. I also got an awesome deal. This top of the line model cost me about as much as the low end ones cost. Win!
  1789. A number of years ago, I purchases a $70 foil style Remington electric shaver. I didn't stay with it long as it caused my face a lot of irritation and I never got a close shave. I even used some of the \\"before shave\\" liquid stuff and it helped but not enough. I went back to the \\"Fusion\\" blades and shaving cream and would go 4-5 days between as I am retired. I don't like to wait that long as my beard gets itchy especially in the heat. I bought this shaver and used the first time and knew this was going to work for me. I've used it 6-7 times and each time it gets better. My shaving time is getting shorter and the closeness is improving too. I plan to shave every other day with this before I shower. Braun suggests not washing your face before use as I assume the skin oils help lubricate.<br />The battery life is OK but I put it in the base after each use so it is fully charged. You would have to take the cord along with you on a week long trip. The base and cleaning system works well but as I read in a review, it is bit noisy while cleaning which lasts about 20 minutes or so. It is about as loud as using the shaver on your face. I'm not so concerned about the price of the cleaning cartridge nor the fact that the foil and blades should be replaced every 18 months. The Gillette Fusion blades I was using before are pretty pricey and now I don't look all grubby after 2-3 days. I have no doubt I will be using this shaver every two days from here on out.

This may seem odd to you (it certainly did to me) but there were some hairs I simply could not get this razor to cut at times. It wasn't a consistent problem but I couldn't figure out why it was happening. I'd try coming at them from every angle, multiple times, even circling the razor. No idea what the problem was since my manual got it.<br />Slightly speckled base (on the black). This may not bother most people but it did me slightly so I thought I'd mention it. The cleaning base has little metallic flecks through the black that look a bit like dust. Not a deal breaker but if you get a little OCD about this kind of thing, fair warning.<br />Slightly odd smell from cleaning product. I'm a bit sensitive to odors, and this certainly isn't terrible, but there is a light scent when you bring it up to your nose even if its been cleaned the day before.). This may not bother most people but it did me slightly so I thought I'd mention it. The cleaning base has little metallic flecks through the black that look a bit like dust.   1837. This shaver does everything is advertises and provided a great shave. I upgraded from the 6 series and couldn't be happier. If you are looking for an electric razor, this is it.
  1838. This is a fantastic product and delivers an outstanding shaving experience. Since the product has already been reviewed in great length I wanted to focus my review on one particular aspect that seems to stir up some controversy: wet vs dry shave.<br /><br />There are some that use this razor as a wet razor meaning they use it to shave with shaving foam, gel, or other like products. Others, rightfully so, point out that this model is not rated as a wet shaver and uphold that 1) the razor would not perform well \\"wet\\" since it's not designed to shave with foam and 2) that \\"wet\\" shaving might damage the unit.<br /><br />Fact is, there is only one model in the Series 7 lineup that is officially rated as a wet shaver, the 7-799cc. Unfortunately, that model is not available in the US and Canada. At least not at the time this review was written and since the 7-799cc has been out for a while now I doubt it will come to the US at all.<br /><br />Having said that, all the Series 7 models use the exact same shaver head (Braun only makes one for the 7 series) and the same pulsonic shaving mechanism. The ONLY difference between the 7-799cc and other Series 7 models is the amount of water insulation of the shaver itself.<br /><br />The body of the 7-799cc is completely water insulated and can be completely immersed in water. The unit can therefor safely be used in the shower. That is NOT the case for the other Series 7 models which should NOT be used in the shower since water can get into the power plug hole and damage the shaver.<br /><br />That aside, all models are completely water insulated around the shaver head. Braun advises to rinse the shaver head under running water with the shaver turned on (although unplugged for safety reasons) for manual cleaning. The user manual also states that it is ok to rinse the shaver with a mild soap solution. Obviously, alcohol based solutions (which have very low surface tension) aren't a problem either since that is what the cleaning station uses. Exposing the shaver head to shaving foam/gel etc would therefor not be any more of a problem than cleaning the shaver manually by rinsing it under running water, soap, or alcohol.<br /><br />That means all Series 7 models are fine to be used as a \\"wet\\" shaver as long as one does not expose the unit to more water than one would when manually cleaning it per manufacturer instructions. In other words do NOT use it in the shower and keep water off the body of the razor. As far as shaving performance goes, the 7-790cc would perform identical to the 7-799cc.<br /><br />Whether you should use it as a wet shaver comes down to personal preference. I personally find that I get a slightly closer shave when shaving wet and the razor glides much more smoothly over the skin. On the other hand the dry performance is still outstanding and since it's faster and more convenient I only use the wet shave when I need an extra smooth shave for special occasions.on uses. Exposing the shaver head to shaving foam/gel etc would therefor not be any more of a problem than cleaning the shaver manually by rinsing it under running water, soap, or alcohol.<br /><br />That means all Series 7 models are fine to be used as a \\"wet\\" shaver as long as one does not expose the unit to more water than one would when manually cleaning it per manufacturer instructions. In other words do NOT use it in the shower and keep water off the body of the razor. As far as shaving performance goes, the 7-790cc would perform identical to the 7-799cc.<br /><br />Whether you should use it as a wet shaver comes down to personal preference. I personally find that I get a slightly closer shave when shaving wet and the razor glides much more smoothly over the skin. On the other hand the dry performance is still outstanding and since it's faster and more convenient I only use the wet shave when I need an extra smooth shave for special occasions.

  1848. Replaced an old 7000 series that wouldn't hold a charge any longer. Great razor! Fast and powerful... picks up pesky flat whiskers easily.
  1849. I purchased this product in 2011 and am writing my review about a year later. This product works very well. I shave about three times a week and am unable to shave with regular razors due to a nickel allergy. Though this product did take a few weeks for my face to &#34;get used&#34; to it, it shaves close with very little irritation and cuts through multi-day stubble with ease. I use the cleaning feature about every three shaves (when the display indicates a cleaning is needed) and it does seem to keep it pretty clean. One year later, it's still cutting as good as it did on the first day (minus the break-in period). The battery life seems really, really good. I only plug the unit in to clean, and it keeps a full charge (at least based on the battery life indicator) the whole time.<br /><br />One hint to save on the cleaning packs is to remove the cleaning pack (and re-plug the cleaning pack) when not in use and only keep it in the unit when cleaning. Because of this, I have been able to only use 2 cleaning packs in the past year (partially because I only shave every few days as well, and probably because I try to empty the razor after each shave).

I never had that problem with any product here but it cannot be returned because I gave the machine a third week, which did not make any difference at all.   1879. So excited for my series 7 to arrive to my home after getting a great deal on amazon but I was gifted with a chipped foil head right out of the box... Really doubting Braun's quality control now but will try another before making final conclusions. I thought amazon would not accept returns as it says online but I called to make sure anyway since Braun was closed for the day. I was surprised by the response which was that they would simply send me a new one. When the item is nonreturnable they simply send you a brand new one and you keep the old one to throw away. Really surprised by the no hassel response from amazon. Really great customer service, the guy was really apologetic and handled this in 5 minutes. This definitely encourages me to keep shopping from amazon confidently knowing they stand behind their customers. As for Braun I still can't increase rating as this was really disappointing that their most high end end device slipped through their quality control with a chipped foil head.

  1888. This razor arrived DOA (despite trying to charge it for several days, to give it a chance at redemption). I called the customer support line, to ensure there wasn't some trick I was missing. The service representative (who was clearly on a different continent) spent about 3 minutes on the phone with me, basically instantly proclaiming this was not correct behavior for the razor and to return it or have it serviced (right, because I want to fix a defective razor right from the start).<br /><br />I typically wouldn't leave a negative review for a faulty product. After all, there's always a bad apple in the bunch, and this does not reflect how the razor works when it DOES work. But hopefully others can learn my lesson and NOT buy the razor here. As it turns out, you can't return products that contain \\"flammable materials\\" to Amazon, which I assume refers to the cleaning solution (though I did empty it, it doesn't matter, there's no area to contact Amazon regarding this problem). So the ONLY alternative I have, opposed to simply returning the razor and swapping it for a new - and hopefully working - one, is to return the razor to Braun. Which means I have to PAY for the return shipping and wait 10 weeks for my money back on an item that NEVER WORKED. This is beyond frustrating. And really makes me far more hesitant about a lot of purchases on Amazon. Either way, I certainly won't be buying another razor here.<br /><br />And another note to justify my 1 star review - the returns process for the razor is deliberately antiquated. You need to have all the original packaging. The manual does NOT include the shipping address for returns. It seems solely out of hope you won't be bothered to hunt it down, you must call and have the address dictated to you. And let me mention again the scripted service representative whose response to a DOA product was essentially \\"ah well, you can return it or do whatever you want with it.\\" All for a product that NEVER worked. I can only advise others against buying a product from a company with such deliberately terrible customer support.can only advise others against buying a product from a company with such deliberately terrible customer support.
  1889. Having been a Rotary Shaver Guy for the past 20 years, this was quite a change for me. The shaver has a solid feel in your hands. The blade orientation with the sliding head permits shaving those tough to get at areas. They suggest that it takes a few days to \\"re-train\\" your beard and they are right. Initially my shaves were not as good as my Rotary Shaver, but after a few days, I found it to be very close. There is no irritation when shaving or afterwards. The cleaning system is nice (so far). I like having a clean smelling shaver. I don't clean it every day, though they recommend that you do.<br /><br />The only downsides to the shaver are: It has a very loud buzz while shaving, but this is to be expected since that vibration is used to cause the hairs to be easier to cut. The second thing is the cleaning mode is also very noisy.<br /><br />I am very happy with this shaver.

  1894. I'm into my 3rd week of using the shaver. Here's some things which probably influence this review: (1) I have been an electric shaver user for over 20 years, so I'm not comparing to straight-edge shaving (2) I'm not a rotary/Norelco user (tried it several times through the years, but never liked it) (3) I have used other brands for extended periods, such as Wahl and Remington, but have mostly used Braun products, some purchased new, some hand-me-downs or inherited from Dad. Nevertheless, I had great reservations about shelling out this much money for a shaver. My previous model was a 2-year old Braun series 3 product, and I was not a happy camper because it seemed to get dull quite fast and I was buying a new head 2 or 3 times a year. So here's my verdict on this Series 7-790cc model: It's worth it! If it ever gets lost or stolen, I'll buy it again in a heart-beat. I can echo all the other favorable reviews: It's quick.... it takes me very little time to shave in the morning. I use overlapping straight strokes, with a little back & forth on those hard-to-get areas like under the chin. The clean-up process is easy. With my prior razors, I have always popped off the head after each shave and brushed out the debris, and then usually sprayed a lubricant on the screen so that it was ready to go the next morning. None of that is necessary with this razor, and the cleaner does a great job of flushing it out. My only complaint, and the reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5, is that the cleaning machine is loud! And I did not see any warning about it in the literature or the prior reviews. The cleaning cycle causes the razor to activate, so it's not really any louder than regular shaving, but it cycles on/off several times, and it can transmit the vibration through the surface it sits on. So if I leave it in the bathroom for a cleaning cycle, it wakes up the spouse. If I put it in another room, it still generates enough noise to disturb the quiet morning. Maybe my 5am routine is just too early for the household, but it would be great if the cleaning unit had a timer to start it at a pre-set time, such as 10am when all the house occupants are out the door. I have to keep the cleaner/charger on the workbench in my garage, and even though it's awfully inconvient to retrieve the razor each morning, I still wouldn't buy any other razor. I'd hook up my own timer, but you have to press the button on the front to start the cleaning process.Maybe my 5am routine is just too early for the household, but it would be great if the cleaning unit had a timer to start it at a pre-set time, such as 10am when all the house occupants are out the door. I have to keep the cleaner/charger on the workbench in my garage, and even though it's awfully inconvient to retrieve the razor each morning, I still wouldn't buy any other razor. I'd hook up my own timer, but you have to press the button on the front to start the cleaning process.

  1897. I had to replace my Norelco razor due to the discontinuing of the shaving cream refills. I thought that system was nice as it seemed to give me a clean, smooth shave. It's nice to have clean, sanitized razor every day, but it takes up alot of counter space. It's a minor gripe, but if you don't have a small sink than you might have to store it somewhere else.   1898. I did my research and read the reviews for a multitude of electric shavers. I went with the Braun which got the best reviews and was the top choice in Consumer Reports. I got a great price through Amazon (approximately $80-$90 less than in the stores) with free shipping. I got the shaver two days after I placed my order.<br />The last time I used an electric shaver was in college over 30 years ago so I was worried that with my first few shaves I would have irritated skin as I did when I first used an electric shaver way back when. My concerns were unfounded as my skin never got irritated and the shave was just as good as a razor. In addition this Braun model has a cleaning feature. When put in the charger the shaver is automatically cleaned and lubricated. This feature should help the blades and shaver last longer. I would recommend this shaver to anyone who wants a great shave.
  1899. I have been using the same Bruan top of the line 7 series shaver for the past 8 years. I was pretty impressed when I received it as a Christmas gift. I have replaced the block & foil on my older Braun 2 times since I have had it. After the first replacement (which was about 5yrs in) I noticed that the shave quality was not quite what it was from the years earlier. So recently (in the last month) I had been pondering the decision to either replace the block & foil again (a third time) on my old but still running perfectly Braun, or to cough up the cash for a Brand Spankin new one. For anyone who does not know this Brauns are made in Germany. Not only are they made in Germany, but their model naming convention is based on the BMW. Yes the BMW car, hence the Braun 3, 5, and 7 series models. I have been a long time enthusiast of BMW cars. What impresses me most about the BMW is the build quality. Similarly, the Braun seems to reflect the same quality. So to get to the point, I opted to buy the new Braun 790cc. After about 4 hours of charging, I had to take this thing for a spin. For starters I was not impressed at the initial results. I had been using my old Braun for so long that I had forgotten what a good shave looked and felt like. Never the less my first shave with Braun 790cc was not a whole lot better than my existing 8 year old Braun. Then, I put the thing back into the charger, and ran the cleaning cycle. The next morning I used it again. This time I was blown away. The thing gave me the closest most comfortable shave I have ever experienced, outside of a regular razor. Regular razors are not an option for me due to having a very wirey (black man's) beard that will curl right back into an adjacent pore when cut with a razor. The result being a series of very nasty & painful shaving bumps. My new Braun performed outstandingly well. It shaved my face (including the sensitive neck area) extremely close and with 0 irritations (something my old Braun did not do). Ultimately I have no regrets for buying the Braun 790cc, especially since I got it for $206.00 with shipping included. I could go on and on about this item, but I will simply end it hear by saying \\"A Solid Buy\\".ltimately I have no regrets for buying the Braun 790cc, especially since I got it for $206.00 with shipping included. I could go on and on about this item, but I will simply end it hear by saying \\"A Solid Buy\\".
  1900. I ordered Panasonic LA 63 two weeks back. Tried it for couple of weeks and found it not working very well for me esp with neck and chin. Got even couple of minor cuts with the first shave. I went ahead and ordered Braun 790cc and the first shave out of the box was fantastic. Got a fairly decent shave for neck and chin too, thou it took over 5 minutes going back and forth in all directions. Overall this is a good shaver compared to LA 63 for the following reasons :<br />neck / chin shave : LA 63 left a lot of hair untouched even after multiple tries. 790cc did a much better job, almost as good as razor, after multiple tries. Dont expect it to remove everything with one swipe.<br />cleaning : LA 63 is washable but without a stand or storage, it is a pain. LA 93 should help here but dont get fooled by ordering LA 63 and hope to store it some place else after cleaning. LA 93 is still cheaper than 790cc at amazon.<br /><br />Bottom line is, 790cc gave much better shave with less irritation compared to LA 63. You definitely need a stand / storage / cleaning station to keep this thing after shaving. If you are going to order Panasonic, LA 93 will give the stand / cleaning system like 790cc for an additional $30.
  1901. I've been struggling with electric razors most my life. I've had a number of them ranging from the most expensive norelco's to cheap ones only to not find a close shave. I had recently read an article \\"2011 Grooming Awards\\" in Maxim 05/11 issue 161, which covered the reviews of the products. The Braun Series 7 shaver was listed at No. 1 for electric razors. This prodded me to give it a shot.<br /><br />First I looked through several local retailers here in Houston, only to find the price was quite high. Next stop was online, and behold the Amazon beast has the best prices.<br /><br />Purchased the product, was delivered before Xmas, (wife claimed it was a gift, bah humbug.)!<br /><br />Opened the box, shaver was BRAND NEW, NEVER OPENED. this having been one of my first times to purchase something like this over the internet, i wasn't certain as to what i would be receiving. I was very happy to see this was just as i had bought it from the store. Once i drug everything out of the box, snagged the manual, quick read plug this, snap that, and viola we're charging.<br /><br />Charge took a little over 4hrs (plugged in and came back after 4hrs so not completely sure). Figured i'd try it out w/o trimming first, and WOW... Lets just say that, this razor can take a good amount of stubble down to bare skin very quickly.<br /><br />The purchase of the Braun Series 7 razor has by far been my most valued amazon purchase thus far. A must have for all those men looking for the closest shave w/o having to use a straight razor.

  1906. This shaver was a birthday present (August 2013) for my boyfriend. At 51 years old he had never used an electric shaver and was very hesitant. It has been THE BEST experience ever for him. Fast, easy and smoother than he has ever been able to achieve with razorblades. The cleaning attachment is a very big plus. I would recommend this to any man with strong facial hairgrowth.

  1908. This was a replacement for my 10+ year old Braun electric shaver which was fairly well worn out but still working OK. This model takes off a 2 day growth with no pulls on the beard. Oddly there was no shaver head cover supplied.
  1909. My only experience with an electric shaver before this one was a cheap Remington shaver I bought over 10 years ago. I didn't use it very much because it caused more irritation to my skin than even a regular blade. For the last several years I've pretty much only used a beard trimmer to shave with occasional use of a Gillette Mach 3 for special occasions. Even with a higher quality blade like the Mach 3, my skin still gets irritated and shaving more than two days in a row with it really causes problems. The beard trimmer was easy on the skin, but I always looked like I haven't shaved for a couple of days.<br /><br />A couple of weeks ago I finally decided to try an electric shaver again. I knew if I was going to use it regularly it needed to work well and I was willing to spend the extra money to get a good one. After much reading I settled on the Braun 790cc.<br /><br />Since the instructions say give it a couple of weeks for your skin to get used to it, I have made a point of shaving every day. From the beginning, I have had absolutely no irritation after the shave. It's so nice to get a shave that's practically just as close as a razor but without the razor burn. I definitely wish I had tried it sooner. I think the adage of, you get what you pay for, is true for electric razors and I think that was likely the problem with my old Remington.<br /><br />Now, for some specific points about this razor:<br /><br />- Overall Feel - Feels great in the hand. Looks and feels very solid and well made.<br /><br />- Cleaning system - I always hated cleaning my old razor, which means it was never done regularly. The Braun cleaning system works really well and guarantees it will get cleaned regularly since I only have to push a button. It's also nice that it gets sanitized with an alcohol based solution during the process. I've settled on an every other day cleaning schedule. The full cleaning cycle takes about 30min which includes a heated drying cycle. Take note that if you tilt or tip the base with the cleaning cartridge installed it will spill.<br /><br />- Closeness - For me, there is no visual difference between using shaver and a razor. You might could tell a difference by feel, but it still feels pretty smooth to me. The area below the jaw right at the neck requires a few additional passes in different directions to get all the hairs, but this seems to be a common problem area with all electric shavers.<br /><br />Difference between 790 vs. 760:<br /><br />I debated between these two models and ended up choosing the 790. I wasn't sure if I would use the extra features, but it wasn't much more at the time than the 760. Now that I've used it for a while, I can say that I don't think spending the extra money for the 790 is necessary.<br /><br />The 790 adds a quick clean feature, which is supposed to clean the shaver in about 30 seconds if you're in a hurry. I tried it once but don't see myself ever using it. First, it leaves the shaver wet which causes problems shaving unless you take some time to dry it off. Second, the shaver certainly doesn't have to be cleaned before every shave. I've been cleaning it every other shave, but I don't think it would have any problem going longer than that. If I was in a hurry, I wouldn't worry about the cleaning. When I do clean it, I start the cleaning cycle right after I shave so the length of time it takes doesn't matter.<br /><br />The only other additional feature you get with the 790 is a &#34;hygiene&#34; meter. This supposedly tells you how dirty the shaver is. This seems very much like a gimmick designed to make sure you use the cleaning system frequently, ensuring you buy more cleaning cartridges. The hygiene meter goes down by about 1/3 for each shave and seems to have no bearing on how dirty the shaver actually is. The only way to make the hygiene meter go back up is to use the cleaning system. Manually cleaning the shaver does not bring it back up no matterhow good a job you do.<br /><br />Overall I've been very pleased with the 790 and wouldn't hesitate to buy another Braun series 7 shaver. However, if you're debating between the 790 and 760, my advice is to go with the 760 unless the price difference is very small.how good a job you do.<br /><br />Overall I've been very pleased with the 790 and wouldn't hesitate to buy another Braun series 7 shaver. However, if you're debating between the 790 and 760, my advice is to go with the 760 unless the price difference is very small.

  1929. I purchased this shaver last April after Consumer Reports(and other sources)gave it glowing reviews. It was praised for its close, consistently comfortable shave and ergonomics, as well as the self-cleaning feature. I never had any luck with rotary shavers as they always left my skin feeling dry, taut, and gave me a rash-like burn that I found very uncomfortable. So I switched to foil...<br /><br />The shaver itself worked amazingly well in the beginning. With the first use, I was amazed at the smoothness of the shave and how comfortable it felt against my skin. The trimmer worked OK for my needs and, as always, the self-cleaning feature worked perfect as well. Fast forward 9 months later. I don't know if it's simply my skin type, the \\"grain\\" of my beard or what, but the shaver seemed to lose its \\"oomph\\" as time went by. Shaves that were close and comfortable before now seem less smooth and accurate. The unit also goes through cleaning solution much more faster than my old Series 5(which simply wore out after 6 years). The solution always seems to be in short supply in my area so I end up buying two packs of three refills when I can find them available locally. The instructions say the cutting foil/head is supposed to be good for 18 months(that's about a year and a half), but I beg to differ. It just seems all around DULL to me now. I am contemplating on purchasing a new head just to see if that indeed makes any difference in performance.<br /><br />As far as the \\"electric vs. blade\\" argument goes, we all know this has been fiercely debated for decades. Either you're on one side of the fence or the other. Electrics are more convenient, but I don't care what anyone says, you just CANNOT beat the close and accurate shave that the old traditional wet blade razors offer you. I personally liked the Gillette Mach 3 Turbo, but got tired of purchasing the expensive cartridges before I decided to make the switch to electric shavers. Bottom line folks, it all comes down to personal preference and opinion.<br /><br />I only give the shaver three stars because I feel that, despite the price, something just doesn't seem \\"right\\" with this one. As stated previously, my old Series 5 seemed better in many regards, and cost nearly $100 less than this model. Either Braun has changed something along the way, or my beard just doesn't like this particular model. Whatever the reason, I'm stuck with it, will tolerate it for now, but will give serious consideration to purchasing another Braun in the future. Good luck to all the other user's out there.comes down to personal preference and opinion.<br /><br />I only give the shaver three stars because I feel that, despite the price, something just doesn't seem \\"right\\" with this one. As stated previously, my old Series 5 seemed better in many regards, and cost nearly $100 less than this model. Either Braun has changed something along the way, or my beard just doesn't like this particular model. Whatever the reason, I'm stuck with it, will tolerate it for now, but will give serious consideration to purchasing another Braun in the future. Good luck to all the other user's out there.

  1934. First, let me state that I've had this shaver for 2yrs and this is my conclusion on it for me.<br /><br />Shaving:<br />This is really dependent on the person using. For reference when I use a safety razor I have to shave twice; once going with the hair and once going against it. This is the only way I can get a completely smooth shave without using a straight razor. Now knowing this, the foil razor style does not work for me. There are hairs that no matter how many times I go over it or which direction I go the razor just won't cut.<br /><br />Hidden Costs:<br />The cleaning solution will cost you roughly $15 for three cartridges. So you have three months of cleaning solution; please be aware of this. The blades are suppose to last for 18months but after nine months you will start to notice you have to go over the same are more often. At one year it's even worse and if you skip a day shaving the next shave will be horrid as it will completely miss areas and will most likely take you longer than if you just used a safety razor.<br /><br />Cleaning:<br />The cleaning cycle is incredibly loud and pretty much has to be run after every use (so everyday). Also realize that there will be a lot of hair left in the stand and it needs to be washed out every few months or it could plug up the drain.<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />After using this razor and a Norelco rotary (several years ago) I've come to realize that foil razors just don't work for me. I know it's weird but if you know someone who has a foil razor I highly recommend you ask to try it a couple times first. While the foil razor has issues getting all the hair I never had that trouble with the rotary one. So each individual will get different results with this razor.
  1935. It took him a day or two to get used to, but he loves using it now! I definitely recommend to buy as a gift.
  1936. The shaver is quite great, I like the design, however it will be better if I can turn off the vibra mode....
  1937. This shaver, while not as good as a blade, is the best I have ever had from an electric razor. I use the cleaning device once a week and just manually clean it on other uses to save time and money. I have owned it almost a year and it still shaves as close as ever. A fabulous shaver.
  1938. I've been looking for a decent shaver for a while to try something new and came across this model. As I'm not going to go over all the features, I will say you do get your money's worth in terms of quality and easy of use. I will say that having the base for charging and cleaning does take some up real estate on the counter. Also the cleaning cycle is very effective, but not the quietest process depending on where the base is located. The only thing I hope isn't an issue is the cleaning cycle versus the charging cycle. I use the shaver four or five times, clean it manually after every use of course, and do the sonic cleaning when the indicator gets in the red. However the battery really doesn't get used up that much and always gets charged while the cleaning cycle is doing its thing. Why is this an issue? Well in the history of batteries its a known fact that with any recharge battery its good to discharge the battery all the way before recharging it in order to extend the life of the battery overall. Something that cannot be done with the way its designed.<br /><br />One other thing to note is that this model is not for the person who travels. Since the cleaning and charging must take place in the base that needs to be around in order to do its job. Not something to be through in a suitcase especially with the cleaning tank at the bottom. Otherwise an excellent shaver for the money.
  1939. I have always had electric razors for less then $80 bucks. I couldn't believe someone would pay more than $100 for one. I saw this one on sale and figured I would give it a try and return it if I didn't like it. I really like though and will not be sending it back. I have to shave everyday for work except for the weekends. I don't grow a think beard, but after not shaving over the weekend my old razor used to make my neck red and itchy. This Braun has never done that. I can go over my face several time to make sure I get everything and it has never made me itch or caused a red rash. It is not as loud as my old razor either. I would have to close my bathroom door so I didn't wake my wife and kids up. I alsi love how I can just stick it back in the docking system and clean it. I don't plan on buying replacement cleaner cartridges. I plan on cleaning out the old cartridge and filling it back up with rubbing alcohol and a little electric pre shaver. I have not had to do that yet because the one it came with is still good, but I have read a few threads online and others have done it so I am going to give it a try. Right now I also take the cleaner cartridge out after every cleaning and replace the caps so it doesn't evaporate when not being used. I think that helps. There are also little things that I like about it. I like how the end of the plug it is bent at a 90 degree angle and plugs into the side of the dock so I can push the dock up against the wall without the cord getting in the way. That helps a lot when you don't have a lot of shelf space in your bathroom. Overall I wish I would have bought this a long time ago.

  1945. I have gone through a mini Odyssey of electric shavers, after switching from a DE because I was tired of the time & technique requirements. I started with the SensoTouch 3D, which was fairly close but caused some irritation and took a long time to shave with. I replaced that with the Panasonic Arc-4 (8243A), which seemed better during the week that I tried both. So, final observations:<br /><br />Closeness: The Panasonic was capable of getting the closest on my cheeks. However, the overall shave was uneven, and it had major trouble on my neck. The Braun had the maximum average closeness.<br /><br />Evenness: By far, the Braun produced the most even shave. There were no missed hairs, and the variation in closeness between face and neck was the smallest of the three (but still noticeable to the touch). That made the shave look much closer as well.<br /><br />Time & Comfort: The Braun took the least amount of time, and produced the least amount of irritation. It actually feels really good!<br /><br />Overall: I wound up doubling my original budget, but I think the 790cc is the shaver for me.

  1952. This is my first electric shaver. I charged the unit and gave it a try and was immediately impressed with the quality and closeness of the shave. The shaver is very solid and well built. Before I shaved I placed the shaver in the cleaning unit and it replied with a light indicating the unit was clean. After my first shave, I replaced it in the charging/cleaning station and it indicated the 1st level of cleaning would be appropriate. I pushed the button and could hear the shaver vibrating on and off as it thoroughly cleaned the razor. The next morning it was like new and ready to go. It is a little noisy as it cleans the unit but it is well worth the noise. Most days I'm heading out the door to work and don't care that it's taking about 30 minutes to go through the cleaning and drying cycle. The noise is only in the beginning of the clean process.<br /><br />The cleaning cartridges last approximately a month and the shaver head needs to be changed in 18 months. There is an indicator on the base telling you when to change the cleaning solution and one on the shaver to let you know when to change the head.<br /><br />The electric plug is a little large and sticks out from the wall socket more than I would expect.<br />Overall, I'm very happy with this shaver and would highly recommend it to anyone thinking of making the switch!

  1959. I've used Norelco for a while and even the Wahl Peanut for shaves to avoid a shredded beef face. The search stops here. The best, by far, 2nd place is not even visible from this shaver. Super smooth and you can press it against your face, chin, jaw lines, neck, and you get no irritation with a superb shave! It's pretty amazing, I just wish I found this a while ago. Also feels its made of more quality then other shavers I've held, overall I would recommend it over any other shaver. It's not cheap, but definitely worth it.
  1960. After using a Norelco for years, I finally decided to try the Braun foil shaver based on reviews from several different websites. In short, there is no perfect electric razor, but this is as close as it comes! This is the closest shave I have experienced with an electric razor. The shave feels closer than my Norelco 1250 plus the clippings don't fall out easily as with the Norelco RQ12 head.<br /><br />I did not think I would like or use the self-cleaning station since it requires purchasing refill solution. However, it perfectly cleans the shaving head much better than could ever be accomplished manually. I simply take the solution out of the base after cleaning and re-cap the container using the plastic caps it came with which avoids the denatured alcohol evaporating naturally while not in use. After 4 weeks about 20-25% of the solution has been used after cleaning every 5 days or so. Bottom line: if you don't want to purchase the refills then you can simply wash out the shaving head and store the cleaning station elsewhere which was my original intent.<br /><br />One of the main motivations for trying something new was the poor reviews on the new Norelco RQ12 replacement heads. I had my 1250 for a couple of years and it was time to replace the heads. But the new one was $60 and had poor reviews. The Braun's replacement foils are cheaper (about $30) and the reviews on this shaver have been fantastic. Also, one of the user reviews mentioned that the little red spots on his neck from irritation have gone away since switching to the Braun. I have experienced the same thing - no red irritation spots on my neck after 3-4 weeks of daily use. I have zero complaints since making the switch. It's obvious no electric shaver will give you the closeness of a good manual razor with just one pass but this is the best electric option out there! All electric razors take several passes and stretching the skin in some areas to get the perfect shave. I am extremely satisfied with the quality of shave and quality of this product one month in. Highly recommend!e quality of shave and quality of this product one month in. Highly recommend!
  1961. More convenient than using before. And I like the clean way.
  1962. This was a gift for my father who is partially disabled and he loves the clean shave he gets with it.
  1963. Made with care for countless razor sharp accidents.It's product worth buying in order to expand market and make decent shaver accessible. Production description and price match product. Thank you.
  1964. Bought this on Amazon on Black Friday sale. Great deal. I still have the old model Braun 7680 and it still runs great after 7 years. So far I think this is definitely an upgrade comparing to 7680. Much smoother shave and it cuts my shave time to half. Love the battery indicator. The only thing I found missing is the cap. The old 7680 has a cap on the top to protect the head and this new model does not come with one.
  1965. I still love my Series 1 (on my second one) for a quick shave and ability to take the abuse of being dropped. I liked the Series 3 but it just died recently and I thought I'd scope out the newer styles. This Series 7 is the hook! It was a choice between the Braun and Panasonic after a boat load of research. I really liked the fact that the Panasonic head came apart from the shaving block like the Braun Series 3, but it came down to overall shaver ratings online and knowing the reliability of the Braun products I've used over the past 35 years. Okay, that and I got to party with some German senior enlisted when I was on my twilight tour in the Navy and those guys were pretty cool (Hitler wasn't their fault).<br /><br />I've got to say the Braun 790cc gives me the best shave I've ever had from an electric shaver. Say what you want about the rotary shavers, but the foil shavers don't pull the hairs out of your face to give you a close shave.
  1966. I disliked a previous electric shaver. It didn't shave well and left may face irritated. The Braun Series 7 provides a shave that is almost as close as a standard razor and it is less irritating to my skin than the prior electric razor or my standard razor. It is convenient. Also, I am able to shave daily (as opposed to every other day). With my standard razor I couldn't shave daily due to irritation.<br />This system is expensive. But, if it lasts, it will be worth it (especially since razor blade refills are so expensive now!).
  1967. Love it. My 10 year old Braun finally gave up and died so I was forced to replace it with a newer model. This is tragic because my face is used to Braun shavers and it will take a long time to adjust to another brand.

  2001. I had tried a rotary head shaver about 15 yrs ago with the recommendation of my father but the shave never really felt great. I have been shaving with a Mach 3 for many years and with my sensitive skin, it meant that I would skip a couple of days shaving from time to time because my skin just couldn't handle it. I did some research about electric shavers, rotary vs foil, and most websites/reviewers were claiming that foil shavers gave a better shave than rotary. I then researched which foil shaver was best. It came down to 2-3 different ones. I decided on the Braun shaver simply because I had quality issues with other Philips products lately and did not want to go through this hassle again. I have been using it daily now for over 2 weeks and since I have a bald head, I also use it to shave my entire head!   2005. I have been using it for less than a month, however it has been a significant improvement over my previous Braun System 3 shaver. For me, the trimmer works better than any that was available on electric shavers I previously owned.   2006. I've been using the Braun 790cc for about three months now with excellent results. The short version goes like this: the shaver comes with a high price tag, but one that's worth it if you want a no-fuss shaver that has its own built-in cleaning system.<br /><br />Here's the longer version:<br /><br />My beard grows in with a medium level of thickness and speed, but my facial hair - especially on my neck - grows in a multitude of odd-shaped whorls and other circular patterns. With a traditional razor, it's impossible to shave without cutting myself. Despite that, for years I dealt with a bloody face after shaving and would stanch the bleeding with a styptic pencil. I finally got sick of that and made the switch to an electric shaver.<br />Back in high school, I shaved with a three-head Panasonic shaver that was less-than ideal and always left stray stubble unshaven, which I'd have to remove with a traditional razor. With a gap of about 15 years between that electric shaver experience and my current one, I realize the technology has changed quite a bit. Despite that, I can say hands down this is an amazing shaver.<br /><br />One thing is for sure: it may be the best electric shaver out there but it will never shave as closely as a blade razor. That's just the reality. Your shave will still be close and you'll still be happy, but you'll never get that \\"baby smooth\\" feel.<br /><br />Now I'm able to shave in about three minutes - a mere fraction of the time I spent shaving when I had to lather up and use a blade razor. That time savings alone makes it worth it, but the icing on the cake is the Clean & Renew system, which is wonderful. Just place the shaver in the charging station, press a button to clean it, then walk away. Awesome.<br /><br />My only gripe with the clean & renew system is that I appear to have a mild allergy to the cleaning solution. Even after being cleaned and dried, my shaver always has a slight residue of the lubricant on its metal surfaces, and on two different occasions my lips have become swollen and slightly bumpy. I've fixed this problem by gently wiping off the shaver head with a tissue before each shave, and this seems to have solved the problem. Just be aware - there may be other people who have allergic reactions to the lubricant too.<br /><br />If I weren't slightly allergic to the cleaning solution/lubricant, I'd give this shaver 5 stars. But since I am, I have to take away one star and give it a 4. But don't let that steer you to some other shaver - this thing is the real deal and I highly endorse it.two different occasions my lips have become swollen and slightly bumpy. I've fixed this problem by gently wiping off the shaver head with a tissue before each shave, and this seems to have solved the problem. Just be aware - there may be other people who have allergic reactions to the lubricant too.<br /><br />If I weren't slightly allergic to the cleaning solution/lubricant, I'd give this shaver 5 stars. But since I am, I have to take away one star and give it a 4. But don't let that steer you to some other shaver - this thing is the real deal and I highly endorse it.
  2007. My Dad absolutely loves this shaver.
  2008. I wished that I had known the capabilities of this type of shaver many years ago. Even though my face is multi-color from razor burn, my face has not itched since my first used of this shaver system. It is worth the expense.
  2009. I've used Braun products for over 20 years and have found their shavers of high quality throughout this period. Next, the foil over the blades is not of cheap construction... it will last. I also am impressed with battery life and the built-in battery life indicator. I travel a lot and it's nice to \\"not have to guess\\" if there's enough life left in the battery anymore. The travel cover fits tight and provides good protection too. Overall, this shaver is a solid choice to purchase.

  2013. I hadn't used an electric shaver for around 15 years. I thought I'd give it another go. They have definitely come a long way.   2014. Great shaver. I'm a fan of the Braun shavers and this one is as good as they come. For me, nothing works as well. Lots of horsepower, long battery charge, close shave. Fits in your hand the way you would expect it to.

  2016. I'm not sure about this particular model, but I will never purchase a braun product again. I always used Braun shavers until my wife purchased the new Braun 360 complete for me one X-mas. 2 years later it broke and of coarse the warranty expired. I contacted Braun and they gave me a list of service centers. So I sent it in to be repaired at my own expense. The part was discontinued (after 3 yrs. on the market). I contaced Braun again and to my surprise they could not care less. They would not replace my shaver with an equal value shaver. They sent me a travel shaver worth $49. The 360 complete cost my wife just under $400 at the time. Make your own choice, but I've made mine. It's like buying a car and three yrs later you can't find parts for it anymore. Is it a disposable? I guess Braun beleives it is. A very expensive disposable!! If you're going to offer repairs, then the parts should be available at all times. BOTTOM LINE!!!

However with this I do buy the cleaning fluid, but use it only every few months. I shave about twice a week, and I used to get razer burn before I got my first Braun (my first braun lasted 8 years and still worked great, I was just ready for something new). But this one has 3 different settings so when I'm on my neck I use the lightest setting so it doesn't cause any discomfort. The key to this is being slow and gentle and LIGHTLY pressing on your skin. I don't mind going over an area a few times if it means no irritation later, and this thing gives my skin baby soft like a razor can! I will always buy Braun.

For what the solution refills cost, I could just replace my cutter head parts annually and rinse them weekly.   2030. I have always hated shaving. I had used &#34;very good&#34; razors + shaving cream for 25 years. During that time, I tried a few electric shavers. They were mid-priced electric shavers and I hated them. They seemed to remove more skin than hair, so they quickly found themselves buried in my drawer or thrown away. A little over a year ago I decided to spend &#34;real money&#34; on an electric shaver and give it a final try. After a lot of research I decided on this one- at least in part due to the generous try/return policy. Am I ever glad I did! I<br />love this shaver, to the extent that shaving has almost become enjoyable. It works great- very close shave. I thought there might be a &#34;get used to it period&#34; where it would be uncomfortable for a while, but it worked great and comfortably right out of the box. The cleaning system works great, too. I run the cycle after every shave, and I shave on average every other day. A cleaning cartridge tends to last me a couple months. Sometimes I won't shave for a few days and will have a pretty heavy beard. In those cases, this shaver works a little harder but does the job no problem. I've had no trouble using the trimmer either. All in all, it's a great product and a night and day difference compared to the less expensive models. I can't say how other brands' top models compare to this one, but I can't imagine them being any better. It's also just the right size and weight- easy to hold/handle. It's literally been a life-changer for me!!

  2038. This was a gift for my husband - the following it his feedback on this shaver - I had an 8 year old version of this Braun shaver - It worked well but for a really close shave, I used a blade. I cannot begin to tell you how impressed I was with this new Braun Series 7! It is extremely easy to use and has this really cool feature where you can use a blue light to dial up or down the intensity of the shave. The lesser settings still gives a great shave. Also the fact that you can get a very close shave without having to go over the same spot is a big plus. In short, the electric razor is fantastic and if you are thinking it's time to replace yours (whatever the brand) I would say do it. Obviously it is much more expensive than most other razors - but A) You get what you pay for and B) Since you will be using it almost every day, the cost per day is SO worth it!

  2045. Have a Panasonic ES8077 that I have used for about 3 years and have been quite happy with. However, after purchasing this Braun I have made the Panasonic my backup shaver that I take on trips and the Braun is my number one shaver for everyday use at home. Shave is great with the Braun and another big plus is the charging/cleaning station that is much quieter than the Panasonic and gets better reviews for reliability. The charging/cleaning station fopr the Panasonic sounded like an F14 taking off and began to give trouble after a couple of years. it completely died just short of 3 years old.
  2046. The delivery was quick and efficient. Although I have used Braun shavers for a long time, this one is a real improvement both in terms of result and battery life.<br />Very good product
  2047. This razor is awesome beautiful clean shaves everytime... This is coming from the wife. The cleaning feature is pretty cool but kinda loud, we just start it as we're headed out the door for work. The only complaint besides noise is the beard trimmer is silly. They put it in a place where you have to contort yourself in front of the mirror to see what you're doing. It does a fine job it's just in a weird place to be able to see around it to see what you are trimming.

  2058. Coming from previous Pulsonic 9595 which was showing wear and tear of age. I like the adjustable closeness settings, light-normal-powerful, which does make a difference for my beard. If I don't shave for a day or two, I use the light (comfort) setting to take off a quick layer, and then go to normal for a finishing run, and am quite satisfied. One harmlessly annoying feature is the &#34;hygiene&#34; indicator which declines rapidly (after two or 3 shaves) so that it is blinking a warning at you. Once you put it in the base for a cleaning it resets. However, I like to go a full week or maybe even a full charge (this battery goes for 10 or more days before needing a recharge) before using the cleaning station, so I basically ignore the hygiene indicator.<br /><br />One marketing point on this item: feel the Amazon should make it more obvious up front that if you choose to return this shaver for whatever reason, it has to go back to Braun because of the &#34;hazardous&#34; clean & renew refill (alcohol based) - NOT back to Amazon. This did not affect me, as I like this product, but other reviews have complained about this.

  2062. I have had a Braun 7000 syncro for years and loved it. Only decided to go with the new series 7 since the battery in the old faithful razor was starting to lose some of its pep. Have been using this series 7 for about a month and it is definitely the best shave I've ever had. It leaves nothing behind and I finish shaving probably about 30 percent faster. For anyone that says their beard is too tough, or they don't like electrics, I say give this a chance. It takes about 2 weeks for your face to get used to the electric shave, but you'll never get as close of a shave with a blade as you do with this razor. The auto-clean feature is great, but may not be necessary to do every day (like I do.) I haven't tried just rinsing it in water. Overall, I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Acted like it was running (blue light lit, activity for battery blinking, etc. but nothing happened with shaving head). I let it die, recharged, nothing worked, even bought a new foil head.<br /><br />My experience with Braun / PG support has been a long drawn out mess and I just had to warn people.<br /><br />First, if you rely on this thing, purchase 2 or look for another brand. If it dies you are out of a shaver for at least 30 days.<br /><br />Braun call in support is little to no help, they outsource the repair to 1 company based in Northern California. I sent my shaver in 2 weeks ago and they STILL have not looked at it.<br />So let me get this straight - I paid over 200 bucks for a high end shaver and I have to pay shipping to get it fixed? and wait 3-4 weeks?<br /><br />This will be the last Braun I ever buy, moving to Panasonic after this, or some other decent brand once I do some research.<br /><br />I am sure others have had the same experience.<br /><br />Buyers beware!

  2122. This is a review more of the Braun return process (which is bad) than of the shaver itself (which could be great for you, but didn't work well for me). The return process is part of the shaver experience, and it seemed worthy of documentation.<br /><br />THE SHAVER<br />I purchased this shaver in September, having shaved manually for a number of years and wanting to speed up my grooming. I have a fairly thick beard, and various online guides and reviews suggested that this was one of the better shavers on the market. The cleaning solution smelled great, the automatic cleaning process seemed to work well, and the entire setup looked cool in my bathroom. The shaver itself did a great job on my face but couldn't shave fairly large sections of my neck, despite many passes from many angles, varying degrees of pressure, and weeks of acclimation.<br /><br />THE RETURN PROCESS<br />Different shavers work well for different people, so most consumer shavers come with money-back guarantees. The Braun is no different: you have 60 days to try it out, and if you'd like to return it, you can. Unfortunately, I found the return process frustrating and ultimately misleading. My experience was as follows:<br />1. Search online for &#34;braun 60 day money back guarantee.&#34; The top hit is the return form pdf. Off to a good start!<br />2. Read the return form, looking for a return address. Seems like an obvious place to put it, but no dice.<br />3. Call the number listed on the form, then navigate four layers deep into their automated phone system. Eventually find the recorded message that reveals the return address after making you listen to much of the return form.<br />4. Call the number back again and re-navigate the phone system and re-listen to the whole message, since the address is only read to you once (fairly quickly) and then the system hangs up on you.<br />5. Call the number a third time and re-navigate/re-listen to check the address I have written down.<br />6. Punch the address into Google Maps to increase confidence in its correctness, since I'm about to mail a fairly expensive gizmo to this address and I haven't actually seen it printed anywhere. Pump fist when the address exists.<br />7. Repack my shaver and accessories, walk it down to the Post Office, and pay to mail it and track it.<br />8. Check Post Office tracking status a few days later to learn that it arrived safely somewhere, hopefully where it needs to be.<br />9. Wait for ~5 weeks without hearing anything.<br />10. Call the Braun customer service number and speak with someone about the status of my return. They found my return in the system, which pleased me, and told me that it was being processed. No timeline estimate was available.<br />11. Receive in the mail a prepaid Citi card for the amount I paid Amazon, after about 6 weeks.<br /><br />Steps 1-10 could have been (much) better, but Step 11 broke the camel's back. I purchased a Norelco shaver earlier this year, and when I took advantage of its money-back guarantee, I received a check in the mail. I didn't have to call a number to activate the check, the money that the check conferred didn't expire or have maintenance fees, there was no PIN to memorize, it was simple to combine the funds from the check with other funds to pay for something expensive - in other words, it was just my money back, which is exactly what was advertised.<br /><br />But the prepaid card I received from the Braun money-back guarantee has all of those features, and seems like a poor substitute for getting my money back. Thus, the process continued:<br /><br />12. Call Braun customer service, express my confusion about getting a crippled card when I wanted my money back. Ask if this switcheroo is buried in fine print anywhere, or if they just do this. Be informed that it's not printed anywhere, but that's their policy, and there's nothing that they can do about it.<br />13. Think on this for a few minutes, then call Braun customer serviceagain and speak with someone else about it. Receive the same story again, and hear that I don't actually need to activate the card that says &#34;You must activate your card prior to use.&#34; The jury is still out on this one.<br />14. Write this review on Amazon, with the hope that people will be better aware of how the return process works and that Braun and Proctor & Gamble will make this experience more user-friendly.<br /><br />Best of luck with your shaving and/or returning!again and speak with someone else about it. Receive the same story again, and hear that I don't actually need to activate the card that says &#34;You must activate your card prior to use.&#34; The jury is still out on this one.<br />14. Write this review on Amazon, with the hope that people will be better aware of how the return process works and that Braun and Proctor & Gamble will make this experience more user-friendly.<br /><br />Best of luck with your shaving and/or returning!

  2133. come quick works well looks good.it works comfortably, it worth that much price. try it next thanksgiving. the cleaning system a bit noisy. fully automatic.
  2134. I bought this to replace an old 360 series shaver that developed a problem with the switch (still useable but the trimmer setting became a bit difficult to use).<br /><br />I could not be more pleased with the Series 7---I thought of not &#34;upgrading&#34; but getting the equivalent of my old shaver. Glad I upgraded. The shaver head has independent &#34;springs&#34; on the two shaving surfaces to adjust to the shape of my face, and the shave is definitely smoother and closer. This is one of the best pieces of engineering one can find in the area of personal care products---ergonomic design is just right, the shaving head is simply outstanding and the &#34;clean and renew&#34; holder is not only well designed but also shuts off after the shaver is cleaned and charged (no more slow drainage on the electrical circuit---it was never a lot, but many many 'small&#34; drains add up.)<br /><br />The travel case for the shaver is a plastic reinforced (very rigid reinforcement) cloth container shaped to fit the shaver. It has a zipper. An improvement (I think) over the all plastic holder for my previous Braun.<br /><br />ALL IN ALL---an outstanding product. If you are looking for an outstanding shaver, this is the one!!!!<br /><br />PS: For those who are concerned about where Braun products are being made (following the Gillette acquisition, here is the info from the box: Shaver made in Germany (5 stars for that!); Clean and Renew unit made in Hungary; Cleaning Cartridge made in Ireland; Electrical cord and travel case made in China. From the info, this shaver head seems to be made in Germany. (No markings on the shaver head.)<br /><br />PS 2: Do not confuse this with the Series 7000 shavers. That is a series &#34;lower&#34; in the features, etc. hierarchy for Braun (and an earlier model).
  2135. Braun has been incrementally improving their shavers for quite some time now. This is the 3rd one I have owned from them since 2005 and it is definitely the best one. It is essentially the same as the original Pulsonic but the design is slightly changed, they have added a speed adjustment setting and changed the color to a black/silver/gunmetal type color.<br />The great thing about this shaver is that if you have sensitive skin you can turn down the speed so as not to damage your face or skin as badly. That is not to say that this shaver will do that by any means. It will not, actually. I use mine on the highest setting all the time to quickly take care of my facial hair and it does the trick without causing razor burn, bumps, or irritation.<br />The cleaning system is very good at charging and sanitizing but just remember to clean out the inside because hair can accumulate between cleanings.<br />I definitely recommend this shaver system to anyone who doesn't have the time to use a wet razor or anyone who prefers electric shavers.
  2136. This razor does its job without a problem. When used correctly, it gives a close shave, as close as one can expect from any electric razor. Contrary to what some people say, I do like the cleaning system that comes with the razor. It seems to do a better job than trying to clean it by hand. The shaving foils are very sensitive, and it pays to use the cleaning system to maintain the quality and duration of those foils.<br /><br />Another tip: Keep the shaving head parallel to your shaving surface - makes a big difference in the closeness of the shave. I don't suggest using a pre-shave lotion, as it doesn't seem to make a difference in shaving, and even has a tendency to gum up the shaver.<br /><br />I like the shaver a lot, and find that I need to use it again in the evening, if we're going out to a public place. But that's not a problem, as it just takes a few minutes to shave.
  2137. I got this for my husband who is very sick. He loves it. He shaves every day and then it cleans itself. It gives the cleanest shave ever. I would recommend this to any one.
  2138. My husband had this Braun shaver a few years ago and thought it was the best. When it was time for a new shaver he switched brands and was very disappointed. It wasn't long before he went back to Braun. It's the best and will never switch brands again!

  2144. First just a little about myself and my preferences. I have to have an electric shaver due to really sensitive skin and a lot of issues using razors. Another thing I consider is that I have very thick and fast growing facial hair, aka I look like a mountain man after not shaving over a weekend. I also have to use foil shavers and have gone through several brands of various price points before I decided it is worth it to buy the high end shavers with cleaning bases. The cleaning bases aren't necessarily a must have but I like them personally.<br /><br />I'm going to compare the Series 7-790cc and the Panny (Panasonic) LA-93.<br /><br />Closeness of shave:<br /> I would call this a tie between the two. Panny seems have a bit more umph to the motor and a much larger shaving head than the Braun. They both accomplish a very close shave and do it very well.<br /><br />Ability to tackle thick facial hair:<br /> This one goes to the Panny. It has a bigger shaving head and a little more muscle to the motor. The win here is due to the fact that it took just a few minutes less to get a really good shave compared to the Braun. The Braun is able to do very well but takes just a little longer.<br /><br />Form Factor:<br /> This is a very personal consideration and just my opinion but it goes to Braun. Fits in the hand nicely and the smaller shaving head, pop-up trimmer, and lock for the head seem to have been planned out very well. The Panny always seemed a bit awkward to hold and use. Eventually you get used to it but the Braun was natural right out of the box.<br /><br />Cleaning base:<br /> Panny wins hands down. The base while it isn't much to look at performs it's job extraordinarily well. Braun's isn't bad but not up to the Panny by a long shot. Also not a huge fan of the citrus scent from Braun's solution but it's also not terrible.<br /><br />For me those are the main points. I can answer any questions just leave a comment if you are debating between these two or just want to know more about them.<br /><br />So the final verdict? Well after using each for a year (Panny) and six months (Braun) I have to say I like the Braun better out of the two. This is a very tough decision but I seem to get a little less irritation and just as close of a shave. The form factor for this also pushes it over the top for me.hese two or just want to know more about them.<br /><br />So the final verdict? Well after using each for a year (Panny) and six months (Braun) I have to say I like the Braun better out of the two. This is a very tough decision but I seem to get a little less irritation and just as close of a shave. The form factor for this also pushes it over the top for me.
  2145. As with all my other Braun shavers, it provides clean shave with minimal irritation. This model picks up long hair much better than the old four digit models.<br /><br />One minor complaint I have is, after inserting the shaver, the base needs to recognize it before I can push the cleaning button. It only takes a split second, but the previous model would allow me to push the cleaning button before the shaver was recognized. Considering that I'm in auto-pilot in the morning, waiting that split second is a hard habit to break.
  2146. This is Braun flagship model.I came from shanghai.The price is attractive.So I bought it.After half many transport of month,I received my parcel.I am so exciting.Although I paid tariff.I am still very happy.
  2147. I have always used a Philips/Norelco rotary shaver, and would use a regular manual razor when I wanted/needed a nice close shave, but the rotary was good enough most of the time. Then, after surgery and radiation treatment to my neck area (my battle with cancer); my doctors advised me to only use electric shavers from that point on, because any cuts to the treatment area would have difficulty healing and increase chances of infection. So for the past two years I have relied on my rotary shaver; and although it has always given a decent shave, it would irritate my skin, and the large head was difficult to navigate around my sideburns and nose, etc...<br /><br />So I decided it was time to upgrade. I read reviews and researched the top shavers from Braun, Panasonic, and Philips/Norelco and ultimately decided on the Braun. Based on my research, all three shavers produced similar results, so in the end it came down to price, features, and comfort. At the time, Philips/Norelco had the best price and was offering a $50 instant rebate which made it very tempting; but because I had been using their product form some time, I really just wanted to try something else. The Panasonic was also a good alternative, but was priced a little higher and it had a larger shaving head then the Braun, so I was worried about having the same difficulties around the nose and side-burn areas as I had with the Philips/Norelco. So my money went to Braun.<br /><br />I've had the shaver for a few weeks now and am very happy with my purchase. I'm getting a closer shave than I ever got with my Philips/Norelco, with less irritation. The build quality is top notch and the cleaning station works great. Always leaving my shaver smelling clean and fresh. For me this shaver was a great choice, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a high quality shaver.
  2148. My 6 year old Braun 8985 slider that turns the unit on stopped working. In the past, I've replaced foils and cutters probably once every 2 years for that brand new shave feel.
