When the new Braun shaver arrived I immediately tried it and to my surprise, the shave was closer on the regular setting than with my 8985 model. The 790cc also is more comfortable to hold in hand since it's not as flat and heavy, but more organomic. It feels very sturdy, no rattling parts. The cleaning station feels a bit lighter but well constructed.<br />I consider this shaver as a substantial upgrade to my 6 year old activator. Very happy with the purchase. Shaving is fun again :)

  2175. Alittle background - I'm 56 years old, so I've been shaving for awhile. Like many men my age, I've tried almost every way under the sun to shave, including a lengthy process that involves hot washcloths, a mantle of Noxema underneath shaving gel, changing blades every 5 days religiously, etc. Additionally, I've tried virtually EVERY electric razor option that's ever been made; my electric razor \\"graveyard\\" is embarrassing! Bottom line - Nothing shaves closer and more efficiently than a Gillette Mach 3 Turbo, lots of hot water, and a gel product - but who can be bothered with this 20+ minute/day RITUAL? Plus, it's messy, uses a bunch of hot water, needs to be done immediately after a shower (or IN the shower), etc. Enter the Braun Series 7 - 790cc. I've been using it for ~1 month now, so this is no \\"honeymoon review\\". But from the VERY first shave, I was in love! The entire kit oozes \\"Teutonic Craftsmanship\\" - if you want the Porsche/Mercedes Benz of electric shaver, this is it! It's reasonably quiet for an electric - I immediately plugged it in (since it came w/o a sufficient charge to run cordless), spooled it up to \\"Intensive Shave\\" (the most aggressive of the three closeness settings) and attacked my stubble. I fully expected some \\"razor burn\\", since I was switching from blade to electric - NOPE! I also expected a noticeably less close shave - wrong again! The Braun shaves ~95% as close as a blade, with NO razor burn; I don't care if you go over the same place 100 times (and *I* do; I'm anal like that). Careful around your lips - you CAN get some razor burn on your lips if you're not. And remember to \\"stretch\\" your skin while you're shaving; plus, I flip the shaver around so the head hits every section of your beard from every possible angle. Start under your nose first - using an electric shaver will make that area sweat, so get that section done while you're \\"dry\\" there. And don't forget the back of your neck - get out that hand-held mirror! No razor burn THERE either - THIS was when I KNEW that Braun had hit a grandslam home run! I have always only been able to use the \\"sideburn trimmer\\" of an electric shaver to keep the back of my neck shaved - with any and every OTHER electric shaver, if I used the regular shaving head to shave this area, I would break out. Not so with the Braun! After you're done, just put the shaver into the cradle and push the \\"clean\\" button - next time you're ready to shave, it's all charged up and fully clean! No more removing the shaving head and trying to brush out the skin/stubble; no more blowing it out with compressed air cans. No muss, no fuss - takes me 13 minutes to shave my face AND the back of my neck - and I go over each area multiple times. Can't beat Amazon's price on this unit either. Go ahead and buy the extra cleaning cartridges and an extra cutting head while you're at it. And DO buy a \\"7 Series\\", WITH the cleaning option - Made in GERMANY, NOT Cheen-wa. You'll never look back, and the \\"price of admission\\" will soon be forgotten! Thanks Braun, for making THE shaving system for the new millenium - this is the \\"gold standard\\" for which all other electric shavers will be judged. If I were Norelco or Remington, I'd just toss in the towel and go home...razor burn THERE either - THIS was when I KNEW that Braun had hit a grandslam home run! I have always only been able to use the \\"sideburn trimmer\\" of an electric shaver to keep the back of my neck shaved - with any and every OTHER electric shaver, if I used the regular shaving head to shave this area, I would break out. Not so with the Braun! After you're done, just put the shaver into the cradle and push the \\"clean\\" button - next time you're ready to shave, it's all charged up and fully clean! No more removing the shaving head and trying to brush out the skin/stubble; no more blowing it out with compressed air cans. No muss, no fuss - takes me 13 minutes to shave my face AND the back of my neck - and I go over each area multiple times. Can't beat Amazon's price on this unit either. Go ahead and buy the extra cleaning cartridges and an extra cutting head while you're at it. And DO buy a \\"7 Series\\", WITH the cleaning option - Made in GERMANY, NOT Cheen-wa. You'll never look back, and the \\"price of admission\\" will soon be forgotten! Thanks Braun, for making THE shaving system for the new millenium - this is the \\"gold standard\\" for which all other electric shavers will be judged. If I were Norelco or Remington, I'd just toss in the towel and go home...
  2176. I bought my Braun 9595 on 7/2/08 after extensive research on trying to find the best electric razor. At age 26, I was through with razor blades and even a cheapy rotary electric wet/dry razor, so I wanted to get the best money could buy. There are a lot of gimmicks Braun uses here, and I'll start with the foils. They say that the micro foils give you the closest shave and even pick up hair on your neck that other shavers leave behind. I just shaved with the Braun for one of the last times this morning (see below for what I'm replacing it with), and let me tell you, there's a lot of stray hairs on my neck! I replaced the foil head one month ago! I should note that I stopped replacing the foil every 18 months after the first 18 months, and started replacing them yearly in hopes I could get a closer shave, sooner, but that didn't happen with this last replacement. Repetitively shaving over and over on my neck will make it irritated very quickly, so I've learned to either live with it when in a hurry or go back over it with - get this - a $17 Walmart trimmer with multiple attachments, one of which is a foil head. No joke. The $17 trimmer gets closer and picks up what the $200 Braun left behind! Heck, I even bought a $5 micro shaver just as a fast, small shaver to bring on trips and THAT shaves closer than the Braun, albeit with the irritation expected from something so small and with a single focus in mind, getting close.<br /><br />Let's talk about all the things that have failed now. One thing I liked about the Braun was the built-in trimmer, but that broke after 3 years and would flop around until the cutter died and I had to super-glue it to the razor just to stay in place! And what's with the official Braun cleaning fluids - it has literally burned off the silver \\"paint\\" on the razor itself, just under the swiveling head, as where there was once a warning of some kind, it has been completely wiped off and is now a flat black under the paint. I have had to grab a hand towel and nearly \\"sand down\\" the paint when it was chipping off, not something you expect from a fine piece of German engineering.... An LED burned out on the cleaner, and considering I clean my razor every time I use it, go figure it was the one under the Economy status light. Why the lights flash next to the setting and not the one in the center telling you the cleaning has been activated is a little beyond me - someone will need to comment on whether or not they've changed that with future revisions, but I doubt it.<br /><br />With using a good soothing aftershave, the Braun is still very bearable to use, but I shave before showering as they recommend and while in the shower, I feel a lot of irritation that I shouldn't feel from something that has all this special mechanisms for vibrating to prevent irritation (another gimmick). It is ridiculous how loud this razor is to operate - if my girlfriend is sleeping, not even a closed bathroom door will prevent her from waking up in the adjacent bedroom. I've gotten used to it, but now that I know there are other razors that are quieter, shave better, and last longer (the latter is to be determined), I've placed my order for a Panasonic ES-LV81-K that was once a $600 shaving system, much more than the max Braun ever charged for the 9595. This was recommended by a certain authority on what's \\"the best\\" and arrives in a catalog by mail, and considering they've never let me down in the past in telling me what's best, I'm going to give this one a shot in hopes that I will look more presentable day after day! Check for my review on it after 4 years!to grab a hand towel and nearly \\"sand down\\" the paint when it was chipping off, not something you expect from a fine piece of German engineering.... An LED burned out on the cleaner, and considering I clean my razor every time I use it, go figure it was the one under the Economy status light. Why the lights flash next to the setting and not the one in the center telling you the cleaning has been activated is a little beyond me - someone will need to comment on whether or not they've changed that with future revisions, but I doubt it.<br /><br />With using a good soothing aftershave, the Braun is still very bearable to use, but I shave before showering as they recommend and while in the shower, I feel a lot of irritation that I shouldn't feel from something that has all this special mechanisms for vibrating to prevent irritation (another gimmick). It is ridiculous how loud this razor is to operate - if my girlfriend is sleeping, not even a closed bathroom door will prevent her from waking up in the adjacent bedroom. I've gotten used to it, but now that I know there are other razors that are quieter, shave better, and last longer (the latter is to be determined), I've placed my order for a Panasonic ES-LV81-K that was once a $600 shaving system, much more than the max Braun ever charged for the 9595.   2177. my previous shaver pulled out the whiskers, this one cut them off. Much better. They seem to want to sell you cleaning solution. I think you can clean it with a tap and some brushing of the base
  2178. I've owned the three previous generations of the Braun top end model, so I can't compare it to other brands. I've used this shaver for the last several weeks, and can say that it shaves closer than previous models, especially under the chin, where the older models were less than satisfactory. As a result, you can now shave faster without having to go over the same areas a number of times.<br /><br />Even though the overall performance is excellent, I've rated this item four stars for two reasons: The new trimmer design takes some getting used to. Unlike the old design, which pushes up parallel to the body, the new trimmer pops out at right angels to the body. It's much narrower than the old design, so this whole new configuration feel different to hold, and takes a few uses before feeling comfortable. Secondly, the concept of the new travel case is weird. It is a hard molded case designed to protect the shaver, but doesn't accept the charging cord. You have to throw the cord into your luggage, along with the shaver case. Why not stay with the old soft case design where the cord and shaver fit into the same case?<br /><br />All in all, a great product that could use a few small improvements.

  2185. This is the best foil shaver currently available. I have owned foil shavers for over 50 years and Braun shavers for about 30 years. I have a Syncro, 8995 360 Complete, and most of the previous top models. The display on the 8995 is the most advanced by far and gives lots of useful information, but the 8995 is not as good overall as the 790cc, and uses the older NiCd batteries. The 790cc uses lithium ion batteries.<br /><br />This shaver is much faster than the older models, and offers various settings to customize for the particular face area or type of beard. It can do an average shave very quickly, or an extremely close shave if you take more time, locking the head for some areas. The trimmer flips out about 1 1/2 inch perpendicular to the shaver body.<br /><br />We have two Braun Pulsonic Shavers, an original 790cc and a newer 790cc-4. The earlier shaver suffered a failure of the trimmer mechanism and was finally replaced by Braun under warranty. The clean and charge overflowed if the drain stopped up. The newer 790cc-4 trimmer has worked perfectly, and the clean and charge has been redesigned so the drain does not stop up. Both shavers will experience paint peeling on the back (from the cleaning solution) after about a year of use. Braun should offer instant replacement of any failed shavers under warranty. Service Centers are often unreliable with slow turnaround. It is totally unacceptable that major cities like Houston do not have a Service Center.<br /><br />Overall this is an extremely fine shaver, smooth, fast, comfortable, powerful, and the best foil shaver I have used. It is highly recommended. I have several friends who previously used rotary shavers that bought a 790cc-4. They also find the Braun a superior product and are extremely satisfied.

  2197. Having used an older Norelco shaver for the past few years I guess I didn't know what I was missing with a high quality shaver. My face has slowly adjusted to this razor and the shave has only gotten better. Not only that but the razor burn and ingrown hairs that caused acne on my neck and face seemed to have almost instantly cleared up. The cleaning feature is great, I have been taking out the fluid cartridge per a recommendation I read to help preserve the life of the cartridges. It's a little annoying but it should help them last longer. The cleaning cycle is definitely loud so I wouldn't recommend running it first thing in the morning if your spouse is sleeping. Don't think twice about dropping the money on this razor, it's worth it ten times over for the quality of your skin if nothing else. You can also look at the 760cc which is basically the same razor without the &#34;quick clean&#34; ability and a different color...but if you are spending the money you may as well pony up and get the highest end Braun.

  2203. I was reluctant to buy this because of the cleaning/charging apparatus and having another wall wart sucking power 24/7. But I have resigned myself to either unplugging the power supply when not in use or eating the little electricity that it uses. But worse than that waste of resources are the cleaning cartridges which are made of plastic and evidently not recyclable. If Braun were a responsible corporation, they would offer some kind of exchange on the plastic cartridges, or make them in a way that they would compost quickly. They could also put a switch on the wall wart so that power could be shut off to it when not in use.<br /><br />But if those things bother you, you can put them away and clean the shaver manually, the same way you cleaned your old Braun. The cord that plugs into the charger/cleaner stand will plug directly into the shaver to charge it directly. Of course, you still have to deal with the wall wart because the transformer for charging is not built into the shaver.
  2204. Great shaver but the cleaning machine is way to loud.
  2205. Gave this to my husband for a Christmas gift. He has wanted an electric razor for a long time. Purchased this one based on the other reviews. It has far exceeded his expectations. He loves it
  2206. Shaver is very nice and gets real close on my but i have bad skin and some pitts on my face and does not do a good job of getting in crevices. If your face is perfect this would be a good tool but if you have some breakouts our pitts you might want to try another shaver.
  2207. I am very pleased with this shaver! The battery stays charged for an amazingly long time. It spends a lot of time in my pickup so I can &#34;shavedrive&#34; if needed to save time.

I'll probably send it in for repair and sell it on ebay when I get it back. The shave was great while it lasted, but the quality is lacking and the after purchase support is poor!

  2228. First, let me establish a baseline that was helpful for me when looking at shaver reviews; my facial hair isn't overly course, my skin is sensitive and prone to breakouts, and I generally (used to) skip a day between shaves without looking like I had more than a 5:00 Shadow.<br /><br />With that said, I love this shaver! I am now shaving pretty much every day because it is just so easy to do now. I hate using a traditional blade on my face and always have, but have just dealt with it because I never really tried an electric razor. After years of my neck staying rashed and bumpy, I figured I would try a different approach. I tried using my Wahl Trimmer's foil cutter head and was honestly amazed at the shave it gave me. Well, that's when I decided I would look at a good shaver. I read and watched several reviews and decided just to give this one a try.<br /><br />One negative I read on this shaver was the shave time. Honestly, I don't think it is much different than using a razor. It may take a little longer, but nothing worth mentioning as far as I am concerned.<br /><br />Also, the cleaner is a nice feature, and I am pleased it has it. I like the &#34;no maintenance&#34; approach this gives you. One less thing I have to do after shaving (clean the head).<br /><br />The closeness of the shave is very good. I do have to say that perhaps you CAN get a little closer with a traditional razor, but I think that is generally expected. For me, there is very little difference since I don't have a thick beard anyhow. My wife gives this the nod of approval on smoothness of shave, so that is the only standard I have to meet. Also my skin isn't having any problem adjusting to this shaver, and the bumps on my neck have reduced some already (just about 3 weeks in).<br /><br />The shape and size of this is great. I love the range of motion the head has and the lock feature is easy to use and handy. The Panasonic models this gets compared to look rather large and chunky, so this is a great size IMO.<br /><br />According to the LCD monitor, battery life far exceeds the hygiene, so I have never seen the battery drop more than 1 little block in a weeks usage (at which point I run it through the cleaning cycle and the battery gets recharged). If you had to take this thing with you on a trip, I don't see the battery going dead unless it is over a few weeks.<br /><br />If I had to do it over again, I would certainly buy this again, and I have already recommended it to some of my friends.great size IMO.<br /><br />According to the LCD monitor, battery life far exceeds the hygiene, so I have never seen the battery drop more than 1 little block in a weeks usage (at which point I run it through the cleaning cycle and the battery gets recharged). If you had to take this thing with you on a trip, I don't see the battery going dead unless it is over a few weeks.<br /><br />If I had to do it over again, I would certainly buy this again, and I have already recommended it to some of my friends.

  2254. I've always used an electric shaver for the convenience. Started out with the old Norelco 3-headed lift & cut. It did the job but was never great. About 10 years (yes 10!), I got a Braun 8585 that I have used up until 2 weeks ago. It still works fine and even holds its charge still, but I needed a new cutter foil head and a refill of the clean & renew fluid...those 2 together are about $50 so I figured it was time to spring for a new shaver. Having read the mostly positive and some negative reviews of guys coming from the old 8000 series I was hesitant if I should even opt for the 7-series. I figured the 5-series wasn't much of an upgrade, so I went for it.<br /><br />Glad I did. I don't have the thickest beard, so YMMV...but the 790cc is a definite improvement over my old 8585 workhorse. The Pulsonic shaving action definitely vibrates faster than my 8585 and it does shave faster and closer. The pop-out hair trimmer is not as good though, but that is a secondary feature so I'll let that slide since it does still work. The LCD battery & hygiene scales are gimmicky but will be convenient when travelling. I also like that the shaver body is sealed now so it can be rinsed/cleaned under water, something my old 8585 couldn't do. Again, it's not a big deal feature when home and you have your clean & renew dock charger, but will be good when travelling.<br /><br />As for the clean & renew fluid, I find it a worthwhile expense. It keeps the shaver head clean and lubricated. Since the fluid is still fairly costly, I don't use it everyday. I typically wait for it to get to the \\"normal\\" cleaning cycle (there are 3 cleaning cycles: eco, normal, intensive) which is usually every 3 days or so for me. I've found using the eco cycle every day really burns through the fluid, but waiting to do it less frequently will result in the fluid just evaporating before you get to use it all since it is alcohol based. So by doing it every 3rd day, one cartridge usually lasts me about 2.5 months.about 2.5 months.

What I love most about it is that It gets, for the most part, skin close, which is something I could never do with a blade. And for my money, its a sure thing! The only complaint I have with this shaver is that does an okay job on my neck. Now don't get me wrong! It does a decent, presentable job! The only thing is that on my neck the facial hair grows accross and to the right, which is somewhat difficult for me to shave regardless of stretching the skin in different directions (as it says to shave agains the grain when in use). That being said, this is where the trimmer shines and I am able to clip off the hairs that the foils have missed when shaving the majority of my neck stubble off.   2266. I bought this shaver primarily to shave my head. My head is not the easiest to shave as I have a full head of very thick hair. After reading several reviews I decided to give it a try. Simply put I love it!<br /><br />PROS:<br />1) It shaves my head very smooth.<br />2) Does not leave any skin irritation<br />3) Cleaning system is a nice feature<br />4) Works great for both DRY and WET shaving. I've used it in the shower without issues.<br /><br />CONS:<br />1) Doesn't shave my neck area below the chin as well as top line rotary shavers. It could just be my skin type as a friend of my tried it as said &#34;Wow...best shaver he's used.&#34;<br />2) Hygiene bar - If you normally wash your shaver in running water like I do, you might get confused as to why the Hygiene bar doesn't refill. Truth is that for it to be at full Hygiene you need to use the cleaning base as it uses denatured alcohol to clean.<br />3) Clean and Renew cartage cost can add up<br /><br />TIPS:<br />1) It catches hairs very well if you are just face shaving. If you are shaving your head it will not catch hair as well as your shaver is often facing downwards. If you dry shave your head, take you shirt off so it doesn't fall on your clothes. Personally I prefer to use it in the shower so I don't have to deal with any loose hair particles.<br />2) You don't need to clean it with the base all the time. I tend to clean it twice a week and normally just rinse it after I shave.<br />3) SAVE THE CLEAN AND RENEW CAP - If you don't use the base to clean everyday take it out and cover it with the cap as it will slow down evaporation. If you leave it in the base it will evaporate faster.<br />4) If you don't want to spend on the clean and renew, you can actually make it yourself. Just search 'DIY Clean and Renew' in google.<br /><br />Overall, I love this product. One of the best shavers I've used and certainly the best foil shaver to date. I would recommend this product to anyone and especially those using it to shave their head.to shave their head.

  2275. This shaver is okay. I have to say I was disappointed with the individual results I had with it. I read the Amazon reviews and read up on Consumer Reports about this shaver before buying it. Don't get me wrong, It is a great quality shaver with a powerful yet gentle motor which caught most but not all of my facial hair.<br /><br />Which is my individual problem and the reason for me to rate it 3/5 stars. Like some of the other Amazon reviewers I experienced dilemmas with catching and cutting flat laying hairs on my neck. Which have always been a problem areas as they grow in every direction.<br /><br />Over the years, I have tried 2 Philips dry rotary razors, 1 Philips wet/dry foil razor, 1 Wahl dry foil and 4 Remington MS2-390 foil razors. All purchases within a 10 year period...I would say I am very experienced in the world of electric razors. The Remington MS2-290 was the best for me but unfortunately they have been discontinued. So I am on a quest to find an electric razor that will provide a close shave and get all of my facial hair. It doesn't matter the cost and that is why I considered this one.<br /><br />Well here is what I loved...<br />Pros:<br /><br />1. The cleaning station spoils you if you ever had to clean any other electric shaver. It makes life so much easier when you don't have to clean up fragments of facial hair off the sink.<br />2. The charge and the hygiene indicator was a great visual of how long you needed to charge and clean the razor.<br />3. The cleaning cycle was pretty quick, leaving the razor ready to go within about 30 mins. (No one wants to hear or see that thing cleaning for hours after you have used it)<br />4. The razor is quiet compared to the other brands I have used.<br />5. Again very powerful motor that was gentle on sensitive skins. No pulling or niches of any sort.<br />6. You can even adjust the power based on how your skin reacts to the razor.<br />6. If you wanted you could charge the razor and shave at the same time or in other words you can use it corded.<br />7 Also if you wanted to avoid the cleaning station, you can still clean your razor manually which might save you money on cartridges.<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />1. After 4 weeks of use it kept missing patches of neck hair despite following instructions and using preshave products to straighten the hairs. This is to me is major because when you purchase a razor such as this one, at a hefty price that it is going for, you really want an all-in-one amazing electric razor. In addition to using this razor I had to use a fine beard trimmer to get all of the longer hairs it missed. That defeats the purpose.<br /><br />Overall, great product if you have the right facial hair for it to cut. However, if you have stubborn facial hair that goes in all directions I would suggest the Remington F5-5800 first, The F5-5800 goes for a much smaller price and it performed just slightly better as this one.or in other words you can use it corded.<br />7 Also if you wanted to avoid the cleaning station, you can still clean your razor manually which might save you money on cartridges.<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />1. After 4 weeks of use it kept missing patches of neck hair despite following instructions and using preshave products to straighten the hairs. This is to me is major because when you purchase a razor such as this one, at a hefty price that it is going for, you really want an all-in-one amazing electric razor. In addition to using this razor I had to use a fine beard trimmer to get all of the longer hairs it missed. That defeats the purpose.<br /><br />Overall, great product if you have the right facial hair for it to cut. However, if you have stubborn facial hair that goes in all directions I would suggest the Remington F5-5800 first, The F5-5800 goes for a much smaller price and it performed just slightly better as this one.
  2276. This is my third Braun shaver. I liked them all, but this is the best. It is outstanding even when I am having to plow through a few days of growth. Highly recommend!
  2277. Got this for my Boyfriend - he has used it one time only and so far he LOVES it!!!
  2278. BEST SHAVER I EVER USED.
  2279. I'm a guy that grows facial hair very fast and thick. The common thinking seems to be &#34;I can't get a clean shave with an electric razor&#34;. That ends here, I've used this razor for almost 2 years, it's also been through a deployment to the middle east. excellent battery life and the cleaning station is perfect. I normally don't write reviews but I needed to express my feelings on this device.
  2280. I have purchased cheap electric razors in the past, and figured they did not work well because they were cheap. After several years of shaving my face and head with a razor, I decided to bite the bullet and buy a good electric razor. After much research, I bought the Braun Series 7 - 790cc.<br /><br />I knew it would not shave as close as a razor, but this is a joke. After shaving, it looks like I have a days worth of growth on my face and head. I normally takes me about 3 minutes to shave my head and face with a razor and shaving cream, and I'm baby smooth. I spend at least 5 minutes with this electric razor and look like I haven't shaved at all!<br /><br />I also shave my legs, and although it doesn't get close, it does okay. When I use a razor on my legs, I tend to get razor burn, and don't shave every day anyway. So the electric razor works fine for that. No razor burn, and no one looks that close at my legs.<br /><br />I would not recommend this product unless you absolutely can't use a normal disposable razor.
  2281. Great product<br />Very smooth shave
  2282. Good quality shaver. Worked pretty well but not as well as I expected with all the great reveiws. I'm an African American male and I bought this shaver to shave my head. I also cannot stand when razors &#34;pull&#34; the hair from your face instead of trimming them. I expected the &#34;pull&#34; on the more aggressive settings for this razor, but it happened quite frequently on the sensitive setting, also.<br /><br />The charging station and cleaning solution are quite nice. I personally found the razor to sit awkwardly in the docking station and it would take multiple attempts to align the metal beads on the back of the razor to the charging units; the docking station could have been better manufactured to allow for an easier fit that didn't have to be finagled.<br /><br />Braun offers amazing products but it simply didn't cut it for me. Amazon, fortunately, were beyond cordial with the return of the device, at least.

  2290. This razor provides a fast, comfortable shave.   2294. After much research (and almost buying a Panasonic) I went with this Braun. I've always used a Braun, and my last one last 9 years before the battery started to die. This shaver has been great! When I first started using it, I had to check and make sure there was a plastic cover on it - it was that smooth (there actually is not a plastic protector for the foil provided which is the only negative). The shave is close and smooth and takes me about half the time as my previous Braun (500 series). I don't have a particularly heavy beard so I can get done in about 2 minutes. One time through, even on my neck (where it works really well), and I'm done. The pop-out trimmer is also very good - it's about an inch long and works very great. I started using this shaver on April 1 and haven't needed to re-charge yet. 28 days on one charge is incredible. Best shaver I've ever owned!

For just a slight improvement in shave, the Braun costs a WHOPPING $120 more! And every couple of years you have to replace the head on the Braun, which costs $40. The blades on my Norelcos lasted 3 or 4 times longer.<br /><br />If you have money to burn, go ahead and buy the Braun. If not go with Norelco. I'm done with Braun.

  2322. The higher model 799cc is for showers but that cost over $100 more, and did not seem worth the cost.<br /><br />I did a side by side comparison with both shavers.....<br /><br />I timed a shave using my Norelco SensoTouch 3D shaver with a brand new shaving head, and new Braun 790cc over a two day period (1 complete shave each), and find the Braun takes less time ( 2 1/2 minutes for me), and I will give the Braun slightly closer shave over the Norelco.<br /><br />The cleaning system, though it will cost about $5.00 each, is in my opinion worth it. It does a very good clean job with a nice touch of a lemon smell with a tad of lubricant.<br /><br />The replacement head for the Braun is less expensive than the Norelco, it lasts about 18 months as stated on their web site over the Norelco's 12 month replacement time frame and cost a few dollars more.<br /><br />The pop out Trimmer is better than my Norelco shaver in that its a bit longer, and away from the shaver. Norelco trimmer is shorter, closer to the shaver body, and a bit more difficult to use, but I don’t use them that much.<br /><br />Over all I highly recommend this series 7 shaver.

  2329. It's been probably 10+ years since i've tried using an electric razor and have always gone with gillette disposables, most recently Fusion Proglide Power. I never tried an electric that cut close and didn't cause razor burn or irritation. I recently read some reviews on which electrics were recommended for black men and this one consistently came up so i gave it a try. I found an online coupon and came away with a great price (MUCH lower than retail). As some may know, we are predisposed to ingrown hairs due to the natural curvature of hair growth. Shaving is usually a problem for most of us. with the Fusion, the day of the shave was great, smooth, not too many bumps (used in combo with manually removing ingrown hairs beforehand and products like Bump Patrol), but the following days were pure hell. Once my hair starts growing back,(and my beard is fairly thick and grows in all different directions) i get the soreness in some spots, whiteheads and the beginning of ingrown hairs. because of this, i'd switch back to using hair clippers for shaving : not close, but comfortable.<br /><br />In any case i gave this Braun a try. entered with skepticism, but i'm pleasantly surprised with the result. As some have mentioned, it doesn't cut as close as a blade, but it still cuts plenty close. My skin was smooth to the touch after the first shave. initially, it missed some hairs, but after setting it to the most powerful setting, it took care of those stray hairs. there were literally maybe 5-10 stray hairs (in that hard to get to throat area) that i went over with a manual (single blade). So far, no irritation during or after the shave. the next couple of days will determine whether or not this will work for the long term for me as the regrowth phase is the most problematic. I've never been an every day shaver, usually once a week with the Fusion. the cleaning feature is nice and works well. The cleaning cartridges are somewhat expensive, but given what you pay for a pack of Fusion Proglide Power razors, it's a better deal. With the price i paid, i think i got a winner...and if it doesn't work out on the face, i can always use it on my head!ack of Fusion Proglide Power razors, it's a better deal. With the price i paid, i think i got a winner...and if it doesn't work out on the face, i can always use it on my head!

It doesn't compare to shaving with a blade in terms of closeness. I'm writing this review primarily to make people aware of the return policy. Most electric shaver reviews talk about 30 and/or 60 day 100% satisfaction money back guarantees. I purchased the Panasonic ES-LA93-K from Amazon and didn't notice any real difference from my older Braun so I returned it and received a refund within a few days. Braun however has a much different return policy. First, it must be returned directly to Braun. Second, Braun will issue a pre-paid Citibank debit card. Hopefully you will be satisfied enough to keep it, but good luck if you need to return. This is the response directly from Braun:<br /><br />Allow 8-10 weeks for delivery of a Citibank pre-paid debit card

  2342. * Will try to keep this review as short as possible while still trying to get my point(s) across *<br /><br />A little background on me: I take my shaving and the experience of that very seriously. I have a thick to heavy beard - no question.<br />I have recently used two (top of the line) Phillips Norelco 3D rotary shavers with cleaning system over the past year and a half.<br />Why two identical Norelco's within 1.5 yrs? Functionally they worked fine; was not happy with the 60 minutes charge capacity Norelco claims this shaver can sustain.<br /><br />Why I personally like the Braun over the Norelco:<br />Note: I have had my Braun for 8 wks now.<br /><br />1. The weight and feel of it in your hand is a secure and comfortable feeling - more impressive than the Norelco. This unit is obviously well made.<br />2. Though a little louder than the Norelco 3D. The Braun seems/is more powerful and I like that!<br />3. Shaving closeness... I have to honestly say that I could not tell a distinct difference with one over the other.<br />4. While shaving - I now prefer the straight up and down movement of the Braun foil over the constant small rotations required with a rotary.<br />5. The Braun power cord can attach directly to the shaver and can be used, I'm assuming... to keep the shaver going in case the battery prematurely die's-out. You do not have this option with the Norelco 3D.<br />6. Battery charge indicator is practical and easy to view. Retention of sustained battery power when using is exceptional.<br />7. The cleaning unit is very cool and does a superb job!<br /><br />Regarding overheating of the foil head against your skin as other reviewer's have commented. I have never experienced this. I can tell you this however... When I was using the Norelco rotary, for the longest time I always had two small bumps on the lower left side of my neck. I refer to this as minor skin irritation bumps. After two days of using the Braun they completely disappeared and have never come back.<br /><br />Note: Though waterproofed to a certain extent. This shaver is not designed to be used in the shower. The shaver's foil head can be cleaned by rinsing it under hot running water without having to detach it from the shaver.<br /><br />IN CLOSING I would just like to point out one thing to keep in mind to someone who may be new to shaving with an electric, OR switching from one electric to another; especially if you have a heavier beard like mine. In my opinion and experience you must be patient and give your new electric shaver a 'minimum' of 21 actual shaving days. This will allow your facial skin and whiskers the time needed to adjust for a nice close shave. Again be patient and you will notice a difference.ppeared and have never come back.<br /><br />Note: Though waterproofed to a certain extent. This shaver is not designed to be used in the shower. The shaver's foil head can be cleaned by rinsing it under hot running water without having to detach it from the shaver.<br /><br />IN CLOSING I would just like to point out one thing to keep in mind to someone who may be new to shaving with an electric, OR switching from one electric to another; especially if you have a heavier beard like mine. In my opinion and experience you must be patient and give your new electric shaver a 'minimum' of 21 actual shaving days. This will allow your facial skin and whiskers the time needed to adjust for a nice close shave. Again be patient and you will notice a difference.
  2343. Ok so along with this shaver doing everything it says it's supposed to, it also doesn't irritate my skin when I use it as some electric shavers can. Only downside, I don't think the &#34;hygiene status&#34; is legitmate. I think it is probably time based and doesn't actually know when it gets dirty and needs to be cleaned.
  2344. Major dissapointment with this purchase. I figured because it cost so much that Braun would live up to its reputation and deliver a good product. But now I know why the price is reduced over a 100 dollars over regular cost and now today I notice its even another 30 dollars cheaper. There is nothing worse than shaving, and then jumping in the shower and then feeling your face and then realizing you have to use a razor to get the job right. My 4 year old Panasonic does a better job and its worn out. This thing vibrates rather well but that heavy vibration does not translate into sharp hardworking blades producing a clean shave. In fact, I now finish the job with my Panasonic. As indicated in dozens of other comments, the huge charging station is not practical for travel or easy placement in the bathroom. The shaving head is so complex it collects and then deposits all the shavings all over the floor. Its constantly leaks the trimmings. All in all, a major fail on the part of Braun and it looks like men are going to have to wait a long while longer for a decent shaving product. What product goes from 300 to 200 to 170 in the course of a month.It is clear there are a thousand fake reviews on this product. This product has failed. If you dont believe me, disregard the dozens of fake reviews and sort all the reviews from worst to best. Look at the worst reveiews. Those are the genuine rewies. Sighhhh....
  2345. This is a high quality shaver. The issue that others have with the cost of the cleaning fluid and battery is real, if you put the shaver into the stand after each shave. Batteries have finite recharges, and placing the shaver each day into the charger will cause the battery to fail much too quickly. Secondly, the cleaning fluid is alcohol, so it will simply evaporate. And so while it's really good ad cleaning, it's also an ingenious marketing device to get recurring revenue.<br /><br />Instead, here's what to do: clean and charge the shaver, take the fluid back out, replace cover, use until battery empty, then put the fluid back and place shaver back in charger. In between, after each shave take off the screen and shake out the hairs. I've only had the shaver for 4 months and had to recharge 3 times, with the fluid still working great (if you don't take it out you would have to have replaced it twice already). After 4 months it's too early to make a final judgment, but so far so good. 4 stars only because a piece of the screen came off and I had to repair it.
  2346. I read some fantastic reviews for this shaver. And now that I own it and have used it, I wish they made these twenty years ago so I could have avoided all of those single edge razor burn shaves that were, at times, very irritating to my face. This is actually a pleasure to use. I no longer agonize about having to shave in the morning, it's so simple. The cleaning system is great. My only negative comment is the electric cord plug should have a 90 degree end so the cord does not protrude from the wall. I am highly recommending this shaver.
  2347. I am not happy with this \\"top of the line\\" shaver. It does shave quite well, but the shavings fall out so I have to lean over the sink to use this. And I dont mean just a little bit, a substantial amount comes out. I have ensured that the top is on properly, and its as secure as it can be. If I am doing something wrong someone please let me know, otherwise I would never recommend this item.
  2348. I find every time I have to shave, I have to keep going over, and over the same spots on my face to clear ALL the hairs. And I don't have a thick beard, or mustache. Very frustrating, and sometimes leads to skin soreness. Not thrilled with it, and considering how expensive it is, I would NOT recommend it
  2349. best electric razor I ever owned, however a bit expensive. If it lasts 5 years it is a good product

  2352. I only wish I had discovered the Braun Series 7 earlier. I had been using Gillette manual razors ever since I started shaving--Mach III, Fusion Proglide, etc. They worked fantastically-well: simplicity combined with a close shave. However, once I started to need to shave every day (guess those unkempt college days are over), I found myself loathing the 5+ minute routine every morning of lathering my face with shaving cream, washing the manual razor cartridge under the water every few strokes, and cleaning my face again thoroughly after shaving to avoid any residue shaving cream. And that led me to the Braun Series 7.<br /><br />I can now complete the daily shave-routine in under 3 minutes. That may not seem like much of a difference, but believe me, when you're trying to get out the door to catch public transportation into downtown in the morning, those few minutes help--any fan of the snooze button can certainly attest to that. And sure, the shave isn't as close as the manual razor, but it's 80-90% as close and definitely gets the job done. There's also no thinking about accidentally cutting yourself like you might with a manual razor. For the ultimate time-saver, this razor even cleans itself.<br /><br />Love this gadget, and would recommend it to anyone.

  2368. I suffer from ingrowns and razor bumps so I did some research, and came up with this device. Honestly, this is the best move I've made, in an effort to tame ingrowns and razor bumps. Simple glides with light pressure and you will get an unbelievably close shave for an electric, I couldn't believe my eyes- or my skin for that matter. It looked like I spend an hour trying to get every hair off my face with a blade, when in reality it took me 10 minutes total with this one electric. Unbelievable.<br /><br />I owned a Series 5 previously, which was ok, but I'd have to follow up the electric shave with some light double blade razor shaving for tough areas. I don't have to do that here, Series 7 cleans that area well enough to not have to follow up with a blade. It might appear to be the same as a series 5's head (which I had serviced to be the sharpest ever), but this device is clearly not the same, and far superior to what I used previously. The close competitor to this is a Panasonic that costs 2 times the cost of this Series 7, and does the same thing. This is your device if you're ethnic.

This particular model doesn't seem to last as long between cleanings but the cleaner it is the more effective the shave so I can't complain if I have to run the cleaner once a week or every other week.<br /><br />Don't get the Panasonic if you think it is as good for less money.   2411. I bought this to replace a Remington I had bought in a clearance isle. I used it for 2 years and liked I could run the head under the water and use it's cleaning system to dry it. I went through 4 blades in two years. They no longer sell the replacement blades and foils without going online to their website. I didn't like paying $10 shipping so I looked in to a new electric razor I could rinse under water. I found the Braun 7-790cc-4. The razor looks good and feels good in your hand. The cleaning system blows my old razor's out of the water. Very clean very quickly. The shave though surprised me. It was not as close as I thought it would be. Some days I shave twice. I never felt the need to do that with my old razor. I have been learning new ways to shave with it that has helped a bit. I started using my free hand to pull and stretch my skin to get a closer shave. It was not much better. I like to shave after I shower thinking it was making the hairs easier to cut. The instructions say shave before your shower. I tried that today and my face still feels pretty smooth and I have worked all day. I am going to try it again and see if a closer shave is as simple as doing it before a shower. With that being said I would probably buy it again if I had a choice due to the quality of the unit as a whole. It looks good, feels good, cleans up easy, and the shave is pretty good.
  2412. I am hesitantly giving this 5 stars so far. I alternate between a wet shave and dry shave. Started a long time ago using a rotary shave then 20 years ago. I switched to a Braun shaver and found it was highly superior to the rotary shavers but that is my preference. My old Braun started to die so my kids gave me this model for Christmas. After a week of use, here are my observations.<br /><br />The good, the shaver charges quickly, gives a good close shave. You do have to manipulate your skin like stretching and puffing out your cheeks. I also judge how good of a shave by how well it does around the neck and Adam's apple. So far, it has been working well and passed my test shaves. The new cleaner/charger works well and can judge when it needs to be cleaned. Something different from my last Braun shaving sytem. Takes the same cleaning cartridge as previous models.<br /><br />Now the bad, this has a very high pitched sound, both when using the shaver and when on the cleaning cycle. It is very loud too. It also vibrates as one of the features which gets a little getting used to. One other issue is the location of the trimmer. It is not in the best of locations and is quite close to the shaver itself. Very inconvenient.<br /><br />Regarding the cleaning cartridge. The cartridges are the same. Braun always recommends you shave prior to washing or cleaning your face. I have tried both prior to and after washing and I cannot tell the difference and feel it is a way to sell more cartridges. I still use Lectric Shave, more to allow the shaver to move a little more easily. The only other thing is it is pricey even with purchasing on Amazon. Amazon's price was still the best than anything local. Arrived quickly too.<br /><br />Still, overall, it seems to work very well. I would recommend this shaver.

In order to make the cleaning solution last I clean it every fourth shave in the solution, but release the blades and tap the cutter on the sink to knock the loose stuff loose each use. The solution it shipped with lasted me months.
  2447. I was surprised.....Its an OK shaver, but not for its price.   2459. Thirty years ago I received and electric razor as a gift, used it a handful of times before throwing it out and declaring I would never use one again. My shave regiment was in the shower, hot towel on the face, followed by shaving cream and a Gillette Mach 3 razor. Over the past couple of years I started nicking myself in a couple spots. A few weeks ago I nicked myself on the chin before an event and I could not stop the bleeding. I did not have styptic pencil handy and it took forever to stop the bleeding. That night I decided to look into electric razors and found that there were a few electric razors that had a large following of loyal users. After doing my due diligence I settled on the Braun Series 7 and boy am I glad I did! I was surprised at how well this shaver worked!!! There are a couple of spots on my neck that are tough to get, but after a few tries mission accomplished!!! I think my wife likes this razor as much as I do because gone are the days where I have rough stubble from a few days growth. N
  2460. great, love it. best offer
  2461. I moved up from Braun Series 5 550cc, and there is a night and day difference! The 550 is pretty good, but the 790 is just plain awesome! I'm able to shave closer, and more quickly than my previous shaver. I found the 550 had a harder time with difficult areas to cut on my face, like areas on my neck, where the 790 required 1 or 2 quick passes.
  2462. Not as close as a straight razor or mechanical razor blade unless one is willing to spend @25 minutes which is too long for me. My purpose is not to eliminate every strand of hair from my face, . I noticed that electric razors are more effective if the skin is moist, it eliminate friction and permit the razor to glide and cut the hair. Here is how I engage in this:<br />I use a Clarsonic Mia 1 face brush and a cleaner and scrub my face clean and wash (generally when taking a shower). once my face is as dry as the Sahara Desert, I use Williams Lectric pre shave. I DO NOT wait until 15 seconds, I apply an amount to the sector of the face I wish to shave and immediately after applying, I shave employing the lowest or the medium setting, the Braun shaver literally glides over my face like a car driving on solid ice and it removes virtually all of the hair from that area. Then I repeat until my entire face is virtually hair free and wash the Electric Pre wash when finished. I get double my pleasure because as the pre shave starts to evaporate, it &#34;shocks&#34; the facial hair away from the skin, permitting me to further remove more hair.<br /><br />When the Braun is completely dry (alcohol will evaporate in several minutes), I employ compressed air such as one used to blow a chilled air from computer monitors (cleaning duster / Blow of duster - to remove dust from computer related devices) which removes 100% of the hair from the Cleaner, the cleaning solution will not accomplish this entirely. I engage in this every time I shave. Then one a week, I clean the Braun in the provided cleaning solution that came with the Braun shaver. I save on the cleaning solution this way and instead of using water to remove the hairs from the shaver, compressed air is more efficient.

  2467. I am enormously pleased with this product! The Braun Series 7-790cc is a perfect example that Braun continues to make advanced quality razors. This razor is truly \\"Top-of-the-Line\\" in features, and it most definitely produces a desirably smooth, close shave. I like the totally redesigned shape. The handle is well constructed with an \\"Easy-to-Hold\\" fit made especially for your hand's grip. The Liquid Crystal Display is easy to read. A real plus to this razor is that the razor blade and shaving foil are constructed into one high performance unit. The combined razor/foil head is easily removed, and this new design makes cleaning a snap. Plus, this razor's head makes shaving a two or three day old beard practically effortless. I have a Braun razor that I have been using for more than 20 years. It is so old that I can no longer purchase a replacement rechargeable battery for it. The old razor still works as good as new with the exception that it is only operational by using the electrical cord. If this Braun Series 7-790cc razor holds up for me as long as the old Braun has, I will be in my 90's. If you have never had an electric razor before, making Braun your first choice is the right way to go. Braun is a longtime respected razor for quality. I had my first one in Germany when I was in the Army in 1975. Braun is a GREAT BUY and WELL WORTH your money.
  2468. Only have used it a few times but it is far better than my 3 foil Norelco. I bought my Norelco about a year ago to replace my 8 year old 7 Series Braun. I basically disliked the Norelco from day one, but kept giving it a chance. I finally bought this 790 Braun and have been very please. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the way Braun is trying to promote sales of their cleaning solution by having you clean your razor daily. The first time I used my razor the display said it was at 75% on the hygienic sensor. So I took off the head and completely cleaned it with water and a little soap and it was still at 75%. I plan to ignore that sensor and clean it weekly with the cleaning dock and charge at that time also. Other than than small complaint (more of a disappointment in Braun) it's a great razor.

  2471. For over thirty years I've tried it all. Single, double, triple blades. Blades that vibrate, blades that have to be sharpened and stropped, blades that are disposable, blades in a cartridge, blades in a safety razor. Shave in the shower or shave before the shower or shave after the shower. And electrics? Rotary heads that are dry and those that squirt a lubricant. Foil heads (most that were Brauns). I have even tried a gamut of shave creams, gels, oils and lather you whip up in a mug. Over the years I have gone back and forth between electric and blade.<br /><br />All I have ever wanted was a fast, clean shave. No fuss, no muss. This is it. A fast, clean and close shave in under five minutes.<br /><br />The self-cleaning feature is terrific. The base tells me when to clean the shaver, usually once a week. I have only gotten half-way through the first cleaning cartridge and I've been using the shaver for over three months.<br /><br />Believe what you will from all the reviewers that say it's a terrible shaver, not as close as a blade, too hot, too loud, not easy to hold, too expensive, leaves a rash, and cuts up your face. I have experienced none of these things and I know I have a thick, tough beard and fairly sensitive skin.<br /><br />Seriously, this is the fastest, cleanest and closest shave I've ever had.

  2479. Lots of razor choices out there but if you want the best for your money, and this Braun takes a lot of money, then a 790cc is the way to go.<br /><br />The most significant improvement in electric shaving I have had in many years. As the saying goes, Baby-butt smooth with little to no effort. If your face is used to the Braun Foil Shaver, go right for the high/fast setting and enjoy a nice smooth shave in less time with less \\"leakage(you know, those little beard crumbs that fall out of the head)\\" in the sink. Yes, leakage is about the only complaint I had from previous Braun razors. Now, with the 790cc, there is hardly any noticable even after a full three day weekend of beard to blaze through Monday morning.<br /><br />I have had this razor for two weeks and have yet to find a flaw or any detractions. The body is comfortable to hold, has enough grip to not get dropped yet is not so grippy that it takes two hands to flip it or spin it for better presentation to the skin.<br /><br />So far, as near a perfect electric razor as I have found.<br /><br />I was considering going to scrape razors because my old Bruan was \\"biting\\" me and I couldn't find any holes in the Foil. That and the \\"leakage\\" was enough to make me want to give up on the whole electric razor thing after 30 years. I am completely pleased with the 790cc experience and will once again be an electric(Braun ONLY) devotee for the foreseable future. Nothing like it for speed, closeness, ease(cleaning and chargin happen in same stand), and overall enjoyment of one of the most tedious parts of being a man, SHAVING. Makes quick work of it and you are on your way!!
  2480. Wow, this razor is idiot proof. I used to cut my face to smithereens using the Norelco electric shaver that had the lotion dispenser in it. This makes my face baby smooth each and every time I use it. No red marks, no cuts, just a smooth face.<br /><br />It has a trimmer as well that slides out to even up your sideburns.<br /><br />The cleaning system is great. Put the shaver in the holder, push a button and it's done cleaning in around 30 minutes (time varies due to how clean the razor says it is - all digital readings). You don't have to use the cleaning system every day, but I do. The cleaning solution is an extra expense that will need to be purchased around every 8 weeks, but it leaves your razor clean and smelling like lemons every time.<br /><br />Only thing I have to remember is to shave before I jump in the shower, which is what's the recommended use.<br /><br />Comes with a travel case for the razor (not suggested moving the cleaning station, the cleaning solution would spill out of it.) But you can take the charging cable with you to directly plug into the shaver (otherwise, you have about a 50 minute shave charge, I believe). You can disconnect and wash the razor head under water if you aren't using the cleaning station.<br /><br />It's expensive, but it's worth every penny. I love this thing.

  2487. Please understand that I have used electric shavers for 15 years, so, I am not a novice, neither am I someone who has no idea what they are talking about when it comes to a close, non-irritating shave.<br /><br />For years I have used Panasonic products and have been very satisfied. Panasonic shavers can be used either dry or wet in the shower. I have heard so many great review about the Braun Series 7-790cc, I decided to purchase one and give it a try. Well, not only was the Braun shave not anywhere near as close as my previous Panasonic ES-8228 (which is a 5 year old shaver), but the Braun also tore up my face with minor to medium irritation. I used the Braun for several weeks with no improvement in the shave or face irritation. Granted, I do have sensitive skin. However, having sensitive skin is no excuse for Braun producing a product that is not up to par with other shavers with equal standards and value.<br /><br />So, I returned my Braun 790cc for a complete refund (thank God) and purchased a Panasonic ES-LV61-A in its place. The Panasonic is a far superior shaver. As a matter of fact, the Braun is not even in the same league with the Panasonic when it comes to producing a very close, actually razor close, shave that is non-irritating.<br /><br />Now, I realize there are some who will say they do not want the Panasonic because it shaves better, wet, and many do not want to use shave gel or cream. Well, I shave wet with the Panasonic and do not use gel or cream either. I use a wonderful product called Shave Secret which can be purchased right here on Amazon at many participating stores. I have used this product for years, and when it is used with a top of the line Panasonic Wet/Dry shaver like the ES-LV61-A or the ES-LV81-K, the result is the closest, most comfortable, non-irritating shave that can be achieved.<br /><br />So, if you are a current Braun fan, or are one who is considering the purchase of a Braun shaver, my advice is to give Braun a pink slip, get rid of your Braun, and try a Panasonic. Yes, the price is slightly higher, however, once you try a Panasonic with some Shave Secret and just use a few drops of water to dampen your face......well.....you will never use a Braun again.<br /><br />The Braun is over rated due to the reputation of its shavers from over ten years ago. Braun, in my opinion, has failed to keep pace with technology and the 790cc is no longer a relevant, competitive product when compared against the Panasonic. My advice. Fire Braun and hire Panasonic. You will be much happier.k slip, get rid of your Braun, and try a Panasonic. The Braun series 7 is without a doubt the most progressive and finest shavers on the market. Truly a German masterpiece. I have also found that Amazon has the cleaner liquid from a company to cut down on the expense of the costly cartridges. Here is the link to it here on Amazon: [[ASIN:B00CMQZFJG B00CMQZFJG]]<br /><br />The system cuts close without irritation and is very quiet in doing so. I rarely get a pulled or yanked hair either. Only if you shave fast across your face and hit a longer hair will it yank it. Otherwise, you take your time and do smooth strokes. The result......a very close and fine shave. If you are like me and constant razor burn from disposable razors the electric shaver may be your answer. They have come so far in the past decade that they are not your father's electric razor!<br /><br />I do recommend replacing the foil cutter every 1.5 years.   2516. I ordered this monster from Amazon. Got delivered fast and reliable. Tried it out and it works like a charm. Absolutely a super machine.<br /><br />But you have to buy the cleaning fluid at least every 8 weeks. You have to change the shaving machine head at least every 18 month. You have to be very carefull with placement of the clean station as it is filled with dangerous fluid that can ignite. You are not recommended to move the cleaning station after inserting fluid as it can tip.<br /><br />Besides that its pretty easy to use and the self cleaning works like a charm.<br /><br />If you get too long stubbles you have to use the trimmer first and then shaver but thats okay. Some times the shaver has problems getting the tiny hairs at the jawline, maybe because the size of the shaver head is a little big.<br /><br />Enjoy as I am enjoying my gift from my girlfriend.<br /><br />Ps.   2517. Very smoot shaving, easy to use, I will recommend it, reasonable price, no irritation after shaving even after the first time.
  2518. I was nervous after reading some of the negative reviews but my old Braun Activator 8585 that I'd been using for 8 years just wasn't working as well any more, even with meticulous maintenance (regular foil cutter replacements and frequent cleaning using the Braun fluid). It was definitely time to replace it.<br /><br />I decided to go for the Series 7 since it should be a similar experience and I might not need a full 2-3 weeks to get used to it. I figured if it didn't do well, I could always return it and try something else.<br /><br />I charged it today just long enough to use it, and my first impression was - WOW. I always liked my 8585 but this really blows it away. There is a much greater degree of flex and movement to the foil and it gave an outstanding close shave under conditions where my 8585 would not have worked very well. I also thought it was quieter and vibrated less than the 8585 - it was much more comfortable to hold and use overall.<br /><br />Based on the first experience with it right out of the box, it is a worthy replacement for my trusty old 8585 and if I get half as much useful life out of it, I'll be thrilled.<br /><br />I do plan to keep it well-stocked with the Braun cleaning cartridges and replace the foil/cutter on schedule every year. I know the cost of ownership is rather high with this line, but it still beats the price of the 3-blade cartridges I was burning through with regular blade shaving, and I never get any razor burn or serious irritation with these Brauns.

  2564. I bought this as a replacement for an aging Braun 8595 that I got back in the early 2000's (it's still kicking strong!) and I have been very impressed with the big jump electric shaving has taken over the last decade.<br /><br />Pros<br />- It is a lot quieter than previous versions and other similarly priced electric shavers, but it's still loud enough that someone outside the bathroom can hear it even when the door is closed.<br />- Feels very solid in the hand (like a premium product), has a great grip, and is easy to maneuver around the face.<br />- The trimmer works great for cleaning up around the edges and for cutting down sideburns. Big plus for me is that it pops up away from the main body of the unit so it's easier to use.<br />- The battery life is absolutely fantastic. I've been using it for just about 2 weeks every morning and it's still showing me there's a bit left (I take about 4-5 min a shave). If you get a full charge in you can rest easy in case you forget the charger over a long vacation.<br />- Does a much better job at trimming down hair under the chin and on the neck than other electric shavers I've tried.<br />- Is water-sealed so you can use it with shaving cream etc. and clean it easily by just running it under a hot tap instead of having to buy those Braun cleaning/charging station refill packs.<br />- Walk away every morning feeling like I got a great shave in (was definitely not true before with other models I've tried).<br /><br />Cons<br />- Pricey shaver compared to its competitors like the Sensotouch 3D (which I was cross-shopping with).<br />- Pricey upkeep if you plan to use the cleaning cartridges for the cleaning/charging station (but you don't need them to clean it).<br />- Arguably you can be better off with the 760c over the 790c since you get the same basic shaving performance.<br />- Takes at least a few days to \\"break in\\" and get used to how to use it (don't give up hope if it's not 100% at day 1).<br />- Takes a while to full clean the shaver on a \\"full\\" clean through the cleaning/charging station.<br /><br />Overall this shaver purchase is definitely one of the best I've made and I have no regrets. Whether this is better than rotary styled competitors (like the sensotouch 3d), I personally think it is. It's just a great shaver and using a foil-based shaver like the braun feels a lot more natural to me than the triple-blade rotary styled ones. Is the 790c worth is over the 760c? If you don't need the extras like a well-made travel bag, silver color scheme, or the nicer back-lit readout then maybe not. I personally do like the nice travel bag and got a great deal through amazon on the 790c so I went for it.<br /><br />The Braun simply isn't going to cut as close as a standard non-electric blade shaver. But what it can do is give you a pretty great shave that's pretty close to a blade, and save you lots of money down the road on replacement blades, shaving cream, etc. My last Braun lasted me nearly a decade and I have no reason to doubt that this one will do even better.ull clean the shaver on a \\"full\\" clean through the cleaning/charging station.<br /><br />Overall this shaver purchase is definitely one of the best I've made and I have no regrets. Whether this is better than rotary styled competitors (like the sensotouch 3d), I personally think it is. It's just a great shaver and using a foil-based shaver like the braun feels a lot more natural to me than the triple-blade rotary styled ones. Is the 790c worth is over the 760c? If you don't need the extras like a well-made travel bag, silver color scheme, or the nicer back-lit readout then maybe not. I personally do like the nice travel bag and got a great deal through amazon on the 790c so I went for it.<br /><br />The Braun simply isn't going to cut as close as a standard non-electric blade shaver. But what it can do is give you a pretty great shave that's pretty close to a blade, and save you lots of money down the road on replacement blades, shaving cream, etc. My last Braun lasted me nearly a decade and I have no reason to doubt that this one will do even better.

Unlike older Brauns, you don't need to push a lock button after setting it in the base - you just set it and push the power button. Good design and performance improvements.

  2581. I am pleased with this series. It gives a comfortable shave. The heads float well and as long as you do not push too hard into your face, it does not get too hot and remains comfortable. As a hint I had received, with a rotary electric shaver, move the head in circles. With a oscillating shaver like this one, you should move it in straight lines. I am able to hear the stubble cutting with this unit which is contrary to other reports I had read. The pop out trimmer is in a bit of an odd location for visibility reasons, but you learn how to adjust to that. The only down side is the care necessary when shaving up to (but not into) any beard/goatee you may have. Moving this razor along the edge of the goatee with the edge of the blade, you will snag and pull a hair or two. You QUICKLY learn, shave up to it...much more comfortable. The charging and cleaning system works well too. Knocking out trimmings from the head is a little more difficult than older models due to the more complex design which captures trimmings within cavities. The cleaner system cleans those areas well though.
  2582. For the price, and with all of the fantastic reviews on Amazon, I expected the Braun Series 7 to be the best electric shaver I've ever used. It definitely is not. The problem is, it's just terrible on the neck. I've tried everything over the last year -- softer, harder, up, down, side-to-side -- and nothing has improved the poor results. I even replaced the (expensive) shaver screen/blade before it was due to be replaced. This is just too high priced of a razor to produce such average -- and below average below the chin - results.<br /><br />Update: I tried another highly-rated electric razor and results were even worse. Maybe it's time for me to accept that the problem is me, not the razor technology. Anyway, I gave this another star as it probably is better than most others, even if it's not perfect for me.
  2583. Amazon has best price on this shaver. Nice shaver gives close shave no burning face feeling. Nice sideburn or mustche trimer. Sits in home station and cleans head with a cleaner for a always new and fresh smelling feeling.Best electric shaver I've ever tried.
  2584. I got this for my husband for Christmas. He loves it. It shaves much closer than his Remingtom shaver. The automatic cleaning is fantastic. Plus on vacation, he can take the adapter cord and use it.
  2585. Have been a primary blade shaver (multi-blade)only using an electric rotary shaver on few occasions years ago. It was a miserable experience feeling like each hair was being plucked out. Even using a blade, shaving around my chin is tough and thick and sometimes painful. Like cutting coarse sandpaper, you men know what I saying.<br /><br />THIS ELECTRIC RAZOR HAS BEEN AMAZING!!!!! Shaves REALLY close with no pull, I repeat, NO PULL whatsoever, including my chin. So quick. So smooth. Almost as clean as against the grain with a blade. I treat it like a blade, similar technique and shave pattern. I make one pass, flip over and make second slower pass. Works well for me. A few minutes while shower heats up and I'm done. Touch up with razor on missed areas, as needed, still learning, but a DEFINITE must-have for me from now on. SO HAPPY TO HAVE IT!!!!!<br /><br />Self-clean is a dream, but I use it only once or twice a week. Rinse with hot water after each shave, using full clean cycle only after hygiene setting reaches red mark. I man-up my shaver, try to toughen it up so its not afraid to get a little dirty. Took others advice and remove cleaning cartridge after each use, re-seal and store it to prevent unnecessary evaporation of cleaning fluid. Keeps a charge really well.<br /><br />Decided to go with top of the line shaver, such a good deal and good reviews (70% 5-star) on Amazon. I do not regret it. Glad I made the investment. Pleasant, pain-free, close shave, hassle-free and quick. What more can you ask? No need for lathers either. No complaints. Worth every penny and then some to me.<br /><br />5-star recommendation.
