  2586. The recipient of this gift says this product is well designed, especially with adjustable shaving settings. Another great feature is the self cleaning. It is especially good for home or for travel use.
  2587. It feels nice, very sturdy, but I don't believe the shave received is worth the price. I have no problem dishing out the big bucks but if I do so, I want results. That being said, my main problem is my hair is pitch black and I'm pale-ish. So if this thing doesn't get as smooth as possible it shows on my face.<br /><br />Pros:<br />*Cleaning system works well<br />*Head is small enough to fit in 'stache area<br />*Easy to see and guide head of shaver<br />*Feels well built<br />*Decent to good shave in most parts of my beard<br /><br />Neutral:<br />*Cannot shave wet and the BRAUN 799cc WET/DRY MODEL IS COMING TO AMERICA THIS SUMMER Via/ BraunUS twitter personal response(only said summer, nothing specific). So save your money until then if you want the ability to wet shave and even if not, this should become cheaper when that arrives.<br /><br />Cons:<br />*Loud enough you need 2 shut doors between you and your sleeping housemates<br />*Unable to get neck/jaw hairs shaved (would call it a trimming)<br />*Alcohol smell was overpowering when shaving 'stache area (though enjoyable when further away from the sniffer)<br />*Trimmer is non-existent<br />*Cannot realistically manually clean<br />*Price is too high for just an okay shaver performance<br /><br />Overall, it isn't a bad piece of machinery, but I was lucky enough to buy this from Walmart so I could return it hassle free unlike amazon which will not accept it back due to alcohol cleaning solution. So I ordered the Panasonic ESLV81K and will update this with a comparison when I get to test that out as well. Like I said, I don't mind spending a lot if I get good quality. Hope that theory works...<br /><br />**************Braun 790cc vs Panasonic ESLV81K Comparison update*************<br />I'm going to compare over what I feel the most important features are. I thought this would be completely easy to decide the winner, but as I write this, I still haven't completely decided. So let me get started and I'll have to make my pick.<br /><br />Build Quality and Looks: Not much to say here, they both feel pretty solid. Braun \\"feels\\" better built as the Panasonic has more of a plastic feel to the outside. Panasonic seems to have smudges that I cannot get out from when I used shaving cream, makes the shaver look stained. Cannot rightfully compare that with the Braun since I cannot use shaving cream with it.<br /><br />Feel: I would say the Braun feels like its meant to fit in your hand better though the Panasonic is by no means bad.<br /><br />Loudness: ESLV81K is a good bit higher in pitch, which seems to just barely creep past my 2 shut doors to my sleeping girlfriend. The Braun 790cc cannot be heard with 2 doors between you and it. Its lower buzz is more enjoyable to my ears.<br /><br />Cleaning Station: The Braun's looks way better but the Panasonic's is easier to read and figure out for first timers. They both get the job done and the shavers come out as clean as when it was unboxed. Tossup here, can't decide which I prefer until I mention the cleaning solution.<br /><br />Cleaning Solution: I had to put this in a completely separate category because I don't feel the cleaning station of the Panasonic is by any means inferior to Braun's. Though the cleaning solution is just bad to me. I complained about the Braun's alcohol smell going up in my sniffer when doing the 'stache before but boy do I miss those days. the Braun 790cc comes out smelling lemony fresh and is so pleasant during 90% of your shave time and even then the alcohol smell isn't that bad near your nose. The Panasonic on the other hand, it smells so odd... Hard to describe better, smells soapy but not a good soapy smell. Like soap trying to cover up a mold smell. The more worn the Panasonic's cleaning cartridge is the less obtrusive the smell is though. But 100%, Braun cleaning solution is so much better on the senses. Though I would like to repeat, they both get the shaver clean!<br /><br />Manual Clean: I know Braun gives you a brush but they shouldn't, you cannot manually clean it, don't even bother. The Panasonic's manual cleaning is easy and probably as effective as the cleaning station. Heck, I would probably recommend people get just the shaver for the Panasonic.<br /><br />Now the important stuff, the shaving experience!<br /><br />***I use Lab Series For Men Electric Shaver Solution when Dry shaving.<br /><br />Trimmer: They both stink hardcore. Choosing between a turd and a pile of poo here. If forced I would pick the Panasonic's trimmer.<br /><br />3-Day Stubble: Braun did way better than I would have thought, just some jaw hairs needed touching up. Panasonic looked just as good as 1 day stubble shaving.<br /><br />Dry Shave Experience: Both are very comfortable, feel as though I end up with more red bumps and irritation with the ESLV81K but might just be the closeness and its only around my bottom neck. Braun gives me some around my neck/jaw probably from all the skin stretching I do around that area.<br /><br />Wet Shave Experience: Only Panasonic here, have I used it with cream? Yes, I won't say much about it because I don't like using cream with shavers because I think its messy but I will say it works. I use shaving gel, a little lighter and not quite as messy. With my gel (Eshu, had to throw the brand name in there, I love their stuff), the Panasonic glides effortlessly and gets a pretty close shave. I would say it's only slightly closer than a dry shave.<br /><br />Handling: I NEED TO SAY THIS BECAUSE I WAS WORRIED A LOT BY IT! The Panasonic's 5 blade head is not as big as it looks and it fits in my 'stache area with ease. The big head doesn't off-balance the device in your hand and the maneuverability of the head is admirable. I might say it is too maneuverable and you may need to put the lock on to press down harder to get an area. The Braun feels even better though, probably because the Panasonic moves left to right as well as up and down which I feel is overkill.<br /><br />Shave Speed: Holy cow, Panasonic just destroys my facial hair. Cheeks and upper lip only need 1 pass most of the time. Neck requires an extra pass or two. Braun requires a lot more face stretching which adds up. The 790cc also needs a minimum of 3-4 strokes at one spot, the Panasonic is just way faster.<br /><br />Shave Closeness: That unholy patch of neck/jaw hair my Braun couldn't get was shaved closer by the ESLV81K but not as good as I hoped. Would have to say besides that, the difference isn't huge. Panasonic is just a little closer everywhere.<br /><br />Am I required to pick a winner? Ugh, I think I may return my ESLV81K and hope the Braun 799cc does indeed come out this summer or the 790cc hits a big sale here on Amazon. I said the Braun wasn't worth the price but the Panasonic isn't either. Add the replacement heads of the Panasonic which, as I write this, are currently on backorder and are over $80 for the combo foil and blades! The Panasonic cleaning cartridges are cheaper in the long run but nowhere close enough to make up for the replacement heads.<br /><br />My winner comes down to the one thing I didn't want it to, price... Even if you don't mind throwing around money, the boost in shave quality with the Panasonic is so minimal that it's not worth $100 more than the Braun. Let me finish by saying, I would be keeping the Panasonic if the Braun's cleaning solution didn't smell so very good.aun gives you a brush but they shouldn't, you cannot manually clean it, don't even bother. The Panasonic's manual cleaning is easy and probably as effective as the cleaning station. Heck, I would probably recommend people get just the shaver for the Panasonic.<br /><br />Now the important stuff, the shaving experience!<br /><br />***I use Lab Series For Men Electric Shaver Solution when Dry shaving.<br /><br />Trimmer: They both stink hardcore. Choosing between a turd and a pile of poo here. If forced I would pick the Panasonic's trimmer.<br /><br />3-Day Stubble: Braun did way better than I would have thought, just some jaw hairs needed touching up. Panasonic looked just as good as 1 day stubble shaving.<br /><br />Dry Shave Experience: Both are very comfortable, feel as though I end up with more red bumps and irritation with the ESLV81K but might just be the closeness and its only around my bottom neck. Braun gives me some around my neck/jaw probably from all the skin stretching I do around that area.<br /><br />Wet Shave Experience: Only Panasonic here, have I used it with cream? Yes, I won't say much about it because I don't like using cream with shavers because I think its messy but I will say it works. I use shaving gel, a little lighter and not quite as messy.   2591. I bought this razor to replace my 5 year old Braun 8595. I’ve been putting off the upgrade because I kept reading mixed reviews of this new Braun 790. My preference is the Braun style compared to the Norelco style so I want to get that out of the way.<br /><br />I unboxed the unit and I must say that Braun does a first class job packing this unit. Everything was perfect although the unit did not have any charge upon opening. Also, Braun only provides 1 cleaning solution. For the money there should be 2 or at least some coupons, but this is a minor complaint.<br /><br />I charged the unit for about an hour and then I started my first shave. My expectations were low, but my 8595 was starting to fail. It usually takes me about 10-15 minutes with the 8595 to complete a shave. I started to shave and I immediately noticed the difference. The new razor cut effortlessly and quickly. I finished my shave in about 6 minutes. It reached all areas of my face even the difficult neck region. The shave was the closest I have ever experienced from an electric razor. In fairness, I have older blades on the 8595, but it never shaved this close with so little effort.<br /><br />I absolutely love the Braun 790. I only wish I purchased it sooner and Amazon has the best price available as well.
  2592. My facial grows really quick and is very dark that makes me always seem to have a five o'clock shadow. With my quick growing hair I also have sensitive skin so that using regular disposable razors (mainly Gillette) would cause &#34;razor burn&#34;. I have always used Braun electric shavers as it really helps with my sensitive skin as using this on my face feels pretty good. The foils on this shaver don't irritate my skin in any way no matter what angel or direction I'm shaving in. Don't really have to press this shaver to hard to your face as it gives a nice close shave. The LCD on the razor is a nice touch as it informs you easily with the &#34;hygiene&#34; status of your shaver and battery life remaining. The &#34;Braun Clean & Renew System&#34; is great as I love having my shaver cleaned for me quickly with just a press of a button also the cleaning solution is easy to replace in the unit.<br /><br />Some of the negatives I have with this is that the shaver is really loud. There are 3 settings on this shaver based on your skin type and with my senstive skin I have it on the middle setting for my face and lowest for my neck though is loud in comparison to its older models. Also the cleaning of the shaver itself from the &#34;Braun Clean & Renew System&#34; is REALLY LOUD. I really hate how loud it is as it can be heard from a good distance in the house. So keep this in mind if you wake up really early to go to work or whatever to not push the clean button maybe until you get home as to not wake up anyone else in the house as I find this to be annoyingly loud. Last thing I don't care for is the &#34;Precision Long Hair Trimmer&#34; that is designed to trim your sideburns as it doesn't cut very well at all.<br /><br />Overall I really like this shaver as it is perfect for my sensitive skin as well as my thick facial hair. It gets the job done and provides me with an excellent close shave without any discomfort. I RECOMMEND this shaver to those that want a great shave without any hassle of clean up and &#34;razor burn&#34;.e without any hassle of clean up and &#34;razor burn&#34;.
  2593. Provides a smooth, close shave! Which is the most important aspect of this or any shaver.<br />Added perks that I like is the cleaning system. There are indicators on the shaver for battery charge and cleaning. Drop it in the base and with the push of a button it does its thing. Walk away and its ready for the next time.<br />Unlike other systems I've owned, the cleaning solution is in a self contained unit and doesn't evaporate away too quickly. It lasts about three months before you need to install another cleaning solution tank/cartridge. Hey so much easier and less messy!<br />Love it!
  2594. Over the years Braun has steadily been improving the closeness of the shave and the 790cc is a definite improvement over prior models. The cleaning system works well and with subscribe and save from Amazon I don't have to worry about running out of cartridges.<br /><br />The only slight annoyance is how bright the blue light is on the shaver when it's in the cleaning base -- it really lights up my bedroom from the master bath at night so I end up having to close the door which I wouldn't otherwise.<br /><br />Overall, I highly recommend this shaver.

  2607. I had an older version of the Braun 500 series for 12 years. I used it until the charger literally broke and would not charge/clean anymore. I loved the razor and decided to upgrade but stick with the Braun. After researching I landed on this one and have not been disappointed. Although I am not a super hairy guy, I've been impressed with the quality of shave it gives. It's shaves better than my straight blade does (when shaving with teh grain) and its' very easy to use. The clean and charge station is easier and a WAY better design than the older version that required you to press down and lock in the charging arm to charge through the bottom of the razor. This one sits in the cradle easily and has no moving part to break like my old one. It also has a great built in digital gauge to tell you how much charge is left in the razor, and how &#34;sanitary&#34; it is. This helps guide you whether you are in need of a cleaning or not. I tend to let it go through a cleaning cycle daily because I like having a clean fresh razor with each shave, but for those that would rather replace the cleaning solution less often, this helps you gauge whether you want to clean it or not. Also has a quick clean option that will quickly clean it up for you in a pinch, though not as thoroughly.<br /><br />Overall I love this razor, and assuming it holds up as my old one did, will likely have it for another decade to come!
  2608. UPDATE 12-19-2012<br />------------------------------------<br />I've since changed over to the Panasonic Arc 4 and have not looked back. It's really night and day in my opinion. I feel that the Arc 4 gets a much closer shave and does it quicker than the 790cc. I liked the 790cc when I had it but I feel that the Arc 4 is way better.<br /><br />UPDATED to 3 stars...<br /><br />------------------------------------<br /><br />I've had this shaver for over two years now and have been generally happy with it. Several years ago I ditched my mach 3 and went with an electric for every day use. I just find it to be more convenient, not having to deal with shaving cream/etc every day. In any case, I have really liked this shaver in comparison to my old panasonic. The cleaning system can be a little loud and it can take some time to go through the cycle so be prepared if you happen to turn it on at night. Just when you think it's done cleaning, you'll probably hear it start buzzing again, especially if it hasn't been cleaned in a while. The cleaning unit seems to know how long it's been between cleanings, not necessarily how dirty your shaver is. I travel a lot for work mon-thurs and every time I come home it is always on the intense clean mode when I set it back in the charger even if I actually cleaned my shaver under water when I was away from the cleaning base. Since there is no way that I know of to change the cleaning setting this can be a bit annoying. Also, as far as cleaning goes, I usually find that one cleaning cartridge will last a few months before you have to replace it. For what it is, I personally think that the cleaning cartridges are too expensive. They do seem to get the job done though as every time I replace a cartridge, the old one is always full of hair.<br /><br />Anyway, the shaver is a very good shaver, I find that I can finish up shaving in less than a few minutes. Also, the battery lasts a very long time. I've been away from home for more than 2 weeks at a time and the battery has yet to run out on me when I'm away. The other nice thing is that this shaver comes with a hard plastic case for the shaver that's not too bad. After several years of use and probably more than 100 trips with this thing though, the case and the shaver are starting to show their age. The case is showing its age as the locking mechanism isn't as tight as it used to be and the shaver itself is showing age as well as the silver paint is starting to chip off all around the top of the shaver under the head.<br /><br />All in all, this has been a great electric shaver for me. The problems I've had with the case, I suspect are normal wear and tear but the paint chipping I was not suspecting. Luckily the paint chipping has no impact on the shaving itself. This shaver should last me another year or so before I start looking for a new one. I took off one star because of the expensive replacement cartridges and the paint chipping...<br /><br />--- One thing to note... after the first year of use I changed the blade. It made a world of difference so make sure you follow the guidelines fairly closely to maintain a good shave!more than 2 weeks at a time and the battery has yet to run out on me when I'm away. The other nice thing is that this shaver comes with a hard plastic case for the shaver that's not too bad. After several years of use and probably more than 100 trips with this thing though, the case and the shaver are starting to show their age. The case is showing its age as the locking mechanism isn't as tight as it used to be and the shaver itself is showing age as well as the silver paint is starting to chip off all around the top of the shaver under the head.<br /><br />All in all, this has been a great electric shaver for me. The problems I've had with the case, I suspect are normal wear and tear but the paint chipping I was not suspecting. Luckily the paint chipping has no impact on the shaving itself. This shaver should last me another year or so before I start looking for a new one. I took off one star because of the expensive replacement cartridges and the paint chipping...<br /><br />--- One thing to note... after the first year of use I changed the blade. It made a world of difference so make sure you follow the guidelines fairly closely to maintain a good shave!

  2615. I'm actually not certain why folks give this less than FOUR stars. I considered five, but it's not quite there. I then ponied up and purchased this one.<br /><br />IN sum it works great.<br />I think one thing folks forget is that each time I (one) get(s) a new electric razor (about every 5 years it seems) there is a period of getting the face/beard used to the razor. I'm not sure why but that has been my experience. Once I used this razor for about a week or two all was really great. I get a nice close shave. This is now a deal. Highly recommend and changing my star rating. Only reason for the four star was the price. I do stand by my above that it's probably the best on the market, but my feeling was $250 for a razor mean I should expect something that is just WOW!. This razor is definitely worth the $170 and that is usually what I have paid for a good Braun. Not sure why others are giving it one start. I can see why some might give it three if they are not used to Bruans or do not follow my recommendation above. This price is very solid.

  2622. I've had the razor for 10 months now and it does give me a close shave. I used a Norelco for many years before buying this. I have a couple of gripes with this razor and the biggest is one I didn't have with my Norelcos. When I shave with this razor, I have to shave in different directions to get a smooth shave. One pass doesn't come close to getting it done. With my circular head Norelcos, this wasn't an issue.<br /><br />My second gripe is the \\"self cleaning\\" stand that comes with it. I still don't see what this does. It looks to me like the razor sheds most of your whiskers on your chest while shaving. I still have to open the razor head occasionally and blow out whiskers. The stand seems worthless.<br /><br />On the plus side, there's no need for preshave or after shave. My skin isn't the least bit irritated following a shave. The documentation didn't let me know that preshave was not supposed to be used. I found out about that after doing some web surfing. I assume it might damage the blades but who knows.<br /><br />If you're after a smooth shave and are willing to fork over some major change, this razor is a keeper. You just have to learn to be a little more patient when shaving.

  2630. This is a good shaver although it has some annoying design/feature aspects. It is a fine replacement for a broken older unit. If you are considering whether to upgrade a working shaver to the new model, I say no - save your money.<br /><br />THE POSITIVE ASPECTS:<br /><br />It provides a very good shave. Not much better, though, than an older series 8900 Braun. It does seem a bit smoother on the skin.<br /><br />The body of the shaver is narrower than older models and it is comfortable to hold.<br /><br />It is quieter than older models.<br /><br />The LCD display contains a multiple segment display to show battery charge. That seems to work well, although no better than the LED-based display on some older units.<br /><br />THE NEGATIVE ASPECTS:<br /><br />The packaging is terrible. What is the opposite of green - brown? Lots of Styrofoam and plastic. It could easily have been packed in cardboard that would be more green and easier to open.<br /><br />There is no plastic cap to cover and protect the shaver heads. Older units had this. Why does this $200 top-of-the-line shaver lack it? Who knows. So if you want to keep the shaver in a drawer where it may get knocked a bit then you will have to keep it in the case. You can just partly zip the case and it will hold the shaver while still being easy to take out the shaver for use. But the case takes up more space in the drawer than would the shaver alone. Silly and annoying design choice.<br /><br />This unit comes with a hygienic cleaner and recharger stand. If you use it, it solves the storage with no plastic head cap issues above. BUT: The cleaner/recharger is about 4x5 inches (10 x 13 cm) at the base. It takes a lot of space on the sink top and needs to be plugged in using the shaver's charger cord. It has a replaceable tank of liquid solution for hygienic cleaning. The tank lasts about one to two months according to the instruction manual. The refill costs $17.49 on Amazon. Are they crazy? Clean it either by rinsing the shaver head under hot water and drying it or by using the very small brush to clean the housing and shaking the head assembly on a paper towel. Recharge it with the recharger cord. Those instructions are also in the owner's manual.<br /><br />This unit's LCD display also has a 'hygiene' status display with multiple segments. According to the manual it indicates when the shaver is no longer clean and needs a cleaning in the above-mentioned cleaner stand. BUT: According to the manual the ONLY way to reset the hygiene display is to clean it with their expensive solution. The manual says that since cleaning with hot water is not as hygienic it will not reset the hygiene status display. AND once the shaver starts indicating on the LCD display that it needs a cleaning it will continue to blink at you. It seems the ONLY way to turn it off is to clean the shaver in their cleaner/recharger stand with their expensive cleaning solution. Pardon - this strikes me as a bit arrogant. I suppose a small piece of masking tape could hide the blinking display.<br /><br />The unit has a pop-up shaver for long hair - e.g. mustache or sideburn. It extends out a fairly good distance. But the pop-up shaver has a convex shape! It is curved outward in the center. Other than to look nice given the design of the shaver body this is a bit ridiculous. Shaving your sideburn is clearly easier with a flat-edged pop-up shaver!<br /><br />So, yes - it is a very good replacement for a failed unit. But it has some annoying aspects. And it certainly seems to have no attraction as an upgrade to an otherwise-working unit. The 760cc still has a battery charge indicator but no cleaner, and the 720s lacks both the charge indicator and cleaner. If I were repurchasing I might look closely at the 760cc.g the shaver head under hot water and drying it or by using the very small brush to clean the housing and shaking the head assembly on a paper towel. Recharge it with the recharger cord. Those instructions are also in the owner's manual.<br /><br />This unit's LCD display also has a 'hygiene' status display with multiple segments. According to the manual it indicates when the shaver is no longer clean and needs a cleaning in the above-mentioned cleaner stand. BUT: According to the manual the ONLY way to reset the hygiene display is to clean it with their expensive solution. The manual says that since cleaning with hot water is not as hygienic it will not reset the hygiene status display. AND once the shaver starts indicating on the LCD display that it needs a cleaning it will continue to blink at you. It seems the ONLY way to turn it off is to clean the shaver in their cleaner/recharger stand with their expensive cleaning solution. Pardon - this strikes me as a bit arrogant. I suppose a small piece of masking tape could hide the blinking display.<br /><br />The unit has a pop-up shaver for long hair - e.g. mustache or sideburn. It extends out a fairly good distance. But the pop-up shaver has a convex shape! It is curved outward in the center. Other than to look nice given the design of the shaver body this is a bit ridiculous. Shaving your sideburn is clearly easier with a flat-edged pop-up shaver!<br /><br />So, yes - it is a very good replacement for a failed unit. But it has some annoying aspects. And it certainly seems to have no attraction as an upgrade to an otherwise-working unit. The 760cc still has a battery charge indicator but no cleaner, and the 720s lacks both the charge indicator and cleaner. If I were repurchasing I might look closely at the 760cc.
  2631. This was my first electric shaver purchase. I attempted a lot of research on types of shavers rotary vs foil prior to purchase. So far this Braun gives a fairly close shave but does not get as close or long lasting shave as my twin or triple blade manual razor. Convenience of not being in front of a mirror is a plus. Overall good performance.

  2635. Quality at amazing price...
  2636. Coming from a Braun 7526. It lasted a month shy of either 8 or 9 years, hopefully this will have the same life. Shave has be closer and smoother, but takes a few more strokes than the old one even on the highest setting. Can't tell much difference between the middle sensitivity to the one above and below, but switching between high and sensitive has been pleasant. I'm still not settled on preference for the trimmer. Old style slid out, versus this popping out to close to 90deg from the unit and ~. Each has its pros and cons. New model allows much more visabillty and the slightly slimmer trimmer head allows much more versatility, especially around the mustache area. But the old style had more sheer cutting ability, could just use a full-size trimmer without a guard for that though if needed.<br />Cleaning system and is improved, and the auto-drying feature is great for those \\"oh, missed a spot\\" sections if you find one after putting it away.
  2637. When you have a 3-4 days old bristle to shave, you're up for a nasty surprise/painful shaving experience. It feels like a shaver's ripping out some of the hair from your face one by one.   2643. Came on time (one day only after shipping!)<br />I have been using manual razors for some time but turns out that they are very expensive to replace heads every few months. Was almost paying the price of electric shaver for manual heads replacement in a year. Decided to buy electric shaver and did my research that ended up buying Braun 790cc. After a couple of uses, I believe that I made the right decision. I have a tough beard and was really afraid that the shaver will not be able to make a close shave on my neck. I can finish a complete shave in less than 5 minutes with this shaver. Also, the cleaning station is really good. You do not have to worry about cleaning, just put the shaver back to the startion and push a button and it will take care of cleaning, lubricating and drying the shaver and is ready for your next use. Highly recommend!

  2647. This shaver was amazing the first time I used it. It provided the best refreshing and smooth shaving experience and skin feel I have ever had in an electric shaver. It felt like a precise medical instrument right off from the outset. I would go home at lunch just to use it it again. In the evening after work I could not wait to use it to clear off a half-day's growth to make my skin smooth again. At night, I set my alarm for various times to power it up just to experience the way it would smoothly glide across my face and skin. It was like having a face massage with fingers made of smoothly pulsing and vibrating highly precise cool blades across your skin.<br /><br />But that \\"WOW\\" feeling mysteriously disappeared after the first week... maybe the blades were used and broken in. Now, it's just a good shave, a good shaver, feels good, does its job very well, but that first week excitement is gone. I no longer schedule special times to use it just to feel its precise sculpting of my skin. However, it's still the best electric shaver I ever owned, and I would recommend the shaver to anyone. I just wish that new shaver experience would have lasted a longer time.

  2709. This is a fantastic electric razor. I previously had a Braun 390cc from the mid 2000s and the battery was finally shot. I was able to score a Philips Norelco 9300 on promotion but was hugely disappointed with that shaver. The build quality was subpar for such an expensive shaver and the cleaning station was a disaster (software bugs made it clean endlessly for hours and hours). I returned it and got the Braun 790cc. I should've got this to begin with...<br /><br />Update: The Braun has taken a turn for the worse. My Series 7 has made two trips to the repair depot because the cleaning station incorrectly senses the fluid level and thinks it's empty, when it is not. It refuses to run a cleaning cycle if it senses the fluid level is empty. Braun service replaces the cleaning station but, based on the numerous complaints online, it is clear to me that this is a fundamental engineering issue with the Series 7 and not an isolated case.<br /><br />Replacement foils are now very hard to find and prohibitively expensive. I wouldn't even consider investing in a new foil/cutter block because my Series 7 will soon be out of warranty. My feedback for Braun's engineering team would be to go back to basics and get rid of the complex electronic crap that breaks down and the customer won't be able to fix once it's out of warranty. You have lost a loyal customer.and the alcohol based formula leaves the shaver head sanitized and oil-free. I found the fresh lemon scent Braun uses to smell better than the cheap cologne scent Philips uses in the Norelco cartridges. I appreciate that after 10 minutes the lights on the cleaning station turn off.<br /><br />I expect this shaver to last as long as my old 390cc. Overall I'm very happy and will remain a loyal Braun customer so long as they continue to produce great quality electric shavers.

  2746. I did not expect this razor work for me. I made sure that the receipt and original packaging were in a safe place, because I was fully prepared to send it back before the 60 day trial period expired.<br /><br />I was cursed with a very heavy beard AND very sensitive skin. I've seen two dermatologists in my life, and they both advised me to grow a beard and to give up on any hope of finding an electric razor that would give me a halfway decent shave. I'm stubborn (and I can't tolerate beards), so I've tried electric razors every two years or so over the last 20 years, looking for an electric that might work. They have always been returned (with varying degrees of ease, depending on the manufacturer and the truthfulness of their guarantees). In order to get a decent shave with a razor, I must press hard enough to take off the top two layers of skin and slowly enough to avoid cutting myself or causing any ingrown hairs. It was a slow, painful process that I could only really endure about every other day.<br /><br />I was ready to give another electric a shot, and the Braun Series 7 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System got the best reviews for shavers under $300. The instructions say to use the razor for two or three weeks to give your skin time to adjust to an electric shaver. I thought this was just a ploy to trick people into not returning the razor in time to take advantage of the guarantee... it's not. The first two or three shaves weren't great. The next few were a little better. After about a week, I was stunned to find that I just given myself the first quick, effective and PAINLESS shave of my life. Maybe it just took me a few days to figure out how to use it properly, or maybe they were telling the truth and your skin really does need to adjust. It doesn't matter, I LOVE THIS RAZOR!!!<br /><br />I am now able to shave every day, even on weekends (a luxury I just figured I would never enjoy). I've been using it for over a month now, and I could not be happier with it. The cleaning system is nice, but only use it two or three times a week. I figure that even with changing the cassette every 18 months and replacing the cleaning fluid every month, I'm still going to be spending less than I did on blades. Even if it did cost more, it would be worth it for a FAST, SMOOTH shave that I can enjoy EVERY DAY!!!<br /><br />My only complaint would be that the trimmer feature is not great, but I don't imagine any built-in trimmer attachment could do a truly effective job. I'm still learning how to shave around my sideburns without getting them uneven, but there is a learning curve with anything. I cannot recommend this shaver highly enough, especially if you have a heavy beard and never thought you would get to enjoy a comfortable shave.pier with it. The cleaning system is nice, but only use it two or three times a week. I figure that even with changing the cassette every 18 months and replacing the cleaning fluid every month, I'm still going to be spending less than I did on blades. Even if it did cost more, it would be worth it for a FAST, SMOOTH shave that I can enjoy EVERY DAY!!!<br /><br />My only complaint would be that the trimmer feature is not great, but I don't imagine any built-in trimmer attachment could do a truly effective job. I'm still learning how to shave around my sideburns without getting them uneven, but there is a learning curve with anything. I cannot recommend this shaver highly enough, especially if you have a heavy beard and never thought you would get to enjoy a comfortable shave.

  2760. This time, I researched for days before deciding on this model, and we're both a little bit stunned. On the very first use, with no acclimation, he got an incredibly close shave with absolutely no irritation to his skin. It's been a couple weeks now, and he just loves this thing. Instead of putting off shaving for as long as possible, he's like a kid with a new toy.<br /><br />I thought the cleaning function sounded a little gimmicky, but it turns out to be another fantastic feature for guys like my husband who tend to be lax about maintaining their tools.   2782. I used a Braun 8585 for several years and I remember it doing a pretty good job. People complained about the newer foils and/or cutters, so I took their advice and stuck to the older ones.<br />I decided to try a less expensive shaver that could be cleaned using water at the beginning of 2011. I went with the Panasonic ES8103S. It seemed like it took longer to get a close shave than it did with the 8585, but I could get a very close dry shave in 10 minutes or less. The Panasonic had poor battery life and a poor trimmer. The battery life declined from lasting 4-5 shaves to 3 in around a year, but it did actually shave my face pretty well.<br />The Braun Series 7 is easily the worst shaver I've ever owned. It has good battery life and the trimmer seems like it will hold up for a while. As far as design goes, it's great. Those are the only reasons it gets 2 stars.<br />I haven't tried shaving for much over 10 minutes, but I still haven't gotten a close shave out of this razor in the 2 1/2 months that I've had it. I don't shave in front of a mirror. I never have with an electric and it's never been a problem. I've noticed that this shaver misses the area immediately below my sideburns, the area on the side of my jaw under my ear, and it's terrible above the lip and on the neck. I have a 5 o'clock shadow within about 3 hours of shaving. I've tried concentrating on areas to see if they get any smoother and that doesn't make much of a difference, especially above the lip. I've also tried using the different speeds. I can't tell much difference.<br />I have no idea how this is the highest rated shaver on the market according to the research I did. It might work well for people with thinner beards, but it is relatively ineffective for someone with a medium to thick beard. The Panasonic I tried is well under half the price of this one and it does its job. Buy a separate trimmer, if necessary, and charge it twice/week instead of once and you'll get a far superior shave.rior shave.
  2783. This Razor works great. The cost is a little high but well worth it. I would recommend this for anyone.
  2784. The product is very well, and the package is so well! Everything is good over my expectation. It can be used as a good gift!!
  2785. Love this razor. I agree with the majority of the folks who have reviewed this product and given it rave reviews. So I wont spend any of your time rehashing what others have already told you. Having had this model for a couple years and an earlier 7 series model for about 10 years, I have discovered a few tricks along the way that I thought that I would pass along.<br /><br />Cleaning: This is the most important thing when it comes to these shavers. I used to replace the cutters frequently on my old 7 Series. Once I started doing a better job of cleaning the shaver head, I found that they lasted for years and gave much better results (See tips below).<br /><br />Quality of Shave: I get great results from this shaver. I have what I would consider to be a fairly normal beard. The hair is not too thick nor too fast growing. I don't have a 5 o'clock shadow a few hours after shaving like some people do. So I think that it's pretty hard to say that this shaver or any other is going to perform well for everybody.<br /><br />Here are some tips that I hope will be helpful...<br /><br />1. I find that the best way to clean the razor is using compressed air. I have a small air compressor in the garage and I blow out the shaver head once a month. The shaver will feel like new again. I know that the average person may not have a compressor... But if you do, this is the very best way to clean the shaver.<br /><br />2. Always clean the razor head before you use the Clean & Renew system. If you don't, the reservoir can become pretty disgusting.I know it sounds crazy to say clean the shaver before you clean it... What I really mean is to remove the excess debris. Tap the base of the saver head on a hard surface and poke around with the brush that comes with the shaver to remove the as much of the hair as possible.<br /><br />3. You can find pretty good prices on Amazon for the Clean and Renew replacement cartridges... But it's still not a cheap date. Like the cartridges in an ink jet printer, the liquid will evaporate and you will have to frequently replace them. A neat trick that I have found can really reduce the frequency of replacement. New cartridges have plugs that have to be removed when installed. I now keep the plugs. I insert the cartridge, clean the razor, and then remove the cartridge and put the plugs back in. This prevents evaporation and greatly extends the life of the cartridge. In addition, evaporation concentrates the yucky residue. So preventing evaporation tends to keep the solution cleaner as well.<br /><br />4. When it comes to the quality of the shave... I have never had a better shave from an electric razor. That being said, I would agree with some reviews that state that the Pulsonic does not handle an extra day's growth as well as the older Braun models. I find it helps to make a first pass without pressing the razor tightly to the skin and then go back and do the finish cut so to speak.<br /><br />Hope this info helps perspective buyers.t printer, the liquid will evaporate and you will have to frequently replace them. A neat trick that I have found can really reduce the frequency of replacement. New cartridges have plugs that have to be removed when installed. I now keep the plugs. I insert the cartridge, clean the razor, and then remove the cartridge and put the plugs back in. This prevents evaporation and greatly extends the life of the cartridge. In addition, evaporation concentrates the yucky residue. So preventing evaporation tends to keep the solution cleaner as well.<br /><br />4. When it comes to the quality of the shave... I have never had a better shave from an electric razor. That being said, I would agree with some reviews that state that the Pulsonic does not handle an extra day's growth as well as the older Braun models. I find it helps to make a first pass without pressing the razor tightly to the skin and then go back and do the finish cut so to speak.<br /><br />Hope this info helps perspective buyers.
  2786. I just printed out my return sip to send this electric razor back to Braun. Real quick, here's what I found to be the issue and the advantages of this shaver:<br />--I thought after years of using a disposable razor, I would try out an electric one: convenience, cost, efficiency, less nicks...etc.<br />--I thought I would purchase a &#34;high-end&#34; electric razor, knowing that if I didn't like this one, well, I would probably not like the other ones<br />--The problems: charging unit light is so BRIGHT (too bright for a bedroom); there is no way to get to all the spots on my hairy face; useless when wanting to trim neck hairs (unlike a razor, that I can anywhere on my body); when it came in contact with my sideburns, it would 'pull' the hair(s) it came in contact with (meaning I had to place my finger as close to the hair line of my sideburns, and trim as close as I dare. I would then have to get out my disposable razor and finish-up the fine-tuning of a good, neat shave.); no matter how long I went over my face with this razor, I still missed spots; sometimes I would have to go over one little hair several times just to get it -- it was like a game<br />--The good things: It looks cool; not too noisy, although I would wait until your young kids and spouse are up; The cleaning system seems to work fine, but I was feeling like I didn't know exactly how clean the unit really was...; it charges quick, and holds the charge for a good amount of time; shipping it back was easy (so far), and the price for shipping was just under $10 (Braun requires you ship it back insured to MD)<br /><br />My suggestions:<br />1. Purchase it if you want to try an &#34;elite&#34; shaver solely b/c you can return it within 60-days<br />2. Don't purchase the extra cleaning fluid until you KNOW you love the razor (it comes with one container of fluid already)<br />3. Don't throw your old razor away -- you will need it for fine trimming and edging<br />4. Know that you have an outlet to plug the unit into where a light at night won't be bothersome (it can literally work as a nightlight)<br />5. Know that it isn't any quicker to use this shaver than it is to use a disposable razor, unless you are virtually hairless and can shave while driving (that's not me!)g the unit into where a light at night won't be bothersome (it can literally work as a nightlight)<br />5. Know that it isn't any quicker to use this shaver than it is to use a disposable razor, unless you are virtually hairless and can shave while driving (that's not me!)

But, basically because of some hazardous materials asterisk when my sister was purchasing it, they're refusing to exchange it, making me become an INDEPENDENT RESELLER just to get a gift that fits my needs. The killer was that a \\"hazardous materials representative\\" told me that if I had \\"moved faster,\\" they'd have taken it back--but I wasn't even in the country!<br /><br />So, my bottom line is, unless you're 100% sure with all your heart that you want this, just buy it from your local Walmart ([...]) or whatever superstore you prefer. That way, you can always exchange your unopened item if you come across something more fitting (or even decide a day later that you want an electric toothbrush instead!). Isn't that something you should be able to expect for an unopened item?

  2808. First I am a little bias as this is my 2nd Braun shaver with the last one lasting about 7 years with 2 head replacements. I must say that it gives a very close shave for an electric shaver and doesn't leave my sensitive facial area sore or irritated in any way. I know it may seem expensive but if you consider razor prices and that you will be using this almost every day of your life it is more than worth it! Close shave, no irritation and self cleaning is huge. The only thing I wish it had was a place to put the little brush for manual cleaning as they are easily lost. Plus I personally liked the way I could self clean my old one to help the cleaning cartridges last longer this one does not have that feature which can be good if you are lazy or bad if you are cheap and like to save where you can.<br /><br />Bottom Line - Best Electric Shaver I have ever used and have been recommending it to all my friends.

  2811. I've used this shaver for the last week. Setup was easy. All you do for the cleaning/charging stand is push a button to open it up, open up the plastic cartridge full of the cleaning fluid, slide it into the unit, and lock it down. The initial charge didn't take very long all. A couple of hours I think, but don't hold me to that because I wasn't keeping track. The razor itself came with the blade cartridge installed, so I didn't have to do anything to the razor itself. I haven't tried changing the blade cartridge yet. I'm sure there's another review here that does.<br /><br />As to the performance of the razor itself, this razor glides over your face like a hockey puck on the ice (in a good way). LOL! I had the razor set on the highest setting for the thickest beard. I didn't feel a thing. I actually had to run my hand over my face to convince myself that this thing actually cut any hair at all. Smooth as a baby's butt, even in the hard-to-reach areas. The spot trimmer (or whatever it's called), pops out of the side of the unit with the typical slide type switch. It's slightly inconvenient to use in that the razor head itself gets in the way of trying to see what you're trimming. But I can live with that. And I really can't see how else they could've done it.<br /><br />Although it wasn't necessary, I tried the cleaning cycle, after my first shave. The only thing I can really say about it (since I know the razor wasn't dirty yet...) Was that the cleaning cycle was loud. If you store this razor in a bathroom off your bedroom, I wouldn't suggest kicking off a cleaning cycle right before you hit the sack, especially if you have trouble falling asleep. I'd do it during waking hours. This is by no means a deal breaker. Buzzing coming out of the bathroom, I can handle.<br /><br />The razor also comes with a sturdy carrying case for travel. The case will hold the razor itself, and a cleaning brush, which they provide with the unit. I wouldn't recommend packing the cleaning unit for trip, as the fluid could spill out. (I think but I'm not sure. Somebody else chime in if you know better.) If you do need to take it with you, remove the cleaning fluid reservoir. I would suggest buying a new, unopened reservoir and packing that, to avoid any possibility of spillage in your baggage. It's also possible that the reservoir can be resealed with its original cover, but I don't know that either. Use your own best judgment.<br /><br />all things considered, a wonderful purchase. I may have to pick one up for dad.acking the cleaning unit for trip, as the fluid could spill out. (I think but I'm not sure. Somebody else chime in if you know better.) If you do need to take it with you, remove the cleaning fluid reservoir. I would suggest buying a new, unopened reservoir and packing that, to avoid any possibility of spillage in your baggage. It's also possible that the reservoir can be resealed with its original cover, but I don't know that either. Use your own best judgment.<br /><br />all things considered, a wonderful purchase. I may have to pick one up for dad.

  2820. I've been using Braun shavers for more than a decade. When my first Braun shaver finally took one drop too many and started limping a bit, I decided to replace it. That was the first Braun 7900, a joint effort with Gilette. I'll spare you the details, but it was a tremendous disappointment.<br /><br />With the current revision of the 790-cc, Braun has gotten back to its roots and delivered an incredible product that innovates the way you shave. I realize that sounds like an ad, but really, it does!<br /><br />Shavers have always had adjustable power levels, but this razor's lowest power setting is incredibly good for shaving sensitive areas like the neck where even at the lowest power in previous razor's I had a hard time with razor burn.<br /><br />The ergonomics of this razor are awesome, and there are a ton of other little refinements too. They've clearly been listening to their customers and have fixed a number of annoyances I had with previous models. Things like the hard plastic case for previous models which was brittle and prone to break has been replaced with a soft cloth/plastic case that provides protection and is sturdier.<br /><br />The self cleaning features of this razor work much better than the last model as well, which tended to have clumps of hair build up in the base that needed to be teased out by hand.<br /><br />Overall, love this product and would definitely recommend to anyone with sensitive skin or anyone who wants a really good, convenient shave. Definitely worth the investment.
  2821. I've owned a braun shaver for many years. I bought this new one becuase of the technology advances and good reports from other users. The 790cc is a huge leap in technology and better than any electric shaver I have ever used. It is ergonomicly friendly, easy to hold and use. It is powerful when needed and gives a very close shave. The new cleaning tank/reservoir is a bit awkward and has to many buttons, but that has nothing to do with quality of the shave. If you like quality equipment that lasts, buy a Braun 790cc.
  2822. I recently decided to switch back to an electric shaver. I've owned Braun in the past but that's not why I purchased this one. After comparing several brands and models on-line (pouring through ratings and reviews like the one I'm now writing), I settled on this model for my \\"Cadillac\\" shaver.<br /><br />The shave isn't as close as a razor (I haven't found one that is). But, it's darned close without the nicks and cuts. I didn't know if I would like the cleaning function. But, after several months, I have learned to really appreciate it. The foil and blades are kept fresh and I actually like using it better right after a cleaning cycle.<br /><br />I clean the shaver when it indicates a required cleaning cycle. I was concerned that I would be running through cleaning cartridges (I even purchased a 3-pack in anticipation). But, after 6 months of daily use, I am barely halfway through the starter cartridge. And, as I mentioned, I clean it when the light indicates cleaning.<br /><br />I took a week long trip and it easily lasted the entire time. There were even days I shaved twice. I think the charge might have dipped to half before I got back home.<br /><br />This is really a great shaver and I can't say enough good things about it.

Only gripe I really have so far is that the foil area doesn't catch some of the cut hairs, so have to be carefull what shave over since have a small layer of hair falling.   2824.   2825. It's not a bad shaver and it certainly has good looks and seems to be very well made but it is definitely not worth the price. I received it as a gift but I would never pay the crazy price for this shaver. This shaver screams \\"redundant and unnecessary features\\" from top to bottom. The battery meter and hygiene meter are at the bottom of the shaver. I don't understand why there is a need to have a hygiene meter there when there is one on the cleaning station. The meters are difficult to read since they are dark and the glass provides a lot of glare. Why not light up the meters on the shaver or provide an LED readout? The cleaning solution does nothing more than what a good cleaning under running water would do and the shaver is still wet and oily up until the next days shave. Not to mention that you have this monstrosity of a cleaning station on your bathroom counter. I could live with all of that if I got a good shave with it but I don't. There are 3 power settings which is quite funny since the strongest setting barely does a half way decent job of my pretty soft daily growth. I keep wondering what kind of beard would need the lightest setting. After a couple of months, I still can't shave my jaw line and neck without way too many passes. It takes me a long time to get a mediocre shave. I know everyone is different and all of what I just mentioned may not make a difference to everyone using the shaver so remember that shavers are a very personal item and what works for one, may not work for another. Within the last 3 weeks, I've switched to the Panasonic ES-LA63s shaver and from day one, it has provided me with a surprisingly easy, close, comfortable shave without the voodoo of cleaning stations, solutions, meters and other assorted gimmicks. If you like gimmicky gadgets and don't mind shelling out anywhere from $11-$15 a month for unnecessary fluids, this may be the razor of your dreams. If you like simple, inexpensive, get-the-job-done-well gadgets, keep looking.ts, keep looking.
  2826. I brought this shaver because it came highly rated. It is a good shaver, but nothing special. I have had Braun shavers that have lasted me over 15 years and cost less than half what this shaver cost. There is really nothing that blows me away about this shaver except for the price. If I could do it all over again I would have went with a much less expensive Braun shaver. The cleaning liquid is an absolute ripoff. I barely use the cleaning cycle and I think I might get 4, maybe five cleaning cycles out of it before the machine says it needs to be replaced. I clean it the old fashion way by blowing on it and using a small brush. The overall quality is good and I've had it for almost 2 years now with no problems, but none of my previous Braun shavers gave me any trouble either at the 2 year mark. The battery does last quite a long time and I charge it maybe once every 2 weeks, but I do not have thick facial hair either. For the price this shaver should have blown me away, it didn't. Save your money and buy a less expensive shaver that does not require constant refills of the expensive cleaning agent.

  2831. Very good shaver. I have used electric shavers for years. As far as the shave itself, you can't beat this model. The cleaning/charging base seems to work well so far too. My only issue with the whole thing is that the \\"flip-up sideburns trimmer\\" is on the front of the shaver instead of the back. With the angle of the shaver case, trimming sideburns/mustache/etc results in the regular shaver head catching other hair. Additionally, it makes for difficult visibility when trying to line the clippers up as well. In my experience, shavers with the flip-up clippers on the back side of the unit, with the shaving head angled away from their work area, are much easier to use.<br /><br />All in all, from the main shaving aspect, this thing is great. I'll just have to buy a separate beard/mustache trimmer for cleaning up those other spots.<br /><br />Just a note... I was wary of a \\"self cleaning\\" shaver at first. It has been a nice feature to have. The cleaning cycle is a little noisy, but since I shave before walking out the door in the morning there is nobody to be annoyed by the 10 minutes of cleaning that it does. I also haven't been going through the cleaning solution nearly as quickly as I expected to, and I cycle it every day.

  2839. Great shaver. More recent version of a long line of great shavers. Sturdy, no issues.<br /><br />Things worth noting- Check shipping requirements if you order one that includes alcohol-based cleaner. The cleaner will restrict shipping options. This isn't great if you wait until your shaver breaks to replace it and speedy delivery isn't available.<br /><br />The cleaning device is fairly large and less than attractive, especially if you don't like clutter and your bathroom is less than spacious. You can put it away between cleanings but it does have liquid in there to slosh around. I haven't had it spill though.<br /><br />If you loose the power cord, you'll likely have to choose a compatible power supply since the simple power cord that comes with this shaver is less than simple inside and very hard to replace. The compatible power supplies tend to be bulky and conflict with hairdryers for receptacle space. Like the cleaning device, it's one more bulky thing to put away if you want a tidy work surface for your personal grooming space. The trick here is *do not loose the power cord!* On the other hand, these power cords are so deceptively good, we use one from a tech's shaver out of desperation to keep a new factory running during a shortage of the one needed for our equipment. So, well worth the money!

  2851. I was forced to replace my 10+ year old Braun series 5 razor after the charge chord would not carry a current. I searched for a replacement chord, but due to the age of the razor, the best price I found was $130 – for a chord. This is my 3rd Braun shaver, and each one has been a step up from the last. After three weeks of daily (with a few lazy days here and there), I feel confident in my review…<br />Pros-<br />-The 790 Shaver does a great job on my beard, better than the old 5 series did. Even if I take a few days off from shaving, the 790 leaves my cheeks and neck smooth without dozens of “redo’s”.<br /><br />-Braun uses the same cleaning cartridge on all of its models so the two I had purchased for use in the 5 series will not go to waste.<br /><br />-Auto shut off after cleaning/charging cycle is complete, a nice feature since I will set it to charge in the morning and will not be able to unplug it for 8+ hours.<br /><br />-This shaver feels comfortable in my hand, not bulky or slick.<br /><br />Cons-<br /><br />-I have not gotten used to the pop up trimmer. I liked the design better on the 5 series. This one closes by itself if I push it the wrong way. Rather than being close to the shaver head it juts out a few inches and it at an awkward angle. I am sure I will learn the right way to use it over time.<br /><br />-It indicates it is time for a thorough much more frequently than the 5 series ever did. Not a con per se, but an annoyance. Looks like I will be replacing cleaning cartridges a bit more often.<br /><br />Bottom line, my “cons” are minor, and I LOVE the resulting shave I get from this shaver. Big thumbs up from me.

Any cut to that area can cause me lymphedema (extremity swelling) which can be very serious. I've never gotten a nick or any irritation with this electric shaver. This electric shaver works significantly better on legs (and knees), underarms, and bikini area than any electric shaver, especially those designed for women which are the worst. I have tried the rotary type electric shaver also and each time they would leave my skin scratchy with some razor burn. If while using this electric shaver you pull the skin tight on your legs they'll feel as smooth after using this as if shaved in the shower with a normal disposable blade razor. Well worth the money and the battery lasts plenty long enough to complete all my shaving in a single use. For travel I simply take the power cord and shaver in the carry case that it comes with. So, it takes up as much room as 2 razors with disposable blades.

  2869. Before this model, I owned a Series 3 Braun Razor. It was on its last leg, so I decided to upgrade to Series 7. Probably the best decision I've made in a while!<br /><br />It now takes me about 5 minutes to shave instead of 20 (my Series 3 was THAT bad) This gets 99% of the hair the first time over, while in return doesn't irritate your skin as much.<br /><br />When you put the razor in the base, it will automatically charge and tell you how dirty the razor is. There are three levels of cleaning, and the razor will tell you how much of a cleaning it needs. You then click the start button and the base takes over from there. My series 3 would clean every time, no matter how much you used it. It's great that you get to choose because you end up saving on cleaning solution.<br /><br />The razor itself has a screen that shows hygiene levels and battery level so you know when it's time to plug it into the base if you don't keep it there all the time.<br /><br />The razor has three levels of speed, a slower speed to get the sensitive areas like the neck, and medium speed for normal shaving, and a high speed for when you haven't shaved in a while and need an extra boost of power. The pop out trimmer is also great for cleaning up lines and sideburns.<br /><br />Overall, this is the best electric razor I have used since 2005!
  2870. Easy to hold, no cords to get in way. Efficient, effective, no nonsense shaver. I bought this as well as the Norelco beard trimmer/vac system by Phillips.Never had a blade shave as close as this one. The pivot head works very well and the options of it make it very easy to get the best shave. I love the cleaning system, and kit keeps the razor out of the shower. No more beard stubble in the tub makes wife or GF very happy (Shave before showering).
  2871. It has been awhile since I used an electric razor. This one by far has been the best. In the first two weeks I used it just about every day. Smooth shave and great cutting ability! Even gets the hard to shave areas really good.

  2881. I decided to finally upgrade from my old braun 7650 (no digital screen)<br />Started getting razor burn and after changing the foil/razor set it only helped a little.<br />Ran across the [...] on youtube and started listening to the types of beards and so forth.<br />After a bunch of reviews vs the other brands that were WAY more $ I chose the 790cc.<br /><br />HUGE difference in my opinion. My face is almost as close as a disposable blade which was amazing.<br />My wife was shocked and thought this purchase was a waste until she felt how smooth my face was.<br />Not really a huge fan of the trimmer as its a little too close to the main shaver head.<br />The BOSS edition looked really slick but no one had if for a reasonable price but honestly the only difference was the color of the shaver to me since this one comes with the same shaver travel case.<br />Also I love the fact that the foil piece pushes in and out when you bring it closer to your skin. my old one would really end up scraping my skin if i pushed too hard.<br /><br />Either way I am sold and everyone that has an older shaver should upgrade.

I know that this series is meant to be returned to the base after every use and it renews and cleans the blades for next time, but I just have a feeling the manufacturer just did that to sell more clean cartridge refills although they are not so expensive and I still have my original cartridge after 3 months at 75% full and that is after using it every 3 to 5 shaves.

  2906. For an electric shaver it beats the competition but when I want smooth clean shaven skin, nothing beats the Gillette Mach 3 and Edge Gel combination. This is about convenience. I can't use a Mach 3 in the car. My first Braun top of the line Pulsonic Series 7 shaver broke several times within the first three years with the first issue occurring 3 months after the warranty expired. The trimmer parts become misaligned and the unit had to be sent to a Braun service facility which repaired it for 43 dollars and the trimmer broke again on the first use. Deciding not to go back to the authorized repair center in Fort Pierce, Fl, I took the liberty of trying to repair it myself and discovered that the magnet that keeps the trimmer head flush with the body was missing. The repair shop failed to put all of the parts back. After 5 years of intermittent service, I finally retired it. Being left with the choice of replacing the shaver with another brand, I decided to take it up one notch and purchase the 790cc for $149 on Amazon instead of going with Norelco or Remington, which I have had problems with in the past as well. Remington is a joke. Norelco triple header was bad out of the box and non returnable however it did provide a good shave with the exception that the battery lcd display was cracked, which had nothing to do with the performance. When the Norelco triple header finally died after 10 years, I decided to try Braun. So this is my 2nd high end Braun. Hopefully, the Braun Series 7 790cc Pulsonic will provide years of uninterrupted service and an outstanding shaving experience. Should it fail me this round, farewell Braun and back to Norelco.

  2911. I've had this shaver for just over 4 years now and it works as good today as it did 4 years ago. I have used a few Remington shavers in the past and after about a year of moderate use, every single one couldn't hold a charge long enough for a single shave, dulled down quickly and began painfully snagging my beard hair ultimately leading to replacement.<br /><br />I don't have these problems with the Braun Series 7! While I do keep it in the charging base between shaves, the battery meter only ever loses one dot after a shave and I've never had any snags. I have even yet to replace the foil on the head after all this time as is recommended.<br /><br />I shave 1-2 times per week on average and at that rate I only have to replace the cleaning cartridge about once every 2-3 months. Currently the cartridges are on amazon priced under $20 for 4, so for me it's roughly $20/year to keep my shaver clean. While the added cost of cleaning cartridges may be a turn off for some, I believe it's well worth it and it keeps the shaver running flawlessly over the years (also remember the cartridges are optional if you don't want to clean it).

  2914. This is my second Braun Series 7 shaver, and my third Braun overall. While I’ve only had this particular unit for a relatively short time, it works very much as the previous one, except it’s quieter. I finally wore out the previous shaver after half a dozen years, which seems pretty reasonable for something that I used almost every day. I read a couple of reviews where they talked about a quick death for the shaver, but so far this one is humming along nicely.<br /><br />I have two negative comments: First, I have a tough beard, and while I get a very good shave, the blade only lasts about half of the recommended 18 months before I feel I have to work too hard to get a clean shave. Again, this doesn’t seem outrageously bad, but it does fall short of the advertised ideal. I also found that the finish next to the shaving head deteriorated over time due to the cleaning solution, which I’ve read in a few other reviews. You would think that surface might be replaced with a small piece of stainless rather than the current approach (which appears to be painted plastic), just to maintain the appearance of the unit. It didn’t affect the performance, but it did degrade the overall appearance.<br /><br />In terms of the feel of the unit, it fits nicely in my hand. I like the way the blade conforms to my face while I’m shaving, and the ease of using the popup trimmer. I guess I have average sized hands for a guy, and the shaver is very nice in terms of the comfort holding it, and the weight.<br /><br />All in all, I’m very pleased with the shaver, and assuming it lasts like the previous one, I’ll probably get another one when I finally wear this one out. My true rating is probably closer to 4.5 stars, just due to the minor glitches, but given the overall performance and life of the shaver, I’ll give it the benefit of the doubt with 5 stars.<br />~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br /><br />One year later. Still running flawlessly. I recognize that any electronic/mechanical gizmo can fail, but my experience is that these things really do last.<br /><br />~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br /><br />As noted above, the blades do not last 18 months, at least with my beard. I'm usually closer to the nine or ten month mark before I feel it's too much effort. I went to Amazon to order a new blade, and found that the price I paid last year of $31.45 has now tripled. All of the previous offers on the Internet in the previous price range are &#34;out of stock.&#34; Prices on the Braun site are now about $85.00, with prices on the Internet running up to the low hundreds. That jump in price, coupled with the original price of the shaver, makes this a much more expensive option. I wouldn't have even flinched if the price had gone up some, but tripling seems like Braun is just attempting to fleece it's customers. While I still think this is a nice shaver, the total cost of ownership no longer makes sense if the annual price for the blades is $85.00+ (plus the original cost plus the cleaning solution). This jump in price is why I changed my overall rating. Buyer beware!il, but my experience is that these things really do last.<br /><br />~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br /><br />As noted above, the blades do not last 18 months, at least with my beard. I'm usually closer to the nine or ten month mark before I feel it's too much effort. I went to Amazon to order a new blade, and found that the price I paid last year of $31.45 has now tripled. All of the previous offers on the Internet in the previous price range are &#34;out of stock.&#34; Prices on the Braun site are now about $85.00, with prices on the Internet running up to the low hundreds. That jump in price, coupled with the original price of the shaver, makes this a much more expensive option. I wouldn't have even flinched if the price had gone up some, but tripling seems like Braun is just attempting to fleece it's customers. While I still think this is a nice shaver, the total cost of ownership no longer makes sense if the annual price for the blades is $85.00+ (plus the original cost plus the cleaning solution). This jump in price is why I changed my overall rating. Buyer beware!

  2926. I have switched back and forth from blades to electrics many times. Funny how electric shavers advertise how they \\"shave close as a blade\\". The blade is still the standard by which electrics are measured. That said, this Braun is truly the best and most \\"blade like\\" shave I have ever had from an electric. Most striking was that I normally expect, and the user guide even says, to need a month for your face to adjust from blade to electric for best results. Nope. First shave out of the box this thing was giving me perfect results. I was amazed.<br /><br />Now I have used this razor for a year and once again am going back to blades. Why? 3 reason:<br /><br />1. The noise of this this shaver, especially first thing in the morning, is really annoying. It is loud. I mean really, really loud next to your ear. Rotary shaver are much quieter because they simply spin while this must oscillate. I really thought I would get used to it but in fact have become more annoyed with the noise over time. Maybe it is louder now than when I first got it. I don't know and have no way to know for sure. But the noise is bad. Real bad.<br /><br />2. Maintenance. I got the whole system with the cleaning base thinking it made sense. And yes, the cleaner really works well. The shaver is absolutely clean after you pull it out. The issue is that even when only putting it in 2 or 3 times per month to clean and charge I have gone through 12+ refills in one year. Braun says they should last 2 - 3 months. No, not for me. I think the dry climate where I live could be a factor. The refills appear to simply evaporate rather than get used up during cleaning cycles. My last refill was only used one time before I got the red light saying it had to be replaced! I have tried water cleaning and it does not work well at all compared to using the base.<br /><br />3. Shaver is wearing out after one year. Braun says head could last 6 years but they recommend replacing after 18 months. After 12 months mine is definitely cooked. I often get at least one particularly course hair ripped right out by the root when shaving if I have gone more than 2 days between shaves.<br /><br />I bought the Braun because I got so fed up with the ridiculous price of razor blade refills I decided it would be no different cost wise to go electric long term when compared to buying $15 worth of blades and $5 worth of shaving creme each month. That's $240 per year to shave with blades. I think the reality is that the long term cost of using this electric is no different than blade shaving. Even with amazon's subscription for the refills they are over $4 each. And at my burn rate that's over $50 per year. Now add another $34 per year to replace the head. Amortized over a couple years with the cost of the shaver and we're talking over $180 per year cost to own.After 12 months mine is definitely cooked. I often get at least one particularly course hair ripped right out by the root when shaving if I have gone more than 2 days between shaves.<br /><br />I bought the Braun because I got so fed up with the ridiculous price of razor blade refills I decided it would be no different cost wise to go electric long term when compared to buying $15 worth of blades and $5 worth of shaving creme each month. That's $240 per year to shave with blades. I think the reality is that the long term cost of using this electric is no different than blade shaving. Even with amazon's subscription for the refills they are over $4 each. And at my burn rate that's over $50 per year. Now add another $34 per year to replace the head. Amortized over a couple years with the cost of the shaver and we're talking over $180 per year cost to own.

I do not use a regular bladed razors because they are expensive, you cut yourself and have to have shaving cream....all a pain... Electric razors take two weeks to get your skin used to using. If you don't want to have two weeks of trying it then don't bother investing the money. Braun razors (I have owned 3 in the last 15 years) typically last 3-5 years. I prefer this one because it can clean itself and all I have to do is throw it into the base and hit clean once a week. I shave daily and it will hold a charge for a good two weeks, if I don't charge it up. The cleaning refills are cheap and you only need to replace them every other month if you wash out the razor prior to dropping it on the base. Love this thing and if you try it you will as well.
