  2939. excellent product, shaving is very smooth and burn free. I like the auto cleaning technology they have, sometimes I still have to manually clean it.
  2940. I purchased the Series 7 and the Cruzer Face 6 because I had a terrible need of an electric shaver. I read the reviews, nearly all of them, starting with the negative then moving to the positive. I was not impressed by the reviews but Brauns money back guarantee gave me the courage to buy the products and try them out, so I did. These are my thoughts on the Series 7 and how it compares to the Cruzer Face 6.<br /><br />The Series 7 is a shaver primarily. It does have a trimming feature that shapes up the side burns, and it does a great job of trimming and making a line, but with it's angle, it's so awkward to use. You can use it to shape your mustache and beard line, but it would a cumbersome and most unpleasant task. The Series 7 does have 3 different settings, but the blue setting is too rough for my skin. It gets hairs more quickly but it leaves me with an agitated face because I have such sensitive skin. The light blue, almost white setting takes several passes to get about 98% of all the hairs under my chin, while the blue setting gets about 99% of all the hairs. I still have to knick a few hairs with a razor because my skin has crevasses that the hairs try and hide between. Stretching my skin helps, but it also adds to the irritation.<br /><br />If you are like me and you want to keep a goatee or shaped mustache, the Series 7 is not the shaver for you. The Cruzer Face 6 excels in all areas except that with the foil shaver, it only gets about 95% of the hairs under my chin. The Series 7, is bulky... square like, so trimming a mustache shape under the nose or grooming a nice facial hair design is grossly undesirable. I am keeping both shavers, but if I had to choose to have one shaver, it would be the Cruzer Face 6. It's cheaper and it performs almost as well shaving with many more features to enjoy. The trimmer on the Cruzer Face 6 is a God send and the foil shaver has never irritated my skin, not once. I can't say the same about the Series 7.<br /><br />As far as maintenance, both shavers are easy to clean and maintain, so with the Series 7, it makes the purpose of the cleaning station almost negligible. It's just more of a hassle to have to keep buying the solution for it although it is low maintenance to use. Also, if you are a cheapo like me, you can make your own solution. It's just 70 proof rubbing alcohol mixed with several droplets of lemon scented oil. You can get lemon scented oil off Amazon and put maybe 30 drops per tank of 70 proof rubbing alcohol and that's a much cheaper option than buying refill packs. As I said before, both these shaves are so easy to clean and maintain that it shouldn't be a factor in making your purchase. The Cruzer Face 6 is the best shaver I've come across.as maintenance, both shavers are easy to clean and maintain, so with the Series 7, it makes the purpose of the cleaning station almost negligible. It's just more of a hassle to have to keep buying the solution for it although it is low maintenance to use. Also, if you are a cheapo like me, you can make your own solution. It's just 70 proof rubbing alcohol mixed with several droplets of lemon scented oil. You can get lemon scented oil off Amazon and put maybe 30 drops per tank of 70 proof rubbing alcohol and that's a much cheaper option than buying refill packs. As I said before, both these shaves are so easy to clean and maintain that it shouldn't be a factor in making your purchase. The Cruzer Face 6 is the best shaver I've come across.

Apart from my daily beard shave I do the whole head about once a week so it gets a lot of use.<br /><br />I highly recommend this Braun model to all those who have used electric shavers.

  2955. Previous to this shaver (790cc) I used a a Braun 7526 shaver for about ~10 years. The Braun 7526 still works great but the battery is slowly going out. My review is therefore partial in comparison to the Braun 7526.<br /><br />Anyways, I have been using the 790cc for about 3 months and have been satisfied. I get a pretty close shave and I have medium course facial hair. The battery seems to hold up for a number of shaves so no complaints there. The shaver has an indicator to let you know the &#34;battery&#34; and &#34;hygiene&#34; status. The &#34;hygiene&#34; status indicates cleaning about your 4th or 5th shave. The cleaning process is pretty straight forward, just place it in the cleaning apparatus and let it do its business. It can get kinda loud (not ridiculous though) and can last about 3-5 minutes (haven't actually timed it).<br /><br />There have been a couple of times, when I have not shaven for about 3-4 days, that the shaver seems to catch on my beard. Was not expecting that, but if I shave really slow I can mostly avoid the tugging. This is not a problem when my beard is shaven every ~2 days. I suspect this is due to screen/foil, was never an issue with my old shaver (Braun 7526). Have not read that this has been a problem with other people, must just be me.

  2972. i talked to several people who use electric razors and they claim to have no issues with them. they told me they shave like a blade. so after using a disposable razor for years i decided to give one a try. this was my first electric razor.<br /><br />this shaver works well on most of my hair that grows perpendicular to my skin. that's 99% of the stuff above my jaw line. it even gets as close as a blade or closer in places. i know this because i used a blade right afterwards and can tell where it's actually cutting my beard. for the other 1% ( a few hairs) i have to run it back and forth over and over.<br /><br />below my jaw it does not get as close and it misses hairs randomly. no matter how much time i spend i can't get a decent shave. these are hairs that grow close to parallel with my skin. but a blade gets them fine.<br /><br />you may want to take a close look at your beard and see how the hairs grow out before getting this shaver.<br /><br />so it's going back to braun i guess. if they don't take it it's being sold.<br /><br />it's disappointing because i really looked into electric shavers and this one got high marks. wish i knew amazon would not take it back because the of cleaning fluid.<br /><br />update: braun does have a 60 day money back satisfaction guarantee. but the process is a real pain. the manual lists a general number to call, you go through the menu system and then get a recording rattling off what to do, address, etc. listen to that about 4 times to get it right. then print your receipt, package it up, insure it, and wait up to 10 weeks for the refund. we will see if i ever get one.<br /><br />bottom line, unless you know this product and like how it works on your face don't order from amazon. returns are a major pain. i love amazon in general though.

  2993. I had a Series 5 razor for almost 4.5 years, and decided to upgrade because I needed to both replace the foil/cutter assembly and the charging/cleaning base, which was no longer cleaning properly (all the stubble would just collect at the bottom and not go into the cartridge). Although comparing a well-used Series 5 with a new Series 7 probably isn't fair, the Series 7 provides a much better shave. It takes fewer strokes, shaves more closely, and is smoother. Again, hard to know whether that's all due to the features/performance of the Series 7 or the age of the razor it replaced, but I have no regrets. In addition, the Series 7 (790cc model, at least) comes with a nice and compact, semi-hard, zippered case; some earlier runs appear to have come with a much cheaper plastic case. (Not sure why Braun does this, but I've been using their razors for over 25 years, and the quality of the travel cases waxes and wanes. Fortunately, a good quality case right now.) There are a few downsides: There is no little plastic cover that clips over the foil when traveling, so it's not as well protected. The trimmer is step backwards. It extends out so far (and is narrower than those on the Series 5) that it magnifies movement and is harder to control. I suspect I'll get used to it eventually. The button to extend the trimmer also is right where my thumb rests when shaving, so you have a tendency to push the trimmer out/open when shaving unless you pay attention. But for those quibbles, a real improvement over the Series 5. It's worth noting that the battery in the 790cc is lithium ion battery. The 790cc also has an electronically controlled sensitivity/power function, which controls the intensity/speed of the pulsations, as far as I can tell. Seems to work, but I just use the medium setting. The swivel lock function (lock either on or off) makes more sense than the three-position switch on the Series 5.<br /><br />Amazon's price for the 790cc right now is so good that it's hard to justify getting a lower model Series 7, since they are about the same price. The Series 5 is significantly cheaper (by about $50), and served me well, but I think that the extra amount for the Series 7 at Amazon.com's price is worth it. I do hope that the cleaning/charging base for the 790cc proves more durable/reliable than the one I had for the Series 5.it's hard to justify getting a lower model Series 7, since they are about the same price. The Series 5 is significantly cheaper (by about $50), and served me well, but I think that the extra amount for the Series 7 at Amazon.com's price is worth it. I do hope that the cleaning/charging base for the 790cc proves more durable/reliable than the one I had for the Series 5.
  2994. This razor is simply amazing. I can get a shave that is as close as one with a blade razor. I get no razor burn and my face feels &#34;baby skin soft&#34; after each shave. The razor has an adjustment to power it up for tougher beards. I use this selection for shaving my neck hairs which are somewhat harder to shave and it does it perfectly. I use the feature that locks the moveable shaving head in place to shave the area under my nose and it is very effective.<br /><br />The cradle the razor sits has a larger footprint than I expected. The various indicator lights for charge and level of dirt in the razor's head is a nice feature. The cleaning process that is performed in this cradle is a nice touch. My only concern is the additional cost of the cleaning fluid that is contained in a replaceable cartridge. Not sure what that cost of the cartridge is, but that part of the unit was an unexpected surprise.

  3008. There are some great review on Amazon for this already, but I wanted to just throw in my observation.<br /><br />I wanted to return this after about two weeks of use. It just wasn't working for me at all. Amazon wouldn't take it back because it's a razor. Since I paid so much for it, I decided I better give it a few more weeks. I'm glad I did because I discovered a couple small tricks: I rub my beard with my hand in the opposite direction of the growth in the few trouble spots and, boom, no longer trouble spots. Also, don't be afraid to shave in a weird pattern. You will find the pattern you need to shave in, and once you get that part down, your shave times will be cut way down and the quality of the save will go way up. My first few weeks, it took me several minutes to shave and I had to clean up some areas with my Mach 3, now it's much closer to 2 or 3 minutes and I'm done. I'm very glad that Amazon doesn't accept returns for razors. I would have been missing out.

  3010. I have used a rotorary razor for about 30 years. I tried a foil wet/dry razor a few years back but it did not last very long. My last rotorary razor only lasted 3 years and when it died I took it apart to see what happened. Turns out the connector to the battery corroaded away and could not be repaired. If the cleaning method for this razor is to wash it with water would you not expect it to be waterproof? Guess not their loss. That is why decided to try the Braun foil, and the very high rating it gets on consumer review sites. I have been using the Braun for about three weeks now and due to the cleaning system it has not even seen water. This razor shaves very close, I do not use a blade anymore. But the real secret to this razor is the cleaning system. I was sure this was just some useless selling feature but I was wrong. It works great! It is like doing the wash.First it washes the head and then it drys it without you doing anything. No more rinseing and brushing. I would say this product is one of the finest I have purchased in quite awhile. And yes I really do love it. My advise to you is &#34;just buy it&#34;, you will not be sorry.

  3013. This shaver is awsome. I didn't shave at all before. I use to use a beard trimmer with no guard because I would break out bad from shaving. My GF's parents bought me a shaver for x-mas. I took the hint, my gf wanted me to shave. The only thing is they bought me a cheap rotary one. I used it and it sucked. I fingered if I was gonna shave I was going to spend some money and get a good one. I read a lot of reviews and finally decided on the 7 series. Best choice I made. I don't break out like I use to at all. Not even close. I use aftershave lotion and this shaver. I guess one reason I like this one is that it's not a rotary one. Those the blades were cutting my skin from all directions. This one the blades cut in one direction so I can control the direction that I'm shaving. Yes it's almost $200 but it's worth it. I know you probably read that a lot but it's true. I'll pop the blade off while shaving and dump it out then shave then pop the head off again and that's it. When I'm done I'll stick it in the base and start the self cleaning cycle. I read reviews that the self cleaning is loud. It is if your right there in the bathroom with it but I shave last so when it's cleaning I'm gone. If your in another room you don't even notice it. The price for cleaning solution isn't bad when you look at how much you'd spend on mach 12 blades in a year. The razor blade for this shaver say there supposed to last 18 months, so far mine are still cutting good after about 4 months so far. Oh yeah and I've gone about 3 1/2 to 4 days without shaving and then used it and it went through that kind of growth no problem. Well I mean after 4 days it does take a little longer than if you use it every day but it's still good. It has a side burn cutter on it that fold out, I use it to touch up edges and it works good to. I actually use this for my head to. Haven't had any problems with my head at all. For me the hard part is to get my neck under my jaw, that seams to be where this shaver has the most problem for me. The head angles up and down and not side to side so getting my neck is kinda hard. I end up not getting as close a shave there as I'd like. But all in all I really like this shaver or I wouldn't waste my time typing this review out. OK well that's it. hope you pick this over some cheap one.he most problem for me. The head angles up and down and not side to side so getting my neck is kinda hard. I end up not getting as close a shave there as I'd like. But all in all I really like this shaver or I wouldn't waste my time typing this review out. OK well that's it. hope you pick this over some cheap one.
  3014. I though a long time before buying this razor. My first gereration unit did not shave well, pulled wiskers if I was at a 3 day growth, the trimmer kinda' worked and it was LOUD.<br />All those negatives are positives with this unit Except the pulling wiskers.<br />It has three power settings, the strongest is still many factors quieter. I find low is plenty powerful for me. The trimmer, I think I could use as clippers if so motivated. It shaves much closer than the former, BUT still pulls at times.<br />I am glad I bought it, I would love to speak to the company about modifying the 'head cassette' to not pull, I believe I know why. However, if you hold the razor at an angle not the recomended 90 degrees, you can cut things down in a single pass, then use 90 degrees for the final touch up.<br />Hope this helps your decision.<br />Cordially a Motor City Guy
  3015. This is easily the best electric shaver I have ever used. For the last 6-7 years I've used the Phillips Norelco Architect. I paid a hefty $130 for it many years ago. I liked the Architect because I knew it was a premium protect and it did a good job. However, this Braun razor beats it in just about every respect. What I like most about this Braun is it causes very little irritation on my sensitive skin, it gets hard to reach hair on my neck easily, and it self cleans.<br /><br />The only con I can think of is the price, but you are getting probably the best electric shaver on the market for your money.
  3016. I have the 760 model.<br /><br />The look and feel are great. Futuristic. The manufacture is very good indeed.<br /><br />The problem is the neck. It is great for the face, but the neck always needs a retouch with a different electric shaver that SHAVES the neck better.<br /><br />I have a thick beard hair, and I find that the grid profile that gives the smooth feel of this shaver, skips many flat hairs in the neck. So you spent more time trying to get the flat oriented ones in the neck, that<br /><br />a full shave with blade.<br /><br />Nevertheless, if you are not a thick bearded person you can enjoy this machine a lot.<br /><br />I get better shaves with cheaper Remington's, but I won't get rid of this Braun, because the gadget is cool, and it smells like lemons in the morning.<br /><br />The auto cleaning is not cheap, but gives a superb feel of asepsis and cleanness.<br /><br />I think Braun should let a 2mm band of the center grid raw with 90 degrees border to catch better the horizontal oriented hairs, but I don't think they read this review.

  3046. This is a very good shaver, however there are few things to consider before plunking down hard earned money towards it.<br /><br />1) The shave is pretty good. 85% of what you'd get using a double edge razor. Good enough for me on a day to day basis, especially because it's fast and you don't cut yourself. I actually like the shave intensity buttons. They are great for me because my neck is prone to getting red from a hot electric razor. This one is really good about avoiding that.<br />2) The cleaning station is great. I've had Norelco's in the past and the ALL broke. Every single one of them broke. This works consistently and leaves a great smelling razor. Worth the $5 every month and a half.<br />3) The fast clean option is a waste of money. I regret getting this razor over the less expensive version without the fast clean. For some reason the sterilization level on the razor itself never resets all the way... If you are in a rush than just popping the head off and brushing it is a better idea as it keeps the razor dry.<br />4) Speaking of sterilization level- pretty gimmicky. Not sure I really like having LCD bars that give sort of random and useless info. Again the razor which is one level down is less expensive and uses a less gimmicky LED.<br /><br />5) This gets its own line because it's a huge pet peeve of mine. The product I received was clearly a returned product. Much of the plastic wrap was missing, and the standard packaging was not complete... the box itself was sealed with one piece carelessly applied tape. For the record I chose &#34;standard packaging&#34; instead of frustration free packaging. I don't know how long the previous owner used it, if they abused it, etc. It is completely unacceptable to purchase a $200+ item and receive somebody's sloppy seconds. I recommend taking Amazon's price and finding a brick and mortar store that is willing to price match (many do).<br /><br />In the end I'd buy this razor again. I've owned a lot of Norelcos and a few Brauns. This one is the best I've tried (including the newest Norelco... tried that twice, once the cleaning station broke after a month, the other time the razor was just DOA). To scared to try a Panasonic because of battery QC issues. This is the best I've had so far, but I'd definitely rather buy offline if I had to do it again.a lot of Norelcos and a few Brauns. This one is the best I've tried (including the newest Norelco... tried that twice, once the cleaning station broke after a month, the other time the razor was just DOA). To scared to try a Panasonic because of battery QC issues. This is the best I've had so far, but I'd definitely rather buy offline if I had to do it again.

  3086. I thought the best way to review the 790cc is to compare it with my previous Braun Syncro System 7526. I have used 7526 for 10 years now, until last week. It is a rock solid shaver! (See my review on it here on Amazon) After 7 years, its batteries died but functioned great on power cord. In about 6 years however, the Cleaner/Charger unit failed big time. I had to pay $60 for replacement. Clearly cheaply manufactured piece that is below Braun standards, what a shame!<br /><br />But first, all about this Braun 790cc: Very close and quick shave. Very powerful. No skin irritation. It completes whole shave in under 5 min. The three modes of speed is not useful to me as I need power and speed. This set is multinational: the Shaver is German, the charger/cord is Chinese, and the Cleaner unit is Hungarian. It comes with a nice carrying case but missing the foil protection cap!<br /><br />Now the comparison:<br /><br />1- Closer and quicker shave than 7526.<br /><br />2- Clean&Charger unit looks more durable and solid, expect it to last longer than that of 7526.<br /><br />3- Clean&Charger is very loud when compared to 7526. I can hear the motor even from behind a closed door very clearly.<br /><br />4- It has a display that shows battery and hygiene percentage left, 7526 did not have this. I understand the battery remained, but do not know how it evaluates the hygiene of the shaver, the manual does not say anything about it. I checked but it does not measure how long it ran! But I don't think that it would measure the residue on it, since if you wash it, it does not detect it.<br /><br />5- The display however is not very clear, it looks more like some old technology black&white LCD unit with stains behind a glass.<br /><br />6- It is missing the foil protection cap the 7526 had. It protects the foil and was so durable and I used it the entire 10 years.<br /><br />7-Comes with a nice carrying case. The 7526 came with one but not very usable as it was bulky to hold the charger/power cord as well.<br /><br />8- You can get a better grasp, it has a slim design.<br /><br />9- The cutter/foil has also a better design and more functional, and also a single block.<br /><br />10- The pivoting head lock button is a lot less convenient than 7526, as you have to use two hands to activate it. On 7526 it is the power button and a lot easier to go back and forth, this is definitely a down side, and downgrade from an older model.<br /><br />11- The release button is also difficult to operate when compared to 7526.<br /><br />12- The cleaning cartridge is exactly the same with the 7526, I can use the leftover from 7526, huge plus of standardization.<br /><br />13- The charger and power cord set has a better socket design, but looks cheaper.er/power cord as well.<br /><br />8- You can get a better grasp, it has a slim design.<br /><br />9- The cutter/foil has also a better design and more functional, and also a single block.<br /><br />10- The pivoting head lock button is a lot less convenient than 7526, as you have to use two hands to activate it. On 7526 it is the power button and a lot easier to go back and forth, this is definitely a down side, and downgrade from an older model.<br /><br />11- The release button is also difficult to operate when compared to 7526.<br /><br />12- The cleaning cartridge is exactly the same with the 7526, I can use the leftover from 7526, huge plus of standardization.<br /><br />13- The charger and power cord set has a better socket design, but looks cheaper.

  3108. I've had this shaver for about 6 months now and I love it. It gets a very close shave very quickly and with minimal effort. The self cleaning feature works very well, it gets every tiny particle of debris clear of the blades all while disinfecting and lubricating. My daily shave is about 30 seconds, however after a weekend of not shaving it takes a little more effort to clean up a few days of stubble growth. I used to use a Mach 3, but never again.

The only thing that could be improved is the flip-out cutter is based on a plastic mechanism, which is unrepresentative of the build of the rest of the shaver and base in long-gevity. I've owned Norelco prior, and nothing beats this unit from Braun.

  3135. This is the best shaver I have ever owned. It's much more comfortable and a whole lot faster than the rotary style shaver I was using.<br />I had doubts about spending the money but it has proven to be well worth it.<br /><br />MATERIALS<br />The shaver feels sturdy and well-built. My old shaver feels like a cheap toy compared to this one.<br /><br />SHAVE<br />My old rotary-style shaver left my neck looking and feeling like I had used a sander. This shaver gives a close, comfortable shave and leaves no redness on my neck, even at the most intense setting. I also no longer have those annoying stray hairs or patches that I would always find sticking out there later on (if you have light colored hair like I do, you probably know what I'm talking about). It takes me less than half the time and effort it took to shave with the rotary shaver.<br /><br />NOISE<br />At first, it seemed a little loud to me. But when I compared it side-by-side with the rotary shaver, it was not any louder. The sound is a \\"buzz\\" instead of a \\"whir\\" but not louder.<br /><br />CLEANING<br />This part is awesome. There is no real cleanup. You place it into the base, hit the button and walk away. After cleaning, I have popped off the head and found it looking like new with no hairs to be found. It also smells fresh and clean. No little hairs in the sink and caked on the inside. You can't beat that.

  3171. I think all the features are great. I like the digital display on the bottom that shows how dirty the head is and how much battery you have left. I like the charging base that also cleans and lubricates the shaving head. However, in order to save on the cost of getting new cleaning solution so much I usually give the head a rinse before I put it through a cleaning cycle so it doesnt have so much to clean. Something worth knowing, the digitial &#34;hygiene&#34; scale on the bottom that tells you how dirty your shaving head unit is does not do this with any kind of sensor. it knows how long the head has been running in between cleaning cycles and figures, &#34;ok, it's probably this dirty.&#34; I have given it a thorough cleaning and the gauge doesn't reset until I run it through a cleaning cycle on the charging/cleaning stand. I still like having the gauge despite this because it still gives me an idea of how long it's been since I (or the base unit) have given the shaver head a cleaning.<br />My biggest disappointment is the shaving quality. In order for me to get a close shave I have to really push the shaving head against my skin. I have found that pushing as hard as I need to to get a great shave will pretty much always give me some pretty bad ingrown hairs. The vibrating heads are supposed to help lift hairs up into the shaving head but often times I will have hairs that I wont get shaved unless I pinch my skin so the hair sticks straight out and then put the shaver to the hair. You can adjust the intensity of the vibrations (lighter for more sensitive areas, stronger for the more thick and tough areas) but I run into the same problem I just stated. I put it on the sensitive setting and it doesn't shave as well; I put it on the more intense setting and I get ingrown hairs. I usually just end up getting a mediocre shave and only one or two ingrown hairs verses having a great, close shave and 10 bad ingrown hairs.<br />All in all, its easy to maintain, you can get it wet, and it does OK at shaving so I give it a three star rating but I will not be buying another one when my current one dies.it wet, and it does OK at shaving so I give it a three star rating but I will not be buying another one when my current one dies.

  3187. Being a life long manual blade user after a disappointing experience with a rotary electric razor in my twenties, and after much research, I purchased this razor. And I have to say it was money very well spent!<br /><br />I have a tough beard and sensitive skin. This razor comfortably and cleanly gives me a close shave with no skin irritation. It quietly buzzs the hair off. It's was an easy adjustment from the blade to this electric razor.<br /><br />The cleaning station is great.   3188. I received a Remington MS2-390 back in 2006 as a gift and used it for 6 years before looking for a replacement. The Remington was still working, but the rubber button on the on/off switch was falling apart (though the unit was still working excellently otherwise).<br /><br />About me:<br /><br />I am a dry-shaver. I shave about 15 min after my shower every day and use Lectric Shave before every shave. I am clean shaven, have fairly course straight hair, but the hair on my neck does not always stick out in the same direction.<br /><br />=====================<br />Remington MS2-390:<br />=====================<br /><br />The Remington was a nearly perfect unit. It rarely pulled any hairs, cut cleanly and quickly. It was easy to clean, water resistant and could go for 2 weeks on a single charge even after 6 years of daily use. It is also super cheap about $60.<br /><br />However, my favorite feature of the Remington was the sideburn trimmer. You press a button and it rose up about 1/2 inch from it's resting position. While this was supposed to be for sideburns, I used it on my neck once I was done shaving to catch all of those long neck hairs that were missed. These hairs were not always trimmed super closely, but they were pretty close and were then easier to get at for a final pass.<br /><br />This means that you could get a super clean shave quickly with almost no long neck hairs left out.<br /><br />=====================<br />The Braun 790cc:<br />=====================<br /><br />After doing much research I bought the Braun thinking that the ActiveLift would do the same thing I was doing with the Remington for shaving my neck.<br /><br />The Braun is much heavier than the Remington and took a bit of getting used to. Once used to it, I notice that my overall shaving time is roughly the same. For the non-neck regions the Braun and Remington give almost the same shave.<br /><br />You have to be very careful with the Braun about the direction in which you are shaving. The foil is not quiet edge to edge (you can even see this in the picture) so if you pull the shaver horizontally across an unshaved area the Braun can easily give you a nasty pull on your hair. I see this as a disappointing design flaw coming from such an expensive razor, but if you are careful in your shaving routine, this is avoidable.<br /><br />With the Braun you also have to be super careful around your lips due to the always constant activelift. If you do not angle the razor properly the activelift turns into an active lip nicker. This is likely unavoidable if you are to include this feature in a razor. Just be aware that you will have to angle this razor so only one of the two foils is touching your face when you are around your lips. Again this is not an issue if you are careful in your shaving routine, but it does take more passes in this area to get a close shave since you are only using one foil instead of two.<br /><br />The Braun does do a good job in the neck region, but it does take a lot of passes. The method I used with the Remington does not work with the trimmer in the Braun and thus I have to use many passes and hope that the activelift does it's job. If you spend enough time the Braun can give you a better neck shave with less irritation.<br /><br />The cleaning system of the Braun is the major selling feature. It is very convenient and even though the Braun is slightly longer in cutting, the cleanup makes up for it. The cleaning system is very loud when it runs. I wish they would program in a delay option to let it run 15 minutes after you press the button so you don't have to hear it while you are finishing getting ready.<br /><br />==================<br />Conclusion<br />==================<br /><br />Is the Braun 790CC better than the Remington MS2-390? Yes.<br />Is it $140 better? No.<br /><br />The Braun shaver is ridiculously expensive compared to the Remington which gives you almost as good a shave. The Braun also has small quirks like lacking edge-to-edge foil coverage which you really would expect in such an expensive product.<br /><br />If I had to do it over again, I would have purchased another Remington. However, I do have to admit that the Braun 790CC is a great overall razor and does produce better results when shaving your neck.s small quirks like lacking edge-to-edge foil coverage which you really would expect in such an expensive product.<br /><br />If I had to do it over again, I would have purchased another Remington. However, I do have to admit that the Braun 790CC is a great overall razor and does produce better results when shaving your neck.

  3193. I bought this shaver almost 2 years ago to replace a venerable Braun's Series 5 8985, looking to take advantage of the newer pulsating technology that my brother and some friends I trust told me was amazing. My brother has a beard as thick as polar bear fur, so if this shaver can go through that and survive -and satisfy him-, it was a very simple decision for me<br /><br />The shaving result is definitively better with the series 7, I get a smoother face and where the Series 5 had to pass several times, the 7 gets it done in one or two passes. This in turn reduces irritation to the skin; I get none or only once in a while bumps and ingrown hair with this shaver and it last longer. And the ability to change the intensity of the shaving is very helpful for the neck and when you just want to retouch and still have very short hair; nice shave at minimum contact thus less irritation. Overall I'm very happy with the end result and the premium over the series 5 is justified, this is a better, more modern machine<br /><br />However, it is not free of shortcomings. Even if the rubber grip is welcomed for a safer grip, the design is not that ergonomic and it takes time to adapt and find the proper way to handle it right, it feels just awkward for a few days. Then there is the strangely placed trimmer: by placing it on inside and not on the outside like the Series 5, the body of the shaver combined with your hand blocks your view when using the trimmer at certain angles, particularly your left hand sideburn if you are right-handed (and it would be the opposite if you are a lefty). The only way to unblock the view is to switch hands, which is not only silly but dangerous for the health of your sideburns. Also, after two years of use the paint on the border of the shaver's body close to the head is peeling off, apparently caused by the long time use of cleaning agent (made also by Braun by the way); it has no impact on performance but it looks bad and cheap. Painted plastic in the 21st century? Really? Common' Braun! And don't try to get it repaired or replaced easily, I live in Florida and have to send my shaver to Massachusetts! For service! And in the mean time I shave with... a kitchen knife?<br /><br />Another issue might be the duration of the cleaning agent when compared to the Series 5, it lasts at least 30% less time, but this might be more an issue of a lighter cleaner than a different cleaning system, so I don't blame it on the shaver. I noticed the cleaning solution have changed as sometimes it leaves an oily, yellow residue on the sides of the shaving head, thing didn't do in the past<br /><br />To summarize, this is a Ferrari on a Geo Metro body. If Braun could pay more attention to design and body quality, as well as product testing on the trimmer, they would have a really amazing, extraordinary product. Right now they have just a nice onehe 21st century? Really? Common' Braun! And don't try to get it repaired or replaced easily, I live in Florida and have to send my shaver to Massachusetts! For service! And in the mean time I shave with... a kitchen knife?<br /><br />Another issue might be the duration of the cleaning agent when compared to the Series 5, it lasts at least 30% less time, but this might be more an issue of a lighter cleaner than a different cleaning system, so I don't blame it on the shaver. I noticed the cleaning solution have changed as sometimes it leaves an oily, yellow residue on the sides of the shaving head, thing didn't do in the past<br /><br />To summarize, this is a Ferrari on a Geo Metro body. If Braun could pay more attention to design and body quality, as well as product testing on the trimmer, they would have a really amazing, extraordinary product. Right now they have just a nice one
  3194. Best shaver I ever own.
  3195. I have tested quite a few shavers over the years.<br />I have a very sensitive skin and every other shaver I tried irritated it badly.<br />This one have been amazing since the first use. No irritation at all.<br />It has a great power, it shaves very nicely, no irritation, and the cleaning base... is awesome.<br />I used it until it gets to the red mark (time to clean), put the fluid on the base (I don't leave it there all the time. It's alcohool based and will evaporate) and push the clean button.<br />Next shave, it is as good as new.<br /><br />I am very impressed with the build quality. Would recommend to anyone!
  3196. My husband needed a replacement for his previous Braun razor which lasted 6 or 7 years. This razor did not disappoint and he is very happy with it. A great price through Amazon. We will definitely shop here again for this razor when this current one dies.

  3199. My husband had been wanting this for a couple of years. I didn't want to spend that much, and we stuck to discount shavers. I saw a great deal on this, and even though it cost more then I wanted to spend, I bought it for him. He LOVES it, and says it would have been worth it to buy full price. He is in the military, so needs to be clean cut. He uses it daily, and has done so for the last 4 months, and has no issues with it. He tells everybody he knows to buy one. He will never go back to off brands again.
